Reviews.Title: “Bill Elvis! Margaritas! Elegant rooms!”
Reviews.Author: robandjanie
Reviews.Content: This is one of our favorite places on the strip. Perfect location next to Paris, across from Caesers and kitty-corner to Bellagio. While the casino area isn't my favorite, we LOVE Big Elvis and go to his show everytime we're in town, The $2 margaritas are delicious and our room was gorgeous (think upscale old west bordello) Easy to get to everything within the hotel as well as on the strip and the parking garage was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: JennM517
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights with my Mom and sister for Mom's 70th birthday. We had the time of our lives! We stayed in room 250, which is spacious and impeccably clean. Every staff member we encountered from front desk to housekeeping, were courteous and friendly. Mom and my sister each won $100 in comps in their daily drawings. Victoria Room restaurant was busy, but the service was good and the food was too. The Steak House was amazing, service was excellent and so was the food. We were on the Strip side of the building, so yes, there's some street noise, but that's to be expected - it's Las Vegas. The hotel's location is right in the middle of it all, so we weren't bothered by that, as we were out late anyway! Casino staff were also a lot of fun, especially the Blackjack dealers. We got our information wrong and missed all but a bit of the Fat Elvis show, but what we did see was pretty good - given that it's free, we can't complain about that :) The only criticism I have is that there is no coffee pot in the the room, and the restaurant does not offer coffee 'to go'. The bar does, but they don't have lids for the cups... the bartender directed me across the side-street to the Flamingo ($10.59 for 3 large cups of coffee - ouch!) Suggest bringing your own coffee pot or at least travel mugs if you need a morning caffeine fix. Still, if that's the biggest "complaint"... it's minor at best. I would definitely come here again. We enjoyed the smaller size of the hotel, and the friendliness. I hope to be back again someday!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: werethebrews
Reviews.Content: I have never had a bad experience at Bills! The rooms are quiet and clean. The staff is helpful and friendly. It's a small hotel and casino (read: you don't spend 15 minutes getting to/from your room). I always felt safe staying here too! What you see in the pics online is exactly what your room will look like. It's quieter on the flamingo side of the hotel. They did charge me an extra fee to check into my room early (they've never done that before). I had a room with a partial view of the bellagio fountains too! You have access to the Flamingo pool, spa, gym, etc with your Bills room key. Overall, good value for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean had a great view of the ballagio fountain in the luxury room the front desk is small and if 3 or more people are waiting in line it takes a while to check in. Right in the middle of the strip so easy walking to most hotels. Cafe is decent and has some great late night specials. Would stay here again very inexpensive for the location

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but beware of street noise.”
Reviews.Author: Jim_and_Barbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It's on a very cool part of the Strip, and some of the rooms actually have a pretty good view of the Bellagio fountains. Also, compared to many of the other nearby hotels, it is pretty cheap. I stayed there many years ago for New Year's Eve, and it was perfect for that. Most of the other hotels are insanely expensive for New Year's Eve, but this place was reasonable. More recently, I stayed there for a couple of nights during the week. I had originally planned to stay there through the weekend, but we left after two nights because of the street noise. It can be pretty loud at night. In particular, there was a street musician playing the drums until after 2 AM. I could sleep through it, but my wife was tossing and turning. Even without the street drummer, it can be pretty loud with shouts and horns and sirens. Ear plugs would have been nice. I guess it depends on what your plans are. If you plan on spending most of your time out partying, then this might be the perfect place to stay. If you are planning to party all night and stumble back to the room at dawn to pass out, then the street noise really won't bother you, and you'll love the great location and cheap price. In our case, we wanted to go to sleep around midnight, and that just didn't work. As I said, after a couple nights we couldn't take it anymore switched hotels. We moved over to the Vdara, which was a little more expensive, but much, much better. Bill's has good prices, but I question the value. Be sure to compare other nearby options. In particular, check out the Flamingo next door. I've never stayed at the Flamingo, but looking at it from the outside it seems like the Flamingo might have some rooms with the same good view of the fountains, but without as much street noise. Or if you can go a little higher in your budget, you might want to check something like the Vdara. I thought that place was awesome, and a really good value. If you do stay at Bill's and you want a really good view, ask for a room close to the front corner of the building overlooking the fountains. We were in room 302, and it had a great fountain view. Room 402 would be even better. Our room was a smoking room, which was unfortunate. (They said that you can request a non-smoking room, but they can't guarantee it.) Our room didn't smell too much like smoke when we arrived, but I woke up the next morning to a strong odor of cigar smoke. I soon realized that the smell was coming from my pillow. I asked for fresh pillows, and I didn't have the problem the following morning. By the way, Bill's is a good place to park even if you aren't staying there. It's a small hotel, so the walk from the parking garage to the Strip is very short. In contrast, if you park at Paris, Bellagio, or Caesars, the walk from your car to the strip can take 10 minutes. The garage is small, but I have never seen it full. However, I'm sure it gets full sometimes. Gambling at Bill's is relatively cheap, too. After you lose your shirt at the big strip hotels, and you only have the change in your pockets left, head to Bill's to stretch your last few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Worth waiting for”
Reviews.Author: OLDBRITDoncaster
Reviews.Content: On what is probably the last of our nine trips to Las Vegas (we can't take the ten hour flights from the UK any more) we finally got around to spending some time staying at Bill's. We were not disappointed. Ok, it isn't the quietest place, and there were no comfy chairs in the room, but for the price we paid it was a real bargain. The up-side of the noisiness is the brilliant location right in the heart of the strip. We ate in the Victorian Room a few times and thought it was good value. If you are tired of chrome/glitz and wonder what an old style stop over in Vegas was like, try this place.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Bill's!”
Reviews.Author: bigrockr
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at Bill's after staying there 2 years ago & still the same great service (Mar 10-15). Place is the smallest hotel around, only 4 floors, perfectly located in middle of strip, very spacious room & extremely comfy beds, great cleaning staff, front desk & casino staff very helpful and friendly, takes 1 minute to get to your room and check in took literally 5 minutes. Excellent steak & eggs special from midnite till 6 a.m. - a perfect way to end your early morning adventure! The food in their restaurant is excellent & large portions. One pool at Flamingo was open, with full serviced bar, just had to present room key to get in. Check out Margaritiville and Harrahs Piano Bar just down the road. The room price here doesn't blow your pocket book out either...

Reviews.Title: “Second time was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Marriottscove
Reviews.Content: We just finished spending 5 nights at Bill's March 6-9 then March 10-12 2012. This was our second and last time we will stay there. The location as always is great and the rooms clean and cheap but that's all it has going for it. We spent 5 nights there in Oct of 2010 and raved about it but either has new owners or managers and it has gone down hill since our last stay. After traveling for 17 hrs to get there we tried to check in at 3:15 pm and were told that there would be a $10 early check in fee as check in is not until 4 pm we were tired at wanted to clean up so we paid the gouge. .......Poor customer service I had visited their web site and noted that the breakfast special in the Victorian cafe of steak and eggs for $6.99 was on until 8 am. we had gone to bed early and were up by 5am cleaned up watched some local news on TV and got down for breakfast at 6:05 am 5 minutes too late for the special so live and learn we paid over double for the breakfast we could have had 5 minutes earlier. The next morning we would not make the same mistake and were down by 5 am only to be told there was a half hour wait not because it was so busy but because the manger had gone away and didn't have enough staff scheduled to work .............Poor managing. On our last trip to Bill's I had the Prime Rib 4 out of 5 night because it was great. This time I didn't see any advertising and ordered something un-memorable off the menu fter diner I mentioned this to the waiter and he brought us over a table add that showed the Prime Rib diner available 24hrs a day. Again live and learn but had the add been on our table as well I would have ordered it.The next day I ordered it and it was not as remembered, I received a tough, rubbery and fatty/ greasy hunk of meat more akin to a cheap prime rib steak than roast and a sad old baked potato that looked like it had been cooked days before...............Cheapened product. We played the slots and the payouts percentage were the worst of any casino we visited in our 5 nights in Vegas. Every other casino we went into and played had some payback but not at Bills it was take take take take and keep.............. Poor value Usually we would be able to get a drink / beer without problems but at Bill's we would order then about 45 min to an hour later the waitress would come by again apologize for forgetting us then return 15 minutes late apologize again and serve us our beer. We had tipped each and every time we had a beer delivered to us but that didn't matter either they were short staffed or the waitresses just weren't very good............Poor management. I had requested a quiet room away from Bill's and the Flamingo's air conditioning units the first 3 nights were fine but on our return they gave me a room with a constantly running toilet and non-stop air conditioning noise............ Poor customer service None of these complaints by themselves would make for a bad stay but when all combined it makes it so I will go elsewhere the next time down to Vegas. We spent over two thousand dollars in Bill's on rooms, the machines, in their restaurants and tips and we won't be back .............. Poor management

Reviews.Title: “Clean. Super comfortable bed. Good location on the strip. Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bangforbucktravel
Reviews.Content: What a great deal. We stayed mid-week, Sun - Thurs, Sunday was a little more pricy, but we paid about $45 inc tax each night for Mon, Tue, Wed. We got a king size bed, ooh so comfortable with a nice doona, only complaint would be the pillows. A little old and chunky ( you know when the filling bunches into little clumps), but we just put the bad ones underneath. Nice hot shower with good water pressure. But beware, the water drainage is a bit of a problem, we were on the top floor ( not sure if this makes a difference) but we would shower and be standing in about half a foot of water. Great size TV, room was well lit and spacious. Has an ironing board and iron, however it does not have a kettle which was a bit annoying for me as I love a cuppa when I wake-up , but as my partner said, 'who cares you're in Vegas'. The restaurant downstairs does an awesome $13.95 Steak, great service, generous serving and good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: hennessy26
Reviews.Content: Best part is the location. Across from Caesars, next to Ballys and Flamingo. Smaller casino not a lot of food options. Rooms good size but getting old. A lot of small cosmetic stuff that isn't that important especially at $45 a night. I would try staying somewhere else next time but overall good. OK staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: flowergirlt
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I read alot of reviews on hotels in Las Vegas. To the point where I was driving myself crazy trying to decide where to stay. I finally decided on Billts Gamblin' Hall & Saloon. This place rocks!! The location was perfect!!! The rooms were not the most modern or luxurious but they were clean and big. The price was good and the staff was always pleasant. I was also worried because we had 3 laptops with us and they do not have any safes. It was not a problem at all. We had alot of stuff with us because we were traveling on after Las Vegas and had to have enough to be gone for 2 weeks. I would def recommend staying at this place!!!! The casino is small, but we were busy visiting the rest of Las VEgas and was not concerned with that! I see reviews about smells, etc. I did not find any of these negative items on my stay! Dont be afraid to stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “For the location and value, wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetosparkle
Reviews.Content: I came to Vegas for Reading Week and stayed at Bill's at the recommendation of my brother. There is absolutely no better location you can stay at on the strip! The hotel is not very big - only 4 floors. When we arrived, we got upgraded to a room with a view, so we could see the Bellagio Fountains. The room was great! It was clean and fairly big. If I had to complain about one thing it would be the sheets. They were not soft, but we were not expecting much with our budget. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: mogcambomama
Reviews.Content: The size of this hotel,200 rooms is why I choose it plus the location is perfect.We got a free upgrade to the fourth floor on the Bellagio side. The front desk ladies Lucy and Colette were outstanding and worked quickly to resolve a overbooking problem. The hotel was very clean. The housekeeping staff did a excellent job on the rooms. The beds were very comfy. We were worried about the noise but the street noise wasn't bad since we were on the fourth floor and there was no noise from the other rooms. We tried Bill's Victorian room for a couple of meals. The food was OK but had some good specials for breakfast,lunch and dinner at good Vegas prices. The casino is small but very popular so busy. The cocktails waitress came by frequently so we never paid for a drink our whole five day stay. The slots weren't lucky the first four days but during the last twenty four hours we hit the jackpot on three different slot machines. We will stay at Bill's next time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: red99336
Reviews.Content: Vomit in the elevator, and in the hallway. Called about it, nobody shower. The whole place has a "hangover smell".

Reviews.Title: “BUSY, BUSY, BUSY”
Reviews.Author: bedhead02
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to be in the middle of the Strip with lots of noise, then Bill's is the place for you. The hotel is very close to the road so you hear all the noise of the traffic and the constant partying. The rooms are very clean and the housekeeping staff are friendly and work hard. The rooms do not have a safe and the internet service cost is $11.99 for 24 hours and is for laptop's ONLY, (no notebook's/ipad's etc.). The Casino's small and constantly busy. The security staff are very visible and there appear's to be plenty of them on duty at all times. The bell desk staff were really nice and very helpful. You can't buy a coffee in the hotel, which is an inconvenience in the mornings. The beds were very comfortable. I can see why, due to its location, people want to stay at Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “slap bang in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: lorraine n
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2012 and loved it we were right in the middle of it all !!!! Bally's, Bellagio and Cesears Palace across the road from Bill's. The Room was quite large, spotlessly clean, and the bed just brings to mind the song Grandma's Feather Bed, bedlinen was spotless and changed every second day. Towels were clean and soft and there was an ironing board and iron and also a hair dryer which worked quite adequetely. We were on the 2nd floor and had a view of the Bellagio Fountains and when the fountains went off it sounded like thunder, but this didn't bother us as the spectacular view more than made up for the noise. The only negative I could find is the lack of tea or coffee making facilities in the room. If we were going back we'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spen $10 more and go somewhere that cares”
Reviews.Author: RulesLawyer
Reviews.Content: What a dive. I've stayed at other bottom tier properties in Vegas (Imperial Palace, Riviera, Circus Circus), and didn't think that Bill's would be among them. I'd go back to IP before I'd stay here again. I arrived at 3:30 on a Sunday afternoon and attempted to check in. My travel agent said check-in time was 3:00; the front desk (and Bill's web site) says it was 4:00. Would I like to pay $10 for early check-in? Fine. My wife and I head up to the room. The elevators are creaky, and we exit onto the third floor. A stained marble shelf in the elevator lobby clearly used to have a vase bolted down to it -- the bolt hole and the round stain make that obvious. To my left, an ice machine with a semi-permanent handwritten "out of order" sign exudes class. We head to the room, open the door, and it's a smoking room. We'd requested non-smoking. We've got a view of the parking lot. There's no safe, no refrigerator, no closet. The bed's very firm. The shower head fixture is attached to the wall with lots of red putty; the cover for the connection is loose on the pipe. My wife wants to take a nap, and fortunately, we've got one more comped night at the Riviera to use (we thought we'd skip it and stay here, but that ain't happening). I drive her back, and then come back to Bill's at 4:30 to request a change to a non-smoking room. The front desk says they have none available, and that they don't guarantee such requests. Really? Maybe ask again tomorrow, he says. So if I'm understanding correctly, on a Sunday in early March, when there's no major events in town, there's no non-smoking rooms available for early check-in (fine, maybe they weren't clean yet?), and none after the regular check-in time either? And you can't assign me one that you'll know will be available tomorrow or the next day? Really? We stayed at the Riviera instead of Bill's on Sunday night. I dropped my wife at the airport on Monday morning, went to work, and returned on Monday night. By this time, I'd given up on the non-smoking issue. I only use the hotel to sleep and shower; I could tolerate the smokiness. There's better hotels nearby (Flamingo, Harrah's, Ballys, Imperial Palace) usually for the same cost or less. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In a Great Location 27 FEB 2012”
Reviews.Author: bs4u2c
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and have not been disappointed. The rooms are nice, it is fast and convenient to get to your room from the casino, and a great value for your money. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that likes to stay in a hotel that’s located in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “great location terrible coffee”
Reviews.Author: Nekolover
Reviews.Content: Bill's is in the best location, and I would stay here again IF the price were really good. Great towels and housekeeping service. Everything else... not too thrilled. There was no coffee maker in the room, and although the website shows some sort of coffee bar in the lobby, there wasn't one. The coffee from the restaurant was really awful. I ended up walking to the Flamingo next door every day for coffee. I don't like the idea of being charged for wifi - it's ridiculous when a cheapy motel offeres it for free. I am not particularly tall (5'7"), but the shower head was at my height, so I had to bend over to wash my hair. I guess they wanted to save money on the piping. Also, very strangely, the hair dryer was installed flush to the outlet, so if you want to use the outlet you have to unplug the hair dryer. However, the price was good, the location was great, the hotel was very clean, and the beds were comfortable. Just don't expect anything fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: hifi-schatzi
Reviews.Content: Bills is clean, beds are comfy, sheets are soft and the halls are short and rooms are easy to get to! I always stay at Bills' when is Vegas, the prices are great and the location cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Goofball15
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful and fun atmosphere to be around in. Out of all of the casinos this one was my favorite. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. I have stayed at other larger hotels in Vegas but this one was very nice and fun. The location of the hotel is great because its right in the middle of all the fun hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat Price for Location”
Reviews.Author: yideboit
Reviews.Content: Plain and Simple review: If you want suave, swanky, upscale.. this place isn't for you! HOWEVER! If you want somewhere that has a GREAT rate, AMAZING location, and helpful staff, this is your place. I had no problem staying here and will likely stay again, unless some other places substantially drop their rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Aran88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bills, because of the great location on the strip. And I have to say you can't fault that. We were in Vegas for the USA sevens which were running shuttles from Bally's so Bills suited us. We did not get the room we requested - despite requesting it and paying the deposit 6 months in advance. I accidentally left my very expensive MP3 played in the room, it had fallen off the bedside table on the floor, so I forgot to pick it up when I left. I emailed 3 times with no response, I live in the UK so it is expensive to call so hoped they'd reply via email - they didn't. I called house keeping and they said they would check the room again - as the MP3 player hadn't turned up - and let me know via email which yet again they didn't. I would have thought a Vegas hotel would be used to dealing with lost property. However Bills did not 'Find' my item or give me the necessary assistance to lodge a claim with my insurance company. And another complaint against Bills was they would not allow us late check out, despite requesting it months in advance and again on the day - Monday of check out. Even though the hotel was virtually empty and we even said we would pay for the room.

Reviews.Title: “We love Bill's Gamblin Hall”
Reviews.Author: Geocam
Reviews.Content: Location, service, room. restaurant, value, were all fantastic! We would not hesitate to stay here again. We also LOVE big Elvis who plays in their lounge. That was the reason we wanted to stay at Bill's in the first place. The hotel is old and very tiny in Las Vegas standards but we liked that about it. It only took a minute to go up to our room and we didn't need a map to find our way around like many of the huge hotels. Being right in the center of the strip it was noisy so if you are going to Vegas for a restful stay this might not be the place for you. For us, it was all part of the Vegas experience. I also can not say enough about the staff. We had excellent service from them all.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: hugs4u
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas with the sole purpose of seeing Elton John at Caesar's Palace. We wanted an inexpensive, overnight stay before heading out the day after. We came and saw good reviews here on TripAdvisor, so we felt comfortable making this selection. Yes, this hotel is affordable and SO conveniently located in the heart of the strip. Yes, we had an incredible view of the strip (viewing south toward Paris, Bellagio, even the fountains). Yes, it is great to see all the lights and excitement of the strip. The room was clean and certainly decent enough. There is a lovely, large flat screen television on the wall. So, what's the gripe? We arrived at the hotel at 3:15 PM and began checking in with our reservation. We were greeted by a friendly staff member, who looked up our reservation and mused aloud "Humm..that room isn't ready yet. Let me see what is." So, she found a room that was ready and moved forward with checking us in, taking a credit card for additional expenses. When the check-in was completed, she mentioned "Oh, there is an additional $10.00 charge for checking in early." Check in time, apparently, is 4:00 PM. Our car was one flight up from the desk, we could have easily waited out the 45 minutes so as not to incur the extra charge. Ehh, $10, what the heck? So, we went up to our room, looked things over, enjoyed the view and the adequate interior. Nothing at all fancy, but we weren't there for a resort experience. Fine. Upon check out time the next morning, we went to check out using the option on our TV, only to notice that the early check in charge had gone from $10 up to $11.20. Huh? Ok, still not a lot of money, but we wanted to understand why. The hostess at the desk said, even after hearing that we were not told of the charge in advance said "The $11.20 is the original $10.00 plus tax, which comes to $11.20. I'm sorry, but we cannot refund that, it is hotel policy. I am sorry that you were not told in advance, but we can't change it now." When looking at the receipt we were given, we say that there was not an itemized charge for the $1.20 tax like the rest of the bill, so this seemed a bit suspect. By nature, we are not people who complain, nor are we cheap. Still, this felt wrong. (We also learned in this discussion that Bill's is owned by Caesar's...good to know.) Here's the bigger beef. The hotel is located at the corner of Las Vegas Blvd. and Flamingo Road. Truly at the heart of the strip. We've stayed on strip facing properties on many, many occasions, but somehow, some way, the other hotels manage to mute the sounds of the strip. This was a Friday night, the entire strip was hopping. And hopping. AND HOPPING. The sounds were deafening! Loud music from the strip (we never were able to determine where the music was coming from..maybe an animated, brightly lit sign at Bally's?) The cars honking, the party people reveling at the street level, the endless sirens..ALL NIGHT LONG. The drunken revelers coming back to their rooms at 2, 3 and 4 AM. Loud, laughing, wall-pounding as they walked down the hallway, inconsiderate drunks. We're all for people having a good time, we realize that alcohol renders people less inhibited, but COME ON!! 4 AM screaming up and down the hall? We also understand that this is, in now way, the fault of the hotel itself. For these reasons, although we appreciate the prime location, the inexpensive but clean and decent room, we will not be staying here again. Better to spend more money for a good night's sleep. I will say that the staff member, Lisa, at the "rewards" desk was extremely friendly and helpfully chatty. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: RUCP
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at Bill's. I couldn't ask for more. It is located dead center on the strip on the corner of Flamingo Road which makes walking to most places on the strip a possibility. The distances can be huge in Las Vegas, especially when walking, but we easily walked to Palazzo for a show in about 20 minutes. Ceasar's Palace is right across the street and Planet Hollywood is about 10 minutes away. If you are looking for plush surroundings with the newest of everything, keep looking. This is not your place. If you are looking for a clean, decently appointed, safe, reasonably priced place to sleep and relax during your stay, I'd recommend giving Bill's a try. We travel to see the sights and experience the place we are visiting, not to stay in a hotel room. We spend maybe 10 hours a day total in a room and I can't see spending hundreds of dollars for that. The staff was friendly and helpful when needed and our bellman was a real gentleman. I enjoyed the old school feel to the place and absolutely loved the mahogany trim and wainscoting used throughout the hotel. Next time we go to Vegas, we'll be staying at Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Indianacats
Reviews.Content: We just got back and were very pleased with Bill's. The room had a wonderful view of the strip - Bellagio Fountain, Eiffel Tower...etc. Food was good, gambling was good. We have absolutely no complaint. Our room was clean, good shower, good view! What more do you need?! Convient to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great...or not....depending on what kind of Vegas trip you want”
Reviews.Author: kevin443
Reviews.Content: Bill's has probably the best Mid-Strip location for anyone who wants to be in the middle of it all for a cheap price. It definitely "feels" like Vegas around the hotel. It is a great place to stay for someone on a budget or someone just interested in a place to sleep with a good location on the Strip. The hotel is very small compared to the mega hotels that surround it. My room was very clean and a normal standard room size. No frills of course, but it is priced accordingly. The casino is a complete smoke cloud with a lot of younger people in it. It is a fun vibe, but definitely not fancy and is not meant to pamper you. If you haven't seen "Big Elvis" perfom, you should do that at least once in your life. It is a free show in the casino daily. There are no resort fees at Bill's and you can use the Flamingo Hotel's pool during pool months. By the way, the Flamingo does not have resort fees either. I would stay at whichever hotel was cheaper. They are right next to each other. It was not very busy when I stayed there and the elevators where not an issue. I'm sure they would be slow if it was busy though. There are only two of them. If you are looking for a more pampered feel for you vacation stay somewhere else. If you are looking for budget, location, party atmosphere Bill's will work well for you. Just remember, you can always use the fancy nearby hotel's restaurants and casinos without staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location...Location”
Reviews.Author: Arden44
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several other Hotels both on the Strip and Downtown and we just loved the ambience of Bill's. We were there for 7 nights and really enjoyed the location. Booked this Hotel because we were going to see Rod Stewart @ Caesars Palace. We were treated very well from the moment we checked in. Our room was big and comfortable and overlooked the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains which was great. Housekeeping was 1st Class. Casino was fun & lively although not big. Our only problem was with the Victoria Room Restaurant. I have a food allergy and if one cook was on duty he had no problem with it...another one did and the food was very hit and miss and also expensive. The front end and wait staff were fabulous but could do nothing to help. We would certainly stay there again as we feel it is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Been there, done that.”
Reviews.Author: rio2009
Reviews.Content: Been there, done that kinda hotel. It has that old cowboy feel charm, but that's about it. If you are going for just a place to sleep, then the price is ok. It's right on the strip, I mean right on the sidewalk. Our room was VERY noisy. It was as if the windows were open. We had to sleep with the ac/fan on all night to help drown out the noise. So if you are going to stay, ask for a room off the strip but you will get a view of the alley. The staff however, was nice. The hotel, well....... per the front desk, valet is only available from midnight to 7 am, it is a bit worn out. The carpets in the halls are in need of a good cleaning, the furniture is a worn. The rooms were dated but clean, beds were ok, no coffee maker or fridge unless you have a suite. You don't have to drag your bags thru the hotel to check in/out. The Victorian restaurant that is in the hotel, we won't be back. Though our waitress was very funny and nice, we sat there for almost 15 minutes before we were acknowledged or offered anything to drink. Both orders of eggs benedict had poached hard boiled eggs, the sauce was not good, hashbrowns were cold, the waffle was cold, not a good flavor. We won't be back

Reviews.Title: “Functional, fun and cheap”
Reviews.Author: beaker13_13
Reviews.Content: By now if you've read the other reviews, you pretty much have a picture of Bill's. Yes, it's older and small, could use some updating. If you're a "see and be seen party queen" you'll hate it, not blingy, glitzy or new enough for you. If you're taking the family along (grandad, granny and the kids), it's not for you either - not what I'd call family oriented (pool is at the Flamingo, food choices limited). But.. if you're a "my hotel room is for sleeping in and I hate dragging my luggage through monstrous jungles of slots " type, give Bill's a try. The room we had was bigger and better appointed than what others in our party had in Ceasar's, beds were comfy and tidy. (eg -We had 42" flat screen tv, Caesar's still had a 27" crt. Caesar's bathroom had no door, just a switch back hallway that echoed - kind of odd when you have a bunch of people in the room and someone has to use the facilities.). Our room was quiet, but we were on the back side of the hotel, so the view was back alley but we were never in the room long enough to care anyhow. Our whole group had fun in Bill's casino even though others were staying at Caesar's and The Mirage. If you're looking for Craps lessons, they have free lessons every day at 10:30 - try to get the older pit boss as a coach - he was hilarious without trying to be. I'm guessing he's seen a few things in his life there.. :) Fat Elvis was good for a laugh, everyone in the crowd was having fun. It's just a lot more low-key and friendly than what we saw in other casinos. If you want a suite, either for entertaining or just because you have a bigger group, apparently the John Wayne room is a hoot - it was supposedly built and decorated for him to stay in way back when and then he died just before he was supposed to stay there. Cowboy decor, leather and wood, 3 room suite for a few hundred $$/night. Might be worth asking about. Victorian restaurant was good, prices were reasonable and staff was helpful and friendly. Bartenders were also helpful, no problems with giving advice or answering questions. Drinks were decent sized and priced. If you were gambling the drinks came around as often as you wanted them. If/when we go back, we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ken T
Reviews.Content: While not glitzy and modern, Bill's (formerly Barbary Coast) has a great location on the strip, and unlike the newer casinos isn't a football field's walk to your room. The staff was beyond friendly, and the gambling provided a great bang for our buck. Our room was very clean (although could have used a little updating), had a great view of the strip, and was only minutes away when we decided to call it a night. Fans of glamor will not appreciate this place---it's old school Vegas (and that's the reason we chose it). I'd personally give Bill's a 4---my husband and I intend to stay there again on our next Vegas adventure----but with so many other more modern options I worry about disappointing those who don't share our aesthetics.

Reviews.Title: “run-down”
Reviews.Author: TracyAnn-California
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying in a Victorian old-fashioned hotel. It was a dreary disappointment. We left as early in the morning as we could and didn't come back until we were ready to sleep. We gambled, ate, relaxed, and people watched at a few other hotels. We were only disappointed with Bills! We ate one meal there and although the food tasted okay. The food was overpriced, the staff chatty with each other and not friendly or helpful with customers. The atmosphere made me think of a Denny's that should have been remodeled 20 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great room at great price”
Reviews.Author: Bruce P
Reviews.Content: This room was very clean and I slept like a baby. It is right on the strip in between Bally's and Flamingo. The cleaning staff wished me a safe trip on my way out which to me is rare in cold and greedy Vegas. I could literally see the Bellagio fountain shows nightly which was cool. The only problem I had was with room service. Very expensive for the low quality of food. If you want food go down to the Victorian room which serves 24/7 and grab yourself a bite to eat and bring it back to room. The food here is really good. Parking was extremely easy to get navigate and I would leave all day and go to the national parks nearby then come back at night and get wasted and gamble. The casino is a bit of an older crowd, but hey who cares for the price of $40 a night you can roam the strip til your heart's content. I don't even have to question if I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive ok rooms but huge fun to be had downstairs.”
Reviews.Author: Popstar23
Reviews.Content: I've only stayed at Bill's once but we never fail to pay it a visit when whenever we're in Vegas due to the massive old school fun factor. It's always packed with a fabulous array of 'Vegas' characters and has pretty much the cheapest tables on the strip. The free drinks are slow to transpire if your gaming so you have to really attract your servers attention. The best way to get cheap drinks though is to sit and watch the utterly insane karaoke in the other room. Every 20 minutes the host spins a massive wheel full of drinks offers and whatever it lands on is what's on offer for the next 1/2 hr - plus you may get to meet the legendary Barbara Ann Queen of Karaoke. She really is unmissable and unmistakable. The rooms themselves are done out in a mock 'cowboy saloon' style, with lots of dark wood and tassels and heavy curtains. They are a bit shabby to be honest but they're a real bargain mid week and you are in the heart of all the action and not far from a Sky Train stop. Let's face it...your in Vegas...you won't be spending much time in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Two nights at Bills”
Reviews.Author: 16gauge
Reviews.Content: I just returned for a Vegas trip where I spent two nights at Bills Gamblin' Hall. Generally I stay downtown when in Vegas, but I had a first time Vegas visitor with me - so the first two nights on the strip were planned. Our room was on the 3rd floor with a decent view of some of the north strip properties. The room was basic, but clean. A bargain for $36/night. Check in/check out quick - no lines. Bills does not have thousands of rooms and dozens of shops and restaurants - if you want that, go somewhere else. Bills small size allows you to be out of your room and on the strip in a minute or two - no 10-15 minute walk from the room to the street like some of the mega strip resorts. Location at LVB and Flamingo cannot be beat. The best way to describe Bills is to call it a Downtown casino hotel located on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Basic With Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JTB9110
Reviews.Content: Bill's Gambling Hall and Saloon is an inexpensive and centrally located hotel in Las Vegas. The rooms are comfortable. The price is exceptionally reasonable. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't return”
Reviews.Author: lisandbri
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel while staying in Vegas. Hotel is older and shows age. Bathroom was tiny and very cold inside when I noticed the fixed window in tub area was left open by previous guest/housekeeping? Water did not drain well out of bathtub while I showered. Bed was comfortable, but it was easy to hear hallway and a/c noise. First 3 or 4 TV stations didn't come in well...fuzzy and couldn't see them. Only a couple of restaurants in hotel. One is expensive (but very good) steakhouse and the other is small, diner-style. Small restaurant did not take reservations and the wait for breakfast could be lengthy if you don't arrive early. The staff was very courteous and the live band on Friday night was great!! I would recommend this hotel for those who don't spend a lot of time in their room and use it mainly to crash. Since I like to spend some time relaxing in the room while on vacation I'll probably book elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Very Good Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bosox1010
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six days at Bill's: Pros: -Excellent Location -Low stakes gaming for the Strip -Steakhouse was amazing -reasonably good service for the rate -Tickets 4 Tonite right in hotel casino (great for booking shows and restaurants) Cons: -Internet did not work (even after working with on and off site technician) -Casino does not have the best ventilation (very smoky) -bed was too soft

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendybel
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at Bill's or 3 weeks. Second time in 2 years. The rooms are clean and large, housekeeping ladies are really nice. Bill's does not have a coffee machine in the room so we purchased a kettle and cups from Walmart for $15. Used it most days and left it in the room. Bill's has the best beds, so comfortable & warm. Super location right in the middle of the strip. Mike the Concierge guy is really friendly & knowledgeable. We got to know him quite well, gave us a few good tips on Vegas and the surrounding areas. We hired a car to get around, most of the casino have free parking. We also got to know the staff in the Victorian room, its nice that they remember you from previous visits. The steakhouse is amazing, huge steaks & excellent service, great for a romantic evening or a large group. Bill's is a small hotel with about 300 or so rooms. The casino is always busy and not as smokey as some of the others. Would recommend this hotel to everyone and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A step back in time with views of the Bellagio fountains”
Reviews.Author: D_elle_D
Reviews.Content: We spent three weeks in the USA and, out of all the places we stayed, Bill's was by far my favourite. Bill's is not competing with the showy themed hotels that surround it. Instead, it has a timeless quality, almost like it's marching to the beat of its own drum. I really felt like I had I stepped back in time to an old gambling saloon, complete with striped-paper wallpaper and an old fashioned steak-house (which we frequented as often as we could!). We didn't spend too much time in our room (who does in Vegas?!). That said, Bill's rooms were clean with modern amenities and were perfectly adequate, especially given how reasonable the room rates were. We were also lucky enough to have a view of the Bellagio fountains from our room, which was magical. Bill's is well placed - it was right next to Bally's and the Flamingo, and not far from some of the bigger well-known hotel/casino's, such as Caeser's. The only bad point in our entire stay at Bill's was the lady working the nightshift on the front counter -- she could not have been ruder - but she was the exception to an otherwise fantastic stay. We'll be back next time we're in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Mini Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: coloradonative63
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that we stayed at Bill's. I based my decision on booking there from the ratings on several websites and the price. This is right in the middle of the strip and close to the action, but the price can't be beat. No resort fees either! This location is no bigger than a Comfort Suites, but it worked out well. No mile long walk to get to your room. Small, cozy atmosphere. Employees were nice. Bellman gave us a great tip on an Italian Restuarant just a couple of blocks from the hotel, Batista's Hole in the Wall. It was fantastic! Highly recommend!! We had some problems with the people next door to us being VERY LOUD and obnoxious at 3 a.m., but security handled the issue for us and we were able to get back to sleep. There is nothing fancy about the rooms, but they were clean and comfortable. If you want a "resort", this isn't the place to stay. But if you want to save money and are OK with a basic room you can't go wrong. There isn't a pool, but it was too cold to hang out by the pool anyways. I guess you can go over to the Tropicana if you want to use a pool, but we didn't verify that. We had breakfast once at the Victorian Cafe and it was good. Didn't eat at the steakhouse. Blackjack dealers we had were for the most part friendly and personable.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here from NYE 2011/2012”
Reviews.Author: MilHope
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Bill for 4 nights over NYE 2011/2012. It was our first time to Vegas. We chose Bills because of the location in the center of the Strip and the reasonable room rates. The rooms themselves were very large! We had a suitcases all over the floor and it was no problem. The bathroom inc shower above bath was small and simple. All we really needed Big king size bed with questionable room decor, but it kind of works with the theme- its all for fun anyway. We chose the room option with a view of the Strip. I think we were on Level 2. We could the the Bellagio Fountians, Ballys, Paris etc. Great view. The hallways smell a bit life smoke but our room was non smoking and smelt fine. Beds were kind of lumpy but once you got used to them it was okay. You dont really come to Vegas to sleep anyway.. The food at the restaurant was not at all cheap, even the breakfast. Room service cost an extra $5 on top of your order which sucked but nice big portions. We ordered off the menu a few times (they only have limited selection room service menu compared to the restaurant itself) and they didnt have a problem. Wifi was an extra $12 per day. We somehow ended up getting an occasional free Wifi signal from somewhere though so we never had to pay for it. Downstairs casino was small in comparison, but still really fun because you dont have to push your way around so much. All in all, it was good value for money. The location was tops and we got the Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jgabiatti
Reviews.Content: It's an old hotel with a great location. Large and confortables rooms. Casino it was cool, we saw a Elvis's cover.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time a charm”
Reviews.Author: Tonyrosenalex
Reviews.Content: Our 8th visit to Vegas and 2nd at Bills, we decided to come back as we got a great deal online. The room was nice and clean with a large bed and huge T.V. we had a lovely strip view, yeah its noisy but how much sleep are you expecting in Vegas... I would def recommend the hotel to anyone looking for somewhere clean to stay in the centre of the strip, there are a couple of eating choices in the hotel which are fine. The Victoria restaurant was very busy when we ate there and the food was okay if you want to stay local. Overall the hotel is a hidden gem on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best location best value on strip”
Reviews.Author: insearchofit
Reviews.Content: Third time here. Location is fantastic. Staff very friendly. Rooms big and very clean. Food at the Steakhouse excellent. Breakfast average++. Casino small friendly. A band played one night in the casino and were superb. I'll never bother to look for other hotels - this is my home in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “old vegas in the middle of new vegas”
Reviews.Author: rpleb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Bills. Room 312 which overlooked the strip. Let me start by saying I have read every review for Bills going back 6 months on Tripadvisor and can not believe what some people complain about. The noise from the street was a non issue. In fact, it was great watching all the people walking down the strip. We did not have any issues with street noise while going to bed. The elevators were not slow and I never waited more than 30 seconds for one. We had so much fun here. The place is full of hard working middle class people who would rather spend their money on gambling, drinks and shows than on their room. It was perfect for us. Why spend 200 or 300 a night for a place to pass out when Bills offers 60 dollar rooms with a perfect view? The room was nice size. Very clean. Little window in the bathroom that opens and you can people watch even while showering. I only turned the tv on to check out. It looked nice though. There is a huge dresser, a work desk and a table in the room along with 4 chairs. It served our needs well. The staff was very pleasant and I had no issues with any of them. Check in was quick with no wait and the elevators are within steps of the front desk. It was great to walk in this place and be in the room in a minute or two. The property is a little old but thats what I like about it. Nice looking wood work. It is in the center of it all. The only time we cabbed was to and from the airport. I didnt find the casino to be smoky like some people have said. There is karaoke at night and my wife and I had so much fun watching this. There is only one thing I did not like about Bills and that was their Victorian Room restaurant. We went here around 2 am after a hard day of drinking so everything should taste good at that point. We both got the steak and egg special for 6.99 and the steak was inedible. I realize that for 6.99, the steak would not be a prime cut but at least make it edible. All and all, great time. I will definitely look this place up the next time I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAY IN LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Kay T
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this hotel might not be for everyone but for me and my husband in our 50's it was the best on the strip. first the staff was wonderful from the maids,restruant,floor... were there to help us have the best time possible..it is a smaller hotel than some of the big names but that was also the wonderful part of it.. smack dab in the middle of the strip in walking distance to all the big casino's and hotels... our view was of the bellogio water show every night.. something i never got use to. they were wonderful... being on the corner we of course people watched and had a bill board with all the news and attractions.....i would and will stay there if and when i go back..i can not say enough good things about the hotel...thank you all for taking such good care of us on our stay

Reviews.Title: “best value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jarek_Yaroslav
Reviews.Content: to be short, this is the best hotel to experience the true las vegas spirit without significant harm to your credit card. to tell the full story, i googled this hotel searching for 'cheesiest las vegas hotels'. given vegas is a sensorial insult, i wanted my hotel to match this. and bills gamblin hall lived to this expectations - it is all in lights and hosts their very own signature elvis show. now, to those of you who are not after cheesiness, this is still a good choice - you get a spacious clean room with comfortable bed just in the centre of the strip, steps from belaggio fountains for the fraction of the strip price. you can still enjoy other great resort hotels - belaggio, venetian - all of which are step away. on top, staying at bills you get access to flamingo swimming pool - and could fully immerse into this pink craziness (make sure you take your id with you if you look 30 or younger to get admitted to the pool). all in all, i think you would not get a better deal to stay on strip, and don't need to compromise on room comfort on cleanliness to get this deal. of course, if you have bigger budget, then probably opt for other hotels like belaggio, if you are on reasonable budget, i recommend to stay on strip in bill's. it is much better choice vs. staying for the same price in a probably newer and funnier hotel further away from the strip (e.g. golden nugget is further away from strip, but have shark aquarium)- first, given that free cocktails are served everywhere, you would not be able to drive back from strip to your hotel, second, if you take taxi, you would spend quite some time in slow down-town traffic and spend money which could probably get you into a better strip hotel. so, if you go vegas, you should stay right where everything is happening - which is on strip, and bill's offers this opportunity for very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great price - great location”
Reviews.Author: Niels_Maaike_NL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in DEC 2009 (!), not 2011 as I cannot select 2011. It is a little hidden gem, because it is not that big and not as expensive as other hotels on the strip but the location is great. So have all the benefits for a relatively low price... oww and the rooms are good too :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location- Friendly staff- Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: lushou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's from Monday to Friday. The hotel is old but very clean. The location cannot be beat. The staff was friendly and Victoria's restaurant was decent for breakfast. Mi highly recommend staying here if you are on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurence_and_Trudi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bills over New Years 2011/12. Bills is a great place. We've always enjoyed the Casino but this was our first stay here. Its great value with an excellent rate compared to the other Hotels near by. The rooms are pretty large, and whilst they are quite basic, they are well cared for and clean. The bathroom is pretty basic, with a shower over the bath, but again its clean, and you are supplied with all the toiletries you need! The rooms are also pretty quiet. Bills location is excellent and second to none; bang in the centre of the Strip and the heart of the action. If you are looking for a good location for a fantastic rate and dont mind having a more basic room for that, this is the place for you. We had a good stay here, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Old School!”
Reviews.Author: LopezAV7
Reviews.Content: Great location with old school feel right on the strip. Great place to swing by for cheap $1 margaritas and beers! Usually have cheap $5 table action if your looking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: javyjoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bills in October with my husband. We were really happy with our experience. Everyone was wonderful! Our room was spacious and had a wonderful view of Bellagio Fountains, plus you could hear the music if you open the cute stained glass window in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great on a budget”
Reviews.Author: esztechm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while passing through during a low budget cross country road trip. Does not offer any glamour, but you cannot beat the location. For a really good price, you can stay here, right on the strip, and right near the high end hotels. The hotel itself has been a part of the strip since before Oceans 11 starred Clooney. It stays true to what really matters in this town. A place to sleep, some food if you need it, and plenty of room to gamble in house. Truly a hidden gem on the strip. If you want a glitzy room, this is definitely not the place for you, but if you plan on spending more time out than in, you cannot beat this spot. Easy to get anywhere you may want to go, no need to pay the price. For example, it is right across the street from the Fountains of Bellagio, and hell, you can spend all night playing their floor, but unless you have the means (and good for you if you do), there is no need to pay their rates, when you can stay at good ol'Bill's. Parking is also a breeze. Unless I come into some money, I will be staying here when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Sjoseph410
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at Bill's. Without doubt the best no frills hotel on the strip. In the middle of everything. The best part is being able to get from your room to Las Vegas Blvd in two minutes or less. Love the old time ambiance of Bill's casino, and the lower prices overall. Strip view rooms are great and their suites are amazing! If you want the fancy room service and luxury amenities go to Bellagio or Caesars and pay $250/night. Bill's is a Harrah's / Ceasar's property so you can use the Flamingo pool and weight room. Great pressure in the shower and nice clean comfortable rooms. No lines to check in or out. Just a great place for an affordable Las Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Same, good old Bills”
Reviews.Author: Niels2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 4 times as it still has the best prices and the best location mid strip. i stayed in September and I was not dissapointed as usual. This is a small hotel compared to the hotels surrounding it (Ceasars, Bellagio, Flamingo, Ballys) and it is a more 'family' type hotel. The casino is relatively small but has a great atmosphere. The rooms are huge, with a wild west kind of feel to them. The 42 inch screen is fantastic, and there are the usual channels and movie rentals available. Room service is also possible. When i arrived, I asked for a smoking room, just because I was in Vegas. The lady at the front desk said there were unfortunately none left. BUT, "I'll upgrade you to the Suite for the same price as a regular room. You can smoke in there". This blew me away, and I must say this room was massive and not the most luxurious suite I've ever stayed in, but still put me in heaven. Huge separate bedroom with sofa chair, tv and own bathroom (with a window looking out on the strip - great having a shower and seeing what was going on on the strip). The 2nd room had ample seating space, dinner table, bar area and guest restroom. Ended up having dinner in the room, just because it was so nice. In any case, this hotel has great prices and service. Recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: carmelrunners
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the perfect location on a budget but still have a very clean and large room look no further. This hotel is not fancy and doesn't have a pool onsite but if you want to come to Vegas and be within walking distance of pretty much everything on the strip this is the place. I was here for 5 days for what you would pay for one night at other casinos just across the street. We like to stay at different hotels each visit. If you want inexpensive but great choose Bills! It is a bit noisy so take that into consideration when booking...I don't think either side of the hotel is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_in_Port
Reviews.Content: Except for having to enter through the very smoky main area of the casino, this place is a gem. The rooms are very generous in size, beuatifully decorated and quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location perfect for a solo traveller who wanted to walk around Las Vegas. I had a wonderful time and found both the restuarant and cafe good value too. I even found a atke away coffee place that made a decent cafe latte!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on Strip !”
Reviews.Author: Geminitraveller1953
Reviews.Content: Have just spent Christmas in Las Vegas and Bill's Gamblin' Hall was a perfect choice for us. The staff were all friendly and helpful;the rooms were clean, with fresh towels every day; beds were extremely comfortable; breakfasts were huge and kept you going all day and we got a(free) upgrade to a room overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Although this room was on the "road" side, noise from traffic was minimal. We all agreed that Bill's is perfect if you don't want a hotel that's glitzy and overpriced (and you can visit all of them at your leisure) and just want somewhere comfortable to sleep that's perfectly positioned for all the attractions on the Strip. If we ever return to Las Vegas, I would definitely stay at Bill's again. One tip for cheap drinks - O'Sheas Irish Bar just down the road has Coors for 1 dollar a bottle until 6pm every night.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed.....”
Reviews.Author: STLfan420
Reviews.Content: Now this review is for the hotel..... I have been waiting to stay here just to check it out, and it turns out with my wife going through 2 back surgeries in 6 months and I needed to save some cash. I have read all the reviews and it really didn't matter, I was going to stay there anyway. There really is not much bad I can say about this place. The parking garage is old and very circular. I mean... what do you expect from an old old old building. Easy to navigate around but the elevators are slow....so what. The more time you are in the elevator then less time you loose money right? Still not too shabby. When you get out of the elevators, you make a quick turn to the right and there is the front desk. Check in was SUPER EASY. This was one of my wife's main reason for staying here. NO line queue. I mean the walked from the elevator, made the turn and walked right up to the Front desk agent. She was really nice and noticed it was my birthday. We received our keys and walked right up to our room. Room was everything we needed. Its not like we needed much due to we were not in the room, but to rest and shower. We had the 2 beds and we used one of the beds to lay out all of our clothes for the next day. The TV was a large flat screen and was above the 2 person dresser. There was a decent table and chairs right next to window were we had a view of the entrance to the Flamingo. The view was really cool at night when that huge sign was lit up. JUST FYI, they don't turn off that sign until 7am. The bathroom was kinda small, but it worked. There was a small stained glass window you can open in the shower. If you close it and take a hot shower, it steams up the small bathroom when the door is closed. It left sooooo good. We really liked this hotel because you can walk from your room down to the strip in less than 5 minutes. Unlike those huge resorts where you may have to walk through a mall or something. Even the check out was quick and easy. No wait on a Thursday afternoon and again walked right up. Normally other resorts have the Thurs-Sun crowds filtering in. There was only 2 issues we had. One was when the heater kicked on the vents would make a load noise, but it only lasted a few times each night. The other issue was that we called down to request more bath towels, and they said the maid service was out for the day and we needed to call again in the morning. 10 minutes later someone did bring up the towels we needed. All the people are super nice, the bar tenders are really cool and even the security will stop and talk to you if they are not doing anything at the moment. I would stay there again if need be. I really cant pass up rooms for $37.00 per night for 4 nights. BOOM.

Reviews.Title: “OK- good for the money, but not for a long stay”
Reviews.Author: Salitini
Reviews.Content: This was the least nice of all of the hotels we stayed in on our month long holiday in the US. The hotel is old, and the hallways smell strongly of cigarettes. I'm sure the beds were clean, but after staying at The Tropicana and Sunset Station, I felt a little uneasy. The carpets seemed dirty, but this is probably because it is one of the older hotels. The room did have a really great air conditioner though. Very small casino. We were impressed by the Steakhouse restaurant though- really great service and great food, although expensive. Great location- in the middle of The Strip. Didnt find it noisy. Very cheap room, good for one night, but wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...poor odds in casino”
Reviews.Author: Hany K
Reviews.Content: I like to stay on Fremont Street but a friend I hadn't seen in years was staying on the strip so I booked a room at Bill's. Check in takes 2 minutes and the ladies were very friendly. The room was very large for a standard room. It had a nice view of Bally's and the Bellagio. The room had a large flat screen in it. Also, the room was very cleam and comfortable. The hotel is very easy to get in and out of and is in the center of the action on the strip. I like to gamble when I'm in Vegas and, in doing so, I like for my money to last as long as possible. I hadn't stayed on the strip on about 6 years and was dissapointed to see that Bill's blackjack tables were of the 6/5 variety. I refused to play blackjack or the slots at Bill's. If their rules are so bad in blackjack, where the bad odds are written right onto the table, I could only imagine at how tight the machines were. I did, however, take their free shuttle to the Gold Coast for hours of fun blackjack play. I emailed Harrah's/Ceasers' about their table games and got a response about how they will be forwarding my concern up the ladder. Whatever. Bottom line, great room, rates and location for staying on the strip. I forgot to mention, no real resort type amenaties but I wasn't looking for that. Not good for gambling but it doesn't appear as if anywhere on the strip is any good for gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Goneonvacation
Reviews.Content: I remember this place from when it had been the Barbary Coast, and I called for a room on a Tuesday when passing through Las Vegas. The reason is the location in the middle of the strip, across from Caesar's and near the City Center. As a walk in a got a room for under $40 (with tax). I went across the street to see the new restaurants at the Forum shops, bought a cigar at the new Fuente store, and walked through the City Center complex. Then I went back to Bill's and played blackjack. Bill's is small by Las Vegas standards, but fun. Yes, the casino is a bit smoky, but even on a Tuesday night it was alive. There are a couple of good restaurants and a late night club there, and for a quick trip it is great! If you are looking for luxury, spa,... then this is the wrong place. For location, value, and low key, then Bill's is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Skipper050
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Bill's when visiting Las Vegas because it has decent rooms for a reasonable price in the best possible location. We were there again for 11 nights in late December and early November. Normally we stay in one of the classic rooms but this time we opted for a luxury room, which cost an extra $20 per night. As far as I could tell, the luxury rooms are the same as the classic rooms except that they have a great view of the Bellagio fountains and the Strip. We felt that the view was well worth the additional cost but, if the view is not important or if you are on a tight budget, then the classic rooms are a better bet. The other consideration is that along with the view there comes noise from the street. The biggest problem is the sirens of emergency vehicles. This kept me awake for the first night but after that I slept fine. If you are a light sleeper or bothered by noise you might be better off forgetting the view and taking a classic room facing the wall of the Flamingo. Those rooms are nice and quiet. Noise from the casino below is not an issue even on the first floor as there are couple of floors of parking in between. Bill's is not fancy or ultra cool but it is a nice surviving bit of old Vegas. The rooms are pleasant, the staff are friendly and helpful, the casino is nice except when it gets crowded, and the cocktail waitresses keep you well supplied with drinks while gambling. The carpeting in the hallways could do with upgrading but, other than that, everything is in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and cheap - stay for the location!”
Reviews.Author: Ads_and_Wennie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Dec. Hotel is quite basic (no fridge or anything like that) but we only used it for sleeping. Location is excellent, right in the middle of the strip. Our room overlooked the Bellagio fountain which was cool

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Shasta4
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay at Bill's. I am a first time to Vegas traveller and Bill's left me wanting to go back.! We stayed in a suite and it was very big. The service at the front desk was great. This is a "No Frill's" hotel and if your looking for a friendly, fun atmosphere this is the place. Room's do need a bit of updating but they have everything you need at a quarter of the cost of other hotels. I do agree with the "working girl" comment below, but I did feel that the hotel staff took control of the situation as the morning crowd of guests started to come in. I will definatly stay at Bill's again as will the couple that was with us.

Reviews.Title: “Strip hotel on a human scale.”
Reviews.Author: plainsrefugee
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at Bill's, and we hope it is not the last. There are several good things about Bill's. First is location--mid-strip. Second is value. We paid $160 for a room for three nights, two of them weekend nights. Third is scale. Bill's is a small hotel, meaning that you don't have those interminable waits to check in or out, and you can get to your room without the necessity of packing a lunch. Fourth is the staff--very nice and helpful. The rooms we have had have been clean and the beds are fine. Our experience differed from Reddy45's. We were on the Flamingo side and found our room to me remarkably quiet. Our only complaint is that the bathroom was small, a little dingy, and in need or renovation. There was some mold on the ceiling above the tub, which was off-putting. There was one other aspect of Bill's I want to mention. The casino floor seems to be a favorite place for "working girls" to socialize in the early morning hours (i.e., 6-8). Some readers might be offended by this, while others will find it just another colorful aspect of the Vegas experience. In any event, forewarned is forearmed.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me.”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: I believe I am a very fair and reasonable person in most respects, so giving Bill's a Terrible rating is taking a lot of effort, but I need to review the hotel from my perspective for the benefit of other travelers (who may be like me). I'm not much of a gambler, so my review only covers the hotel. The major perk about Bill's that is echoed in many of these reviews is the location. You cannot get a better location that puts you literally minutes away from the big resorts (CityCenter aside). As a regular Vegas visitor who normally stays at MGM properties, I found that Bill's is easy to get into, easy to get out of, and easy to get back to. The size is also a perk somewhat because very little walking is required to go from your car in the parking garage to the casino, to the registration desk, to your room. The perks stop there, though. Now, before I begin, please realize that I am aware that travelers aren't staying at Bill's for the hotel, but many other reviews vaguely state something along the lines of "the room was decent and good enough", which is very loose for interpretation. For the benefit of others, I am going to highlight the issues that I observed during my stay. 1. The elevators can be extremely slow and in-use during peak periods. It was not abnormal to press the elevator button and then wait up to 5 minutes for it to finally arrive. There are only 3 floors of hotel rooms, so I can't really understand what would take them so long. 2. The room I was in exhibited a random thud or thunk noise many times per minute. When i first checked in I thought it was just noise from other guests, but when it continued all night long I investigated and it is tied to some machinery. It may be from the elevators or the heating/cooling system. Either way, it drove me nuts. 3. I'm pretty sure I booked a non-smoking room, but with the room I was given, I'm not really sure what I got. There is an obvious scent of 'cigarette smoke cover up' in the room that varies in intensity throughout the night. I also think cigarette smoke from other rooms creeped into mine at various times. There was a matchbook and ashtray on the side table when I arrived in the room, so I am inclined to think I was given a smoking room? 4. If your room faces the Flamingo, you will hear the constant mechanical whirr of the heating/cooling units on the roof of Bill's. It's actually quite loud and impossible to block out. A useful tip I read here regarding this problem is that closing the bathroom door helps. I can confirm this, although you cannot block out the noise 100%. 5. So not only was I given a smoking room (I guess) when I had booked a non-smoking room, I also was given a handicap-accessible room. I'm not handicapped in any way so I don't understand why this happened. First of all, save the room for those who really need it as I'm sure there were plenty of non-handicapped rooms for me to stay in. Secondly, the presence of all sorts of hand rails and usability accommodations is a big turn off. The toilet was surrounded in a large metal tubed frame that is supposed to help those who cannot stand using their leg muscles and the tub was lined on all sides with the same metal rails. I hate to be complaining about it, but it really was not necessary and Bill's should probably save rooms like this for people who need it. 6. During my morning shower I noticed that I was pretty much standing in a few inches of water as the drain apparently doesn't function as intended. 7. The room door only has a single deadbolt and no supplemental locking device. Additionally, the doors are thin, so you'll hear all the hallway noise. 8. Victoria's Cafe has what I feel is a ridiculous policy of charging $2 + 15% gratuity on takeout orders in addition to NOT serving their specials as take-out. So by now you are probably saying that I'm a hotel snob, and you're right. I am accustomed to staying at 4 or 5 star properties that don't necessarily mean everything is full service, but that there are certain minimum levels of acceptance for how the hotel room is designed and maintained. If I book a non-smoking room, I expect to get a non-smoking room. I also expect that the room be quiet against any mechanical noises present in the building. It also doesn't hurt to not be booked in a handicap-accessible room. That's my 2 cents. Take or it or leave it, but I had to state my observations and I won't ever be returning to Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / Stayed Dec. 5th through 7th 2011”
Reviews.Author: Tonysledge
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect. Rooms are in need of a little TLC. Casino a little smoky. Other than that service at the desk was very quick and friendly. Hotel let me check in four hours early. Ask for upgrade for extra $30 a day. Suite was well worth it. Twenty feet to the elevator, another thirty feet to the room. Great for going to and from the room quickly. Located almost center strip. Very close to everythig. Next trip I will be staying at Gamblin Bill's. NOTE price for the suite upgrade is the same regardless of the price of the room you book.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, but fun!”
Reviews.Author: Rich P
Reviews.Content: What an exciting trip! I met all types of new people on my first trip to Las Vegas! When I first arrived at Bill's Gamblin' Hall & Saloon, I was greeted by very friendly people who didn't even work for the hotel, but they sure were helpful. Within 5 minutes of walking toward the entrance, I was offered free tickets to shows, car rides to social lounges, and was guaranteed to have great time! Even thought it seemed like a fantastic idea, I thought it might be helpful to get my bag to the room first! Sheesh! The room was good for the price I paid, but I must say the walls seemed a little thin. I could hear so many people around me, it was like I had a few roommates or something! It sure beats feeling alone, I suppose. The hallway outside my room had a strange smell to it, but other than that I thought everything was great! The water faucets had hot and cold water, although the toilet was just cold the entire time. The Las Vegas Strip was right there and chock full of people from all over the planet! I'll bet I met at least 11 people that I didn't know before. That's a bet that I definately would have won on!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite casino on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Ted H
Reviews.Content: Bill's is like stepping back in time 20 years only its still surviving on the strip. The drinks and food are cheap and the slots are loose.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for anyone not too fussy!”
Reviews.Author: moose11
Reviews.Content: Location goes without saying - can you get any better? Check-in was quick and for an extra $20 we were given a room that looked directly onto the Eiffel Tower and across to the Bellagio - just amazing. The room was large, with 2 queen/king beds, and was clean. It was cleaned and beds made, towels replace daily. Those below who complained about the traffic/street noise must have bionic hearing - we slept well and thought the beds were fine. Maybe if you like a firm bed then ok the beds were on the soft side. The heating/cooling worked well also. yes the casino isn't as plush as others but the crowd were a good party crowd and the place had life all of the time, whereas the casinos at Bellagio, Ceasars and others were pretty dead in the mornings. We didn't go to gamble so wern't that fussed by the casinos, but when we did, we won.........then lost it all, so left them alone. We didn't eat in Bill's food places, and the coffee from the shop is ok-ish! If/when we go back, we will definitely head for Bill's - we paid around £180 for 4 nights including Friday and Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Lil-Barthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bills 2 years ago and when we went to Vegas this year in October we stayed there again and nothing has changed. The service was great, rooms great and the location is still awesome. We will be staying here again if we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: seauonboard
Reviews.Content: I found Bill’s here on Tripadvisor and decided to give it a try. I was taking a gamble (no pun intended) because this trip included my in-laws. My mother-in-law is very picky so I wasn’t sure how she would react if things weren’t “just right” but she LOVED it. She (as were we) was impressed by the size of the rooms and how clean they were. We got the Luxury room – which isn’t any bigger than the Classic – but includes a wonderful view of the strip. We could stand in our window and watch the water show at Bellagio every night.
