We also ate at the Victorian Café on site. The food was standard fare but we learned quickly to find something and share. The plates are huge. Most meals could feed 2 people. The casino was small but worked out fine for us when others decided to call it a night. Even got to see “Big Elvis” one night. When they say BIG they mean BIG. Great voice! The location was PERFECT – couldn’t have been better. Only downfall is no refrig or microwave - but that wouldn't stop us from staying again. Also - I checked the website about a week before we arrived and found the price had dropped. I called and they adjusted the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: kpass
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying 3 nights at Bill's. I would highly reccomend this place. Very convienent on the Strip, easy to get in and out of, free parking, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “location cant be beat”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the middle of hte action on the strip but dont want to pay a fortune, this is a great choice. The parking is easy to use, teh rooms are clean, check in fast, and the a location right in teh middle of the strip. Best of all, the cost is a fraction of what you pay at nearby properties. I paid 35$ for a thursday night. YOu are on the same corner with ceasars, ballys, and the bellagio - some high class locations. If you are looking for ultra luxury, or a property with lots of on site amenities, you should look elswhere. But if you want a clean (yet nicely appointed) room in the center of it all for a GREAT price - you cant beat Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price”
Reviews.Author: Amazonblue
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal from the website for $29.99 for a weeknight stay. Parking is very convenient and free although the garage had heavy exhaust fumes. The central location of this hotel on the strip is its main draw. It's very easy to walk to the majority of the other casinos from here. It was a breeze to walk up or down a block casino hopping. The casino crowd in Bills reminded me a lot of the crowd seen in Laughlin. We didn't spend much time in the casino or eat at the restaurant due to the heavy cigarette smoke. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet since it faced the street. The shower tub and toilet were separated by a door from the sink/mirror which was convenient. We had a partial view of the Bellagio fountains, the Bally's sign was in the way, and only heard the loud cannon finale in the room. The room was designated non-smoking but had a strong air freshener smell as did the hallways. The beds were ok, not the lap of luxury but definitely passable. Overall, for the price, location and parking it's a great value if you're not super picky.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable price at the center of strip”
Reviews.Author: ailymor
Reviews.Content: My parents and I went to vegas last Holloween of 2011 for 4 days. We decided to take the bus from Los Angeles, CA. The bus would drop travellers only at 3 locations along strip. I decided that we would go down at Bally's Hotel which is the second stop. Actually, not exactly familiar at Bill's hotel location. I'm afraid that we would walk couple of blocks or take the cab cause my parents are'nt in good shape with our lugagges. Surprisingly, Bill's is just accross Bally's hotel. It is along the intersection along the heart of strip. Its not a fancy hotel but the location is perfect. We don't need fancy one coz we are always out. Old but clean. Definitely would come back in this hotel. Especially for people who is not bringing their car. Nice experience in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: JensogSetta
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of all the good reviews here on tripadvisor and we were not dissapointed. This hotel is small with big nice rooms. Our room was clean and very good, had a view of Bally´s and the fountains at Bellagio. We arrived early so we just left our bags at the concierge and came back when it was time for us to check in. Check in was very quick and easy. Location couldn´t be better. The only things needed are an in room safe and some locks on the doors. It was a little noisy but that was mostly from the traffic, nothing to complain about. Free parking is a plus. Over all a very nice hotel in the percect location. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My kind of place”
Reviews.Author: gigmickey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights with two friends but we had our own rooms, arrived at 4pm on a Wednesday and checked in very quickly , we were offered upgrades to better view rooms which we declined but had partial views of the fountains anyway. The room was clean, comfortable and bigger than I expected I had one King bed, big TV , table and chairs and plenty of wardrobe space. There was no safe or coffee maker but you could use a free safety deposit box at the cashier desk in the casino. The iron in the room didn't work.Staff were all friendly and professional. The casino is small and laid back with good coctail waitress service. I ate at the victoria room three times once for breakfast and twice for Dinner , it was cheap and cheerful and I recommend their Prime Rib special along with a caraffe of the house Merlot. For me this hotel had everything I wanted and expected If I was bringing my wife (which was the original plan) I would go more up market , but here has a great location and very easy and quick access to your room from the strip and very reasonable price.I forgot to mention the bell man he goes beyond the call of duty to help the residents. I'll be back nexy year .

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, no big crowds, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: SarahandTigs
Reviews.Content: We checked into Bill's on a Monday night, no line up at all. We've been to many Las Vegas hotels and to have no line up at check in is a rarity. We stayed in room 218, and despite being on the second floor, the view was amazing, we could see the fountains at Bellagio perfectly. Was very nice to be in a small casino where you could be on the strip in seconds without having to weave your way through a huge casino. One drawback was that it was very noisy from the street. We heard bagpipes throughout the night and one night someone was practicing drums somewhere closeby. The noise was all from outside and it seemed to help if we kept the bathroom door shut. We didn't hear any hallway noise at all. Aside from that, room was nice, nice flatscreen tv, reasonable decor, comfy beds, space was clean and tidy. One night we ate in the steakhouse at Bill's. It has an old world feel to it, like you're stepping back into the gangster era in Vegas. Done up in red velvet and big wing back chairs, we listened to Sinatra and Bing while we were served. I admit I had low expectations but when the prime rib arrived it was simply amazing, a huge slab, done exactly as ordered with an enormous baked potato on the side and a fluffy yorkshire pudding and au jus and horseradish. Because our schedule was a bit off, one of us was sleeping while the other two were out and vice versa, we kept putting off the housekeeper and instead ran into her in the hall and simply did a swap of dirty for clean towels etc. This worked out well for us. All in all, the pros outweighed the cons. Yes the room was noisy but, I loved the karaoke and the small town feel of the casino itself, dealers were very nice, friendly, cocktails were plentiful and the servers were friendly. Would stay there again but would take ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right size”
Reviews.Author: classicmario
Reviews.Content: As we had not visited Las Vegas in 20 years, my wife & I listened to a friend's recommendation. Bill's was above & beyond expectations. We enjoyed two tasty meals a day at the 24 hour Victorian Room restaurant. A great plus was being able to put your name on a waiting list (if necessary) instead of waiting in a long line. The greatest plus was a casino the size of most New Jersey and Connecticut establishments instead of enormous megoliths such as Caesars Palace, etc. etc. I did a lot of walking and exercise during five days at Bill's, but still gained four pounds! Generally I lose weight on casino trips.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, minium walking”
Reviews.Author: Musicaliker13
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as I wanted a hotel on the strip that had rooms and parking within 2 minutes walk from the street; I got exactly that. The room was clean with quality toiletries and adequate facilities. The room had 2 queen beds, small dining table and 2 dining chairs, writing desk and hard chair, a full size ironing board and iron, wardrobing and hairdryer and by UK standards was very spacious. The bathroom was split into 2 spaces, a washbasin area, with hanging rail, large shelf for cases, ironing equipment and hairdryer - this had no door from the bedroom - a door from here opened into a room with a bath (shower over) and toilet. There was an ice machine and a soda machine within 10 yards of the room. The only missing item for me was a kettle, for early morning tea or coffee. The room service charge for this was exhorbitant, so I walked out to the coffee shop on the casino level to get this. If I make a return visit I will take a kettle for sure. In response to other reviews on here, yes, there is no flashy lobby but a reception desk in the corner of the casino level, but equally there were no long queues waiting to be checked in, such as I saw in all the other hotel lobbies that I visited. Again, the carpet at casino level is grubby, but the housekeeping in the rooms was perfect with crisp clean sheets. The hotel is dark, but it's meant to be that way, dark doesn't equal dirty; the rooms are traditional with dark wooden furniture and regency style wallpaper so if you like a contemporay feel, this hotel is not for you. The bonuses are that you can be in your room from the strip inside of 2 minutes and if you have a car, the parking is equally close. No long haul from either the carpark or the street to your room. Located between Bally's and Flamingo's and directly opposite Ceasars the location is brilliant. If you like pool facilities you have access to the ones at the Flamingo immediately next door. Don't stay here if you want to stay in an all singing all dancing resort with a themed experieince, DO stay here if you want a small, friendly and very convenient hotel to use as a base to visit those themed resorts.

Reviews.Title: “No longer a value, don't waste your time or money.”
Reviews.Author: MHawkins_11
Reviews.Content: Bills has changed. If you haven't visited Bils during the past 6 months, don't bother. This hotel has no appreciation for guests and/or players as reflected in the poor customer service. Everything was dirty from the carpet, elevators, craps tables, guest room, etc. It was disappointing to see a casino that I had frequented during the past 8 years deteriorate to this level. I accepted the beer in a cup as opposed to a bottle at every other casino. I accepted the one bottle of water at a time though every other casino allows you to order 2. I accepted the "you must have a pass line bet to bet the fire bet" though this is not the policy at any other property with the fire bet (craps players know about this). I will not accept paying for early check-in when we all know hotels cheat guests out of 4-5 hours during each stay. I can't check in until 4 pm yet I must check out by 11am. Since I checked out of another hotel for a day on the strip, I asked to check in at 12 noon. Early check-in had never been a problem in Vegas (I live in Southern California and visit Vegas at least 6 times per year). I was charged $15 to check-in prior to 4pm. They will no longer nickel and dime me. I used all of my comp dollars as I have no intention of returning. I recommend you do the same. Take your business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Dirty But Cheap, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mav50
Reviews.Content: My title basically says it all. I'm assuming the fact that Bill's is #38 of tripadvisor's hotels in Las Vegas is because of its location and price - there would be no other reason to stay here. I think for those who only sleep in their rooms, it would be okay. One bed is pretty well like any other at this price point. But we like to chill out in our room, enjoy super-clean bathrooms and housekeeping staff that provide you with fresh towels, extra coffee cups, wipe off bed-side tables, etc. without getting a tip every day. Under those criteria Bill's would, in our opinion, be way down the list. We called ahead of time to ask for one of the coveted rooms on the fourth floor that overlook Bellagio and were told that although they couldn't guarantee that room, the prospects looked good as the hotel was not fully booked. When we got there, of course, there weren't any of those rooms left - even with a $20 tip which the clerk swiftly pocketed, saying she would get us something on the strip, but looking in the other direction. Our room was right above the outside bar at the Flamingo and the "boom-boom" of their dance music went on until the early hours. The only way we could drown out the sound was to have the air conditioning on - which sounded like a 737 landing when it kicked in. The linen was worn and shiny polyester, the grout in the bathroom unspeakably discoloured and unattractive, and the mattress lumpy. There was no security at the elevator doors in the evening and an assortment of scary looking men and women crouched in the corner where the internet was trying to get warm. I doubt very much if they were staying or gambling at the hotel. I would not stay here if I was a woman on my own. On Friday and Saturday the casino was constantly patrolled by groups of young men who seemed eager for a fight - they also were not gambling. The only time I noticed security was when a very drunk young woman threw up on one of the slot machines. Perhaps, Big Elvis was entertaining at one time, but he looks very sick and tired and could only stand for a few minutes before he had to sit. He seemed more interested in singing his own Elvis-like songs, instead of actual Elvis tunes. He was also disconnected from the audience, his patter out of sync to what was actually going on. And the bar charged $7 for a small drink during the performance - you could walk down the casino and get the same thing for $2 cheaper. In the evenings one of the worst bands I've ever heard in Vegas, where the standard is normally quite high, unethusiastically sang old "Heart" and Pat Benetar tunes. We used to enjoy drinking the cheap margarita's in Bill's but they don't offer them for $1 any more, and the ones they have are now all syrup and no booze at all. On the positive side, the location is in the heart of everything with Caesar's and Bellagio across the street. The free shuttle to the Gold Coast - which has a very reasonable buffet for $7.99 if you sign up for their free player card - is nice for a break from the Strip (and perfect for eavesdropping, as there as some interesting characters using the bus service). The Victorian Room had an okay breakfast. And there is a Discount Ticket office at the front of the hotel. We were not impressed with many of the staff we encountered except for the bellman who was helpful, and the waitress in the Victorian Room that told us not to drink the water in the hotel rooms, only the restaurant water was filtered. East of Bill's, a block off the strip, is a little shop where you can buy water at reasonable prices. We would not stay there again. Even a room overlooking the air conditioning ducts at a newer hotel would be better, and I'd be prepared to walk a little further for a hotel room I enjoyed returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Bills did NOT impress!!”
Reviews.Author: vegascalling
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Bills from 10/30/11 through 11/2/11 we experienced very bad customer service from the women at the front desk.(back story...we were upgraded to a suite by a friend that is affiliated with HET properties- this was to be a surprise for and an early in) we tried to check in at noon- the women at the front desk said no rooms come back after 2- ok. left went and had lunch came back the same woman told us all she had was first floor and that they had no fridge for me (we had requested one for my insulin) but she said we could upgrade to a suite for $30 a night-we said no thank you! she said come back later. we went and gambled and then came back a third time- a new person was at the desk - a NICE person Kenisha- she found us a 4th floor room and said she would put us on the list to get the fridge we had requested for my insulin. so we get to our room and our friend calls to see how are room is- i say it is ok- he's like how are the fountains ? i said what are you talking about we have a view of Flamingo- he said you are suposed to be in a suite with a view of the strip/fountains ! i also explain the situation with the fridge. He was not a happy man- so after trying to contact the customer service manager we found he wouldnt be in for two days. Our friend let us borrow a cooler to keep my insulin cool.went down and asked about the fridge 3 times...each time NO! So the next day we ask about the fridge - still no- also now armed with the info about us not getting the suite and at least having a fridge- still NO! Finally i had to remind them about the ADA rules and regulations-i also reminded her of our check in and that she did not give us the suite we were suposed to have- i also reminded her that she tried to get us to pay 30 $ a nite extra!!! she was so snotty - and rude and def should not be in customer service!!!! Amazingly enough they FOUND a fridge for me...Pathetic! some good- great parking and the room we had was clean and roomy. Ok shower and even a window in the shower. On tuesday we got a call late afternoon from the customer service manager Andre' who left a message apologize for all the problems and he put $50 on our room for food and bev. so we changed plans and ate at the victoria room- it was ok- so later we went to the front desk to settle up so we could fly out early with no issues. Here we go again!- another RUDE customer service person-Colette! She would not let us settle up and said we would have to do it in the morning! WHAT???? so next morning the dh goes down to settle up on the room- now this same B*tch says she can't check us out until we leave the room- Now seriously what is wrong with these people i have never seen or heard of such crap!! So now we are both furious and clean up and get all crap out of room and i go down to check out of this place!!!!! i tell her that the customer service at Bills is Horrible! and i tell her that i will be in touch with Andre' about all of this! She is unphased- i also tell her they must be the only hotel in the usa that cant do an express check out or anything like it. i tell her to have a nice day in my most sarcastic voice & we got the hell out of there!!! the room and location were good- that is the best i can muster! would not stay there again unless it was free!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: Allipooh27
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews we read on Trip Advisor, plus the awesome price we got. We weren't expecting much, but knew it was right on the Strip in the middle of everything, and we were only gonna sleep there anyway. Wow! We were pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was and the price we paid for a 3 night stay was less than a one night stay at many of the other well-known hotels on The Strip. We had a room with a view of the Strip, including the Bellagio fountains, which was cool. The shower was awesome and the bed was comfortable. The only downside was the noise from all the revelers on the street right below our window and the sirens. If you drink enough and pass out, this won't bother you. Otherwise, maybe get some ear plugs or try our handy trick - turn the fan to "ON" on the thermostat, the noise from the fan running constantly will drown out the street noise all night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap accommodations in the center of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Pickyonejustme
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas at least once a year and stay here frequently. It sits across the street from Ceasars, Ballys and Bellagio. It's old, but kept up decently. Rooms are usually extremely affordable. Opt up to the "Deluxe" room for just a few bucks more and get an upper floor with terrific views of the strip. Rooms are adequate albeit on the small size. Plumbling is ancient but works most of the time. Beds are comfy, TV channels are few and far between, but who comes to Vegas to stay in their room and watch TV anyway? If you need an affordable place to lay your head at night (or day) at a hotel that can't be more conveniently located to the heart of the Vegas strip, you can't go wrong here. There are two restaurants within the hotel. A very affordable family oriented one that frequently offers specials for breakfast and dinner. The other is for those who don't have a problem parting with their cash and prefer the quiet upscale solitude of being served and pampered with fine china and the best wine. If you are a slot player, play elsewhere. I have never had any luck winning here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Location - Great entertainment”
Reviews.Author: PennyRon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bills Hotel for our 25th Wedding anniversary. The hotel is one of the older hotels on the strip, in an unbeatable location. Situated on a crossroads opposite Caesars palace, Belagio and Ballys could not wish for a better spot for sight seeing. Excellent entertainment provided in the form of Big Elvis who is actually very very good. Restaurant on site. Exceptional value hotel and the room was spacious with a flat screen tv. Unfortunately no tea/coffee faciltes so went to the local supermarket and purchased a small kettle. Very happy with the hotel, who provided us with a room facing the Belagio fountains and the fantastic music which we could view from our window. Lots of slots and entertainment downstairs, buses outside the hotel, short distance from the airport transfers. From the hotel you have access to all the fantastic hotels on the strip - you can walk everywhere from here and as you are directly on the strip you can get a taxi or bus up and down the strip for a around $5 a day. We really enjoyed looking round all the amazing hotels. There are a lot to see we made sure we saw them all. You can also take a trip to the Grand Canyon from here also but will be a day trip by air. This is not a cheap holiday by any means, but certainly an experience of a lifetime, there are lots of Buffet meals available which are set prices, try a champagne breakfast and make sure you use discount vouchers which are avaialble everywhere in booklets and at the hotels and airport - these will cover your tips or quite a lot of them. Expect to tip 15 to 20% of your bill the vouchers can be worth 15% of your bill, or a fixed sum per person. You will also find discounts on entertainments and shows etc. LAS Vegas is not as glamorous as you might think, there are lots of people giving out cards advertising 'models' for rent they will give to both women and men, and at night they are a nuisance. There were are also people that are not so well off hanging round most of the popular hotels asking for help, beers etc. which is a sad indicaton of the reasons they are there - to win their fortune. We went for 8 days, saw all the hotels and it was a very interesting experience, we did find it very difficult to find a quiet place to have a drink without a fruit machine in front of you and as we are not gamblers probably wont go again, but having said that glad we went as is an amazing visual experience. We would recommend this hotel due to the location. Entertainment in Las Vegas is comparatively expensive some of the shows in the larger hotels were in excess of $200 per ticket - but some others such as the shows in smaller hotels are free or you may go to a dinner and show in somewhere like the Stratasphere for around $50 per person, we did and thoroughly enjoyed the evening. We would recommend Bills, great rates and comfortable smaller hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yurubi
Reviews.Content: Location is great, price was more than affordable. Our room was clean and spacious. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room especially for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Singitalto
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at Bills for one night. We parked in the parking garage(free) and checked in about 4:00pm.The girl at the front desk was very nice and asked if we wanted an upgrade to a strip view for $20. I declined since we were leaving very early the next morning to drive to the Grand Canyon. When we got to our room we were surprised that we could see the strip just fine- we could also see the Bellagio Fountains, which was great. The room was really nice, it was clean. We had a nice flat panel tv. When we checked in I asked about the room rate(when I booked it was $55, but then I found a better rate with an online code. Then the rate must have gone down because the girl told me that we were now only paying $29.95 for the room. WOW!!! The room was really great for that price!!! We did not go to the casino, or restaurants but did get a cup of coffee in their coffee shop, and it was really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay in, and a really nice casino”
Reviews.Author: Tooshtoosh
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, right in the center of the strip, and also for a great price for this area. We got a really nice room, had no complaints whatsoever... The Casino had a great make you feel at home friendly atmosphere, and also the people you play with at the tables, it wasn't not cold and gigantic like the other casinos.... Very Recommended....

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great place!”
Reviews.Author: Stua76
Reviews.Content: Full view of the bellagio fountains. No need to walk 10 mins through a casino to get to the elevators. We stayed for 8 nights and payed $1100. Hotels around it flamingo, ballys harahs etc were $1500. Rooms are old however there is a flat screen. Everyone is friendly. Awesome place for the price and location. Right on the corner of flamingo and the strip!

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem in prime position on the strip”
Reviews.Author: SammyinLA
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was so impressed with the location. You really can't do better. Right in the middle of the strip. Check in went fine, but was disappointed when we got to our room. We had booked non smoking (I'm a non smoker with asthma, and was with my 16 yr old brother who also has asthma), so when we walked in and the stale smell of cigarette hit me, it was gag worthy! I thought I may have been over reacting, so we put up with it the night as we knew we would be out for everything except sleeping. Well, I had what can only be described as a very sleepless night. The smell was just so overwhelming, and I awoke with a large headache (I so don't know how smokers can do it). I went to reception first thing to ask for a non smoking room, and explained about the smell and our both having asthma. I was told there were no free rooms, which being peak season was quite possible. They said they would get maintenance to see what they could do. I was sceptical, and was fully prepared to come back later in the day, grab my luggage and go elsewhere. I was pleasantly surprised when I got back, what a difference. Nice subtle deodorised smell, all stale smoke smell gone! From there things were fantastic. The room was great, excellent view of the strip (3rd floor, so not of the whole strip, but still really good), the bathroom was compact but functional, internet good, tv good. Housekeeping was great apart from when one of them was tapping on doors every morning around 8am with a pencil...seriously, this is Vegas, 8am is WAY too early. Overall this is a great budget place to stay if you are not after anything fancy like a pool, shops within the casino, gym, etc. I will absolutely stay here again if I go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: D0nna2469
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Vegas with 7 others, couldn't fault Bill's Gamblin Hall. One of the best postioned hotels for access to areas along the strip. Lovely view of the Bellagio from our bedroom window. Rooms comfortable and very clean, great value for money. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Little_Travel_Flea
Reviews.Content: Bill's is right in the middle of the strip, next door to the Flamingo and across from Caesar's Palace, we even had a view of the Bellagio Fountain from our room. Our room was great, super clean, big, with a very comfy king sized bed. Only complaint was the tub didn't drain too well. Housekeeping did a great job, fresh sheets every day. Check in and check out was quick and easy. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The coffee shop in the casino serves really good tea and coffee, bonus is you can use Bill's comp dollars to pay. This was a family trip, my husband and I, my sister and her fiance, and my parents, ranging in age from 23 to 59, we had 3 rooms all on the second floor and we all agreed this is possibly the cleanest hotel any of us have ever stayed in. We all enjoyed our stay there, and would definitely stay there again if we were to return. Highly recommend staying at Bill's, you really can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, decent room”
Reviews.Author: 094STR
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Bill's when attending a conference at Caesar's Palace. The price was much better, and Bill's seemed to be just across the street from Caesar's, as were a few other hotel casinos. When we actually got there we discovered that, thanks to a pedestrian overpass rather than crosswalks, Bill's really is closer to Caesars than any other hotel with the possible exception of the Bellagio which, of course, is not a lower-priced alternative. (It was still a bit of a walk. However, anything in Caesars still involves a lot of walking, so we probably weren't much worse off in that regard than if we had stayed in Caesars.) It's also a central location on the Strip. Check in and check out at Bills were fairly fast, and the hotel lobby is right adjacent to the hotel door, not a long walk as in other Vegas hotels. Taxis dropped us close to the door and were immediately available there again when we left. The casino is noisy and reeks of tobacco smoke, but our room near the far end of the top floor was quiet and odor free. The guest room also seemed a little larger than many hotel rooms we've stayed in. Since the elevator is just inside the side door on Flamingo, it was not necessary to spend much time in the casino area. The room was reasonably clean and comfortable, but there were a few issues. The flapper valve in the toilet leaked, so the toilet would noisily refill periodically. Keeping the bathroom door shut kept down the noise. Also, the tub drained slowly. The most annoying problem was the time housekeeping removed water glasses from our room and did not replace them. It took half an hour after I called the front desk before we again had water glasses in the room. On another day my wife ran into some difficulty in getting housekeeping to take care of our room. Although the room was adequately supplied with most of the usual amenities, it suffered from the conspicuous absence of a coffee pot. Colleagues in Caesars Palace had the same complaint. Apparently they want people to leave their rooms and go to the casino. There is a coffee bar in the casino where $3.00 coffee is available. Another problem of sorts is that one of the two elevators was out of service for most of our stay. However, we got along fine with one elevator and never had a long wait. Internet access would have cost $11 per day, which is outrageous. I used a 3G modem instead.

Reviews.Title: “Little is best”
Reviews.Author: brian_pound
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is famous for its grand hotels. But finding Reception and getting to your rooms is another experience. Bills is great. located right at the centre of The Strip, and opposite Ceasar's Palace it allows you to visit every major hotel without having to constantly walk past the same place time and again. And, being small Reception is right off the street with the elevators just 30 feet away. The rooms are large with two queen size beds and the costs are low. Everyting is easy to find but the star of the show is Mike, the ever present corsierge. You don't need to pre-book shows, or car hire or trips to the Canyon, Mike will do it for you. He has been there forever. Walking out of the hotel you have a choice. Go straight over the footbridge to Ceasar's or go 500 yards to the left to watch the amazing fountain displays at the Bellagio. Alternatively, turn right for the Mirage's Volcano, Treasure Island's outside Pirate display or a gondola ride 1/4 mile further on at the Venetian. The main gamling hall may not be the smartest in town but it feels like a real casino and has a great atmosphere. Known originally as the Barbary Coast this place has history and a reputation to live up to. I am sure the Venetian and Ceasar's are more palatial, but Bill's is the best. Breakfast at Bill's is a good quality American Breakfast with very speedy service and friendly staff. What more can you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: Murphey2192
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's the last week in September for 3 nights. We were not sure we could even go until the last minute, so I made a dash to find us accomodations at a reasonable price. We got into Bill's for $41/night. Absolutely a steal. We loved being able to go to the Flamingo and use thir pool. The rooms were spotless and a nice size. I loved the tiled shower with the lovely little stained glass window that opened. A big plus....we had a pretty decent view. We were on the lowest floor of the hotel, but the road noise did not bother us at all probably because of the A/C. The air was a little noisy, but we got used to is. We would turn it on prior to leaving for the evening and when we returned, the room would be nice and cold for sleeping. Our preferred places are Mirage, Flamingo, Monte Carlo and Caesar's for their pool areas. But I think we will return to Bill's. You can't beat the price nor the location. Only issue was a surly check in gal, but big smiles and politeness warmed her a bit. Just keep in mind, that it's not a big brand new behemouth of a casino hotel...:) But it's so close to everything.....just walk to that overpriced casino if you must and make your deposit. We ended up loving the gambling right where we were! Tip: Get up early if you're interested in the 1/2 price show tickets at the front door...the line gets long, fast...

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Bills.”
Reviews.Author: Time2SeeItAll
Reviews.Content: It's always a good feeling to do a little research and discover something of excellent value. I guess this is why I love Bill's so much. The location is spot on, right in the middle of the strip, close to the Duece, monorail and big name casinos like Bally's, Bellagio's, Ceasars & Flamingos. Checkin and out is very, very quick - not like the larger casinos which resembles more an airport terminal than a hotel foyer. The rooms are huge, a king size bed, large plasma TV, 2x desks, space for 2 large suitcases and still room to swing a cat. For $USD50 per night - wow! Their restaurant - the steakhouse - has to be one of the best steak's I've ever had, I mean really exceptional. My wife had some seafood and raved about it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain on the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: jaco0268
Reviews.Content: I had been to Bill's to gamble many times, and was never impressed, but never disappointed either. I had never stayed there before though. I thought the hotel was excellent, nice rooms, clean and quiet with great views of the strip. There aren't a lot of perks like a lot of the other casino's, but it is Vegas, so why would you limit yourself to one place anyway. As far as a place to stay it was great, the casino is alright, better than some of the other low price places down the way, and the bars and restaraunts they do have are above average. I would very likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reviewing the Casino… not hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TrevellingDuo
Reviews.Content: I love Bill's and always have! It's a fun low key environment in a great location. The entertainment of Big Elvis & Nightly Music Entertainment is great, the awesome drink specials (spin the wheel), and gambling are awesome. The Steak & Egg Special in the Victorian Cafe is my favorite…. open all night long! I ordered it at 4:30am! Priceless….

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel amidst all the tower blocks!”
Reviews.Author: lomos14
Reviews.Content: The main benefit of this hotel is that it has only 200 rooms which makes the check in/out so much quicker with no queues as in the nearby Ceasars Palace, Bellagio, Flamingo, Treasure Island etc, where the wait could be anything up to 30 minutes. A very central hotel with good access to wherever we wanted to go. A small but adequate restaurant was open 24 hours a day so breakfast/lunch/dinner could be eaten there if required.. Very large bedroom with all facilities available though no coffee/tea making. The daily show by "Big Elvis" was very entertaining. Would certainly go back there again if ever in Vegas, though I think one visit in a lifetime is probably enough!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Parkers37
Reviews.Content: Entrance to parking garage is on Flamingo Road, approximately 200 ft past LV Blvd (left turn if heading east). Parking is free with plenty of space. Once in the parking garage, take the elevator to first floor. The elevator opens up in the Casino, two right turns puts you at the gift shop with the front desk approx 30 feet ahead. Check-in was quick. Hotel elevator is separate from garage elevator. To get luggage to room, take the garage elevator to Lobby/Casino, walk around the gift shop then take hotel elevator to room. Elevators were in bad shape and hallway carpet was worn making for a questionable first impression. However, rooms were large and in good shape. Room layout was unique but worked great. Rooms had a large HD TV but did not have a frig or microwave. We were given a room on the west end of hotel and had great views of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio Hotel Fountains. Only downside of room, the noise. You could hear street sounds, sirens and the Bellagio fountains. However, we turned on the AC fan at night and that helped eliminate the noise. Beds were comfortable and allowed for a good night of sleep. Room also came with five dollar comp card per person. The comp card can be used at restaurant and gift shop. We reserved online but had to call hotel for AARP discount code. Considering room price, comp card, location, views and room comfort, this was a great value. We will stay at Bill’s on any return trip to Las Vegas. Friendly service at front desk, gift shop, comp card signup and Victorian Room restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Casino change”
Reviews.Author: shellback89
Reviews.Content: I loved this place when it was Barbary Coast... we would go in for a little 'slot actionand the waitresses would always keep you drink topped off.. but they were scarce we didn't see one for about an hour so we left and found a better casino.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the great location”
Reviews.Author: Conner2dood
Reviews.Content: Many times in Vegas staying at the "big name" hotels. Decided to stay at Bills due to its location and inexpensive rate. Good things beside location and ease of getting to room were limited. Decor was fair, personnel were very good, food in Victorian Restaurant was good, Big Elvis should not be missed. Bad were hall carpets which were worn out and filthy, dirty outside windows, poor tv reception, and in general a rather depressing feel to place. No in-room safe available and some seedy-types hanging around elevator.

Reviews.Title: “ab fab!”
Reviews.Author: northyorkshire_kim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bills at end of Sept for 4 nights, we got upgraded for free which meant a view of the Eiffel Tower which was very nice! Lovely big room, nice sized bathroom, in victorian saloon style decor which was great. Fab location too really easy to access some of the big named hotels. Loads of machines downstairs to gamble with but its only small compared to some of the hotels in Vegas but thats the best bit! No huge queues to check in or out, no 1 mile walks to find your room and walk out and straight into a taxi when your going home! Worth signing up for the players reward card I won $100 which used towards paying the room. We also ate in one of the restaurants not the steakhouse the one by the reception desk and food was gorgeous never had a steak like it! Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jodawn
Reviews.Content: As this was our first time to Vegas I hardly feel quailfied to review... but I will do my best. We cloose Bill's for the great central location and on that note it did not disappoint! Other pros include attached free parking, reasonable dining facilities & overall cleanliness. Overall I think that this is a good value for your money if staying (and paying) for the amenities of the larger & fancier hotels is not your priority.

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bump-In-The-Night
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an inexpensive, clean place with great location on the strip and don't care if you you get a restful nights sleep, this is the place for you. I had room 302 which was literally the room closest to the strip overlooking the Fountains at Bellagio.... unfortunately, right a major LV Blvd. intersection and above what sounded like incessant bongo drum beating. I was only there one night so didn't mind having my sleep interupted by street noise. The room was large, very comfy King-size bed, great 42" flat screen wall-mounted TV and clean bathroom. I would imagine that rooms at the other end of the hotel on the "Flamingo" side would be quiter. Rooms on the "Bally's" side I expect would be equally noisy. Great quick access to Caesars or Bellagio via walkways over LV Blvd. Would stay again but would request higher odd-numbered rooms to ensure I was away from LV Blvd and facing Flamingos. Rates are excellent for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's is the very best!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJane864
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bill's for seven nights the end of September. I had read the review about Delda and the problem the gentleman had with check-in. We also had Delda check us in and she couldn't have been more helpful. Got us a nice quiet room and the best rate available. We love Bill's and this was our fifth stay there and will always come back to the best little hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I Couldnt believe these clowns they handcuffed me.”
Reviews.Author: USMCPrince
Reviews.Content: After winning a royal in dollars @ Stations Casino, for $ 4,000.00 I went to the strip and went into Bills Place, and sat at bar to play video poker, I put in 3, or 4 hundered in the machine, awhile later I was approched by security and they asked me afew questions which I couldnt understand, and they asked me to leave, I had been drinking, But I withdrew my money coupon for $280 some dollars, and left, I took a cab to my house in Vegas, the next afternoon I took a cab back down to where my vehical was and went into Bills to cash in my coupon, I was approached by security and handcuffed and escorted to a security room where I remained for an hour, the security were very proffessional, and released me and escorted me to the door!, After showing 1 security officer that I needed to and was only trying to cash in my coupon for $280 some $, and for whatever reason they feel I wont come in its there place, he (security) escorted me to the cash cage and I cashed in my coupon, I still dont know why I was removed, Im a presidential card holder at several casinos, and never ever had an issue and use to play in Bills commonlly, Im a former 8 year Combat Veteran of USMC discharged as SGT 0324, have been a Strctural Steel and Welding Inspector on the biggest projects in North America, and am always very cordual, I live in Los Angeles, Las Vegas and New York and am a very responcible person, and cant figure out what promted them to remove me and then handcuff me when I was only playing and then tried to cash in my money, If I was for whatever reason not to come back why didnt they allow me to cash in my money?, and/or inform of what and why. for whatever reason it was either not me, or I clearly dont recall anything. Its sad I've always valued playing at this place on the strip and I avoid problems in any and all places I go.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's...not a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Citygirl058
Reviews.Content: This being our 6th trip to Vegas we wanted somewhere central strip, not too expensive and this ticked all the boxes. The rooms are large and yes, as stated in other reviews, slightly old fashioned, but unlike most of the other hotels, you are in your room within minutes of checking in. The room was clean and the towels were changed every day. There is a hairdryer, iron, ironing board and The only downside is that they don't have safe deposit boxes in the rooms. Our room overlooked Bally's and we could see the fountains of Bellagio's as well. The staff were friendly and helpful, apart from the kiosk & the $2 Margarita bar staff, who seemed to feel customers were an inconvenience, but in the rest of the hotel they were all friendly. The Victorian Kitchen is value for money, with good food and service and the steak house, although slightly more expensive is very good as well. Big Elvis (although getting smaller each time we visit) is always worth a visit and the different live bands they had playing were all very good. We paid half of what we would have in one of the larger hotels (although this is part of the Harrah's group) and as we only needed this as a base, it was ideal. We would stay here again if we come back to Vegas. If this is your first time in Vegas I would recommend one of the bigger showier hotels, in order to get the full experience, but if you've been to Vegas before, then this is an ideal base.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation needed, but it's all about location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Pedro400
Reviews.Content: As I write this review I and my friends are at LAS airport heading back to Australia. Our combined review is therefore very fresh in our minds. Bills was a great place to stay. Four young blokes decided to make this home for six nights. We were impressed with the size of the rooms and also the generosity in bed sizes and bed comfort. Pillows were an issue though. Bills casino is great. Awesome atmosphere and very cheap to drink and gamble. Drairs after-hours is also great when you are jetlagged and want to walk out of a nightclub at 9am. Bills needs a renovation in some respects but the atmosphere is definitely created in part by the old, historic feel that is not like the modern high end hotels. For a cheap stay, comfortable as well as being in the prime strip spot, stay at Bills

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: We_Love_to_go_bye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Las Vegas where we stayed at Bill's. We absolutely loved the location. Our room had a comfy king size bed with a view of Bally's and Paris next door. We also had a partial view of the fountains at Bellagio. There were some drum playing folks in front of Bally's that played into the wee hours of the morning, but I was able to drown that out by cutting on the air. We were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “First time at Bill's and loved it”
Reviews.Author: DRoachBlackRock
Reviews.Content: Although I've been to Vegas dozens of times this was my first stay at Bill's. To me, it was perfect. I prefer a smaller hotel and casino for my "base" on the strip and I was more than satisfied with the quality of the room here. The casino is friendly and comfortable and the location couldn't be better. Can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Umm...what can you say about a place...”
Reviews.Author: DonnLlouM
Reviews.Content: that has been around for what appears to be nearly 100 years and still has the original smoke lurking in the corners of the casino? We stayed four nights at this hotel in September, 2011 - only because my daughter was getting married next door at the Flamingo and we couldn't afford their rates. I will never stay here again. The room was okay but noisy. The carpet was worn. The bed was lumpy and very uncomfortable. When we requested extra pillows we were told that there weren't any available. There was LOTS of vehicle noise from the strip below which did not die down at night. The casino, as mentioned, was SMOKY and the smell permeated the hallways entire building. The bathtub was high and hard to step into for a person with arthritic knees. There were very limited options for food on the premises. Basically, it was the worst hotel stay I have ever had, and at a premium price no less. We will never stay here again. My best advice is to run far away and don't look back. And to the 20-ish boys we met in the elevator on our first day who thought it was the best hotel ever, "old Vegas" - look around. There is SO much better for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Shazjak
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 10 night vegas trip, we spent 9 nights at Bills, this is the best hotel on the strip in my opinion. Its not 5 star but the price you will pay will reflect this (also no resort fees). The room was spotless, with a lovely comfy bed, check in was a breeze and all the staff are extremely helpful. We will definately be back, and i would encourage anyone to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Decent First-Time Stay at Bill's”
Reviews.Author: pintessential
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying, this was an overall enjoyable trip to Vegas, but my experience was somewhat dampered by poor customer service at the hotel. We arrived around 10pm on a Thursday night, only to find that our room type and bed type were not available. While I understood that the bed type was not guaranteed, the room type (Deluxe with Partial Strip View) is what we paid for, so I was upset that we were downgraded with no compensation. The desk told me to call at 7am the next morning to switch to a room with two doubles when it became available. I did so, and I was greeted with a very negative attitude. They told me to call back at 10am, so I did. As you can imagine, starting your vacation to Vegas with a major sleep deficit is not pleasant. After being told at 10am that my bed type was not going to become available, I consulted a manager, and magically, I was immediately given the keys to a room with two doubles (it was still downgraded from the deluxe room I prepaid). Didn't receive an apology or any perks. The other customer service issue had to do with check-out. I was notified at 11:15am that I was late checking out, even though the plaque in the bathroom clearly stated that check-out was at 12 noon (they claimed it was 11am, but that info was nowhere to be found). When I requested a late check-out to buy some time, they told me one was not available, which seemed like a complete lie on a Tuesday. I was forced to vacate the premises within minutes to "avoid additional charges". Not a fun way to end your Vegas trip. Now for the good. The location of the hotel cannot be beat. It's dead center of the strip, steps away from Flamingo, Ceasars, Bellagio, Paris, Planet Hollywood, City Center, etc. The parking garage is conveniently located close to the hotel. It requires a different elevator, but it makes getting around so easy. The casino was on the smokier side, but that didn't affect me much, as I did most of my gambling elsewhere. The rooms were very basic, but came with comfortable beds, effective air-conditioning, a bathroom that didn't flood/steam up, and sleek flat-screen tv's. The decor is outdated, but reminded me of the old Vegas within the new Vegas, which was very cool. Everything in the room was quite clean. I would have given this review 4 owl eyes had it not been for the poor customer service, and I'm usually pretty easy-going when it comes to that stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: pap3535
Reviews.Content: First time at Bill's - Good experience - Easy check-in - no lines - very nice clean room - would have liked a coffee maker in the room, but that's hard to find in Vegas. Staff friendly and helpful - We walked to everything - will definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: cottyh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would usually stay at, dare I say it, a more upmarket property whilst in Vegas (our last stay was at Aria), but the prices for the time we were there (18th - 22nd Sept) were extortionate in most hotels. We had this booked as our back up incase we didn't find a better deal so ended up staying here. Upon checking in, we were offered an upgrade to a suite. We paid $25 per night extra for this, but it still cost us less for the whole stay than it would have for one night in any of the other hotels we were considering. The suite was massive with a living area, small kitchen area with a fridge for personal use, bedroom, bathroom and extra toilet off the living area. The decor was a bit dated, but the furniture was comfortable and it was very clean. The pillows weren't the most comfortable I've slept on, but I like very soft pillows. My husband thought they were fine. One of the major advantages of this hotel is ease of access to the Strip. In less time than it took us to get to the lifts (elevators) in Aria or MGM, we were outside and on our way. The one downside that we found was the distance to a shop like Walgreens, CVS or ABC for cheap water and snacks. We like to stay at different hotels each time we come to Vegas, but if prices were the same as this time we would certainly consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place on the strip for the price”
Reviews.Author: Fishtherapy
Reviews.Content: This visit we split our trip by staying at Golden Nugget downtown, then at Bill's Gamblin Hall for the last two nights. We stayed in a Luxury room because we heard you could see the Bellagio fountain show from your room. Actually, you can see part of the show from a side view window if you stand right next to the window. You mostly saw the crowd on the strip walking past Bally's. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. I slept with my ear plugs because it was very noisy on the strip, we were on the fourth floor which is the highest. We actually heard someone playing bag pipes at 6am. The best thing about staying at Bill's besides the price is the fact that you get to use the pool at Flamingo next door. The pool is huge but the water was cold, we enjoyed it anyway. Bill's has an excellent breakfast for a reasonable price, we did not eat lunch or dinner there. I was delighted to see security in the parking garage everytime we went to our car, it made you feel very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexxx777
Reviews.Content: Bill's is a nice little old place where you can stay if you want to be comfortable, be in a good location for a good rate. We've stayed in the suite and the room was great, even if the hotel would use some renovation. Overall the hotel was clean. Also, compared to the other hotel we stayed in Vegas there are NO RESORT FEEs which I think are a greedy way to make extra money. There are a couple of restaurants but we tried the victorian late at night, which is ok if you want to have a quick bite before going to bed. The staff was helpful with anything we needed, we parked our car in the free parking and everything was ok. If you want a nice hotel on the perfect location look no further, but it's not upscale so don't expect that. To be honest I would go back to Bill's anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Another satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: Caro11
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed here before and the value was attractive since we needed to stay just 1 night on the way back from a pricey Grand Canyon rafting trip... We had a similar experience than last time but for some reason, they offered an upgrade to a suite upon check-in - first, for an extra fee, and when we declined, she offered it for free! It looked like it hadn't been updated since the 70s, but was roomy and mostly quiet (except for 1 very noisy A/C unit in the bedroom). A welcome free upgrade. I slammed my finger in the sliding glass shower door (I don't think they make them like that anymore for that reason!!) Upon departure, I called the front desk to ask if we should order a cab and they said they'd be waiting outside. We waited, then had a bellhop try to flag one, to no avail. We walked across the street to Bally's and got in their taxi line. Not fancy but good value once again...

Reviews.Title: “A true Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: lrios86
Reviews.Content: What a great small hotel! I was a bit nervous after seeing some reviews about it being old and needing updates. It is a hotel that looks older but it is their style/theme. I gave cleanliness a 4 because on two occasions our room was not cleaned and I requested the tub be fixed twice because it was backed up. We stayed a total of five days and loved the place because of it's size. The classic room was bigger than your average hotel room! There were no long lines to check in nor out. Staff were plesant and Mike the bellman was great at making us feel welcomed! Two big pluses: arrived early and room was ready before check in, because I switched to a smoking room I had to wait a bit more but was fine by me! Two is... They hold your luggage in a locked room if your room isn't ready or you checkout earlier than you actually leave to the airport ( no lugging bags around)! Best of all NO RESORT FEES!

Reviews.Title: “Bill's: A Little Bit of Freemont Street on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: BigGus79
Reviews.Content: I love Bill's. We stayed here for five nights and it was great. Hotel: The room was clean and large. There was a flat screen TV hanging on the wall. The bathroom was small, but that wasn't an issue for us. We also had a small walk-in closet, which was nice. We had a car and parking was never an issue. In my opinion, this is the easiest hotel to park at on the strip. There is no room service, but this was also not an issue for us. Casino: I really like Bill's casino. It has an old west elegant type feel with all of the wood and chandeliers. Bill's is my favorite place to play craps and the cocktail waitresses stop by frequently. This place is filled with smoke and the booze flows freely which is what makes Vegas great. If I didn't want any of that, I'd have just stayed home. Victorian Room: I'd give the Victorian Room an average rating. They do have prime rib 24 hrs which is nice. I do think Ellis Island has a better prime rib dinner though, plus it's a better value. I wouldn't say that I ever had a bad meal in the Victorian Room, but there are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with Delda, check in lady. Otherwise good experience.”
Reviews.Author: dilophosaurus
Reviews.Content: When I checked in for my room, Delda said there were no more non-smoking rooms available as I had requested when I made the reservation. I made the reservation under my name but a friend of mine was with me. I think I let out a small sigh or shook my head but I didn't complain. She then said, "What's your name?" without eye contact to either of us, so I repeated my name. She replied in a snarky tone, "I am speaking to (my friend), not you. With your attitude, you're not going to go far." I couldn't believe it. I told her, "That is inappropriate and not good customer service. We reserved a non-smoking room and you aren't giving us one and now you are speaking to me in a rude manner." She then said, "I would have given you a non-smoking room but you have a bad attitude. I would give a non-smoking room to (my friend) but not to you." I then asked to speak with a manager and she said, "There is no manager. This is all you get." I then stopped talking to her and went to another check in clerk. I explained what just happened and that Delda said she was giving us a smoking room just to spite me. Delda then lied (again, because she lied the first time about having no non-smoking rooms available), contradicting what actually happened, and said "I gave them a non-smoking room but said he didn't deserve one." Delda also tried to get my friend to agree with her side of the story (which of course my friend did not do). The other check in clerk finished the paperwork and gave us our keys to the room, which was a non-smoking room. The bell hop was a gentleman and the other check in clerk was very nice. The only other problem during my stay was that a street performer set up drums right outside at 11:30 at night, but with the fan on in the room it was bearable to wash out the noise. I have never been treated as rudely as Delda treated me before in my life at a hotel or other place of business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location”
Reviews.Author: vtflyer1
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Las Vegas without a car, and without an unlimited budget stay here! End of story. Clean comfortable rooms, at the right price. Everything you desire is within walking distance, the rest of the strip is just a short cab ride away. I booked with no intention of a rental car, got one anyway when plans changed but stayed here anyway, and not a bit sorry that I did. BTW, Big Elvis is still as good as ever, just not so big anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Not Fancy, But FUNCTIONAL”
Reviews.Author: PriusGirlVA
Reviews.Content: OK, Bill's is not the Bellagio. Heck, it isn't even Treasure Island! But it is FINE. We were worried it would be dirty since the price was so low. But it was NOT BAD! It is small (especially when compared to other Las Vegas properties). The room was nothing special but it was clean enough and functional. I recommend the hot dogs in the casino - tasty! :) The BEST PART of Bill's is "Big Elvis" who performs free in the casino!! Make sure you check out that schedule and go! Seriously, that is a fun event. Worth visiting even if you choose not to stay at Bill's!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the quirky....”
Reviews.Author: PatAndBob
Reviews.Content: The good: Bill's is a small (4 stories) hotel in the center of the Strip surrounded by the best Las Vegas has to offer. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you're looking for an inexpensive, clean room in the best location possible, Bill's is a great value. The restaurant, too, was ok and inexpensive. A glass of wine at Bill's was $5 compared with $11 at other hotels. The bad: there was no coffee pot in the room! My only other complaint would have been the noise level had I not read about it on Trip Advisor and packed some earplugs.I also read that the rooms were very dark but I found it was the Victorian furniture, which is always dark and heavy, that was dark - the walllpaper was a goldish color. The room was a little quirky - the lamps were glued down to the nightstands. I found the sheets to be a little scratchy, too. We did not spend much time at the casino so I can't comment on it, except that it smelled like smoke and the carpeting looked dirty. We really did not spend much t time at Bill's but we did have dinner there one night and it was good, especially for the price!. Like all of the hotels, be sure to join the Players Club if you do stay there. you'll get a $5 off discount which can be used in the casino or the resteraunt.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but would I stay again....”
Reviews.Author: Carolind
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Vegas and the first time we stayed at Cesars Palace. We wouldn't stay there again as the cost is just not worth it so we gave Bill's a try due to the good reviews. The Bill's casino is small and dingy and not really worth playing in. The rooms, as most people note, are large, clean and tidy. Our room had a great bathroom, really large and looked like it has possibly been recently renovated. There is no doubt Bills is awesome value for its location and the size and the quality of the rooms. Unfotunately for us we didnt have the greatest experience there. Our room was located at the very end so one side of our room had nothing and the other side had a suite. Great, we thought, no one on one side of us. There were people staying in the suite though and they were in Vegas to party (isn't everyone?) Unfortunately though, they wanted to party in their suite. And they literally had a party. The music was pumping, at first it was just guys drinking, then girls came over. The kind of girls that can't speak but have to shriek and woooo all the time. It was so loud, we could every word they were saying, like they were in our room. We understand it's Vegas so we tried to give the benefit of the doubt but after several hours we called the front desk and asked if they could possibly turn the music down. We did hear security come up a little while later and the music was turned down but their loud talking and screaming didn't stop all night. Unfortunately this happened the second night also. While this was nothing really to do with the actual hotel, and they did respond when we asked about turning the music down, it just gave me a negative view overall. I also think that when you go to Vegas, the hotel is part of the experience and I probably wouldn't stay here again. Again, nothing really to fault about the hotel itself, our experience just didn't turn out to the best.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing and disappointing - don't go there, awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendyw0050
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas on a 3 week holiday from England. We chose Bill's as there was myself, my husband and our son who had just turned 21 so we required 2 rooms and our budget would not stretch to some of the more expensive hotels. Wish we had made it stretch! The previous week we had stayed in the Carriage House which was great, wish we had chosen to stay there again for our second week. Bill's is a very depressing and disappointing hotel. Our view of the strip for which we were offered and had stupidly paid $10 per night upgrade on each room was of the flashing lights and wall of the Flamingo next door. The rooms are dark, dingy, outdated and depressing. The carpets in the rooms are filthy, I'm sure I got bit by something on our last day there when I was kneeling down on the floor packing my suitcase! The baths do not drain well while having a shower. The windows are filthy, the air con is noisy and in our sons room, it leaked and made the carpet damp. Overall this is a horrible hotel, don't go there, it needs knocking down and something nice rebuilding in its place. I was taken in by the good reviews on here, just wish we had read some of the bad reviews before we booked.

Reviews.Title: “never stay in this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: scarden10
Reviews.Content: I made reservation . but I want to check at 12 am but they wants to charge me $ 20 to check early. I have to wait 1 hr and 1/2 to get somebody to fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas experience!”
Reviews.Author: carol2034
Reviews.Content: After pouring over a multitude of reviews on various hotels, we decided to book Bill's for our little 4-day getaway. So glad we chose Bill's! First of all, the location is perfect....Bellagio and Caesar's across the street, Flamingo next door (BTW Donny & Marie show at Flamingo EXCELLENT even if you're not a big fan like us), Paris & Mirage within walking distance, etc. Half price show ticket booth right outside the front door. Our room was huge, very clean and quiet. Beds were some of the most comfortable we've ever had. Both restaurants are good and the prices are more reasonable than other places on the strip. Steakhouse is especially good and only seats 49....a nice quiet escape after a day of noisey sensory overload! Even liked the kitchy Wild West Victorian decor...think Miss Kitty's Saloon in Gunsmoke. The casino is small, but a welcome relief to the overwhelming mega-casinos in the big hotels. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Such a fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: atlmichelle4571
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the great reviews on this site and every single person was right on. The price per night is one of the cheapest in Vegas, yet you are smack right in the center of the strip, with a clean room, comfortable bed, great 24 hour restaurant, pool access at the Flamingo next door and cheap minimum gambling opportunities. It also only takes 5 minutes to walk from the room elevators to the front of the hotel and strip. My husband and I had a blast and used all the money we saved by staying at this hotel for great drinks, food and shows at other hotels!! Don't even hesitate...stay here and spend your money on the fun stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice....Wonderful location....right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Dippra
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas just for a night.....so we didn't want a very expensive or exclusive place.....we got this hotel for around 100 bucks, since it was a Friday night....the room was clean and spacious.....the decor was nice....all wood.....but there was some peculiar smell which faded away after some time......the bathroom was nice, but just a shower place, no bath. It's an old place, but in good condition and modernized. The location is wonderful....the ballagio is just diagonally across. You can walk around on both end of the strips from here. We chose this place just pure for the location and we were not disappointed. The staff was pleasant and nice. All in all, it was a decent place.

Reviews.Title: “Casino review”
Reviews.Author: lowroll3r
Reviews.Content: I had read about Bill's on several websites, and was happy when I spotted it our first day on the strip. Fiance wasn't so impressed with the foofoo fancy casinos and favors downtown. I figured this would be the place for him and I was right. The bartenders were great, awesome drink service, and found even if you weren't actively playing, CWs would still ask you if you wanted anything, which was nice. The dealers were friendly and helpful, and the laid back, down to earth vibe is great in here. Missed big Elvis, but the karaoke was a hoot, if not painful to listen to at times. Thinking about staying here on day.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's- A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: jmf_sask
Reviews.Content: If you looking for somewhere reasonably priced to hang your hat while visiting Las Vegas, Bill's is for you. We were in town for a family wedding and wanted a central location that wasn't going to cost too much money. Bill's is right in the middle of the Strip, so made walking to the sights very easy. We were able to use the pool and waterslides at The Flamingo, which was nice. The rooms are not fancy, but are clean and well maintained. Overall, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCaptP
Reviews.Content: Best buy on the strip. Rooms were redone in 2008??......so they are still pretty nice.....we like that it's pretty small....a trip from the casino to your room takes 5-10 mins......instead of the 1/2 hour it would take at the bigger hotels. Great Parking. Fat Elvis is great. Right in the heart of the strip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and on the strip”
Reviews.Author: jakobknol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after travelling around Utah to get back to the east coast. It was a good stay and we were pleased it was on the strip, close to major other hotels/casino's. Box office at the hotel made our show bookings very effective and for a reduced price.

Reviews.Title: “Starting to show signs of wear and tear”
Reviews.Author: kardobiedm
Reviews.Content: We started staying at Bill's Gamblin Hall a few years ago because it had a #1 rating in Tripadvisor. We discovered by liked it for some additional reasons. 1. Small - the pit staff in the casino actually begin to recognize you and say good morining. 2. Mike - (bellman, concerierge) has worked at the hotel for some 30 years and actually remembers when we return. He has good knowledge of the area and recommended his favorite offstrip local's breakfast restaurant to us. Called the Omlette House. I asked how many eggs are in a half size portion and they replied "3". Yikes. That means there are 6 eggs in a full size omlette. OMG too many eggs. Needless to say, I had the 3 egger and it was still a huge portion. 3. You only need to walk about 50 feet to get from your foom to the strip. You don't need to pack a lunch to get out of the hotel. 4. The hotel is located at the 4 corners of everything. 5. The pool at the Flamingo is available for guests of Bill's to use. BTW - the family pool is nicer. Water is warmer. However, Bill's is showing its age and sure could use some work. The carpets in the hallways looked like they could use a good cleaning and the bathrooms could use some updating. I still think Bill's is a gem, however it has probably slipped to "diamond in the rough" status.

Reviews.Title: “We love it there!”
Reviews.Author: pestoprincess
Reviews.Content: From the front desk staff to the dealers on the floor....very nice customer service and you cannot beat the location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location....”
Reviews.Author: SweetyandAngel
Reviews.Content: Travel from August 23-Sept.1, 2011...Positives first: 1. Room was great with daily upgrade cash with view. 2. Housekeeping Staff was great and appreciative. 3. Location on the Strip is great. 4. Very affordable. 5. With tip, drinks were constantly flowing. 6. Bed-bug free!!!!! Negatives: 1. Evening (after 11:00pm) front desk check-in employee was mean and disrespectful. 2.Consistently poor and cold quality food from Victorian Cafe. 3. Smokey Casino. Overall, for the money paid it was still a good bargain. If you want a good meal for low price, eat at the Grand Lux Cafe in the Venetian. Reasonable prices, fantastic food.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and superb location!”
Reviews.Author: darkscreamz
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel purely from Tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed at all! The location is what sells it, right in the heart of The Strip! We reserved a partial strip view room for 7 nights, and were located on the 4th floor and had a great view of Bally's & Belagio fountains! The hotel rooms are basic but clean and really for us were just somewhere to sleep a few hours before more exploring each day! This hotel is no Belagio or Wynn by a longshot but when you consider it has all the basics you need, a perfect location and cost us approx. US$60/night you really cannot pass it up. The only con I could think of is that the hallway noise can be heard in the room quite clearly, but this was never a huge issue for us (if other guests were misbehaving it could've become annoying) we would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great location and good rates.”
Reviews.Author: Doyleast
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the strip in an excellent location. The room was clean and large. There was no fridge nor were there any tea/coffee making facilities which we did not like at all. That should be standard in any room. The $13 charge for 24 hours use of wifi was extortionate especially considering the amount of money in vegas. Bill's are not the only ones who dont offer free wifi but fortunatley a lot of cafes and shops have it if you wander around. We had to stay extra nights due to hurricane irene stopping us flying onwards and the staff were helpful. There was no problem either leaving luggage if your flight is leaving later in the day. I would recommend staying here and would do so again but hopefully by then they will offer some tea in the rooms and possibly free wifi for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel revisited-major Security flaw!”
Reviews.Author: MrsLaSimpson
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite Vegas Hotel of all time and we hate to give it even an average review. It really deserves less than average, but despite our problem we still cant bring ourselves to give it a less than average score. Pros: Small, easy check in, quick room to strip or casino, Big Elvis in lobby (amazing) Cons: Security and Customer Service. So I am 2 months pregnant on our trip to Vegas and my husband and I are fast asleep in our beds at about 4am. I wake up with a creepy feeling, open my eyes and there is a woman standing over me, staring at me. I am sooo confused, but I dont scream. I am trying to determine whether I am dreaming so I turn to my husband, wake him up and ask him if there is a person standing next to my bed...Keeping in mind this woman has NO PANTS ON and still hasn't said a word. I get out of bed saying how did you get in my room. She starts to argue with me that I am in her room and tried to grab my pants off the floor and my cell phone...I advise her that those are my things, and that she is in my room, and who the heck is she and how did she get in my room and tried to shoo her out. However I felt a bit bad that she had no pants on so we gave her my husbands shorts and escorted her back to her room which we eventually discovered was next door. Apparently while sleepwalking to the bathroom, she went out into the hallway (with no PANTS), and due to a FAULTY LOCK, entered our room in the middle of the night. I went immediately down to the front desk and they sent someone to check the lock. They assured me they would fix it in the morning. We stayed another 4 days and we could never get it fixed. Its probably still broken. Unbelievable poor security and service. They barely offered an apology never ind anything for scaring a pregnant lady half out of her mind and ruining our entire night.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSuz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great bargain for an excellent location. The room was very spacious and updated - new bed, flat screen tv. The bathroom was small and needs a little tlc. Our biggest issue was the noise. We were on the 4th floor, in a luxury room with a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Being on the corner of Flamingo and Las Vegas Blvd, it was extremely noisy until the wee hours. We stayed from a Wednesday night to a Monday night and every night was really loud - people, cars, motorcycles, and even the Bellagion fountain was startling at 1:00am. We had room delivery for breakfast one morning and it was pretty awful. If you don't mind spending some money, try the Bellagio buffet instead. I rather pay more for quality than cheap for bad food. Overall, we would consider staying again but choose a room farther from the street corner. You can't beat the price for the awesome location. Oh, one more thing, sometimes it's tough to get a taxi. The taxis don't line up at the hotel. Track down the bell hop and he'll help acquire a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location with a excellent price”
Reviews.Author: FranciscoBHMGBRAZIL
