Reviews.Content: the hotel doesn't have the luxurious of the neighbors, but the price is very good and the locations is the best

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bobloblaw19
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at Bill's for 3 nights at the end August 2011, and it was nothing short of great. Rooms were clean as far as I could tell, flat screen TVs and AC were working fine. Room decor was a bit dated, but that doesn't really matter since we only spent a few hours sleeping at night. The casino had a pretty good atmosphere, staff was excellent the one night we were there, they even taught us how to play craps and we even won a hundred or so dollars! Hotel staff was also very helpful. Most important thing about Bill's is the location. It is right at the middle of the Strip, right across from Caesar's Palace and Bellagio. We walked the north half of the Strip the first night and the south half the second night. All in all we were very impressed with Bill's, and will definitely consider staying here again in the future if we plan another cheap trip to Vegas. Oh forgot to mention that we drove from Calgary, Canada, and they had a parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Position and value for money”
Reviews.Author: AussiePhilip
Reviews.Content: Bill's Gamblin Saloon is far from being the best hotel but the location on the strip is perfect. Our room had a nice view of the Bellagio fountains and also offered a goods nights rest with the very comfortable king size bed. Midweek rate was only $39 per night for the room which was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Super location!”
Reviews.Author: hideyho53
Reviews.Content: Bill's is perfect for walking either way on the strip. Monorail station is next door at Bally's. Beautiful pool on the other side for Bill's guests at the Flamingo. The half price ticket outlet is inside Bill's on the strip side. Once you buy tickets, you are considered VIP and don't have to wait in line again. The hotel decor and casino is average but there is no wait at check in or out and you aren't walking forever to get to your room like the megacasinos. The rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal: Great Price for a Convinient and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clementine78
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big, clean, and comfortable. The location is excellent - at the center of the strip, across from Caesars and Bally's, and the price is ridiculously low. The hotel may not be as spectacular as the other hotels in Vegas, but so is the price. Also, the hotel is smaller than the other hotels, and as a result it is much less overwhelming. /i actually liked it that it is smaller and simpler. The hotel doesn't have a pool, but you get a free pass to the awesome Flamingo's pool next door. If you would like to use the internet, you'd have to pay additional $11 a day. i shared the room with 3 other friends and it worked well for all of us- I would totally go back to this hotel. The only down side- some of the receptionist were not helpful, but others were really nice and helpful. Another thing-We could hear some noise from the strip at night, but if you leave the AC on it practically masks all the noise. I had no problem falling asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: binduAustralia
Reviews.Content: We alternate between the Flamingo and Bill's Gamblin' Hall (which used to be known as the Barbary Coast) depending on rates, and we genrally visit once a year. The two properties are next door to each other and Gamblin' Bill's guests have access to the Flamingo Pool. Boith are very well located, virtually in the middle of the strip so you can either head towards Bally's Paris and New York New York, or go the other way to Caesar's Palace, the Mirage and the Venetian. Bill's had an almost Victorian feel to it...heavy brocade, dark timber, fake gold gilt in profusion. The rooms are absolutely huge, the bathrooms less so, but well laid out (in most rooms you can use the hand basin. while someone else is in the other part of the bathroom). It is a small hotel and although it's looks old (and it is!) it is very well maintained and extremely clean and comfortable. We go there for the rooms. I've never been a fan of the Victorian Cafe. We've had a few meals and breakfasts there, but frankly now go elsewhere for meals. The times we have used the resturant the service was slow and indifferent and the food only average. The reception staff can be "businesslike" rather than friendly, and because there is virtually no lobby or foyer, if you have to wait in line to chek in it feels uncomfortable. Still, with so few rooms both check-in and check-out are much easier and quicker than in the bigger hotels. There is a little kiosk off the tiny foyer with papers, snacks, souvenirs, etc. We use Gamblin's Bills as a cost-effective, comfortable and well-located as a base to explore all our favourite places in Las Vegas. Location, location, location

Reviews.Title: “Going back again, soon !”
Reviews.Author: Kich_10
Reviews.Content: Very low rate for excellently possitioned small hotel on the Strip...staff is friendly, too !

Reviews.Title: “So happy we stayed at Bill's”
Reviews.Author: like2fish93710
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been married 28yrs we have never had a honeymoon......and my wife had never been to vegas so we went. When looking for a place online to stay we were going to stay at Paris but the reviews for Bills were mostly good and the rates were about 400 dollars less so we thought let's try it......we stayed august 15th through the 19th. We got there before check in but Carletta at the deak was a real sweetheart and we checked in early. I smoke wife does not so we got a non smoking room on the first floor with a view of the strip. Room was fine, clean, bigger than we thought it would be, bed was great, air worked great. I am fifty and wife is forty seven we r not kids but not over the hill yet, we loved Bills and the people there. We got up in the mornings around nine am and got to bed about four am each day had a great time........we r already planning a return trip and we will b staying at Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience marred by rude bellhop at check-out”
Reviews.Author: Type_A_Tiff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's from August 17-20. This being my fifth trip to Vegas (having stayed at the Stardust, Aladdin, planet hollywood and MGM previously), I was apprehensive about going to an inexpensive older hotel such as Bill's, but based on the TA reviews and needing to do the trip on a shoestring budget, I was pleasantly surprised. For $29/night for the first 2 nights ($69/night for the Friday night), I couldn't ask for a better deal -- the room was spacious and clean (albeit dark and drab decor -- the quiet A/C more than made up for this), we had a perfect view (I used the $20 trick at check-in and were upgraded to a deluxe room with a clear view of the Bellagio fountains and Eiffel Tower), were centrally located (within steps of the escalators to Bally's or Caesar's, and the Bally's/Paris monorail) and because of the size of the hotel, it was a very quick check in and it wasn't a long trek to get to the Strip from our room. My one grievance about the stay was after having friendly, quick service from our front desk lady and being greeted by the cleaning staff every morning, the bellhop who took our luggage for storing after check-out was so rude, it put a damper on our day. It was a quiet morning at the front desk (read: not busy or crowded) and we were four women in two rooms with 4 carry-on bags and 1 day bag for storage. After reacting with shock and unconcealed irritation when we said we were storing the bags until 7pm, the bellhop rolled his eyes, scoffed, and said, "I'll store four bags." This after allowing a young family ahead of us with multiple carry-on and check-in bags and strollers to store all of their items. He then rolled his eyes some more and glared at us like we were inconveniencing him when we went off to the side to re-pack the fifth bag (while the front desk clerks whispered and laughed at our predicament), gave me the stub and dismissed us condescendingly. I regret not getting his name. It wasn't even the inconvenience of having to re-pack that was the issue, but the confrontational way it was demanded. After having received such friendly service from the other staff, I have to say that this was so out of no where that it ruined the rest of our morning for us and we -- a group who appreciates good service and tips liberally -- were set on not tipping at all upon retrieving our luggage. Having said that, another bellhop named Windell was working when we returned, and was so polite, friendly and gracious that we did tip him (and told him to please only keep the tip for himself as I specifically did not want a cent to go to the other man). He offered to hail us a cab and made up for our bad experience. All in all, the two stars down down is because of that one incident, along with the $12 internet fee, the $5 fee if you ask the front desk to print your boarding passes and some minor noise issues at night (which aren't that bad but would disrupt a light sleeper). Ultimately, the pros far outweigh the cons -- location, view and value can't be beat. I would stay at Bill's again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and perfect location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Roofamily
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 9 nights at Bills. If you want luxury then don't stay here but it will cost you a great deal more at somewhere like the Venetian or Bellagio. Bills offers great value for money. We upgraded to a suite but not sure whether it was really worth it as we didn't spend much time in it. The decor also was not to my taste, very dark. I think it has been described as a 60's porn suite by others. It was also in need of a bit of attention in places. Having said that, it was clean and the bed was huge and very comfortable. Bills is tiny compared to the majority which you can get easily lost in. Ate in the dining room a few times which was also good value. Tried the steakhouse one night and the majority of my party were not impressed. Also it was very expensive and they added an incredible 20% gratuity charge on the bill which we weren't happy paying and only paid 10%. Our family love playing poker but I found the poker at Bills a little boring and we ended up playing at the Harrah a couple of times which we thoroughly enjoyed. Vegas is an amazing place, the size of the hotels is mind blowing. We went downtown a few times which we loved too. We definitely intend going back to Vegas soon. Would stay again at Bills but wouldn't mind also seeing what the rooms are like in the more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, would highly recommend !!”
Reviews.Author: Beckyc2812
Reviews.Content: We booked Bill's after searching for weeks for the best Las Vegas hotel and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in an ideal position right in the middle of the south end of The Strip. The hotel room was great, clean and a good size. The curtains were really thick and blocked out all light from the Strip and the AC worked great. The shower was amazing and hairdryer was good enough for you not to need to bring your own. The flatscreen tv was a luxury and on screen check-out was an added bonus. There are only 4 floors at Bill's and one set of elevators which was a blessing after seeing the complicated system of elevators to get to your room in bigger hotels. Parking was never a problem in the hotel car park (we even saw them cleaning the car park with a floor cleaning machine early one morning and didn't ever see any rubbish on the ground !!) We consider Bill's amazing value for it's position and for the lovely room. The staff couldn't have been nicer and we would thoroughly recommend staying at Bill's if you are going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to Enjoy Drinks & Live Music”
Reviews.Author: Elvin_10
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in any of the guest rooms, so my review will focus on the casino and bar. This is a wonderfully non-pretentious place to kick back, enjoy a cocktail, and listen to live music. The "beautiful" people may be across the street at the Cosmo & Bellagio, but the FUN people are right here in Bill's. There aren't many places on this part of the strip where you can come in and listen to a live band. Bill's has a nice show area, good bar service, and a good mix of people. Don't be surprised to find total strangers being extra nice, and having a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 186605Ruby1985
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip as a party trip and chose Bills due to the price/location and the reviews on trip advisor. We were not dissapointed. The hotel was easy to find - directly across from Ceasars Palace and beside Flamingos. Although the casino was a bit grotty in Bills it definately did not lack in athmosphere. The $1 margaritas and beers were excellent value and there were always a great group of people hanging around the bar to have the craic with. The athmosphere in the other hotels was severly lacking. We ate in the hotel restaurant a couple of times as there was no room service, but we did also get a pizza delivered to our room! All in all Bills is a fab little hotel, no queuing for ages to check in is always a plus. Be warned there is a club in the hotel that opens until the very early hours, but the patrons are mostly locals and really lovely. If you chat up the security guards they will let you into the VIP area for nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Bills is Best”
Reviews.Author: howard h
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 10 day stay at Bills. This hotel is located right in the middle of the strip between the Flamingo and Ballys. The hotel is small by Vegas standards which mean no long check in queues. The staff were great especially Mike the concierge. All in all a great hotel, the best location and low prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, staff and value”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: I must admit of all our destination hotels this one had us q bit worried because it was so inexpensive. What we found when we arrived were no check in queues, courteous staff and a location right in the middle of the strip next to Flamingos which provided easy access to all the main casinos and attractions. Bills itself is an old style casino with two restaurants providing good quality food at a great price. The rooms were spacious and clean with cable tv and wireless internet access and at $39 US a night unbelievably good value. If we were to return to Vegas we would always stay at Bills. Bills was our first introduction to American customer service and all I can say is we aussies have to lift our game. Thanks Bills.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of 3rd floor”
Reviews.Author: dandreyev
Reviews.Content: We requested nonsmoking room through hotels.com but when we arrived at the hotel they gave us a room with strong smoking smell, ashtray, and bunch of matches. Also the whole 3rd floor was smelling quite smoky. When we complained they said that all their rooms are nonsmoking and they currently do not have any other rooms available. They could not explain ashtray and matches. Few minutes later they called our room and asked us if we want to upgrade to suite for $30/night, which we accepted. Suite room was on 2nd floor and was great and spacious with no signs of any smoking. In fact 2nd floor did not smell anything near 3rd floor, so I suspect that's where real nonsmoking rooms were. So beware when you book your rooms. The location of the hotel is perfect and other than original issue with the room everything else was good. Although if you are looking for romantic getaway this hotel might not be for you as it is not as clean and new as bunch of other places around. However, if you are in Vegas alone or just to gamble this could be a perfect spot for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: amanda01606
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Monday through Wednesday night. This hotel is located right in the middle of the strip between the Flamingo and Ballys. It's not fancy but it's exactly what we were looking for, a clean, quiet, cheaply prices place to stay that's was right on the strip and we got all of that. We requested a king sized bed with a view of the strip and that's exactly what we got. We checked in Tuesday morning at 2 am an there was no line and we were in our room within minutes. The carpet, linens, and bathroom were clean and the bed was comfortable. When we come back to Vegas we will definitely be returning to Bills!

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful front desk staff amoungst other things”
Reviews.Author: anonymous_advisor
Reviews.Content: Prices during the week were good value but a lot more at the weekend which is to be expected. Whilst the room was clean, the aircon was very loud, the toilet would not finish running a lot of the time and the tv reception was very bad. During one night, the fire alarm went off for around 15mins. In this time, no further information was given and then it suddenly stopped. I had no idea if it was a false alarm or a genuine emergency and I consider this unacceptable. The next morning I heard two people complain and these were not welcomed. I had arranged for a delivery to be made to the hotel some time before I visited. I sent it to the mailing address where it was confirmed as delivered and rather to the hotel address. Both addresses are listed on their website. Many of the front desk staff, including the manager, were not helpful and were actually quite rude. There was only one lady who assisted me and even then it felt a bit begrudged at times (probably because I was always asking where my package was). My parcel was lost and I can't understand how they can't get mail from the mailing address 20mins away to the hotel. If you only need a bed and don't care about health and safety then this place is fine but if you can afford to stay elsewhere, you might want to think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price!”
Reviews.Author: prinmoe
Reviews.Content: Bills was great. I was a bit scared after reading some of the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. It was a clean nice room, view to parking lot and Flamingo. I am really shocked at the bad reviews. It was really nice. Not amazing but you can't expect the Bellagio for the price. I also liked that it was small and you could go straight up to room and be there in 1 minute. not 15 like the other bigger hotels. And it was smack bang in the moddle of things. I had friends who stayed at the Bellagio, MGM and Paris come and look at the room and they felt a bit ripped off when we said we were only paying $50/night. If you want to save money then Bills is definitely the place. I will agree that housekeeping can be aggressive about entering the room after one knock so if you are sleeping past 9am don't forget the do not disturb sign! And room service would be nice but you do get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Bill's is great - you have got to try it out”
Reviews.Author: tracyaKansas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week ago and I always knew we love to gamble here, but also - I loved staying here this time. Check in is fast and easy and I was in my nice clean (not fancy) room within 5 minutes. The rooms are not over the top like the Venetian but the price you pay is also not over the top. The tables are smaller minimums and the dealers are pretty much all friendly. The waitresses are so fast and efficient - I had to tell them to hold off once in a while as the brought the drinks so fast. Cheryl, the pit boss, even is fun and joked around with us the whole time we were there. We loved Bills and loved it when it was Barbary Coast and if it changes again (I heard it will be) - I hope to love the new changes as well. The only downside is the alarm system went off twice during the night and that is annoying and loud. Love the 2.00 Nathan hotdogs for a quick bite to eat. Even the ladies at the gift shop area are super friendly and nice. This location of Bill's is the best selling point... Truly in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gill63
Reviews.Content: It's at the heart of the strip but at budget prices. It's opposite the Bellagio and you can just about see the fountains from the bathroom window!! Large room with a huge comfy bed, huge flat screen TV and a basic but clean bathroom. This is a small hotel (compared to some others) and it offers an affordable alternative to the big well known hotels. It has a small casino and a decent restaurant cooking typical american food (steaks, eggs, salads etc) Staff were friendly. Use of the pool at the Flamingo next door. The pool was awful, thousands of people all vying to get a sun lounger, lots of loud music, people smoking and drinking alcohol in the pool and spilling it in the water. All in all Bill's wasn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place, small and easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: barkerpolly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to las vegas together. We had a lot of fun. I wanted to stay somewhere that was easy to get to and not one of the huge casinos that are hard to get through. Our truck was too tall to fit in the parking garage so they let us park in employee parking. That was convenient. There was a small bar that we visited where we watched some pretty funny karaoke. The drinks were good and they weren't too expensive. We are not gamblers so this place was perfect for us. Right in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Definite YES!”
Reviews.Author: werethebrews
Reviews.Content: Bill's is a smaller hotel (only a few hundred rooms) located right in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip (across from Ceasar's, kitty corner from Bellagio, between Flamingo and Bally's) Perfect location...you are a fairly easy walk to whereever you want to go on the strip! So...Location: AWESOME! Price: very reasonable, considering you are in a central strip location! (I think we paid like $36/night) Rooms: clean, felt safe, updated (all have flat screen TV's), they are EXACTLY like what you see in the pics on the website...so what you see is literally what you get! Housekeepers are very nice and do a good job...met all requests for extra towels, etc The bathroom is sort of a funky shape...kind of triangular...but big enough, and clean! Hotel itself: not the newest, but updated, clean, small (so you can find your way around pretty easily)...AND...you can go from your room to the strip in like 4 minutes (vs 20+ minutes in the bigger hotels where you walk forever, wait for elevators, etc etc etc and it takes forever to get anywhere...) Staff: everyone from the check in/check out staff, to the housekeepers and dealers, were all very nice! (Which was a pleasant surprise!) We checked in immediately ..no wait at all! We checked out immediately...also no wait! NO pool at Bill's, but if you show your room key at Flamingo next door, they let you in to their pool (I guess both hotels are owned by the same people...but Bill's was a far better stay for sure!) Overall, a very positive experience at Bill's! I will not stay anywhere else on the strip! This is by far the best strip hotel I've stayed at in terms of affordable, clean, safe, and friendly! Oh, and the cheap margaritas ($2) are small but GOOD! Big Elvis is also good entertainment (free afternoon show ! Seating fills fast and we had to stand...so get there early if you want seats!) Thanks for reading! I would higly reccomend Bill's if you're looking for prime location and good price!

Reviews.Title: “Frustrated about no response from Bill's management.”
Reviews.Author: 3finmen
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed at Bill's and we had two rooms. The rooms were as described and in a very good location on the strip. My son and I had a very slow draining shower and on the last night the tub filled up and never drained. My other two kids had their door fall off of the hinges. My daughter was so tired and wanted to sleep but they could not shut the door. We called the front desk and waited for a response. After an hour I had to go downstairs to the front desk and ask for help again. I was told that an engineer would be coming soon. After two more hours my kids were first moved to the the third floor into a smoking room. We are all non smokers and I really didnt understand how this mistake was made. I went back to the front desk and asked for a non smoking room. They were then moved to the first floor. We both initially started our stay on the fourth floor with rooms by each other. After my kids were finally settled and resting in their room after almost three hours I went once again to the front desk and talked to the lady about my frustration with the changing of rooms and our shower not draining. She told me to come back in the morning as I did. At that time I talked to the person at the front desk and I requested some type of compensation for the troubles that we had been through. She promissed me that my credit card would not be charged until the manager called me when he returned the following day. I never received a call and I was charged full price for our stay. It was a very disappointing trip at Bill's and we have no plans on returning again to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected”
Reviews.Author: EscapingtheBurg
Reviews.Content: This place is a "hidden gem" in my book. The taxi driver described it that way also. No lines at check-in although we were unable to check in early the first night. The rooms were clean and LARGE. We used the Flamingo pool almost every day and it was always hopping. Get there before 10:30 for a good lounge chair. Bill, who was our bellman, was fantastic and always there with a smile and a kind word. They will take care of your luggage until check in. Shampoo, lotion and soap were provided. No conditioner. There are also irons and hair dryers in each room. The tubs were wide and the bathrooms a decent size. For the price, we loved the place and will be back!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: too far from the wild west!
Reviews.Title: “had to see for myself, for one night -”
Reviews.Author: Rocker_rep
Reviews.Content: On long road trips (2.5 - 3.5 weeks) its especially important to get the best rates without compromising too much quality. On nat'l park road trips, we spend 2-3 *commercialism* nights in vegas as a *break from the red rocks :) So since we're not really in vegas for the over-the-top typical vegas experience, we thought bill's might be a great option. In previous years, we've stayed several times at flamingo, mirage, MGM and monte carlo...... After reading such good reviews about bill's, thought we'd give it a try.... Location? Check. Right in the middle of the strip. Easy parking? Check, the easiest. View? Sorta check; saw the tip of flamingo and part of caesars; better view out of window in shower! Staff? Check; friendly & helpful, especially front desk Colette. Access to flamingo pool (same owner) - Check. Easier than staying at flamingo. Clean? Semi-check. When hotels age, they can't possibly look totally clean. So far so good ... but.... Beds? Yuck. Can you say Flop-House boys & girls? (not that i really know what that is LOL) Can't even venture a guess of their age. But NOT the place to stay if you want a good nights sleep. Unless you come back and pass out. They're clearly past their due / replacement date & sagging, and the pillows are even worse. Yuck. If they'd replace the beds, it would make a HUGE difference. One night was enough for us. We went back to flamingo for the next two. But now we know; perfect location & parking, but probably won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: gecko24
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed in July in a classic room and was assigned one that looked up the Strip past the Flamingo. It was very quiet which suited us and we had requested non smoking-I presume we were on a non smoking floor as we were pleasantly surprised to find the room and hallways had barely a trace of a smell of smoke-nor did we find any of the casino floors to be smokey really to be honest, despite what others have said. The room was spacious and very clean though somewhat outdated in furnishings. We missed not having a coffee maker or fridge though I know few of the hotels on the strip do. The location is brilliant-opposite Bellagio and Caesar's Palace and next to Flamingo and Paris. As a small casino it was great not having to wade through acres of the casino floor or hallways to find the elevators-after checking out some of the bigger ones for us this was a big plus. The car parking was do it yourself, easy to get in and out of. I did get cranky trying to find a place to grab a take away coffee to take back to our room in the morning and to grab a bite to eat and a cup of tea for a late dinner to take back to the room one pm. In the am with the help of the front desk found the coffee shop by the main entrance near the Flamingo and in the evening, though it was only around 9pm the coffee shop was closed so finally found the meagre food court in the Flamingo open to get one but wasn't impressed at how hard it seemed to be to get something light and take away as opposed to a huge meal or alcohol. Friends have stayed at places like the Luxor and report large 24 hr food courts so would take this into consideration next time. Dined at Victoria's in Bill's one night-off the Chinese menu and was very good-looking at other diner's meals think this is the best option. Huge serves, cheap prices and big bowl of complimentary crunchy Asian noodles to munch on while you waited as well as a basket of bread rolls. e are not gamblers so cannot comment on the casino itself but Bill's made a good base for a family stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Vegas - Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: seattle_ali
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my (now) husband along with some members of my family and friends in April 2011. My husband and I got married in Las Vegas at Chapel of the Flowers and we selected this hotel as a relatively inexpensive option for folks to stay at over the weekend. The hotel does not offer blocks of rooms for large parties, though we were able to obtain a discount to apply to our reservation by calling the hotel directly. The hotel's location in the middle of the Las Vegas strip is wonderful, it worked out especially well for us as we had plans all over the strip from the North to South end. Every person in our group who stayed at Bill's was pleased with the hotel. The rooms are comfortably sized and clean. (Example - we had five people in the room the morning of the wedding for hair and makeup and the room was not overly crowded.) Our beds were fine, though I do recall that not everyone was happy with the pillows. Everyone's room had an ironing board and iron in it as well as a hair dryer. The food in the restaurant downstairs was between adequate and good depending on what was ordered - and the location is handy when you don't feel like walking all over the place to find somewhere to eat. They have a menu offering a wide variety of foods, something to please just about everyone. I found the staff at the restaurant to be friendly and I never felt rushed to vacate a table no matter the time of day we were there. I prefer the atmosphere at smaller casinos and for me Bill's was perfect. It was not deserted but it was also never so busy that a group of us couldn't find a place to congregate and have a good time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice, centrally located place to stay in Las Vegas that will not break the bank. I know that I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: amac524
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better price, in a better location! Bill's is smack dab in the middle of the strip surrounded by the Flamingo, Ballys, and Balagio. We grabbed a luxury room for the cheap price of about 60/nite during the week. I will agree with other reviewers that the rooms have potential to be noisy when there is a lot of traffic or people on the crosswalk, but who goes to Vegas for peace and quiet. We could see the Bellagio fountains from our room, totally awesome! Overall room was a little outdated but clean, comfortable and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: OlderThanSand
Reviews.Content: Did a last minute stop over in Vegas and needed a room on the Strip. Checked several big name hotels and decided they weren't worth $200 just for a place to sleep which is all we would be doing there. Found Bill's for $89 and decided to take a chance based on positive reviews. Although it's not a 5 star hotel, the rooms are very clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly, atmosphere was relaxed and everyone seemed to be having a good time. The parking garage was not crowded and it was a very short walk and elevator ride from the front desk. I would definitely stay there again. I would not reccommend a smoking room unless you are a hard core smoker. I went to the "smoking floor" to use the soda machine and the smoke smell was overwhelming. We had breakfast at the Victorian Room. Food wasn't bad (not great either) and in my opinion over priced. We paid $37 for breakfast for 2. I was expecting a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location on the strip, decent value, but not much else”
Reviews.Author: Cymbolz
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in May, the location could not be much better being right in the middle of the strip across from Bellagio and Caesars…so very easy to walk around or catch the bus (which can be very crowded). Typical casino/hotel, having to walk through the gaming area to get to the elevators/rooms. It’s easy to get to from the airport for shuttle or taxi. The room was a good size and clean. I guess this is typical Vegas, as there wasn’t much else going for it…no internet or WIFI. The staff could take a few friendly pills too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, superb location, and easy to find your room!!”
Reviews.Author: ThePughs14
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 2 adults, one 18 year old son and a 17 year old daughter, stayed for 3 nights - Wednesday, Thursday and Friday nights - booking via Booking.com. On arrival we were provided with 2 rooms as requested, one Double and one Twin, but they were not next to each other as they had upgraded the Double to the 4th Floor with excellent view overlooking Bellagio's Fountains - superb, and as other reviewers have commented noiser than the Twin that was facing Flamingo on the 1st Floor. Excellent value, I could find no other hotel in such a great central location that offered such a good price. The rooms are rather dated.... but clean, with smart flatscreen TVs. However as is typical with Las Vegas hotels the room has no tea/coffee making facilities, nor a fridge, as they want you to purchase their own refreshments.... not a problem for us as we went out for any drinks. With only 4 floors of rooms you can get in and out of the hotel in a couple of minutes.... and out onto the strip - and decide which way you want to walk - north or south! If you want to swim..... then you have free access to the Flamingo next door and their swimming pool. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas as it should be.”
Reviews.Author: DevonJohn
Reviews.Content: I loved this place, given some of the reviews which I had previously read and one of my party wanting to "push the boat out" in Las Vegas I did have a few concerns but from the minute that we checked in and the Receptionist saying that she could either honour my request for rooms close to each other or we could be on different floors but both have excellent views of the Strip I knew that this was my sort of Hotel. It is not a glitzy chrome on plastic sort of place but it does have an atmosphere all of it`s own. Where to start ? The room was on the corner and had a brilliant view right across to the Bellagio, watched the Fountains, with Bally`s on the other side, It was very well maintained and the beds were both large and comfortable. Facilities were excellent although we missed the Tea/Coffeee maker. Breakfast was enormous and very, very tasty they do try their best to make you overdose on coffee. For the beer drinkers do not bother with the bar near to reception, go down to the bar at the Strip end, they sell 4 pint jugs at $4:00. The continual Karaoke nearby is an added bonus although a bit wearing. Location could not be faulted with all the Casinos within walking distance. I consider this Hotel to have been the best value for money that we achieved during the entire trip. Anyone expecting a "pristine" hotel should consider the amount of people passing through at any one time and adjust accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: pearly6
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my Birthday in Vegas, with a few girlfriends. This was my first experience with Bill's and it will not be my last! The convenience of the strip location was fantastic. Fast check in and check out. Rooms were clean, big and we had a great strip location. The Woman who checked me in apologized, and told me I didn't have a very good view from the room. On the contrary, I was able to see the Flamingo and Mirage lights from my room. I had no trouble sleeping, very quiet hotel. My only complaint [minimal] was Tix 4 Tonight. I had a gift card for service, and it took several of the employees to figure out how to use it, they should be trained on how to use a service they provide. We called for extra towels and blankets, and were told they were out on two of the nights of my stay. Bill's was a great experience and I will DEFINITELY book there again!

Reviews.Title: “The YMCA version of the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: dlb264
Reviews.Content: This place is not horrible, it is quaint right before quaint goes bad. There is No Way this place should be rated in the top half of places to stay in Las Vegas, The ratings must be weighed towards Price if this is in the top half. It used to be called The Barbary Coast, a late 1970's hotel/casino and not much has changed inside since then. Look close inside and you see dirty carpet, dust, sinks that drip, banged up walls and molding, small rooms. But you are in the heart of the strip for less than $60, and if you don't stay in the place much, and don't care about atmosphere, or the over the top experience of Las Vegas, this place is it. Warning though, because it is small and right on the strip the noise at night outside your window is very loud. Very Loud. But basically it is Motel 6 with a view of the bright lights.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on strip”
Reviews.Author: neuromd
Reviews.Content: Bills is less than 50 dollars a night weekday. Location is perfect. I have stayed at many strip hotels from tropicana to belagio, this may have been the cleanest. No pool but they said they would give us passes to go to flamingo pool. Will def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's Rules!”
Reviews.Author: annabel16
Reviews.Content: We loved our recent stay at Bill's. You couldn't ask for a better location on the strip, and the manageable size of the hotel just made our stay much simpler....no log waits to check-in, or for elevators, and we checked out using the television in our room. We paid a few extra bucks to have an amazing view of the Bellagio Fountains, and our room was new, clean, and an easy place to rest the eye after the excesses of Vegas. Bill's has one of the most popular nightclubs in Vegas, surprisingly, and the poker tournaments we played in were fun and exciting. Who wouldn't want the Bellagio view for a quarter of the price? Bill's has no pool, but you use the one next door at the Flamingo, which is very convenient and quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, best price”
Reviews.Author: Pirateliz
Reviews.Content: We chose this small hotel for its location at a busy intersection in LV, with pedestrian overpasses in all directions. It's a very quick walk from parking area to your room (unlike every other LV casino) and convenient walk to everything. We got a super price for our stay with no resort fees. Checkin was quick, and elevators to rooms are right there. There is a tiny gift shop beside checkin selling trinkets as well as cold sodas and candy. Our room was very large , clean, nicely decorated , and had a stained glass window in the shower. As other guests have mentioned, the bathroom quarters are tight but adequate. Beds were very comfortable, and my friend and I brought our own pillows as that seemed to be a frequent complaint. We loved this hotel. Flamingo pool was A+.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: owl-zat
Reviews.Content: The best kept secret in Vegas this is described as by a U.K newspaper apparently and I can honeslty agree with that statement. This was my 3rd visit to Vegas with a mate who'd been on 17 other occassions staying at different hotels and he commented it's the first time he'd had a room with a view of not only The Strip but The Bellagio Fountains and hey, I could even watch them from the shower out of a small window in the bathroom. I usually stay at The Flamingo which is next door as it has a great pool for relaxing at the end of our road trips but fell upon Bill's which although doesn't have it's own pool you are allowed to use The Flamingo's and it worked out about $150 cheaper than staying in the Flamingo for the same 6 nights. With Bill's only having 4 floors you are never waiting long for the lift (less than a minute) and they are usually there instantly. The only complaint I would have is with housekeeping who would be knocking you up sometimes before 9am asking if they can come and clean your room. Central on The Strip you can't beat this hotel for price and location and the rooms are large enough with a flat screen t.v mounted on the wall giving you even more space. I would definately go back and stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: redoaktree
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a ghetto in the middle of the strip. We reserved a room in April 2011 for June 2011. We booked through the hotel web site, our reservation we printed out said DL for deluxe but when we got there they said they didn't have anymore deluxe room and that we reserved a deluxe/classic room which means they give you a classic. I asked what the difference was between a deluxe room and a classic, they the only difference was the view, that with a deluxe you can see the fountain at the Bellagio. Even though they supposedly remodelled the whole hotel recently it still was old and ghettoey. The king size bed in our room was sloped down on one side, I told them about it they said they would send engineering up to fix it, they never came. The clientel that uses this hotel seem to be the young and drunk kind. I felt like wiping down everywhere we were in the hotel with antibacterial wipes.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will come back!”
Reviews.Author: HotMama128
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean and nice. We had a good view of the strip. The service was good and liked the parking garage to park your vehicle. The parking was free if you stayed at the hotel. Overall, was very impressed for our first time to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Big Payoff without Big Spending”
Reviews.Author: softballmom11
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor for over a month, we decided to go ahead and try this hotel. Boy are we glad we did! There was absolutely no line when we checked in at 6:00 p.m. The clerk was super nice and upgraded us from a deluxe room to the luxury room. We stayed in Room 402, which is the corner room overlooking the Bellagio Fountains and Ballys. Despite what another poster stated, there is a Bell man that will assist with luggage, flagging down taxi's, and give helpful advice. Our room was very large and the bed was very comfortable. We came back to a clean room every day and I don't think that you could make the water turn cold in the shower. I also have to comment that it was super quiet on our floor. I brought ear plugs just in case, but never had to take them out of the package. The casino had lower stakes gambling, which was nice to find. They regularly had poker tournaments for a $30.00 buy-in. However, due to the limited tables, you have to get there ahead of time. As for the service workers, they were wonderful. The cocktail waitresses learned our names and consistently took care of us -- especially Kim! The dealers in the poker room were nice and fun to sit around with. Many thanks to Matt, Shawn, and Hector! There was only one instance of an older guy behind the bar that was rude. Other than that, we never had an issue with the staff. The only downside we found was the hotel's cafe restaurant. With tax and tip, it cost $50.00 for breakfast! For that kind of money, we could have ate a champagne brunch at Treasure Island and still would have saved $15.00. In my opinion, the only time I would eat here is between 12:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. when they run their breakfast specials! Lastly, do hit the ticket vendors. There is one at the front of Bills. You can save a lot of money at the buffets and shows!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dingy with giant roach”
Reviews.Author: jackiesun
Reviews.Content: I booked by stay at Bill's Gamblin Hall because of the riviews on Trip Advisor. It is the first time I was ever disappointed. I upgraded to the suite. It was a nice size suite, but dark and dingy. The furniture was old, lighting was so dark, every thing looked dirty - it may have just been dirty. Pulled back my covers to get in bed and there was someone's else hair already in my bed. Then went in the living area to call the front desk and a 3 inch roach was crawling on the full length wall mirror. They said - she will be right up to kill it. Didn't sound like this was an unusual request. I asked them to move me to a sister property. The front desk manager said no. I would need to find something else myself. Before too long, the manager called me back and said they would move me next door to the Flamingo. They did not help me move or carry my bags. They had me pull my bags on the strip at 11:30pm by myself. I called corporate when I returned home and they were not concerned. Definately would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: James45_Orlando
Reviews.Content: Good employees, cheap bet tables, and a perfect location. A true value

Reviews.Title: “Probably go back here next year.”
Reviews.Author: bikerbear221
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 30th May for 4 nights. Love the location and the price was more than right so decided to give it a go. Checkin and checkout are easy. Rooms are what we would describe as standard Vegas fare. Strange shape bathroom but it works. Beds very comfortable. Clean. Bills own cafe is fine for breakfast and we would happily try it again for another meal. Casino, not the biggest on the strip by far but fair enough selection of slots and the tables seemed to be in use a fair amount of the time, specially the craps tables. From room to outside on the strip is maybe 3 mins depending on what floor your on-good stuff. We would return here no problem. D 1700-10

Reviews.Title: “Small but right in the middle of everything, great rates.”
Reviews.Author: barooga
Reviews.Content: Bills was ideal for us. Great location, good value for money, clean comfortable room - with wi-fi, small but adequate bathroom and I liked that fact you could open your window to get fresh air. The decor was western movie, which we enjoyed. We also liked the fact the you didn't have to walk mile to get to your room and use a GPS to find it!. There are slot machines right in the foyer of the hotel but you're in Vegas so that comes with the territory. Restaurant was nice, food good and reasonable prices and check-in staff were a lot friendlier than some we came across in our month long trip. The location is the abosolute best. Right on the strip, just down from the Belaggio close to everything you need and yet the room was quiet. You can also buy your show tickets from the half price agent, situated right in the hotel itself. There's a Elvis Presley impersonator that's been there for ten years straight, who performs free everyday, plus a really funny kareoke session later in the night. We explored Las Vegas day and night and one of our favourite places was the 'duelling pianos' bar that was right on the strip, part of one of the casinos (can't remember the name) and was hightlight of our stay. We wen't everynight we were there because it was such an entertaining concept. They start playing at 9:00pm and finish at 2:00am and it's well worth seeing. (No charge to get in either) We also did the Grand Canyon sunset tour via helicopter and this was the highlight of our whole trip. It's a bit expensive but worth every cent. You get picked up from the hotel, taken to the airport, given a safety overview then on to the choppers. There were four all up and we flew over the Hoover dam as well. We landed on the floor of the Canyon, a little above the Colorado River and had a small meal and glass of chamnpagne, took some amazing photos and then left just before sunset to get the best pictures. The whole trip took 4 and half hours and we also bought a video of the flight. Trip of a lifetime! Would reccommend Bill's to anyone who just wants a clean, comfortable room with good service and a reasonable rate, that is close to everything you want to see on the strip. Would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it & will stay here EVERY time we go to Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: slak_k_61411
Reviews.Content: I found Bill's Gamblin' Hall via TripAdvisor, and was very impressed with the ratings and reviews. This hotel deserves every great review it has received. I was getting married in Las Vegas, and had about 30 guests also staying in the same hotel. Some of my family members did mention the noise level on the 1st floor, but that's to be expected, considering this hotel was right smack-dab in the middle of the Strip. Also, my husband and I loved our suite. The only drawback was 1 waiter in particular at the VIctorian Room (restaurant just off the lobby) who was pretty rude on a couple occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for price and location”
Reviews.Author: Chaspolin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bill's (Formerly Barbary Coast) June 4th-June 9th . Was in town for business and pleasure.Bill's is owned by Harrah's and is right in the middle of the strip across from Bellagio Fountains. Room rates are best in area. Rooms are clean and modern. One of the few hotels where you get off the elavator and walk out on street...not 1/2 thru casinos and shops. This is 3rd time we've stayed there and have not been disapponted yet. It doesn't have a pool but you can use the one next door at the Flamingo. Although it has 2 restaurants it doesn't offer room service. Still a great value!! Side note...I left a $240 slot receipt on the dresser and left room went up to get it...room had been made up and TICKET WAS STILL THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, superb value”
Reviews.Author: jeanniepep
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: I did not stay here myself, but my dad did while my husband and I were at Caesars across the street (for a work trip). I visited his room, and he gave full daily reports, and he doesn't like to review so I thought this might help other travelers. He managed to find a room for $40/night, pretty great for being right in the middle of the Strip. His room was on the 4th floor right near the elevator (perfect for him because wandering around Vegas was rough on his bad knee). It was a VERY LARGE, clean room with the biggest flatscreen TV I have ever seen. The bathroom wasn't big but well-appointed, and the room had a nice little seating area near the window. He reported that the bed was very comfortable and the floor was quite quiet. He had brought earplugs because he feared Vegas would be loud, but he never had to use them. The place is not new or fancy, but it wears the old-timey saloon decor very well. The location is perfect; next to the Flamingo, right across from Caesars on one side of the street and across from Bally's on the other. We played a bit of video poker at the bar and everyone was very laid-back. I'd definitely recommend it based on Dad's experience!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and location”
Reviews.Author: TWINSPORTS
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Las Vegas and we're happy, happy. Bill's place is right on the strip acrtoss from both the Bellagio and Bally's....a block or so from Paris. Great location and nice rooms. Upgrade for the view of Bellagio's fountain shows....don't miss them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price and central location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Bob666
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bill's on a great internet deal during mid week. The purpose of the trip was to stay somewhere central on the Strip (tick); have a decent sized room with two beds (tick); stay at a hotel with quick access to/from rooms to the Strip (tick); have a decent cheap onsite restaurant (tick); & not too be expensive (tick). The hotel has some good gambling tables (although difficult to get a place); decent bar (go for $7 pitchers); & a great atmosphere with Big Elvis. We got upgraded to a view of Bellagio fountains (with $20 trick) but got disturbed alot on first night with alot of noise from bridge from Bill's to Ballys. Used the swimming pool at the Flamingo. Overall a great choice for a budget hotel as long as you know what your paying for & what you won't get for that price.

Reviews.Title: “they bumped us!!”
Reviews.Author: retiredtravelers30
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation confirmed, when we arrived we were given a letter and told to go to Harrah's, in other words, after 12 hours of driving, get back in the car, navigate the strip at its most crowded, find the parking at Harrah's, wait in a long line to check in, etc. If I had wanted to stay at a huge resort, I would have booked that. One hour later, we had a very nice room, but the location was not what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit. Still the same”
Reviews.Author: livmack
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Bills in maybe 2 years and not much has changed. The rooms are still huge and great value. We booked in advance for dates including the Memorial Day weekend (google for promotional codes) and we paid less than $50 per night after tax. We asked for an upgrade to a Bellagio view room but as we checked in late, all the rooms were gone. The clerk said we could switch the next day but our room ended up having a Bellagio view anyway? The casino itself is looking more run down each time. The carpet is super shabby and really smelly. We didn't spend a huge amount of time there so can't really comment on the bar service etc. In regards to the other reviewer below, we didn't find any issues with getting more than one drink at a time and I think we spent only a few dollars on booze the whole time we were in Vegas as we found the free drinks to be plentiful. Even more so than on other visits. The parking was great and easy. Bills is just an easy and affordable, no frills option. Beds are comfy, rooms are dark and easy to sleep in. I did notice the noise this time which I hadn't in the past. Maybe I am getting old! It wasn't a huge deal for us though but I do recommend ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Only real negative comment about Bills - I am sure they used to have room service from the Victoria Room but this seems to have stopped. Vegas tip - we used to love the Harley Davidson cafe for some good BBQ food but it has seriously gone down. Head to the Rock Bar near Planet Hollywood for some amazing (and cheap!) food. Also, the Flamingo buffet sucks. If you can, head up to the Palms. It is really nice up there and good slots!

Reviews.Title: “Bill's was just OK and Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Dudes
Reviews.Content: After reading the excellent reviews here, I was quite looking forward to a nice stay at Bill's. I understood the property was aged and the furnishing were not new. I really looked forward to being able to get out on the strip in a few seconds of leaving the room and not having to traverse a full scale resort to get anywhere. We stayed Memorial Day weekend, so we did not enjoy the cheap rooms everyone talks about here. 3 nights = $550 Once arriving at Bills for our Deluxe room, check in was very quick. The room was large and as expected, the carpeting, bed and other furnishings were dated. The bed was actually lumpy (weird). The drain in the tub/shower was slow and water buildup happened with each shower. Maid service excellent! No safe or refrigerator in the rooms. A/C worked great and kept the room super cool. Here is why I rated Bill's so low: First, Our room faced Tropicana Blvd. Each night and all night long, the emergency vehicles from the nearby firehouse would sound their sirens as the raced up and down the street. Very loud to say the least. Secondly, on one night of our stay during Memorial Day weekend, the fire alarms kept going off again and again, but there was no emergency! I asked what was going on and I was given some bull line about annual testing. So, they selected one of the busiest nights of the year at 4am in the morning to test and re-test their fire alarm system. I think someone who had something against the place was pulling the fire alarm, knowing the place was full and the complaints it would generate. Third, The unionized bartenders at Bill's just do not give a crap about service. Even with good tips, they just acted like you were a bother. One of them actually told me that he did not care what management thinks, because they cannot fire him anyways. I thought, WOW....why is this guy a bartender to begin with if he is so miserable. I had not been to Vegas in many years and the place has changed substantially. When in the casinos, you have to be gambling with more than $10 to get a complimentary drink. If drinks are not complimentary, the regular prices are high! You cannot have more than one drink at a time, even if you are paying. So, you cannot have a shot and a drink at the same time. We tipped, but observed those that did not tip....did not get drinks. The days of cheap food are few and far between. Buffets are expensive (at least the nicer ones are) and even with coupons, it seems to cost much more to eat than what I remember from the past. Not too mention, I hate chasing down coupons and trying to be someplace at midnight for a $2 egg. I had a good time, but I will pass on Bill's in the future. I would probably pass on Vegas as a whole and go someplace a little less intense. Maybe I am getting old, but being pushed up and down Las Vegas Blvd. just did not set well with me by the time we left. If I do go back, I will stay someplace off strip during off season in the middle of the week!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and we will stay at Bill's Gamlin' Hall again”
Reviews.Author: AmyDaytonOhio
Reviews.Content: Bill's Gamblin' Hall and Saloon is located in a central location on the Strip. The rooms were of decent size and clean. Our smoke-free room was exactly that. No surprises to the room or service. We would stay here again. The only bad part was the noise (yelling, loud talking) in our hallway that occured from 2am - 5am. I am not sure if the value pricing on the rooms attracts a rude clientele or what. Our stay was over Memorial Day weekend, so maybe that was partially the reason. Luckily my husband and I had earplugs, so the interrupted sleep stopped by night #3 for us.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time...Bills was very good!!”
Reviews.Author: barrassyard
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas in September 2010 for our first visit to Las Vegas and Bills was a very good choice....we got dropped off at the side door which was right next to check-in which was helpful, we had booked 10 nights in a deluxe room but the reception girl said they had no rooms left so we would have to spend the night in one of their suites...wohoo!! I am not sure if the hotel was really full as my sister emailed the hotel to tell them we were coming to get married and asked them to pass a message on to us on our wedding day so maybe they gave us the suite because they knew of the wedding? The suite was amazing,huge living room with full size bar and large tv area,huge shower that could get 6 people in and a wirlpool type bath with a tv above...lovely. The next day we moved to the deluxe room which was still very nice and a great view of the Belagio fountains,No fridge but you have an ice machine on each floor next to the lifts and also drinks machines on every other floor which was nice. The room had a large bed and a table with a couple of chairs,Bathroom was small but everything u need.... Best thing about Bills is the location,everything on your doorstep and with $1 hot dogs and $1 margaritas downstairs,what more would you need :-) The pool at the Flamingo is also included if you just show your Bills room key...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MountainBugg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wynn last year and it was great. We got a "good deal" . This year we had no offers from the Wynn so decided to stay somewhere the price was right and a little closer to all the action. This little casino is perfect for folks that plan to walk alot. It is right in the heart of the strip. Some casinos make you walk a mile though the casino with your bags just to get to your room. Not here. Very easy from parking, to check in, to room. The rooms are nice size. Clean. Decorated in nice dark wood and pleasing to come home to after a long day on the strip. I do have to say however that the rooms are the noisiest rooms I've ever been in. If you are a light sleeper then go elsewhere. Just have a few drinks and all will be fine. We enjoyed the ghosts too. All in all I will stay here again. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Situation”
Reviews.Author: Walker05
Reviews.Content: We selected Bill's because of the price and situation and we weren't disappointed. We aren't gamblers so we were there to see the sights and a show and Bill's was okay. I can't believe smoking is still tolerated inside buildings in the USA. Unfortunately on our 2nd night (Grand Canyon inbetween) maybe I didn't specify a non-smoking room so we had to tolerate a faint whiff of cigarettes. The rooms are large,clean and spacious and the beds are comfy which is the main thing. Next door to The Flamingo and across the road from Bellagio, what a spot!

Reviews.Title: “It's a good gamble!”
Reviews.Author: ThreeLegsIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Large clean room made available prior to regular check-in time. Conveniently situated and extremely good value for money. Reception staff were very helpful. Only minor negative was that tea and coffee facilities were not available. Victoria cafe offered very good value breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the position- the rest is ok!”
Reviews.Author: pafuri
Reviews.Content: The position Of this hotel is great- mid-strip and easy to get to the monorail through the back entrance of Flamingo- literally 5 minutes. My feelings about the trip: Check-in was a pleasure - no queue or fuss, and early check-in allowed(around 1pm) Room faced onto the strip, though the view was a bit obscured. Positives- clean, great TV, and good size. Bathroom was a bit tight, but not worth a complaint at any level! For me the noise from the strip was a bit of a hassle- it is pretty loud and goes on all night. This means you can't open a window and this leaves the room a little stuffy despite the aircon. We tried both restaurants and they are both so-so. The more casual 24 hour establishment is OK, but this is Vegas and there are really dozens of nicer places nearby. The steakhouse on the other hand had reasonable steaks and service, but the hostess had dissapeared and the waiting staff were clearly put out by it- never mind the queue that had formed outside- while there were many empty tables inside! We honestly waited 15 minutes and there was no management to complain to. Casino? A bit down at the heel, with barmen who look like they've been there forever, and treat you like you are a bit of a nuisance despite the fact the bar was really very slow when we were there. Overall, I think it was fair enough value. But you get what you pay for. I'll try somewhere else next time, even if it costs a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, everything else sub-par”
Reviews.Author: arjungupta101
Reviews.Content: Great Location, better than anything else. You will reach your room from Ceaser/Bellagio faster than even Ceaser/Bellagio guests Very noizy at night as you are sleeping when everyone is partying just outside No room service, but a good restaurant downstairs with Great Staff Hotel has no bell boy. Actually its more like a large wonderful guest house in Vegas No frills - stay here if you are on budget Huge Rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: baudsam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's for three nights and were impressed from the very beginning. It's location on the middle of the strip is its greatest feature. Our room was huge and the view was great. It was a little noisy at night, but that is to be expected staying on the strip. We could see Paris and the Bellagio fountains from our room. We only paid $50 dollars a night after tax. I will definitely recommend Bill's to any of my friends going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Tan50
Reviews.Content: Great location, great perks, comfortable beds, only negative was hearing sirens during night which isn't the fault of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and Location”
Reviews.Author: NormanCambridge
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried about what we were going to find for the price we paid but shouldn't have been. Great location good sized rooms right on the strip. We used the Flamingo pool a couple of days with no problems. Also parked right next to reception for free. Point about the noise is appropriate but it is Vegas and for this price you can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and the perfect location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: fraggles1975
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted by a friendy lady who checked us in. She said I hope you don't mind having ajoining rooms and passed us the key cards. We took the lift up to the fourth floor, followed down the numbers and we realised our room was the double doors at the end of the corridor. We gingerly opened the door to be greeted by a small entrance hall and on the right there were two massive bedrooms and on the left a huge lounge/diner, kitchen/bar etc amazing, we were like kids in a sweet shop. The footprint of our house would have fitted into it! From the bedroom windows if you looked to the right you could see the Bellagio fountains. Considering the hotel was right in the middle of the strip (opposite cesar's) it wasn't too noisy apart from the occasional sirens which was perfect. What we liked the most was because of the size of the hotel it was easy to navagate your way out and you were on the strip in minutes. Whereas we found with the other hotels you could be lost for ages amongst the slot machines and the disappearing direction signs . Loved it, well recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if you want a central location”
Reviews.Author: Welbudj1
Reviews.Content: After staying at Circus Circus a couple of times, we decided to try Bill's, mainly because of its central location. Our room overlooked the Bellagio fountains and you're directly across the Strip from Ceasers, next door to the Flamingo and across the street from Bally's. The hotel is small which is a plus point. You don't have to walk half a day through the hotel just to leave the building. The room was spacious and very clean and when we told the receptionist we really couldn't afford te £20 a day for a fridge, she threw one in for free. Great service. Their breakfast service was fine but we didn't get around to sampling their steakhouse. The casino floor had low minimum bets and live music most of the time. It was busy, even at 4.30am when we wandered through past full tables and a queue to get into Drais nightclub. It has a Victorian charm totally unlike the wonderful grandeur of the Bellagio or Wynn's. The only drawbacks I could find were the windows were single-glazed so the sirens and traffic from outside was quite loud on occasions. Their internet was also incredibly slow. For $5 I accessed about three sites in 20 minutes and wouldn't get Hotmail. Apart from that though, there was nothing wrong with the place. There is no pool but you can used the Flamingo's if you're a resident at Bill's and that was fine, despite the pool being freezing at first. We braved that though. All in all, if we return to Vegas in a few years, we'll be checking this place out first on Tripadvisor. For the price you can't really beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Vegas so far!”
Reviews.Author: PghPens
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed at Bills for the busy weekend of May 13-15. We had a great time! The location is PERFECT! I love the bellagio fountains, so it was my delight to be able to watch them out my hotel window. The hotel is pretty easy to find, but if you are coming from I-15 be prepared to wait on Flamingo until there is a break in traffic to get into the parking garage. The front desk woman seemed to hate her job, but we did not let it bug us. The players club workers were wonderful though! Bills is an older hotel, but the room was nicer than rooms I have stayed in at Tropicana, Excalibur, Stratosphere and New York New York for a MUCH cheaper rate! It had a flat screen TV with about 30 channels, dresser, desk, and sitting area. The first night we came back to Bills around midnight and the elevators were stopped on the bottom floor because someone pulled the fire alarm. We were standing around there for a while because no workers would tell us where the stairs were! They kept saying that security would come to take us up. Turns out the stairs are just by the parking entrance and not hard to get to at all. Just know that Hotel Floor #1 is actually Building Floor #5. That's why the hotel elevator takes so long. We gambled the most at Harrahs- that is where we had the most winnings. Bills was nice to gamble in, too. I was worried about the smoke smell in the casino from other reviews, but in comparison to other casinos, Bills is not bad at all! Harrahs buffet was no good though. Dont waste your money. The desserts and seafood were good, but nothing else. It was a little loud outside our room because we were right at the intersection, but we were so tired that we went right to sleep. The A/C helped drown out a lot of the street noise as well. During the evening we heard sirens go by like every 20 minutes! Crazy! We used the pool at the Flamingo on Saturday and it was PACKED! They did not check our hotel key, just our IDs. There were no open chairs and they kept letting people in! I guess they want you to pay the money for a Cabana or lounge when they run out of seats. Luckily we found 2 together and I was able to drag an empty one over so we could be together. THEY DO NOT ALLOW ANY OUTSIDE FOOD OR DRINKS, so leave your snacks at the room. People in front of us got their bags searched and had to throw away all their treats. Bring extra money for drinks cause they are expensive. $20 for 5 Coors Light bottles was more than we wanted to pay. I recommend Fat Tuesdays for your frozen drinks. I have tried a bunch on the strip and Fat Tuesday is worth the extra few dollars. Also ask them for a coupon for $1 off your refills! I also recommend Margaritaville for breakfast. We used our 20% off coupons from signing up for the players club and got a really good, generally inexpensive, breakfast! Overall it was a great place to stay! Totally worth the money! I definitely recommend Bills to anyone who wants a good deal for a decent room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: liammccann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's on May 13-16 2011. We got a good deal compared to the other hotels we were looking at. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a wonderful view of the Strip (one tip - when booking, lay down the little extra for a Strip-view room, and make sure they give you one at check-in). Another tip - ask for an extra blanket at check-in - you'll need it if (like us) you like to sleep in a cool room. The food at the Victorian is good - especially the Chinese food (really!) and is a good deal as well. The casino is smaller than most of the surrounding casinos, but they usually have a few $5 blackjack tables with very friendly dealers. The cocktails come often and the wait time between ordering your drink and getting is is very short, since the waitresses don't need to travel far to stock you up. Overall, we would highly recommend Bill's and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: fadeaway
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay! In the middle of the Strip, just in fornt of Caesar Palace. Rooms are huge and comfortable! We were in 4 and we had a lot of space!! great insonorisation! From our window I could see Bellagio Fountains, amazing!! You are close to everything. Staffis very friendly and helpful. The only thing to regret is to pay $11 a day for internet connection. Wifi for free would be good.Great relation price-quality ! I recommend it and I'll come back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Oldster
Reviews.Content: Superb price (booked thru vegas.com), location (close to shopping and the glitzy big hotels - Caesar's, Harrah's, Bellagio, etc.); quietness, room comfort, 42" flat screen, good bath facilities, small hotel advantages (no waiting in lines, responsive staff, good cafe style restaurant, nice little casino). Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, great location”
Reviews.Author: Grace082
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, but had the most pleasant experience. right on the heart of the strip and with the most courteous and pleasant bell men ever. Small hotel but had clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good value but serious security issue”
Reviews.Author: bollidear
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, check-in was painless and efficient, parking was free in the multistorey car park that is directly below the rooms, opposite the Bellagio fountains the loocation is excellent. Rooms were ok but I missed a fridge and must more importantly - a safe. You have to pay $11 for the internet that wasn't that good anyway.No free WiFi in range of the hotel. No the serious issue. At 4:20am on our second night I was awakend by our door being opened and someone entering the room. I quickly woke and shouted and they esacped quickly. Due to my attire (you can guess) I couldn't chase them down the corridor but was pretty shocked by it. Room use standard cardlock doors, so either the intruder was either a staff member or someone has frigged a mastercard for the rooms. Now bear in mind the fact that the rooms have no safes and I would be justified in thinking security was a Major concern at Bills Gamlin Hall and detracted from our stay. I would have recommended the hotel otherwise, but in view of my experience - I would seriously consider how much you value your unsecured documents, money and whether someone creeping in your room while you and your partner were asleep at 420am would leave you cold.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in the heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: SJM9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bills at end of April for 4 nights and had room on 2nd floor with view across to fountains of the Bellagio, slight noise from traffic but not as much as I expected. Very clean and tidy room with 2 double beds. We then went off travelling for 4 nights and then came back for a further 3 nights and had a room with large king bed and walk in shower (think was a disabled room but was only one ready as we had arrived quite early - not a problem) there was a humming noise though coming from a vent outside our window which was due to being near the elevators, I was offered the chance to move but we didnt bother as it wasnt that bad but it could bother lighter sleepers. For the price we had paid I thought that it offered great value and would definately stop again as it means you have more money to shop/eat/drink and gamble with. Also it is good that there are no 'resort fees' to add once your there for things you dont need like papers/local calls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Clean”
Reviews.Author: graffinc
Reviews.Content: This location was PERFECT! the price was the best on the strip and it was perfectly clean. A friendly staff, a nice little casino and restaurant. I must say I don't know what else one could ask for?

Reviews.Title: “+++”
Reviews.Author: Alex12345635
Reviews.Content: Guys, anybody looking for cheap accommodation in the heart of Strip? Welcome to Bill's. Initially, I had a lot of doubts, even after reading all reviews and making reservation. But finally I wasn't disappointed at all. I would not say it's a best hotel I lived ever, but for it's price it looks almost unbelievable. Honestly speaking, I just need a bed, no more, and hotel is totally satisfactory in this aspect. And it's not so old and room is clean and bathroom is ok. Even has big flat TV (I found it only on second day ;) Cheap bar on a land floor. But main benefit - its location. 2 minutes from Bellagio Fontains and Paris Buffet. So, if you're not planing to spend a lot of time in hotel room, you can choose Bill's

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Maylew
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at Bill's after a long trip from Manchester, we were checked into our room within minutes. We were given a room with views of the Bellagio Fountains, big bonus! The room was large with 2 queen size beds, aircon, huge TV, hairdryer, iron and ironing board. The bathroom was fine, good shower with plenty of towels. Bill's is in the middle of everything and from leaving the room you are on The Strip in minutes, which is a blessing if you leave something in the room you have to go back for! All the large hotels are minutes away, Caesars Palace, Bellagio, Paris, Bally's and Flamingo. We had good steak and eggs for breakfast but there are lots of places to eat and drink nearby no matter what your budget may be. We were looking forward to seeing Big Elvis and we weren't disappointed .... he is indeed Big and he sounds just like Elvis!! Not to be missed. We read so much about the dollar margaritas, we couldn't wait to try them - although please note they now cost 2 dollars - but at around £1.30 they are great value, if fact we did a little research and can confidently say they are the best on the strip! Full of strawberries with a big kick of tequila! Not being gamblers we couldn' t comment on how good the tables were but they seemed busy at all times but we did play some slot machines and won a few dollars. We packed so much into our 6 nights in Vegas, it's a non-stop city. We can recommend the Helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon and Ranch, Cirque du Soleil and even firing a machine gun with live ammo at a gun shop on Highland Road! .... only in Vegas!! Overall we give full marks to Bill's and would stay there again.
