Reviews.Title: “Great stay on the strip !!”
Reviews.Author: Chris7542
Reviews.Content: right on the strip, free parking, we had a luxury room with views over the eiffel tower and the bellagio fountains!! We had a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: ThelmaandLouise2011
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Bill's for 7 nights. Having read the numerous reviews on Trip Advisor, we were prepared for a low budget stay. We did thoroughly enjoy our stay at Bill's. The staff, Carol one of the Victorian Cafe hostesses, was a hoot!!! We felt like we had known her forever. Our room was very clean which is what you want in a hotel. It was so nice to be able to leave your room and in five minutes, you're on your way down Las Vegas Blvd., No 15 - 20 minute just to get out of your hotel before you hit the street. We did have a few negatives about Bill's....the pillows are absolutely horrid....they definitely need to be upgraded. The air conditioner is loud but the fact that you can open the window in the bathroom certainly helped. Last but not least, Bill's bellman is a complete and total classless jerk!! We refused his services politely and he responded with a very rude comment. Needless to say, this is not the way to greet people who have just arrived in your place of employment. A complaint was lodged and we hope this person gets the proper training in hotel customer service. Other than that, Bill's was terrific. $2 margaritas....can't beat that price. Bill's steakhouse was also very good. A little pricey but if you buy the $3.00 discount card from Tix for Tonight, you'll get your entree for 1/2 price with a few exceptions. We have no problem recommending Bill's if you are on a budget. If you want all the glitz and the glam of Vegas, it's not here.

Reviews.Title: “Be a WISE Strip visitor and stay at Bill's!”
Reviews.Author: IdaSlapter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are locals and we like to "get away" at home. We have stayed at many hotels in the valley. If you want to stay on "The Strip" - use your money smarts and stay at Bill's. Our room was only $45 dollars. We stayed on a Tuesday night. (Strip hotels are cheaper during the week) Nice big room - clean, spacious, decent strip view and stained glass window in the bathroom - all for $45 bucks! There are $1 draft beers at the bar and "The Big Elvis Show" is free and the guy is a great talent. Get to the show early. The seats fill up fast. The "Victorian Room" cafe has great Chinese food and American favorites. Large famous hotels on the Strip are in very close proximity to Bill's - Ceasar's Palace, Bellagio, Flamingo, etc...Margaritaville is close by too! Enjoy Bill's for what it is...a great value in an expensive location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy to navigate hotel.”
Reviews.Author: daz2397
Reviews.Content: Bills is a good hotel in a great location and the room had a view of the bellagio fountains and the eiffel tower. This hotel is easy to navigate around with no long walk to get outside of the hotel. The rooms are good but the only downside is that the bathrooms are on the small side and could do with some modernising. Maybe some investment on sound proofing from the traffic would be a good idea, but was not a massive problem for us. Overall Cheap and cheerful in the centre of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: MelJane10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's for 5 nights and were very happy here. We LOVED the location. Right close to the centre of the strip but excellent value for money. Check in and out was very easy and we loved using the electronic checkout where you use your TV remote to check out. Rooms were always well serviced and staff were very friendly. Would definately reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice !”
Reviews.Author: Aliceesjan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with amazing value. Good, clean rooms with everything you need. The location is very good, right around the corner you can find everything. Do not expect a fancy lobby or great style, but if you want a great place to sleep and eat (the steakhouse is very good too) this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel best strip location”
Reviews.Author: buzzsolo1
Reviews.Content: this was our fifth visit to vegas we always stay in different hotels but not any more this is the place to stay front desk check in and out were very efficient no waiting in long quese as with the other big hotels i requested a room on the top floor and we got just that (room 426) with the best view ever across to the bellagio fountains it is a smaller hotel and casino but this is a great advantage you dont get lost and you are in and out of your room to the strip in 2 minutes our room had a king bed large 42" flat screen tv lots of storage and when taking a shower i could open the stained glass window and still watch the bellagio fountains!! we signed up for the comps and were lucky enough to win one of the 6 daily 100$ draws so we were able to eat in the victorian cafe all the time we were their for free great little place can get busy no reservations allowed but we never waited any longer than 15 mins staff very friendly food good and plentiful prime rib steak is a must!! we walked 1 way 1 day and the other the next being bang in the middle of the strip this didnt involve to much walking although its still a way but we like to just stroll along and enjoy the sights of which there are many both ways vegas is still a crazy place and im sure thats why we keep going back its none stop fun 24/7 we will return again in maybe 2/3 years time but this time no searching for hotels as Bills will be the one especially as they are in the middle of a refurb rooms will be even better only hope the price remains the same weekday rate $44 weekends $99 you will not be disappointed if you book this hotel yes it can be noisy but vegas is noisy everywhere sirens and harley davidsons are all part of vegas enjoy your stay at Bills im sure you will

Reviews.Title: “Great Smaller place on the strip in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: phantomco
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a break from the glitz of the bigger hotels, I'd recommend Bill's. It has a great center strip location with easy access to everything. Rooms are nice and staff is very friendly. On site restaurants have good food and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Great Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: JoeShabadu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's two nights and thought it was great. Room was recently remodeled with a flat screen TV, new furniture, nice and clean, but very basic. Not too noisy. Staff was very helpful and courteous. The casino itself is kind of run down, but you have Bally's and Caesar's just across the street, and the Flamingo is next door. Great location overall, sort of mid-south on the strip. Good access to the bus to Downtown and the tram to the rest of the strip (in front of and behind the Flamingo, respectively). I wouldn't stay here on my honeymoon or whatever, but for a basic hotel I was very satisfied given the low price. Wifi is extra, I think it was eleven per day, but even factoring that in it is still a great value. I will definitely stay here again next time I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy154998
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with 8 others to celebrate his daughter's 40th birthday. EVERYONE had nothing but nice things to say about this hotel. From the moment we arrived and met with the friendly face at the front desk who got us all in our rooms way before check in, to the bartenders who seemed to know what we were drinking after the first day and a special thank you to Mike, the Bellman, who orchestrated a fantastic day of golf for my husband and his buddy. The rooms were spacious and spotless. I was armed with ear plugs as I had heard it was noisy for sleeping but I didn't need them. I even slept with the bathroom window open! Just so I could take in the Vegas vibe all night long. We have been coming to Vegas since 1995 and have probably been here a dozen times. We stayed at Mirage in '95 and have stayed at Luxor, Bally's, Harrah's etc BUT I would go back to Bill's next trip for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Bill's Gamblin' Hall has its plusses and minuses, really cool place, though!”
Reviews.Author: EdWilliams3
Reviews.Content: Just got back from visiting Vegas, and this time chose to stay at Bill's Gamblin' Hall. Let me give y'all what I see as the pros and cons. Pros: 1. Great location! You couldn't be in a better place strip-wise! Bally's on one side, the Flamingo on the other, and Caesar's Palace right across the street. It's very easy to walk to most of the desired strip properties from Bill's. 2. I loved being able to get in and out of my room quickly! The casino is small and intimate and easy to navigate. You can literally go up to your room and be back out on the strip in a manner of minutes, a great thing for those shoppers out there. 3. Great deals - the gambling is cheap and the two restaurants are very good. The Victorian Cafe has a great steak and eggs special ($8.99 from 12 midnight to 8 am), and you can get into Bill's Steakhouse for half off if you visit the on-site discount tickets outlet. 4. Great views - best view of the Bellagio Fountains I've ever enjoyed, we were able to see the fountains do their thing time and time again during our trip. The Cons: 1. Street noise - I'd read other reviews about this, but it was actually pretty bad from our room. You could hear every motorcycle and sirens wailed constantly. Needless to say, my sleep was disrupted more than once, at Bill's you sleep in one to two hour modules and hope you can go back to sleep once you're woken up. 2. The bathrooms are really small - Not to the point they're uncomfortable, but if you need a little bathroom space, be advised this isn't the property to stay at. The tubs/shower tend to drain slowly as well. 3. Maybe this was just me, but every late night occupant at Bill's seemed to slam the door to their rooms as they returned. Needless to say, this didn't help one's sleeping a bit. All in all, Bill's is a great value and in a great location. I also happened to by chance run into some Harrah's execs over at Caesar's Palace. According to them, they're going to spend some money renovating Bill's later this year. Expect a new restaurant and more!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear - whatever has happened to Bills?”
Reviews.Author: rainysnows
Reviews.Content: I have been to Bills every year for the last few years and always loved it.However, there was a marked difference between this year and last year's stay.We usually have good luck on Bills slots but all the machines we played on seemed dead.Neither myself nor my friend had any joy and gave up in the end.Our favourite coffee shop in Bills "Seattles Best" has shut down and been replaced with another brand.There are less slots and more tables, and the Victorian room where we had come to expect great service in the past has really taken a hit.Sometimes it was hardly occupied.Halfway through my friends dinner the waiter just presented us with the bill !!! The rooms were still kept lovely and clean, but the noise levels were so bad for 2 nights we didn't get any sleep. The slots phenomonen wasn't just at Bills.We spent ages in Flamingos- where we normally had great luck-and again, it's like they were all dead.I didn't hear any big wins going off and assume that the recession has hit the slots.Shame, it was good fun.We got cake in Flamingo's coffee shop but they have taken away the tables outside, and round the corner.So, the assistants were embarassed to tell us we'd just have to make do.They couldn't explain why they'd lost their tables but the bar next door had also closed down,as had the shop in the corner of Flamingos where we used to buy soda. We took the bus to Freemont and took in the Golden Nugget.All great fun and street artsits too.The sun shone and it was still good to be in Las Vegas but it has definitely changed.You do expect the odd win when you're there and it just seemed impossible.To put the top hat on it, even Big Elvis wasn't there.It took me 5 attempts at asking where he was to different staff.3 hadn't noticed he wasn't there- one insisted he'd be on soon- he wasn't .Then we eventually got told- he must be on vacation.I definitely got the sense that things at Bills are changing for the worse.I hope I prove to be wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but otherwise you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: bonleeballerina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for two nights during spring break. We had booked and paid for the room through an online travel site, and when we got there we requested a non smoking room with a king bed. They didn't have any in the room category we booked, so they "upgraded" us for free. I think the only difference in the room category was the view (of the strip), but it was nice they didn't stick us with two queen beds. Overall, the room was nothing special. It was spacious, and the bed was pretty comfortable. The pillows were pathetic, but what you'd expect for the price. The TV was a nice large flat screen attached to the wall in front of the bed, but the remote wasn't in the best working order. The bathroom was okay. The tub was very slow to drain, and the shower head was pretty low (however, the water pressure was great). Also, the caulking around the tub was discolored and looked moldy but otherwise it was pretty clean. The casino was small but fun. It's more smokey than the major casinos on the strip, but we didn't spend much time there and won at the slots, so I can't complain. We didn't eat at the restaurants, so I can't speak to that. The parking was free and adequate. It seemed pretty safe. Overall the hotel and the room were run down and old. It is adequate, especially if you plan to spend minimal time in the room, but nothing impressive. Also, we had a problem upon checkout, but I'm not sure it was the fault of the hotel. We had booked and paid for our room via a travel website, and when we went to check out the hotel tried to charge us, saying that we had only reserved the room through the booking website. After probably half an hour of making calls and waiting around we finally got it resolved. Not a huge deal, but a pain in the neck when we wanted to get on our way. Overall, a good value, I guess, especially considering there is no resort fee, but I won't be staying there again. With a little planning ahead of time you can find much better hotels for only a little more money.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, this place can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: cf_travlin
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean, friendly place to stay in the heart of the Strip, Bill's just can't be beat. Bill's is older but completely renovated. Staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was immaculate. The only thing that would have made it nicer would be comfier pillows (they are thin little foam things) and a coffeemaker in the room. Other than that, I have no complaints. It was very, very nice. Plus dinner in thier main diningroom was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Deal for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: Littlelobo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to try this place due to it's prime location and price. We were not disappointed! The price, location and helpfulness of the staff made this a pleasure to stay at. The rooms are very spacious, clean, and the noise level was not loud at all. I didn't hear doors slamming, people running in the halls, noise in the next room, etc. We had a nice view of the Bellagio Fountains too! Try this place, it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but showing it's age.”
Reviews.Author: Stephano617
Reviews.Content: I don't think I'd stay here again. The rooms need work, bathrooms need updating, etc. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, inexpensive, and location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: jennewby71
Reviews.Content: The room was good size, clean and comfortable and very quiet. It's a small hotel and casino, but that was actually really nice not having to walk 15 minutes to get through casino and hotel to arrive at room. The location is the best! You are right in the center of the all the action and to walk up and down the strip, you are in the perfect spot. The casino itself was ok. The bar was great 99cent margaritas and 99cent beers. You can't beat that! One night there was karaoke and that seemed to be really popular. People seemed to be having fun in the casino. We ate at the restaurant there one night and that was good too. overall I was very pleased with the hotel. I stayed with a friend and we were there to party and have a good time. We did, so no disappointments there! If i returned with husband, we'd stay at the Venetian but then we would also pay 3 times more per night! My one complaint about the hotel is that for internet access it's $11.99/24hours and also PER computer. So for my friend AND myself to have internet access we would have to pay $24 per day. So needless to say, my computer wasn't that important! The decor was very neat. Felt like I was back in "Deadwood" days in a sense. Western/Victorian, very cute.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Wild!”
Reviews.Author: LanieLynn
Reviews.Content: My friends and I did not stay at this hotel but we were there everyday of our six day stay! We stayed at the Flamingo which is right next door so it was very close! We spent a lot of time at Bill's and enjoyed every minute of it! Some of the hightlights: 1) Bartenders were great, here is a shout out and great thanks to Calos and Abraham! The .99 Sauza margaritas are delicious. 2) Sign up for the Bill's Players card they have a drawing 6 times a day that enters you in a drawing to win $100.00 that allows you to spend it on the Restaurants, bar, anything but gambeling, I won the $100 and my friends and I enjoyed a wonderful meal at the Steakhouse! 3) The steakhouse is nice and cozy the prime rib was amazing (also there are coupon booklets around that give you a free bottle of wine when you order 2 entrees) the wedge salad was amazing and the reisling was a great addition to the food! We all wanted dessert the Bananna's Foster looked amazing but we were too full! 3) The breakfast restaurant runs some great specials 8.99 Steak and Eggs breakfst and 5.99 eggs breakfast, but be prepared to wait at least an hour! We only ate there for breakfast once because we couldn't hold off an hour, but it was good and for those prices you can't beat it! 4) Big Elvis was a hit I really enjoyed hanging out and watching him. His shows fill up so try to get there early or grab a stool at the bar and stay for several shows. He has a good following and many people that were arround us stated that they everytime they are back in Vegas they stop by to see him! 5) Again, thank you to the staff that made this a great vacation for all of us! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Small, quaint hotel in the middle of the strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunforMum
Reviews.Content: Bill's was not the creme de la creme but certainly worked for us. A small hotel amongst the large masses on the Las Vegas strip was welcomed. Coffee/ restaurant/ gambling/ great parking all under one roof. The fact that it was so centerally located was it's best feature. Also, we did not have to walk a mile & half to get to the front door. I wouldn't suggest this hotel for children - I wouldn't select Vegas as a small child getaway but that's me - there were many families there. The characters were a bit seedy but the staff was great. For app $40 a night HOW could we go wrong! States it has a swimming pool but it is actually next door at the Flammingo - not a big deal - but if you want a pool on sight - it's not there. Restaurant downstairs wasn't great but it was no worse than anywhere's else.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it is cheap, but it doesn't have to act like it.”
Reviews.Author: ROTJob
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research on rooms in the area for my wedding trip in October 2010. I knew that Bill's was the cheapest hotel in the midstrip area, but I saw that they had a lot of very positive reviews. I also remember gambling there last year and having a great time, so we decided to make Bill's ground zero for our smallish wedding party to stay at. Everything was pretty much as expected. Super small property with a cozy feel. The rooms were adequate in size, but I wish they had used a little more of the room for the bathroom. That was a bit cramped. The street noise was there, but not really a big deal at all. The LCD TV was awesome. The sundry counter had very reasonable prices on everything. My biggest issue with this hotel is the pillows. They are half the size of a normal pillow, and they give you 3 for a king sized bed. I called down and requested more, but they were booked up and didn't have extras. I did not sleep well for 6 nights on those minipillows. The second issue was minor, but it was a constant hassel. They have a bottleneck of people at the front desk/bell desk/victorian room entrance. All 3 of these services conjoins in a 5 sq ft area, so if you need the bell desk or front desk anywhere around meal time, you are screwed. The staff were all very friendly and helpful as much as they could be. No complaints there. I was very surprised to see all the drug dealers in the casino restrooms at 6am though. I guess that is part of the Drai's crowd. They literally had every stall staked out every morning. All in all, Bill's was a good value. The casino and hotel are very smoky and show their age, but the price is right if they would fix the pillow problem. Honestly, I think that Bally's is a better bargain for just a little more money.

Reviews.Title: “great time at Bill's and Las Vegas in genral”
Reviews.Author: nurse57
Reviews.Content: Bills Gamblin hall no complaint's.Price great,Big Elvis great voice, to bad he was sick but we did get to see him.The slots paid well , I am not much on table games but everyone else seemed to have fun. The steak house has good food good service. Easy check in and out. Can not say that for the Imperial hotel my son was booked at it took 2 days to get his room what a nightmare.But still a good time was had by all. One thing at Bill,s no room service. Would have been nice not to have to hunt for a coffe in the morning.The staff were great the girl at the desk to the maids and everyone in between thank you very much and we will see you again the Pyett family.

Reviews.Title: “best location - good value”
Reviews.Author: bialypl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in february 2011. For money we paid we didn't expect nothing more. Be realistic!!! 40 $ for one night [with tax]. Come on - it's bargian. Location is great, rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, works for us!”
Reviews.Author: BararaJo
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location, right across from Bally's, Bellagio, and Caesars. The lobby is somewhat smoky but not the elevator or room areas. We had a view of the strip looking south at the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains for a very reasonable price. The room was quite large, clean and comfortable. The lighting was a weak spot but....hey! This is Vegas, not much reading going on here. The Victorian Restaurant is just OK, if you stick to the specials. Free parking is a plus

Reviews.Title: “Sweet location for the price”
Reviews.Author: MaryGColumbus_OH
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal for the price. We paid a little extra to be down close to the strip end - and ended up having a REALLY good view - we were very surprised. We were closer to te Bellagio fountains than when we stayed at the Bellagio! The caveat to this is that it's a bit noisy (from the strip below, not necessarily from your neighbors). If you don't sleep well with earplugs you may want to be further from the strip end. The fountains are noisy too, but they don't go off all night. The room is fine - even has a new flat screen TV mounted on the wall. It's hard to believe that shower head is legal in Vegas - nice. Bed is comfy. The casino isn't horrible, but there's no reason to stick around...you're smack dab in the middle of the strip! Even with the upgrade, it was only around $100 a night or a little over that. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: OSUBuck
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for just the night to catch an early flight out. Bills was great, it was clean, nice and in a great location to catch the area attractions. It was also extremely cheap. We paid for the hotel and taxi fare to the airport for less than almost all of the casino hotels and airport hotels. There is a taxi stop right outside and a taxi was ready for us when we left at 5:15am. The casino is a little small but we weren't there to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Let's stay at Bill's again this year!!!”
Reviews.Author: pghvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's in April of 2009 (even though 2009 was not a date of stay choice) It was my 3rd time there, but it was the first for my girlfriend and some of my friends. I've stayed at NY NY and Excalibur, but wanted somewhere special this time. While looking for a place to stay on the strip - for a really good price - we found Bill's. It was well worth it!! It is in a very centralized location from all the strip activity. We had a room with a view of the strip - on the Flamingo side. There was nothing bad we could say about the place. It was older, and had a vintage Vegas feel. The staff was friendly and the check in time was less than 5 minutes. The shower drained slowly, but that was about the only bad thing, an inconvinience is really about all. It was noisy from all the activity on the strip - but we slept without any issues. One trick would be to turn on the AC to drown some of the noise, but it really was not a bother to any of us. The Steakhouse was good too - friendly wait staff and the food was good as well. We took advantage of Seattle's Best coffee in the morning to get us going for the day. And the 99 cent margaritas were a good way to start off the night. We also liked that we could use our room key to take advantage of the Flamingo pool. All and all it was a good stay for us in 2009 - and we will be back to Bill's in May of this year!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: Ultraman150
Reviews.Content: Booked room for week on recommendation of friends and couldn't be happier. Even over Superbowl weekend the checkin was quick and efficient (thanks Adam) and room was pretty much as requested. Luxury room looking directly at Ballys, Paris, and across to the lake of Bellagio. Room and bed were clean and sizable. Bathroom was sufficient for 1 or 2 people. Location was brilliant and no more than a 10min walk down to MGM & NewYork NewYork, or up to Mirage & Treasure Island. Right across the road is Ballys, where many shuttles depart from, and there is a good little convenience store in the lobby for chips/snacks/drinks etc. Bills does not have anything like that on premises. Casino on premises is fine for average punter. Poker "room" is only 3 tables, but is best entry level cash game around, and tournaments are held regularly and generally made up of only 10 or so people. Played a few games there, and also tried Ballys poker area across the road. Drinks were good and waitresses were fine with a nominal $1 tip per drink. There's also a great little hotdog cart next to the poker tables. Don't pick a hotel right in the middle of the action & complain about the noise. Turn the air cond or tv on if outside noise bothers you, or get a room off the strip. Don't whinge about minor conditions of the room or bathroom as Bills is an old building, but price reflects this. Frankly i'm happy to stay in a smaller hotel which makes up for it's size by more personal service and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Character & cleanliness on the cheap in the center of the strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: bcjade
Reviews.Content: After the hours of walking and taking in the sometimes overwhelming atmosphere of Vegas, it was so relaxing to come back to Bill's. We enjoyed all of the activity going on in the gamblin' hall (the kareoke is to die for teehee). Most of all, it was nice to come back to a place that wasn't crazy with flashing lights and so big you could get lost!! Loved the spaciousness and cleanliness of the rooms. The street noise was a bit loud but we found if you closed the bathroom doors at night, it really helped (those beautiful stained glass windows in the bathroom are not sound proof). Finally, all of the staff, from the front desk to the restaurant and casino, were friendly and helpful - felt that they enjoyed providing information about what to do, where to eat, etc. Have recommended it already to 3 people who are heading down to Vegas in the next few months!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: travelplanner8891
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bills Gamblin Hall 1/27-1/31 was offered an upgrade for small fee stayed in the John Wayne Suite! What pampering the 10 of us gals got from the staff! Place was spotless 4th floor nice view didnt think the street noise was to bad, never went to dria but crowd was huge, young ones! Nice variety of machines have stayed here about 5 times over last 20 years and if staying and playing on the strip this is the best spot over all of the HUGE hotels and walking, 21 year olds partied since walking on strip was no problem 72 year old gals shopped gambled and just plain had a good time together. I as the chaperone haha and driver of the 15 passenger van coordinated all the buffets we ate at great buffets at the station casinos all over vegas and Henderson. We have stayed at Sams, Gold Coast, venetian, TI, mirage, Ballys,Flamingo, Imperial Palace BUT WE LOVE BILLS! Convience, Excellent Service from checking in early to departure after 2pm the parking is free even with a huge van, bell service always smile and greet you, food was good. Thanks Again Bills!!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem , punching above its weight. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: sp0rtback
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, was given room no 102, which overlooks the Bellagio Fountains! Absolutely perfect location in the middle of the strip. Mike the concierge , extremely helpfull. Cheers Mike much appreciated!!!!!!!!! Breakfast at hotel $4.99 - could not fault it! If you looking for a nice meal out, ensure you visit the Cheesecake Factory in the Forum shops within Ceasars Palace. If we were to return , would not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on strip”
Reviews.Author: KimDaveCampbell
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas to get married. Looked at all Hotels on strip. Have stayed at the Biggest so thought we'd try one of the smallest. Bills Gambling Hall and Saloon turned out to be as good as the Biggest. We loved our room, CLEAN, and the service at this smaller Hotel was as good as it gets. Even better than all that is their LOCATION. Close to everything. Will definately be staying at Bills on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great time but got no sleep”
Reviews.Author: nanczee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had our first trip in Vegas....The hotel wasn't bad...The staff was nice bell hop very helpful....The restaurant was good...The view from our room was really nice...Kinda lousy they didn't have coffee maker...but the worse was not being able to sleep...You could hear traffic not to mention the people quite a few doors down fighting all night...Well at least I got one good nights sleep...and that was probably cuz I drank too much....: ) Oh well had a ball anyway....

Reviews.Title: “Best deal on the strip”
Reviews.Author: foodwriter007
Reviews.Content: Ok, everyone that goes to Vegas has "their" place. Bills is mine. It is reasonable and very well situated on the Strip. Across the street from Ballys, Bellagio, and Ceasers palace, right next door to the Flamingo. For the price it can not be beat. The club "Dria's" in the lower level is the place to go. hot hot hot. So Centrally located, and prices on beer and drinks are good. and is close to my Favorite restaurant, Ellis Island! located on "kovac" a block behind ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good time at Bill's”
Reviews.Author: pestoprincess
Reviews.Content: Nice to stay in such a huge place like Vegas and be treated like an old friend....wait staff friendly, bartenders the best...thanks Jeremy, Romel and Kerry for such a nice time! Best spot on the strip for a good night sleep and no 1/2 mile walk to your room after walking all day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: MissyP66
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. The staff were very friendly and polite. We had a room which overlooked the strip and we could see the Eifel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains. It was a huge room (compared to what we are used to I guess) and was kept very clean. We ate in the Victorian Cafe quite a few times for breakfast and dinner. The food was great and also fantastic value for your money. We aren't gamblers but they had craps lesson each morning which we thought was a good idea for us novices'. We'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ladyinred60
Reviews.Content: We came to see Cher and this was perfect location without a huge price. Check in was easy and fast. Rooms nice and clean for the price it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: CachingFanatic
Reviews.Content: Wow! Could not have chosen a better hotel to stay in right in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. We were worried that because the rate was so cheap that we were going to end up in a dirty, flea bag. Instead, we were in a spacious room with great views of the strip and the location could not possibly be better. Because this is a smaller hotel than the gargantuan ones around it, we could easily pop up to our room to drop off our purchases and get a refill. So convenient! And no resort fee, either=BIG PLUS! This is where I will always stay when I'm in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - honest value”
Reviews.Author: TheWayItWasThere
Reviews.Content: The restaurant within is very good. I spent <$200 on show tickets with www.Vegas.com and picked up a Vegas Insider Card at the Imperial Palace. Then I took the card to Players Club station in Bill's and received a coupon for a free dinner at the Victorian Room within Bill's when I bought the other. It was a great, cheap meal. That's hard to find in Vegas. Bill's is on the strip... in the middle of the strip....adjacent to the Flamingo and Imperial Palace. Only 200 rooms available. Ours was super clean. Serviced every day with towels, etc. It was very big with king sized bed. We could have had a party. NO fridge or microwave... great stained glass decor. a classy place without all the glitz of a theatre. Costs $75 a night. It's an easy walk to Bellagio and catch City Tram to the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: CocoSianElle
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Vegas and we wanted somewhere cheap with a good location to stay for my husbands 30th. Bills is the perfect location and its so nice to be able to leave your room and be out on the strip in 5 minutes! We could see the Bellagio fountains from our room which was awesome! The only thing letting this hotel down is the noise outside which I know you can't do anything about but maybe invest in some triple glazing! Love you Bills!

Reviews.Title: “Won’t be Pampered but You Will Have Fun!”
Reviews.Author: on-the-cheap
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that my screen name, “On the Cheap,” isn’t a joke. Hey, I love staying at the snazzy joints when someone else is paying, but on my nickel for four nights, Bill’s was perfect. And if you also appreciate the rapidly vanishing seedier Las Vegas, you ought to try Bill’s before the economy recovers and Bill’s gets unceremoniously torn down to make room for some sterile oh-la-la high-rise. Actually, Bill’s isn’t seedy or run-down, it’s more that it is 31 years old and not apologetic one bit for being what it is. In fact, were they not dead, it’s the kind of place where you would expect to see Frank or Dino throwing dice. Pluses: location; pleasant, efficient hotel staff, quick easy check-in; 4 nights for under $200, with tax; no resort fees; clean room, clean bath, great water pressure in shower; accommodating housekeeping staff offered extra towels and daily cleaning service; 24-hour restaurant; plenty of Craps and Roulette action; no shortage of free drinks in the casino; never a problem getting a taxi. Negatives: bed linens a tad scratchy; only two straight back chairs in our room for seating; 24-hour restaurant is kind of pricey and no to-go service, which makes getting a cup of coffee difficult after 3 PM when separate coffee bar closes; attitude of dealers much sterner after 2 AM. Even numbered rooms have great Strip views. From our room, we watched the nightly water shows at the Bellagio and other neat stuff down the Strip. There is unbelievable neon and action all day and night on the Strip, which can take its toll on sleep. Odd -numbered rooms lack the Strip view but are quieter. If you want a clean, cheap, no-frills room, lots of free alcohol while you’re gaming and an old-school Las Vegas experience you’ll enjoy staying at Bill’s.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's is the best!”
Reviews.Author: daddymacmoney
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another trip to Vegas, stayed at Bill's....was about $40 per night and within walking distance to anything. Check-in was a breeze. Room was super clean and cleaned daily. Casino is dated, but has the fastest bartenders I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: bklyngalinla
Reviews.Content: Located next door to the Flamingo, mid-strip, Bill's is a small, 4-story hotel, with a proportionately small casino. I thought the $119 a night rate was very reasonable for a large room with a table and chairs, comfortable bed and big screen tv. Ironing board provided but no coffee maker. Shampoo/conditioner combination meant only one bottle in the bathroom. I brought my own hot-pot and hair products. Front desk and housekeeping very friendly. I heard that better deals can be had in more luxurious hotels if you know the tricks.

Reviews.Title: “Good, good, good”
Reviews.Author: Dana S
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right in the middle of everything. Front desk staff are very friendly and helpful especially when one is looking for coffee in the morning. The Seattle's Best was closed in December so the next best place for coffee is walking over to the coffee bar at the Flamingo. No big deal but I wish they had coffee pots in the room. Victorian cafe does not have coffee to go either and no room service. Don't even try the coffee from the bar it is disgusting. Wi--fi in your room is $9.95 for two hours - pricey... Other than those two small things I would recommend Bill'a and probably would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awesome price”
Reviews.Author: Me-n-Princess
Reviews.Content: This is what value is all about. A clean room, comfortable mattress and a huge TV all for well under 50 bucks a night. Parking is just behind hotel and way easy too. WE will be back. Only downsides are road noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Old Vegas Charm”
Reviews.Author: TKIRK
Reviews.Content: This place will always be near and dear to us. Love the location, love the charm, love the service, and the price can't be beat. I have zero complaints about this place except maybe that it doesn't have a pool. We have stayed in the Big Strip Hotels, they are all very nice but Bill's will always be a favourite. I love being able to get from the strip to my room in a matter of minutes. You can't get a better value than the Victoria Room, from breakfast to the Prime Rib Special, delicious and great deals!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money paid”
Reviews.Author: Bookend48
Reviews.Content: Used a studio room for 4 nights. The rooms are a tad dated and in need of some updating and TLC. Overall average for the cost paid, approx £27 per night. Very well located hotel 3 star hotel. Fair size rooms, good TV selection, en-suite bathroom includes bath and separate vanity area with iron, shaving mirror and hairdryer. Rooms are quieter than one would expect being on-top of the Gambling area. As is common in LV you have to walk through smoke filled main lobby to get to your room. No coffee/Tea in the room. Internet is expensive too. Lovely food in the restaurant especially the Steak & Eggs 'special.' Watch out for the charges they put on your card. It took nearly two months for the hotel to finalise one of my night's payment,meanwhile blocking my money Overall the TA reviews are fairly reflective of the hotel and dependent on room type. I would stay again for the £20 - £30 cost.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: jleardini
Reviews.Content: I stayed at BGH&C January 14-17 and had a great time. Here's my suggestions based on our trip - 1. Staying at Bill's let us get away without renting a car. We're within a reasonable walking distance of everything. We could walk to NY-NY in about 20 minutes and on the other side to the Fashion Show Mall in about the same amount of time. 2. Take the Bells Tran shuttle to and from the airport. If you book a round trip it's $12 per person total. We got jobbed by taking a taxi. Seriously, they are all out to rip you off. They purposely took us through the tunnel so that it would take longer. A trip that should have cost about 15-16 bucks, cost us 25. Plus, the back seat was wet and smelled like the drying agent was a cherry air freshener. 3. Save the gambling for the week, or during the day. If you like to play the tables, then all the minimums go up at night. During the day or on the weeknights, you can find a $5 minimum just about anywhere. 4. We upgraded to a Deluxe room at Bill's which was the midgrade. The description said "Strip partial view". Our room (124) directly looked at Ballys and Paris and we even got a view of the Bellagio. It was great. I read comments about Bill's being noisey at night, but it wasn't any noiser than any other place. We weren't disturbed at all. Thinking about the comments, I turned on the AC to fan only for the night to drown out the noise. It wasn't necessary, but it helped drown out the occasional ambulance/police siren. 5. Another comment was about Bill's being too smokey. I don't like smoke any more than the next guy, but you have to expect it when you go to Vegas. All of the casinos are smokey. It isn't terrible, but Bill's is right on par. The room is not smokey at all, just the casino area. We didn't eat at Bill's, so I can't speak about the steakhouse. 6. That brings me to my last point. For the money, Bill's can't be beat. We literally slept, showered, and cleaned up, then spent almost our entire day somewhere else. The location is perfect for this. You can walk right across the street and you're at Caesars or Bellagio. Ballys or Paris is right across on the side of Bills. It's the perfect place to stay, especially because there is no resort fee. Especially in the winter, where there is no pool action, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE Good location,clean room,best food,same staff year in”
Reviews.Author: cannonball69
Reviews.Content: We have been going to this hotel for over 15 years and have NEVER had a bad room or time there. They have a 24 hour restraunt there off the casino that is to die for and the prices can not be beat. Through work I have stayed at all the big names hotels but when I am going to just have fun this is the place to be at Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Cheap room - great location”
Reviews.Author: Rocht
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem. This hotel is a small hotel in Vegas standards of 200 rooms Most people do not know this hotel and some tours do not pick up from this however it is a great little place. The hotel does not have a large hotel enterance or bell desk and it is no frills - no charge back to room or room service etc. This hotel has a nice clean comfortable room, small bathroom but spacious bedroom and bed. In the centre of the strip close to everything and anything, 2 restaurants and a shop down stairs, One restaurant is 24hr. Great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious if thats what you want but its a great place and the best location”
Reviews.Author: bluemirage
Reviews.Content: I just today returned from Vegas which included a quick 2 night say at Bills. First of all everything and everybody was first class. Okay the place wasnt build yesterday but its well taken care of, clean and I felt very good there. First day, I walk in the lady at the desk says its my lucky day they are upgrading me to a suite. I never asked for an upgrade but hey sounds good to me! HUGE room..Unbelieveable..So I had fun with that trust me. The next morning the front desk calls and says sir we maded a mistake because that suite if already booked for tonight could we please move you to a nice room with an even better view? Of course you can, I have no problem with it in the least, so they move me..great room, 1st class and they comp me for it. Other than that, nice people running the place, decent restaurant..Get the $5.99 steak and eggs at midnight great value. ..Oh and make sure you go next door to Ballys they have a 24 hour special..1.00 tacos and 1.00 margaritas..And they dont get cheap with them! Great place, thanks Bills

Reviews.Title: “Good Strip location, but....”
Reviews.Author: McReel
Reviews.Content: Paid for an "upgraded" room, not sure what the standard room was but for $40 extra per night I'd just go for the regular room. Great location on the strip, but as previous reviews said, very noisy. Not from the Casino below, but from the streets. Room: great king bed, view of the strip/ Bellagio fountain through a window so dirty it was likely never cleaned. Asked the desk about why no coffee pot? They acted as if I was nuts. Well, it's obvious they would rather collect $3 for a poor glass of coffee at the bar in the a.m. First part in an effort to nickel and dime you. Room was reasonably clean and not a lot of hall noise. You will hear all the parties on the street crossing below, the numerous fire/police sirens on the strip. It's OK if you stay out late, drink a lot, and totally crash when you get back. Otherwise, hard to sleep. I've been to Vegas a # of times and Bills Casino was the first one that the bartenders really hustled you about a "comp" drink. I had $10 in the poker machine on the bar, the bartender told me if I'd put another 5 in that he "could" comp me the drink. Pretty cheesy as that sort of thing never happened in the other 6-8 casinos I went to this trip. Variations of the same thing at the bar several more times. Impossible to get a drink while you're at the craps table etc. If you have a burning desire to stay on the strip this place is OK, but not for kids. I'm staying downtown on Fremont next time as that's where we spent most of our time. The Golden Nugget looked good, haven't read reviews. Fremont is a funky place with a lot going on, casinos are smaller, food is cheaper, not the huge crowds like the strip. Stay in Fremont, go to the strip during the day to check out the phenomenal architecture of the Vidara, Cosmo, etc while everyone else is sleeping. Probably should have stayed next door at the Flamingo as I spent more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's made this a great Vegas stay”
Reviews.Author: aitchbee151
Reviews.Content: I had taken an absolute age picking a Vegas hotel as we were on such a tight budget. I couldn't believe that a hotel as cheap as Bill's and in such a location would actually be any good, but swayed by the reviews on here, I went for it. Bill's Gamblin' Hall was fab! Our room was big and we had a comfy king size bed. Our room was towards the back of the hotel and faced Flamingos; it was quiet, with the only noise being a ventilation unit outside. We rarely heard any noise from the Strip. Another benefit of Bill's is its size - because it is a lot smaller than the other hotels on the Strip, there are smaller queues at reception (if any) and it doesn't take 20 minutes to get from your room to the front door! Almost all the staff at Bill's are really friendly too (although we did find this across the whole of Vegas). The hotel itself doesn't have the plush and swish style of some other Vegas hotels, but it does have some charm. It's old, but not shabby, and our room was spotlessly clean. Bill's location is great too. Across the road from Caesar's Palace and the Bellagio, the hotel is just about central on the Strip. We ate at the Victorian Cafe in the hotel and although we weren't exactly adventurous in our choices (2 burgers please! It was late and we'd just been travelling for 15 hours!), the food was good and served quickly too. I loved staying at Bill's and would be quite happy to come stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, but Lady at The Front Desk Was Rude.”
Reviews.Author: TheTickTockMan
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, but three things, one of which was my fault. Also one thing that made no sense. 1) When checking in the lady was very rude. I tried asking a question and she just kept saying “No’ even though the question was not a yes or no question. She refused to try and listen to me. 2) While I was there it was 106 throughout my stay give or take a little. When I went out in the morning I would leave on the AC on. When I came back the maid always had shut it off. It took about five hours to recool down my room. I get why they shut it off, but if they are going to do so they need to get better AC units. 3) It was a very far walk from the elevators to my room. Once in my room I had to walk back down to the elevators to get ice then back to the room. As I said before it was about 106 so ice was definitely needed. This isn’t that big a deal, but I have a bad hip and knee which made this really awkward, especially after all that I walked throughout the day. It was my fault though since I forgot to ask if they had handicapped rooms available. 4) On my last day (the 7th day) I grabbed all of my shopping bags from my rental to take up to my room to box and ship home UPS. For the first time the entire trip a guard was at the elevator doors, which made me have to put down everything I was carrying to show my room card. This was a hassle with my bad hip and knee (bending over isn’t that easy) just to flash a card. What makes no sense is why be so worried now that someone is going to sneak up to the rooms when they have been unguarded for a week already. Also the fact that anyone that kept their one-time room card/ or could find-get one could still sneak up there. Maybe it is my security background, but this still doesn’t make sense to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great fun!”
Reviews.Author: scottishlass24
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Vegas with my Dad, Stepmum, Stepbrother, sister and fiance for my sister's 30th birthday, and had an amazing time! Bill's was the cheapest out of all the hotels that we looked into and I was pleasantly surprised to see that it was really lovely, although smaller than the other hotels around. It was a perfect location too, just next to Ceasar's and Bally's and the Bellagio - we could see the fountains from our bedroom window which was lovely. We could also see the Paris eiffel tower - a real vegas view! We thoroughly enjoyed the happy hour drink deals while watching Big Elvis too - a great way to relax after hours of pounding the strip! The rooms weren't the quietest over the bridge just outside our window, but overall we found them comfortable and very roomy. We had a great time in Vegas overall, enjoyed a brilliant trip to the grand canyon and a gun shop shooting range - a real american experience! I would recommend Jimmy Buffet's Margharitaville for amazingly large portions and delicious cocktails and the X Burlesque show at the Flamingo - both very handy for a short walk home to Bill's too!

Reviews.Title: “Value & Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: thejungle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bills for three nights while in Vegas. The hotel is nice for the price. Rooms are clean and fairly spacious (I had room to do yoga). It is a great location on the strip and our room had a view of the Bellagio fountains. The only problem was that our shower drain was so clogged that we ended up with 4 inches of water stuck in the tub. We asked someone to look at it in the morning but no one came to fix it. We went back to the front desk and were able to switch rooms, but the second shower also drained very slowly. The building is old, including the plumbing, but the front desk staff was always very helpful and nice about the entire thing. Over all, it's a great value on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Woguy
Reviews.Content: Bill's is a good bargain. The location is excellent, the rooms are comfortable and quiet, and the desk and bells staffs are very friendly. Our only complaints were that the beds were too soft for our taste, and the shower is rather dingy--they need stronger lights in there at the very least. But for about $200 for three nights, I don't think it can be beat. I imagine we will stay there again the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cholako
Reviews.Content: We got a 4th floor room, facing Flamingo Road (facing Bally's). It wasn't noisy at all, we barely heard street noise. We could hear the Bellagion fountains quite loud, but they don't do the show late at night so that din't affect our sleep. The room was comfortable, big LCD TV, you can tell it's an old hotel but it's not shabby or anything. Bed was comfortable also. Cons: standard room doesn't have breakfast or free WiFi either (as almost all standard rooms on the Strip) Pros: very good location, small hotel, cheap. It doesn't have any kind of room service or spa. Just a nice room to have a shower or a bath and good sleep. If that's okay with you, I would recommend this hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “great Find on Strip”
Reviews.Author: missjj17
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one week in Vegas and stayed at Bill's Gamblin Hall. I felt everything was great. Check in prompt when we arrived, no lines like many other large casinos. Friendly front desk help, housekeeping, casino employees, and restaurant employees. Our room happily faced the Bellagio fountains which was a beautiful surprise. Took advantage of coupon for steak house (free bottle of wine) which was awesome! Great location, always busy and a bargain compared to many others. THANKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy”
Reviews.Author: thefosterfarm
Reviews.Content: I followed the reviews here, and since Bill's is where we always previously had seemed to end up at, we booked a stay here. I was glad I had read the other reviews and request a 4th floor room. What was even better was the our room, and those of our friends, were on the south side. We all had great views of the Bellagio Fountains and enjoyed watching them go off several times. Our room (412) had a good view of the strip that wasn't too obstructed by the Bally's sign. All in all the room was clean and nothing extra. Don't expect coffee in the room, but they do have a Seattle's Best coffee shop and it was great. The very best part of staying here is the size and location. In the mega hotels and casinos I always felt as though I couldn't ever get out of my hotel. They are huge and always a long way from the strip. At Bills you can be out and on your way to see or do whatever you want in about a minute. The restaurant food is oaky, but probably wouldn't eat there again. You do get a coupon book when you sign up at the players club at Bills, an then you get 20% off at breakfast at Margaritaville. Great food there and nice atmosphere. The staff at Bills is laid back and nice also. My only complaint was not hotel noise, but the Bally's sign noise and the Bellagio Fountain noise! Earplugs the 2nd and 3rd night worked great though, and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. One last thing, if you need a cab at night, don't try to catch one at Bills. Either go to the back of the Flamingo or just across the street to Ballys and catch cabs there. For some reason none of the cabs seemed to stop at Bills at night. We had no trouble catching one the morning of our flight though.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get a better location on the strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: legends1958
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's on our honeymoon in October 10. We chose Bill's because of the price, location and excellent reviews we read about it. And we weren't disappointed. The location was perfect, right in the centre of the Strip opposite Caesars Palace and Bellagio. We also liked that the hotel was relatively small in comparison with the others on the Strip therefore it only took a couple of minutes to get from our hotel room to the Strip. The hotel room itself was large with 2 double beds, it was clean and had air conditioning which is needed in the 80-90 degree heat. The decor of the rooms is fairly basic and a bit dated as Bills is one of the older hotels on the Strip and is in a need of some modernisation. We didn't have the best view from our room (we could see a bit of the Strip and was mainly looking at the Flamingo) but who sits in their room and looks at the view in Vegas anyway. Our only complaints about the room was that there was no fridge and no safe. The casino at Bills is relatively small in comparison with some of the other casinos however the drinks at the bar are much cheaper than the other hotels. 99c Margheritas and $2 cans of coors-you'd struggle to find drinks cheaper anywhere else on the Strip. We didn't eat at either of the restaurants at Bills so can't comment on the food. Overall, this hotel is excellent value for money if you want to visit Vegas on a budget and don't expect anything to fancy, would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the Strip - Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: NonRev_Navigator
Reviews.Content: After having read reviews about Bill's and seeing it's great location on previous trips to Vegas, we thought it we'd give it a go. Great mid-week rate through AAA and we were checked in and in our room (room 129) in no time. The casino is a bit dated but the staff were friendly and we liked that we didn't have to walk very far to get between the strip and our room. We were on the Flamingo side of the hotel and slept peacefully both nights. Rooms were fine, t.v great and housekeeping kept our rooms very tidy. Would certainly recommend this hotel for it's central location and price.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: fookincats
Reviews.Content: We are going back to vegas in September 2011 and we are goingto stay at Bills again... check out the cheap $2 hot dogs if you need a snack because they are lovely.... you can get some great views of the Bellagio fountains if you just ask when you book in... we got a free upgrade to a suite for the first night as we went to get married and that was amazing...ignore the moaners saying its noisey as you are booking a hotel on the busiest part of the strip so what do you expect?. $1 margaritas as lovely and worth trying,the pool at the flamingo is good too and it also has an adult pool too thats free to use fi you are a Bills guest.... if u need cheap ticketsfor shows etc you can get them from the counter at the entrance to Bills,they even have reduced buffet tickets available and thinks like madame tussauds...this hotel is great and we wont stay anywhere else... Dont stay in Circus Circus like most british do as its a long walk from anywhere of interest and in 100+ degrees the walk seems much further..!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelers34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for six nights recently. Perfect in every way. One of the best locations in Las Vegas, right on the middle of the strip right across from Caesars. Perfect for walking up and down the strip in all different directions. 2. Small enough that we could go back to our room on a regular basis to change clothes etc (days are warm, nights cool) with a very short walk to our room. 3. Free parking and the parking garage very close to the lobby. It couldn't have been better for we were looking for. 4. Huge clean rooms that were recently updated. The rooms have lots of dresser space and drawers for storage. 5. Nice staff 6. 99c margaritas were fantastic and made with good alcohol. We would highly recommend Bill’s for travelers looking for a nice clean hotel located in an excellent location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “STAYED IN OTHERS THIS IS THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: Snowmobilers
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself have been coming to Vegas for years (myself over 30) and Bill's is the BEST. A great location at a very resonable price. We always book a room overlooking the strip. A little noisy but this is Vegas if we wanted quiet we'd stay home. The staff at Bill's is very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: pasta1000000
Reviews.Content: Only complaint (minor one) is that they didn't have enough pillows....great stay but perhaps a touch noisy, but we did request a strip view!

Reviews.Title: “Drink up”
Reviews.Author: Denvercrazy
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Bills Gambling Hall and still in love with it. The Hotel/Casino is not a glamorous place, but it is real nice, in a perfect location. Again cant stress the great location enough. When your gambling at Bills there is always a waitress yelling "drinks". As long as you gamble your glass stays full, which is a far cry from majority of the other Casinos. Another great reason to stay at Bills is the $5.99 steak n' eggs breakfast from midnight - 5am +/-. Bills has a nice sports book and $5 dollar tables. Get a players card and use it...they offer great room rates to card members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: copedia
Reviews.Content: Firstly the negatives – We had booked two non smoking rooms however we were only allocated one and Bills lacks any quite area to sit and relax after fairly hectic days exploring Las Vegas. That aside however the other room was a room with a view overlooking the strip and the Ballagio fountains although a little noisy at times. The steakhouse was excellent and staff very obliging especially Don who organised our Pink Jeep trip to the Grand Canyon which proved to be one of the highlights of our stay. All in all Bills was exactly what has been said in other reviews, great value for money, an excellent location, the rooms clean and the beds comfortable. If you are not to bothered by a little noise and don’t compare Bills facilities with some of the larger and pricier hotels then Bills is an excellent base from which to get the most out of your trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, noisy!”
Reviews.Author: davarello
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews i was really looking forward to staying here - thinking i had found a hidden gem amongst the expensive las vegas hotels. WRONG! I should have known as soon as we checked in that the stay was not going to go well - we had booked and confirmed a room with 2 beds - upon check in we were given a king and a cot. The cot was exceptionally grotty and not at all comfortable. the room was ok - it was clean and smelled fine, there was a large flat screen tv which was a bonus. However the room which we stayed in on the second level facing the flamingo was EXTREMELY noisy. We heard what sounded like an air conditioner but it turned out to be the generators outside, the air conditioner was not even on! Once we turned the air conditioning on we couldnt even hear the tv. After telling the front desk the next morning we were moved to the fourth floor facing the fountain. This room was less noisier than the first but you could still hear when a car had their radio on too loudly and all the people walking over from the Bally's overpass. The hairdryer and 2 lights were also broken in the room, and it did not have an in room safe or a dead bolt. Despite all these flaws, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful and you do not pay any resort fees. You really do get what you pay for with this place - now that ive experienced it for myself i wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Value and Location all in one little package”
Reviews.Author: SaraC80
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I had seen it on my last trip to Vegas and was curious about the small, four story little structure with all the saloon lights outside. Bill's Gamblin' Hall is right in the middle of all the Vegas action. Right across the street from Ceasar's and the Bellagio and right next door to the Flamingo. It's got an uptown location without the uptown price. We arrived at the hotel about 8:30am local time. I expected to just check our baggage and be on our way but the staff was able to accomodate us right away. It was nice to be able to go freshen up after traveling. The gaming floor isn't big and austentatious like the bigger casinos but it definately has an "Old gamblin' hall" feel. It was perfect for what we were looking for. The tables were active and the main bar had Kareoke from 8:00pm to 2:00am every night. It was nice to go watch, have a drink and relax after a long day of walking! We spoke to a couple who were on their honey moon who stayed at a bigger hotel down the strip. They said that their hotel was quiet and they felt like they had to tip toe around. They took a walk down to Bill's and couldn't believe the energy in the little casino! The room was clean but not big and plush. We weren't looking to spend a lot of time in our room anyway. It served it's purpose. If you're looking for luxury, this ain't it. If you're looking for fun, on the strip for a good deal - Bill's is the place you'll want to check out.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: di947red
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's for 2 nights, it was our first visit to LV and a bit of a shock walking through the Casino to get to the Reception, the first thing to say is that the Parking is free and secure, our room was on the second floor, at the corner of the block and we had a panoramic view of the Bellagio Fountains, but it was noisy. LV is fantastic, you cannot fail to be impressed by the hotels on the strip and their shopping facilities. We ate out at the Bellagio Buffet on both evenings, at $34 per person it is incredibly good value, there is seafood, sushi, kobe beef, roast lamb and pork. We both really enjoyed our meal there and felt under no pressure to eat up and leave. We saw two Cirque de Soleil shows, "O2" and "KA", we booked both shows on line and at a discount, they are both excellent and exciting shows. We saw Big Elvis's show at Bill's in the afternoon which seems to be a bit of a pilgramage, but we enjoyed it. To sum up, Bill's is great for 2 nights, if you want a luxurious experience, look elsewhere, but if you want good value for money with LV in your face, then stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Howbeon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and it was our first trip to Las Vegas. Good points - Great location right at the centre of the strip. Small enough that you don't spend forever in elevators or checking in. Well proportioned room with comfortable bed. Not so good points. Dont expect much sleep on front of building overlooking the street but then you are in Las Vegas! No free coffee in rooms breakfast and the in house restaurants were a little pricey. Overall would probably return there if we ever visited again

Reviews.Title: “marginal but cheap”
Reviews.Author: hateArmPit
Reviews.Content: The low price of rooms was great and compared to others a comfortable and convenient place to stay. Bed/pillows/linens okay and everything appeared clean. TV awesome. Our bathtub had back flush from where ever---NASTY. Our 3rd night the bathroom door-- was locked from inside. The bathroom window would not close so heard all of the sounds from outside.. Victoria's rest. food,was good but the $5.99 for extra plate really low class and tacky. Service was okay. The oriental $ll.99 dinners were so good and the service in the evening was GREAT. Bill's Steak rest. was a shock. Who would think a steak house in Nevada would have a waiter in white coat who quickly pointed out the $20.00 minimum order. Made me want to say good-bye. The Spinach salad for two was good. Beyond that we will not go to Bill's Steak rest.. Way over the top compared to all the other wonderful places to dine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the right price.”
Reviews.Author: sdludlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's over Halloween and SEMA for 5 nights. We travelled with a group of friends so we had 4 rooms in total. Bill's is in a fantastic location right in the middle of the strip. I would recommend Bill's for those on a budget who want a great price for an excellent location. If you can afford more, or if it is your first trip to Vegas, I would recommend another, more luxurious hotel for the full experience. Pro's: Awesome location. Free parking. Friendly staff. Clean well sized rooms. Small casino so you don't get lost! Restaurant does good breakfasts and late night fare. Cheap rooms. Window in the shower opens for fresh air. Daily maid service. Our room had views of the Bellagio fountains. Con's Basic rooms so when you get home from a big day out you don't feel as relaxed as you do when you stay in a more luxurious hotel. Smoky casino floor, but our rooms were all fine. Quite a lot of noise from the streets - I took earplugs and then slept well. Beds a bit saggy but still comfortable. No fridge. Wi-fi was a bit pricey. No pool but you can use the Flamingo one so that's not really a problem. Overall we had a good stay, I would stay here again if I was on a budget but I do prefer the nicer hotels. If it's your first trip to Vegas, stay somewhere more upmarket. If you've been before and just want somewhere basic in a great location for the right price, then Bill's is your answer.

Reviews.Title: “The best Location on strip - Bar Weekends”
Reviews.Author: SexyBill_Compton
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 29th October to 3rd November and the cleanliness and standards at the Hotel were great. However, the hotel is old and on a weekend, especially Halloween the noise was deafening throughout the night to 7am. We went to get married and just got no sleep for first few nights, then Monday night it was quiet as a mouse and didnt hear a thing. If you go to vegas for a weekend, stay off the strip, however, the food and service was great. The Steak and eggs $5.99 special midnight to 8am was the stuff of legends and was very busy. The main a la carte restuarant was romantic and spent my wedding night sampling there delights. Cant recommend enough, however, weekends in Vegas to be avoided if your not part of the party crowd. If you are then happy days.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing conclusion to a great stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsGBroon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked Bill's primarily because of the cost but also because we liked the idea of a small hotel that you could move around easily and be out on the strip really quickly. We stayed in the hotel for 7 nights in a room overlooking the Flamingo so no traffic noise and a great nights sleep. Bill's more than met our expectations in terms of cleanliness, room size, restaurant and casino however the security and access to the rooms could be greatly improved. The huge negative for us was that our room was broken into on our last day. It took us a while to realise that someone had been in the room as it had been cleaned by housekeeping but when we arrived back there were a few things out of place. My husband then discovered his watch was missing and I could see that someone had been through my handbag as all the zips were open and a few things were spilling out. We are seasoned travelers so we had all our other valuables with us (iPad, iPhone, Camera, rings) and our passports were in a travel safe we had with us. We went down to report the incident to reception who called security and came up to the room with us to look things over but it was obvious that they didn't believe us. The guard even called up to the room later to ask if we had found the watch! There was no damage to the door so it has to be someone with a master key card. We discovered the following day that noise reduction headphones had also been taken. We were given an incident number and asked to call the Risk Management team 3 working days later. Its been tricky to call with the time difference but I have tried and always reached an answering machine. Today we received a letter stating that the information has been reviewed and that Bill's provided reasonable care in its duty to provide a safe, secure, and fun gaming environment for its customers. Our complaint was not to do with the casino but to do with the rooms upstairs. If there was more security to get to the rooms and a couple of camera's in the corridors it would be easy to see who entered our room. I have responded to the letter and included a copy of this report in my response. The items stolen total about £200 therefore we are not making a claim on our insurance so we weren't looking to recoup our losses in the casino! To conclude the hotel rooms and amenities were good but until I am assured that the security has been improved and that there are safes in each room I wont be returning or recommending my friends to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ekawq
Reviews.Content: The whole ‘hall & saloon’-theme was fun – location perfect in middle of the Strip.. no amenities in room (=no coffee machine; no refrigerator; WI-FI relatively expensive) but that might be room/rate specific.. They are serious when they say they don’t guarantee a non-smoking room – but a little bit of smoke of course fits the Saloon-theme.

Reviews.Title: “A Definite YES!”
Reviews.Author: FlyCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Bill's (Room 409) last week. Like others say the location is perfect - 1 mi. north to Wynn's and 2 mi. south to Mandalay. When making reservations I had asked for top floor, non-smoking and got exactly that. Our queen/queen was roomy enough to walk around in and had a partial view of TI, Mirage, Flamingo. Housekeeping was very quiet in the mornings, lightly tapping on doors and not banging on them. We asked a couple of questions at the front desk and everyone was very pleasant. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accommodation in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: Manx_on_tour
Reviews.Content: Our experience was similar to many of the other reviews. The hotel is relatively (by Las Vegas standards) small. The accommodation is functional but the main selling point is its location, right on the main intersection at the centre of the Strip. - directly across the road from Caesars Palace, Bellagio and Ballys with Flamingo next door. We were given a room on the first floor overlooking the Flamingo, the main benefit was that there was no traffic noise and although there was a slight hum from the air conditioning unit this did not disturb our sleep. As others have said the price is only a fraction of that charged by the aforementioned hotels. This leaves more money for other activities. Bill's is a perfect base for any of the fun activities that Las Vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “!!!Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: monster77
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Bill's end of september! We travelled with our whole family and had a fantastic stay at Bill's! The Location is perfect, you won't find a better place to stay for that price!! The rooms were clean an huge! Really big!! The casino is fun because the table limts aren't to high! And the Elvi's Show every afternoon was great!! We would definetly stay there again!!! We loved Bill's!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie580419
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bills for 4 nights in the first week of September 2010. Hotel is just a few mins away from airport and right in the heart of the strip, absolutly perfect location. Upon arrival we were offered an upgrade for $20 a night, decided against it to save some money, however the room we were in was perfect. Massive room with a gigantic double bed. View was of Bally across the road, which was fine - dont need to see all the sights from our room when we can go outside and see everything!! En-suite bathroom with bath and shower over top. perfect size!! Air conditioning kept the room lovely and cool, was still in the 40's when we were there! Air con can be a bit noisy at night but not enough to keep us awake all night. Hardly any street noise!! Casino is a lot smaller than some others along the strip but still has everything you could want. Being a smaller casino we found it makes getting drinks easier, give the girls a $1 or $2 tip every round and they will be back to you every 5 mins asking if you want more!! All staff were lovely and polite and willing to help with any problems. All in all a brilliant stay, will def be visiting Vegas again and will definatly be staying at Bills!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: teddybr218
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of the strip, couldn't ask for a better location. I was pleasantly surprised that it was so nice. There was nothing to complain about. We called the front desk and asked for more pillows and bags for the ice bucket and they arrived within 10 minutes this was about 10PM in the evening. I felt this was very quick for this time of evening and the person that brought them up was pleasant. The price was excellent and we would stay hjere again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: babs4848
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bill's with husband and three other couples. The location can't be beat. Right in the middle of the Strip so within walking distance of most of the major hotels and casinos. And after walking through most of the hotels, I'm glad we stayed at Bill's. Even though we were there at 10:30 and our rooms weren't ready, the lady at the counter put a rush on our rooms and we were able to check into our rooms within an hour. We spent that hour at the conveniently located same day ticket booth at the outside corner of Bill's to get tickets for shows that night. After getting our key, he elevator was a mere 20 paces from the desk. Our room was on floor 2, just 40 paces or so from the elevator. I can't imagine how long it would take you to get to your room in some of the larger hotels plus you would need a road map to find your way. The rooms were fine-clean, roomy. Only possible complaint was we were on the Flamingo Road side on the second floor and Saturday night was nonstop noise from cars, horns, sirens, people, but by Sunday night it was very quiet. A great value for the money. Would definitely stay here again next time we're in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Bills (Gamble on a good time) Gamblin Hall is the best!”
Reviews.Author: CanucksKickAzz
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas countless times, and have not seen deals like I have at Bills Gamblin Hall & Saloon.
