Great Value for the money ($45/night this december when we go again) and good looking rooms with plenty of space. I have stayed here 3 times now and will come back until it's torn down (which is hopefully not in my time). Not sure what else I can say that everyone else has. Best hotel by far.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas' Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: LibertyIn76
Reviews.Content: LET ME BE CLEAR. If you are reading this in the first place, odds are you're not a high roller looking for a 5-star world-class hotel. That being said, Bill's simply CANNOT be beat for the value. I challenge you to go ask one of your friends tomorrow who have been to Vegas and ask them what they thought about Bill's. I know what they'll answer....."About which place???" But don't let that fool you. See specifics below. Location: Location is 75% of the draw of any Hotel in Vegas. If you don't believe me, just read the reviews on the Stratosphere. Bill's is on one of the hottest corner's in Vegas. Situated across the street from Caesar's, The Flamingo, and Bally's (also caddy-corner to the Bellagio). Bill's places you in the heart of the strip. It is within WALKING DISTANCE OF EVERYTHING. The only time I took a mode of transportation other than my feet, was getting to and from the airport. One of the biggest bonus for me is what I call the "room to strip time". (No, it's nothing sexual). From the time it takes you to leave your room and be out on the strip took me an average of 1 min and 50 seconds. Compare this to 90% of other resorts and you'll find that it is AT LEAST A 10 MINUTE WALK from your room just to get out to the street. And that gets real old, real quick. Food: The food was decent at the Victorian Room. They have good specials and the wait is usually minimal. But a 3 minute walk away from the hotel will take you too Ellis Island. For $7.95 all day you'll get a great steak, 2 sides, bread, and a tall beer of your choice. Room: Awesome. Very spacious, separate sitting area, great view of the strip, computer desk, several mirrors, big plasma T.V., spacious bathroom, and separate toilet/shower for privacy (so one person can get ready while the other person is still nursing last night's hangover). I will say this however. MANY of the older casinos still have a slight musty smell when you first walk in. This was in no way enough to bother me at all. But there are those people would could be sensitive to this. That being said, the room was VERY clean, and the staff was always seconds away from assisting us if we needed anything. Casino: Depends what you're looking for. If you want a laid back place with friendly dealers who give you advice, this is your place. It is busy during the busy times and slow during the off times. That being said, I never had a hard time finding a table, even at the craps table! Bill;s even has a great poker area. They have .50/1.00 no limit games which are very friendly and most of the players are average at best. They also offer $30 buy-in tournaments several times a day - a VERY REASONABLE buy-in. Great dealers and manager Chris are friendly, professional, and very helpful. I met some very cool people in the casino, and most of them ironically, were from other nearby hotels! Sign up for a players club, for free money entries, comps and more. It only takes a second. Nightclub/Karaoke: I didn't sit in the karaoke area but there were a lot of people having fun. On to Drai's Afterhours. Bottom line, if you're still looking for a place to hang out when everything else shuts down, then Drai's is your place. Especially if you like house music. MUSIC is key. Most places place a mix of hip-hop and top 40. Personally, I can listen to this at home or in my car if I want. To me a the heart and soul of a club is the music and sound. And Drai's has it. I went to XS one night at the Wynn and it was nothing short of amazing, but the whole time I was still looking forward to Drai's when it shut down. It doesn't get busy until around 4:30, so do something else in the meantime. A variety of rooms to choose from, authentic decor, intimate feel, expensive (but strong) drinks, great vibe, good-looking girls, and great music make this a perfect spot to end (or start) the day! Miscellaneous: Bill's doesn't have a pool, but a 4 minute walk takes you to the beautiful grounds of the Flamingo, where you can use that pool for free. DO NOT LET THIS BE A DEAL BREAKER. It's really not that big of a deal. Overall: I have been to resorts and casinos all over the world. When I was in Vegas, I also made it a mission to walk in every hotel on the main strip. Keep in mind, when you're in Vegas, your hotel is typically just a place to lay our head at night. Walk into a place like the Wynn, Venetian, Caesar's, etc and you'll be stunned. But beyond visually impressed, it's not worth the extra 150 a night. I stayed a Bills with a friend for 5 nights. The total came to $295 ( 142 p/person). If I stayed at the Venetian, I would have payed around $900. You know what that equates to?.....MORE GAMBLING MONEY. Remember, it's free to walk into any hotel and casino. You are essentially paying the difference for which ceiling you stare at before you shut your eyes. That being said, Bill's does have a lot to offer, just not in the form of luxury. But again, if you're reading this, that's not what you're after anyways. You're looking for the best deal in the closest spot. And if that's the case. Then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay here but played quite a bit.”
Reviews.Author: CMunster80
Reviews.Content: This was another casino that I didn't stay in but I wanted to review the casino itself since I did play here quite a bit. I stayed a Bally's right across the street and knew when I went out to vegas that I wanted to find a gambling experience that wouldn't have me losing all my money at once but would give me a good time and Bill's was that place. I spent about 3 and a half hours playing blackjack with my wife and a guy from montana and having a great time. We lost all of the money we started with but it was a good time. After the first session we came back at least twice a day for single deck 5 dollar blackjack which is a rarity in most vegas casinos on the strip. Yes I know people are grumbling about the 6 to 5 payout and you will find that here too but it is worth it. I would highly recommend this place as well as casino royale. They are both a little smokey and a little old fashioned and not nearly as flashy as the big mega resorts but dealers are friendlier, drinks are stiffer, and the play is cheaper. A winning combination for me.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Incompetence from the GM down”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtheworld200
Reviews.Content: As a person who has stayed at Bills many times over the years, have had rooms comped based on my play, and basically lost thousands but in a fun environment all came to an end when upon checking out I left a sweater and a USB stick with data I needed. After 12 hours of phone calls from out of state I finally had Officer Weinstein promise me everything was taken care of and that they would firm everything up and get ahold of me the following day. They did not and I was about to leave the country for a long period of time. I then kept calling trying to get ahold of the GM, Trevor, who ignored all of my phone calls and conveniently told he wouldn't be available until 11am the following day, conveniently one hour after my international flight took off. Nobody was empowered to do anything, I kept getting rhetoric from everyone I talked with. Finally I had to call the Las Vegas police to have them step in. They did. I gave them my credit card number, they located the stuff, and had it sent out the following day at my expense...for a sweater and a USB stick it was 25.00. Everyone was involved with the incompetence from Lana and Danny, the pit bosses who comp your rooms, to all of security who were the most incompetent of them all (thats why they only need a high school diploma to get their jobs...with that said, the entire staff I am sure has that credential or lower...can't imagine their critical thinking skills or common sense were a product of our univeristy system). Anyways i digress. From a loyal patron who researchers the tourism industry, I can say after travelling to over 80 countries, having presented/researched/published on the tourism industry, that this incident stands out as the most disgusting incident I have ever experienced. I wouldn't even expect this in many of the third world countries I have visited or lived in. To be under Harrahs umbrella brings shame to the Harrahs name also.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in the centre of everything”
Reviews.Author: royalm
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Bill's early and as I read that check in is not til 4pm i was wary but i was surprise when the front dest booked me in and gave me some vouchers for the hotel The hotel itself is basic but very clean and right in the middle of everything. you don't have to walk far to get to all the sites. I enjoyed my stay at Bill's and would stay there again when in las vegas. A lovely place and you don't have to pay the price like all the other big chain. only thing needed is for them to put some tea making machine in the room

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value with a great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: parrothead37
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay in vegas.....spent the first 3 nights at the Golden Nugget (see seprate review) and the last 2 nights at Gamblin Bill's. This was my 9th trip to vegas and I have stayed everywhere from Bally's, Paris, Rio, Mandalay Bay and the Bellagio. I have enjoyed all of those hotel's but for the money Bill's can't be beat! We paid $56.00 for Thursday night and $129.00 for Friday night which, after hours of shopping around was a steal!!!! Even the GN downtown wanted $300.00 for Friday night! Our room while basic (think holiday inn decorated by your grandmother) was SPOTLESS with a 42' plasma TV. We had read some reviews about the beds being uncomfortable but ours was fine. Every staff member was super friendly, cocktails service very prompt (maybe a little too prompt! LOL!), and dealers were a lot of fun-the casino was jammin!!. As for some of the negative reviews - I can only guess that they are written by people who have never been to vegas and have NO idea how expensive a weekend stay can be. Many hotels advertise low rates but when you really investigate realize that they donnot include a Friday or Saturday night stay. Some of the older hotles may offer low prices but rooms are small, run down and many times dirty. Would I compare it to my stay at Mandalay Bay or the Bellagio?? Of course not! But in terms of room cleanliness, location and overall value Bill's cannot be beat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the location great, but the experience was a disappointment. We paid $150/nt for a full strip view room on a weekend. We had a nice view of the strip through a relatively small window, and my wife and I could see the Belagio fountains by taking turns standing in the corner of the window alcove, There was one bulb burnt out in the bathroom, and a bedroom lamp had a broken plug-in. There was no mini fridge and no in room coffee service or microwave. The casino floor stunk of cigarettes so bad that we spent no time there, and went elsewhere for our gambling and meals. The positive reviews on trip advisor must be coming from people who received much lower rates than we did, and they're comparing Bill's to budget hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Our wedding”
Reviews.Author: starrdogie
Reviews.Content: Bill's gambling Hall is an older hotel compared to the others but it does not lack in quality. The rooms are very comfortable and affordable. It is in the center of the strip next to the Flamingo and shares Flamingo's Pool which is great. Everyone at Bills was very nice and willing to help. When Bill's staff found out that we were getting married they offered to upgrade us for free to a suite, but my daughter and her husband was there as well and I wanted to be on same floor as her. So they upgraded us both.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER LOCATION EASY PARKING HOMELY FEELING FRIENDLY LARGE ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: rayko37
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's with my husband and two friends. It took just a few mins to get from Car Parking to Front Desk and the same from room to striip. Rooms were Large and had view of the strip.Staff were friendly and helpful, Big Elvis was great. Couldn't really ask for more from a Hotel right in the middle of strip. It felt friendly and homely and was not impersonal like the larger Hotels on the strip . My opinion is if you want a good deal stay at Bill;s

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sandyvanbrande
Reviews.Content: I agree with the majority of other reviews. It's an economical place to stay in the middle of the strip. Great location right on the corner of Bally's Caeser's and the Flamingo. Excellent $4.99 steak and eggs breakfast between midnight and 8:00 am, and $1.00 margaritas! Rooms were spacious and nicer than some of the larger hotels I have stayed at. Yes, you can hear a lot of street noise, but you are in Vegas! Take a couple of Tylenol PM's and you will sleep like a baby. I agree that the bathtubs do not drain well, but I had expected that from the other reviews I had read. So you are standing ankle deep in water at the end of your shower. If that's the worst I have to deal with..... If I were paying $300.00 a night it would be different. Anyway, I would definately stay here again. Good value - great location.

Reviews.Title: “F A N T A S T I C !!!”
Reviews.Author: theseahag80
Reviews.Content: i read all the reviews and felt pretty good about booking a room at Bill's. Within the first three minutes we knew we made the right choice. Amazing friendly staff... easy parking and they up graded us for free for no reason. Our room was huge! We did not want to leave it. I have stayed in amazing hotels and dives and this place kills it! We will never stay anywhere else in Vegas. The bell men even remembered us day to day and made jokes about stealing our Rondal's Donuts (another great place to check out).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, especially being in the centre of the strip opposite the old ranch palm spring Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: LF73
Reviews.Content: Great location - centre of the strip opposite the Bellagio, close to other hotels ie Paris, Caesars Palace, but costs far less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and will be staying again!”
Reviews.Author: verorod
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at TI and Ballys, but neither can compare to the location of Bills. It was very convenient to walk out of our hotel and be directly on the strip. The room was a lot nicer than Ballys, although as stated in other reviews the tub drained very slowly (minor issue). I personally had no problem with noise from street level, but I am also not a light sleeper. Room was large and had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Overall, I loved the casino and will definitely be staying there again. Other Vegas tips - we went to see and hubby participated in Marc Savard's hypnosis show. It was great. Ticket's sold at the V Theater for over $50 a piece...we bought from a Half Price Ticket's vendor (located directly in front of Bills) for half price.

Reviews.Title: “Million dollar location for a tiny price”
Reviews.Author: busterNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Bill's. The staff are friendly and efficent , Mike on the Bell Desk said he remembered us and greeted us like old friends. Rooms are huge, a bit outdated and the bathrooms are a bit weird but with a view of the fountains, Eiffel tower and the Strip who's complaining. The breakfasts are huge and delicious.Save your money for the slots and the shows and stay here. By the way, don't reccommend The Legends Show, amateurish and not even worth the half price tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Another good time at Bill's”
Reviews.Author: Magmomsal
Reviews.Content: This is still the best deal on the Strip. Fast in and out parking, front desk is on the ball, great food and drink and from the sound of it, a HOT craps table or two! The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The addition of the half price ticket outlet is a bonus and access to the Flamingo pool, easy as ever.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on the Strip & $1 Margaritas!!”
Reviews.Author: PTownPatto
Reviews.Content: Bill's was awesome! It is right in the middle of the strip and is the perfect base for staying in Las Vegas. The rooms were spacious, the bed comfortable, the bathroom has everything you needed. It was clean. The casino was quant, the craps lesson was helpful, the atmosphere if very welcoming...because its smaller, you feel a part of the 'Bill's Family'. No the floors are not made of marble but if that doesn't bother you then I would 100% recommend this place! Bill's does not have a pool but you get free access to the Flamingoes pool with your room card - 2 birds, 1 stone - even better!

Reviews.Title: “Once Again Bill's is Great”
Reviews.Author: Buskin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bill's in September for my son's wedding. I have to say that I think Bill's is the best no nonsence place in the centre of it all. For someone looking for the basics and a place to sleep..do not hestitate to book this. Maybe for a first time visitor to get the "feel" of The Vegas experience a higher end hotel would suit you. The rooms are clean and spacious, the beds comfortable. We had a great view of the fountains being on the corner. It was a bit noisey at night especially on Friday and Saturday but that would be my only complaint and that is a small one. Cehck in/out was fast and easy. As we like to call it "our comfort zone".

Reviews.Title: “Bill's is Awesome Once Again”
Reviews.Author: janer00
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at Bill's Gambling Hall from Sept 6-10 for the second time. Everything was wonderful was again. You just cannot find another hotel that beats Bill's for the value. Bill's has a wonderful location. Right in the center of the strip, walking distance to many of the strips most exciting spots. The best part about this hotel is the price! We stayed for only $35 dollars a night. I would suggest that you check for promo codes for Bill's and also check your reservation online a few times before you go, because I ended up getting the room cheaper just by re-checking my reservation, I called the hotel and got an adjustment very easily. One of the things I like best about this hotel is the size. It is so small compared to other hotels on the strip. And that means that check-in is seemless and no wait, the elevator is steps away from the front desk. Everything is easy to find and compact. You don't have to walk a mile from the entrance to the hotel elevators or anther mile to the parking garage. Bill's is also a very small casino compared to its neighbors and is always busy. The room is very clean, nice flat screen TV mounted on the wall and a fairly comfortable bed. Not the best but not the worst. Really, for the price we paid, anything would have been fine! The only con about this hotel is that the bathroom has a strange layout and is pretty small. This small issue should not stop anyone from booking this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bills just can't be topped.”
Reviews.Author: Yarnberg
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I traveled to Las Vegas in August and have to say that Bill's gives you everything you need at such a great price. We arrived there after an arduous flight to be greeted by a lovely friendly receptionist. She could probably see we looked shattered and kindly gave us a room over looking the Bellagio at no extra charge. What a start. The room was immaculate with enormously comfy bed and the view was just WOW!!! The restaurants in Bill's are of great standard although not being the biggest of eaters either of us, the portions are huge yet the price is great. The casino, whilst not one of the more glamorous ones like the Bellagio, Caesars or Parisian, is nice and smallish. You can always get on a table and the service off the waitresses is second to none. I had heard off people that some places in Vegas do not come over quickly enough to give out drinks when you’re gambling. This place is definitely not one of them as the service was top notch. Even the customers in Bill's were amazingly friendly. I can't understand how anyone can complain about Bill's as with most people they want the Ritz yet they expect to pay Travel Lodge prices. This place has a great location and yes you can hear some noise at 5am. But its LAS VEGAS not Bournemouth. Rooms, Restaurants and Staff are all amazing. So much so we are going back to Bill’s next year as with all the money in the world I wouldn’t want to stop anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - loud, worn beds, and reservations that aren't reservations”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloJimmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's in September 2010 for the first time because it's so highly rated. Based on my experience, I don't understand why... The good: The room rates and location are great. The parking garage was very convenient and it was nice not having to walk half a mile to get from my room to the strip like at some of the mega resorts. The bad: I reserved a room with a king size bed weeks in advanced. Upon check in, I was told that there were no more "standard" king size bed rooms available, but for $20 more, I could get one with a view of the Bellagio fountains. Wow...I've never been asked before to pay extra for the room type that I reserved. If I really wanted a view of the fountains, I would have stayed at the Bellagio. I stayed at Bill's because it's cheap. Since I was alone, I just took a room with 2 double beds and didn't pay extra. The room was pretty beat up and old, but clean for the most part. The mattresses were worn out and sagging. They obviously haven't been changed for years. I had a room that was on Flamingo Ave. During the day and even late at night, I could hear the traffic which didn't bother me. However, in the early morning hours between 3 - 5 AM, I was constantly being awoken by car horns beeping and loud stereos blasting. I assume these were from people leaving the hotel's after hours club Drai's, which doesn't open until 1 AM. Overall, I would not stay here again or recommend it. Next time, I'll spend another $20 a night and stay at The Flamingo or Harrah's. Even the Imperial Palace, which is pretty awful is better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rich88BuffaloNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights,the room was very clean,only negative was the bathroom tub drained to slow.The location cant be beat,and the use of the flamingo pool is a real bonus.Overall i would stay here anytime i venture to Vegas,the price and location cant be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, just need a little more”
Reviews.Author: SixSix
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bills for 3 comped nights. Overall the rooms are good. Room was clean, nice flat screen, but the bed wasn't comfortable, pillows sucked and felt beyond cheap. The bathroom in our room was also terrible sink would take forever to drain and bathroom was like playing the slots downstairs. We were on the first floor and noise wasn't too bad. We did heat the ocassional loud horn but it wasn't too bad, who sleeps in Vegas anyway? But overall Bill's is a great option on a budget and has ideal location with a hot spot at night, "Drai's". Definetely beats Imprrial or Circus Circus

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: averygosh
Reviews.Content: We got a our rooms very cheap through Expedia after reading lots of positive reviews. When we arrived, we were thrilled to discover that we had been upgraded to a penthouse suite. Our daughter, who loves anything old-fashioned or Victorian, loved it. Our room was slightly tacky and tasteless but huge, luxurious and fun, fun, fun! The breakfast the next morning was delicious: the best French toast ever!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in the heart of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NinafromAustralia
Reviews.Content: There is no question - this is the best value hotel if you want to be in the middle of the action on the strip. If you are in Vegas with your friends or your partner and you want to spend most of your time enjoying yourself on the strip and you want a basic but clean and comfortable room to rest your head - this is the place for you. No, you will not like this place if you want to live in luxury, have a champagne waiting in your room and have bellhops fawning over your luggage. If you're like, me and you are more concerned with having fun and just want a really clean, CHEAP and well located place to stay - Bills is the place for you. We had such a good time here and if offered us everything we needed at a fraction of the price of the neighboring hotels (like Caesars, Bellagio, Flamingo, etc.). You get free access to the Flamingo pool which is great - only a 5 min walk from the hotel. And my favorite part of all... was the 99 cent margaritas at the bar! You can't beat that! The money we saved by staying at Bills meant that we had more to spend having the time of our lives enjoying Vegas and its many sins. You honestly can't beat this value on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in LV”
Reviews.Author: nanania
Reviews.Content: The best thing of Bill's is its position and obviously its price, cheaper than other hotels on The Strip. Rooms are really big, confortable and clean. you can use for free the Flamingo's pool that is awesome (we just have some problems with the smell of real flamingos near the pool area LOL). We really enjoied our staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bill's!”
Reviews.Author: NDHawkFan
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas several times and have stayed everywhere from Caesar's Palace to Circus Circus. This trip I was going by myself for a UNLV seminar and decided to stay at Bill's asI have enjoyed gambling there in the past and enjoying the entertainment. Bill's was absolutely a fine place to stay for the price and what I needed. I arrived at 11:30 AM, not a good time to check in I know. I was the first and only person in line (I later walked through the line at Flamingo which was comparable to DisneyWorld). I was greeted in a very friendly fashion by the lady at the front desk and told the king room I had reserved was not available until 3:00 (that's more than fair) but a two queen room was available right then. I was offered to upgrade to a bellagio/strip view room but passed as I knew that my be noisy. I just asked for a quiet room. The lady at the front desk really was great - I received a room on the top floor (415) that still had a great view of the strip looking north and was very quiet! The room was good size with a 42" flat screen. TV remote was missing battery cover and they fell out a couple times, but no big deal. I'm not a picky traveler, but the room appeared very clean to me with a nice big window. Temperature was a bit warm when I arrived by easily was adjusted and cooled quickly. Bed was comfortable. The toilet and shower are in a seperate room, both were very clean but I didn't get on hands and knees to inspect. The sink is in a seperate room with clothes rack in there. A different set up, but not a bother at all. The decor was older style with dark brown colors, not the latest in interior design but fine for a place to stay. I was reminded right away by the front desk I had access to the Flamingo Pool, but didn't use it. I had breakfast at Bill's a couple times, nothing spectacular but a decent value on the strip. The bar has decent specials and has "Fat Elvis" on the weekday afternoons and karaoke at night early in the week, lounge bands later in the week. Gaming - just simply an excellent experience. From the moment I sat down, all the dealers and pit bosses were very friendly. First dealer I played with told me I should sign up for a players club card as they give away $100 in comps six times a day if you sign up for a card and sign up for the promotion. Sure enough, I won $100 in comps one day! You can use at Bill's with a swipe of your card or go to the Players Club and can print out a voucher for any restaurant at a Harrah's property. Great deal! Location - spectacular. Quick walk to Caesars, Bellagio, Flamingo, O'Sheas, Imperial Palace and Casino Royale which all offer either from classy to budget gambling/dining. I checked out very early (4 AM) and the front desk was right there and friendly as ever, even at the early hour. Took about two minutes. My overall experience at Bill's was very pleasant and I was glad I took the chance to check it out as I will definitely consider it as a low cost, great location option on my next trip to Vegas. If you need a glamorous room and stay, this place isn't for you. If you just want something clean, easy, and right in the middle of everything, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: stormwatch24
Reviews.Content: I had read about Bill's on this site and everyone wrote such nice comments so I booked a room for four nights. Well, the rooms were clean but it is an older hotel. Was upset there wasn't a coffee maker in the room. I just assumed there would be. Guess I should have read the descriptiom in more detail. I asked for more pillows and they said they do not have anymore. It would cost $14 a day for internet service. Bill's share's a pool with Flamingo Hotel. If someone would have told me how far it was of a walk to the Flamingo hotel pool, I would have never booked Bill's. In 106 temp, it was not fun walking to that pool. The hotel desk staff was nice and there were no problems checking in. Hallways were noisy at night with loud party people. It was okay but then moved to a Hilton and that was like night and day change for the better. Free internet too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: tijjw
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 separate rooms following positive reviews on tripadvisor and paid £64.00 total for 1 night. On check-in were told the hotel was full and we would be upgraded to penthouse suite. Suite was fantastic. large lounge, bar, kitchen etc (not used). 2 x luxury king sized bedded rooms one with spa bath. Do not gamble so did not use casino but it looked just fine. Free car parking on premises. Restaurants looked ok but ate out (already decided before arrival to do so). This hotel is right in the middle of the strip and easy walk to most popular other hotels around. Would not hesitate to stay again or recommend for good value accomodation and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Ask For Anything More!”
Reviews.Author: aramjames
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas four times times and have stayed at several Hotels last time I stayed at the Palazzo which is unsurpassed and fantastic in my opinion, if you are going to romance someone go to the Palazzo. This trip I was going by myself to unwind after spending two months in the Gulf for the oil spill and decided to stay at Bill's for I have enjoyed gambling there in the past. Bill's was absolutely great. The rooms are good size with a 42" flat screen had a great view of the strip and fountains (room 308) the casino has fun entertainment and fun table games. The Flamingo Pool was great, mixed crowd with mixed ages really enjoyed it and is included just show your room key. The breakfast prime rib and eggs at Bill's for $4.99 can't be beat, trust me on that. The decor in the hotel and rooms is charming, check in took less than 5 minutes, check out took less than 4 minutes. The bar always has specials $1.00 margaritas and New Castle Brown Ale for 1.00. Great location in a fun spot next to Flamingo's and Oshea's which is always fun, the Imperial Palace and Harrah's are very close, all fun places to gamble and party. Also right across the street from Ceaser's, next door to Bally's and Paris. I can't say enough about Bill's, it's a hidden Gem, perfect place to use as home base. Like I said, if you are going to vegas to have fun definitely stay at Bill's, if you are going for a Honeymoon, Anniversary of to romance someone then stay at the Palazzo or Venitian.

Reviews.Title: “This is Las vegas's best kept secret!!”
Reviews.Author: Missyelli0tt
Reviews.Content: Before we both went away we looked on trip adviser and found this place. it sounded to good to be true, very cheap, great location, cleanliness was brilliant, loved the style (old school las vegas), it was great, me and my partner classed it as "vegas's best kept secret", nothing else to be said its exactly what you want,. if you are first timers like we were at the tables, at 10:30am every morning they teach you how to play "craps", its great to get involved. hope you have an enjoyable stay like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; not luxe, but great value!”
Reviews.Author: MeTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Second stay at Bill's yielded a suite upgrade! The suite was fabulous! Picked this place because it is small, so close to everything, and has good rates. Food so-so. Friends stayed in a regular room, which was small and clean but dated decor. Beds comfy. Bathrooms small. They have a lot of waitresses for such a small casino = free drinks! great service at check-in, bell-hop, bar. Good security-guard presence. Crowd somewhat sketchy but kept themselves to themselves. It is noisy if you have a room on Flamingo Road; however there are some great views from there e.g. of the Bellagio fountains. Didn't hear much hall noise or noise from rooms above/below. All in all, if you're looking for a cheap but decent place and one of the best locations on the strip, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Loud Noises!”
Reviews.Author: NeedMoreLuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's for the first time as I've liked the casino for years. I liked the fact that you can use the Flamingo pool which is where I normally stay. So I decided to give Bill's a try for a change of pace. I've heard of many people getting free upgrades.. I'm not that lucky. Talked down from $20 a night to $10 a night for a strip view, I have my strip view but it's a smoking room. I'm told, "people hardly ever smoke in the room"... um, the room stunk BAD! Not being happy about the smell I suck it up and let it go.. because the view is great! I see Bally's and the Bellagio Fountains.. Ok, I'll deal with the smell. Night time sucks.. there is so much noise from people playing (with amplifiers) music on the sky bridge and sirens, and more sirens.. the only time you can sleep is from 4-9am. I was dissappointed in all. Yes the location is great, the Flamingo pool is great, the casino does have great specials, with a great bartender. (TJ) My suggestion, don't bother getting a strip view, NO smoking room, and I think the place will treat you fine. My experience was less than great, dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Centre Strip, Updated Rooms, AMAZING HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: andrealantz
Reviews.Content: Despite some frustration getting to the hotel and finding the check in counter, everything was amazing from then on out. We only paid $330 for 5 nights&flight on Travelocity. The reviews of Bill's weren't that great, but for the price, and being right in the middle of the strip, we couldn't resist. We got checked in quickly, and headed up the elevator. Amazing room, all updated and brand new. Huge TV, lots of closet space, and a beautiful view of the strip (Bellagio and Caesar's) The room was cleaned everyday quite well, and we were never worried about safety. There is no pool on site, but you are allowed to use the pool at Flamingo right beside, just show your room key. There is a deuce stop very close, and a Tix4Tonite, which got us 3rd row at Believe for $36. The casino is great too, it's got old vegas charm. It's not overly busy, so you can always get a drink. Join the players club, and get free drinks, playing cards, and tshirts. If you don't care about hotels with fountains or gardens, then this place is for you. It's old vegas, but BRAND new. Very clean, comfortable, and fun!

Reviews.Title: “You can't be closer to the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Onophrio
Reviews.Content: This hotel located at the very, very center of the Las Vegas Blvd., also called "the Strip". It is opposite to Caesar's Palace and The Bellagio (we could see the fountain from our room, actually), between the Flamingo and Bally's. Yet, it's pricing is much different from the hotels mentioned above. The rooms are in style of a western saloon and they are clean, big and well equipped. If you're on a value trip and want to see Vegas without being completely ripped off, you're perfect here. But if you are looking for overwhelming luxury I have to dissappoint you. This hotel definetly is something for people who want to see Vegas and sleep in Vegas style, but don't want to spend their complete holidays exploring their own rooms. The best of this hotel is definetly it's location. You just walk out the door and you are in the middel of crazy Las Vegas. Its location in the middel means you can walk either to the one (Sahara, CircusCircus) or the other end of the strip (Mandalay Bay) at the same distances. The other side of this location is noise: you'll hear Sin City all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Psymon
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. The place itself seems a little old, but my room was spotless. Other casinos are just minutes walk from here. Housekeeping every day and great aircon. I am going back this year and will stay at the same place. You can't beat it for value.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you're on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: UKLizzie
Reviews.Content: Bill's is OK if, like me, you end up in Vegas over a really expensive weekend and staying center-Strip is key. But it would never be my first choice of hotel. The rooms are absolutely fine - spacious and very clean, and the staff are really friendly and helpful. Its small size also means no lines to check in our out, which made a refreshing change. But the rooms are noisy. If you're on the Flamingo hotel side, there's the constant and suprisingly loud hum from their airconditioners, and the rooms on the other side, being close to the Strip/Flamingo intersection, get very loud traffic noise day and night. You'll need earplugs to sleep, and even then you'll be woken by not infrequent sirens. I also found my bed uncomfortable. I may have been unlucky, as several other reviewers have said how comfy they found them, but I had to change room once as the first bed was so lumpy and soft I could never have slept in it. And the second was only a little better. To summarize, if budget and location are key issues for you, then Bill's is fine. The rooms are perfectly OK, the location can't be beaten, and the staff are lovely. But it's too small and tired to have any Vegas 'wow' factor (it would be a poor choice for a first timer) and as truly deluxe rooms are usually available at very low prices in Vegas, it's unlikely to be your best choice of place to stay. But it did the job for me when everything else nearby was $200 + a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: gemwise
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bills april 2010. Excellent value for money and it cant be beaten for location on the strip. Casino isnt the largest, room bright and breezy, restaurant ok. There isnt a pool at this hotel however you can gain access for free to the pool area at the flamingo which is directly next door. All in all a good hotel that I would definitely recommend to my friends and the cheap prices mean you have more spending money for the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: --Roman_PA--
Reviews.Content: The biggest plus of the hotel is location, almost directly in front of Bellagio, for much better price. Let's be honest, hotel offers good value, but it's not top notch, as its best years passed already. For similar price I could get Aria (newest hotel in the Strip area), but prefered this due to walking distance to anything in the Strip. There was always a space in the parking lot, close to the elevator, but occasionally only one of the two was working, so I think two times we had to wait for about 10 minutes. As it is in most other Vegas hotels, there is no coffee express in the room. Restaurant is a bit pricey for the hotel class, unless you go for specials. Choice of slots and table games is limited, but dealers do not look prompting either. Go to nearby Flamingo instead, where female dealers, are distracting attention, and a lot of other casinos nearby. We had room overlooking a Strip, but it was quiet, so that was big plus. Did not use swimming pool at Flamingo, to which access is granted for Bill's guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and competes with the BIG names easily”
Reviews.Author: paulamor
Reviews.Content: We came to Vegas for the 4th time and have stayed on the strip in various BIG name hotels and i can honestly say Bills maybe alot smaller but it punches above its weight. Bills rooms are spacious and excellent value for money. The casino area is lively and all the staff are very friendly and are willing to help. It is nice to stay and visit the BIG name hotels but i do not think you can match Bills for location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: shjames38
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Bill's many times. Enjoy the small, friendly feeling of the casino - you don't have to walk a mile to get to anything else. Great location and great price. Totally enjoyed the experience and will plan to stay there for my next visit also!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Woodfield009
Reviews.Content: Lareg clean rooms, fully serviced every day, we had a room at the back so no view of the fountains, but Bills is so close to all the facilities it made no difference to our enjoyment. The pre 8am steak and eggs brakfast at less than $5 was truly excellent, we would have had it more often, but the big comfortable beds and quiet rooms ment we slept beyond the 8am deadline on more than one ocassion. Helpful staff and free self parking in the hotel building (some hotels have free parking so far away from reception it seems like your in the next state) were real plus points, the only small criticism is that there are no safes in the bedrooms, safety deposit boxes are available, but we all elected not to use these. Excellent stay, will use this hotel again the next time we are in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, with a few expected flaws.”
Reviews.Author: MrHawk_1101
Reviews.Content: After a few weeks of looking through hotels, we had settled on Bill's based off the reviews on here, cheapovegas.com. I can honestly say that I had expected the hotel would have some flaws, but nothing that would generate a negative review: Check-In: Due to the hotel's size, the wait times are usually minimal. During my 5 days, I did not see more than 5 people in line. Our room was not ready (we had arrived at 12pm), but within a few minutes of going to our friends room, it was ready. Check-out can be done through your TV. Room: A fairly sized room, with a good king bed, flat panel TV, small bathroom and great view (Room 316). The closet is in the powder room, with the toiler/shower in a separate room. Like the previous review, our shower had a minor drainage problem. Our remote did not work either, and within 10 minutes, problem solved. Bed was comfortable, with 3 pillows (Not average size though for a king bed) and we had new ones brought to us the next day. Oh also, this is a great view of the Bellagio Fountains, Bally's and Paris. Casino: Small, and a bit smoky, but what can you expect for a 31 year old hotel, that Harrah's had planned on tearing down? About as low of a limit as you can find without going downtown, or off-strip, lots of penny slots, and $5 blackjack. Sign up for a Bill's card. Comps are used throughout all Harrah's resorts, and ensure you enter your name into the Comp Explosion draw for $100 of comps (My girlfriend and I had both won and used them). Dining: Victorian Room offers good quality food at a hard to beat price. $14.99 for prime rib all day, All You Can Eat Chinese food at 9.99 (Limit to one specific dish) and lots of other specials. Sebrina was an amazing server, super friendly and funny. Did not eat at the Steakhouse, since it was closed 2 nights, but I heard good things from the people i talked to. Did not like Seattle's Best Coffee, but their cold drinks were top notch. Clientel: Nearly everyone and their next door neighbour. A good mix of young people and older people. You would see some young 20 somethings for a birthday, and a seniors trips at the same craps table. This place also has a Tix4Tonight location, and a few people trying to hock timeshares. You are within spitting distance from Flamingo, Bally's and just a few short steps from Bellagio, Caesar's and Paris. You can use the pool at Flamingo, which is one of the better ones. In final, this hotel is ALL about location vs price. You cannot beat the deal you will get here. Keep that in mind, and you will have a great time. If I missed anything, send me an e-mail :)

Reviews.Title: “Gurgle gurgle gurgle (not)”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugged
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on 4-5 July 2010. Positives: location and price. Its location on The Strip makes all the usual touristy things within easy walking distance, and it's also only a short, 2-3 mile drive from the airport. And at $89 for the night of July 4 (i.e. one of the busiest of the year). no-one could possibly complain about the price. Negatives: facilities misrepresented on hotwire.com, through which I booked (the site said the hotel had free wi-fi, whereas in fact it costs $10 a night on top of the room rate) and a blocked drain in the bath/shower. We called Room Service and an engineer came, cleaned out the plughole assembly and told us it was all fixed. It wasn't: when we tried the shower again the water was up to ankle length in the tub within a couple of minutes. It being the night of July 4 there was only one guy on duty for the whole hotel and he couldn't do any more. The very smoky atmosphere in the casino/lobby (you have to walk through it to get to and from the elevators) wasn't nice, either. In short, if you're willing to accept some rough edges in the quality of service in exchange for a very good room rate (assuming that you don't need Internet access in your room) and location, you might like to give this place a try. But if the standard of facilities is important and you don't want a hotel in which you have to walk through an area in which smoking is allowed (and in which the smoke was so dense as to make me cough and my eyes water) to get to and from your room, I'd suggest looking somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Very UNIQUE”
Reviews.Author: marathonman262
Reviews.Content: I got to stay at one of room that wasn't renovated yet. It was old John Waynes party suite. The room was LARGE. The Decor in the room made me feel like I was back in the 80's. Surprisingly, everything looked new! Huge walk in shower with sitting area. I bet you can fit 5 people in the shower. The only thing I didn't like was small old TV(who watches TV in vegas anyway?), other then that loved the room. Definatly, ask for this room if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience / Best value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Caseyamcl
Reviews.Content: The typical casino experience is: arrive; push through a crowded casino or shopping mall to find the registration desk; wait in a long line to check in; navigate a labyrinth to find your room, etc. Bills is always refreshing. I never once had to wait in line here, and it you can't beat the location. The rooms are always clean, and the staff is always friendly. If this is "Old Vegas", I prefer it to "New Vegas". The western motif in the hotel is pretty cool, too; none of that stupid cheesy "themed" stuff. Plus, you get access to the pool at the Flamingo next-door, which is one of the best in the city.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: mabl32
Reviews.Content: looking at the name you wouldnt think it would amount to much, but i was very surprised! the rooms were clean, and very pleasant, with an excellent view of the strip. the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. also the location couldnt have been any better if you would have planned it, right in the middle of the strip next to bally and flamingo and across the street from caesars. the price was very reasonable for the location. if you are up past midnight, steak and eggs breakfast for about $5.00. all in all i would highly recommended this hotel for anyone that wants to stay on the strip and keep it affordably.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Vegas, Nice for Price”
Reviews.Author: MarknSue1977
Reviews.Content: The Best thing about Bills is that you can walk to and enjoy the nearby high end casinos and end your night at Bills casino which has more of a laid back old downtown vegas feel. Rooms are ok, but definitely not luxury accomodations. Big flat screen TVs and some rooms with great views are the best thing I can say about the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Bills is the best deal in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: vadolly
Reviews.Content: You should not even question about staying here - dont let the fact it was the old Barbary Coast fool you. The rooms are some of the cleanest I have stayed in and the location is by far the best in town. You can leave your room and be on the strip in one minute. The only thing you should know is ask for a view and if you get it (really great) be prepared to hear some noise from the strip. But the view of the Bellagio fountains makes it all worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bill's”
Reviews.Author: Jerry1031
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Bills. The reviews were right on. Our room was 226 with a partial view of the fountain show only blocked by Bally's strip sign. Great south shot toward Paris/Bally's. This is one of the older hotels on the strip, but you can not beat the location, quick walk to all rooms and close parking! The room was big and very clean. Noise level was good with just a few door slams. Casino was nice and lively with good drink service. Big Elvis show was great also. One of the best things for us was free access to The pool at the Flamingo next door. It is laid out as a large lagoon with waterfall also. It was a great, beautiful pool with all sorts of action and lounging. Water was nice and cool and great staff. A nice place to relax after a long night of fun!! A five minute walk to get there and just show the Bill's room key to get in. Great food choices by pool with reasonable prices. If you want prime poolside loungers, get there at open 8:00am. Our best night was at the RIO for fun. This is a very nice casino with a festive feel. The overhead show, dancing and singing was great. Every hour starting at 6:00pm Thurs-Sun. Great drink service by great looking guys! My wife liked Andre (chippendales performer and singer) Once an hour they jump up on small stages and sind a song. If on a hotel budget this is a great choice. We have stayed at Excalibur and Paris and will most likely come back here next year.

Reviews.Title: “great location ,friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: teddyEssex
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nights in may pre cruise,great location right where all the sights are.fast check in very friendly staff,great deals on drinks and food,nice clean room had a great stay ,would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, great gaming floor, superior service”
Reviews.Author: SurfCitytoSinCity
Reviews.Content: I easily read over 100 reviews on Bill's before persuading our group of 6 to stay here. Upon entry to the gaming floor, it instantly smelled of stale cigarettes (not too big a deal), but since I turned to my immediate right and saw nobody in line to check in, I considered it a wash. The room was basic. They asked if we wanted to pay for an upgrade to a "view room" or a suite, which we declined (the "view" was of the Bellagio fountains which we could see from our standard room anyways). The beds were some of the best I have found in any hotel anywhere, not to mention the nice, big 42" flat screens. From room to the Strip was 2 minutes AT MOST!! The service was outstanding, as they had cocktail waitresses coming around every 5 or so minutes. The dealers were extremely helpful and fun to talk to (including the awesome guy who was dealing Texas Hold `Em and dealt me a straight flush, on the flop, at 4am. Sorry I don't remember your name (see FREE DRINKS), but thank you again). No complaints except for, the fire alarm going off at 4am one night, and the fact that they had my wife and I in a smoking room and our friends in a non-smoking room (they smoke and we don't). No biggie, it got fixed. We just had to tolerate a smoking room. All in all, this place has the best pound-for-pound value of anywhere in Vegas. Oh yeah, and the lowest limits in Vegas as well. Good luck and enjoy Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “No Brainer”
Reviews.Author: mtripguy
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price, quick check in, and clean rooms......straight leisure trip for us and getting to use the Flamingo pool is awesome......would recommend the twins at the dueling pianos at Harrah's......go just before 9 so you don't have to pay the $5 cover.....they are really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Old School Vegas Vibe”
Reviews.Author: BadaBingosMaestro
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas many times over the past 30 years and stayed in most of the hotels. For me it's more about a good location, and bang for the buck and this provides both. I stay at the Venetian many times because they offer me free rooms and i'd say Venetian's rooms are some of the nicest and if it's free why not, BUT when you have to pay $ Bill's is tough to beat and has the old Vegas look and feel to it. We like to move from casino to casinio and bill's is a fun one. They have a new electronic craps table that was kind of fun and interesting. I like to play poker and did not play at bill's where they only had a few tables but it looked like a kick. Service was good and the room was clean and fine. My only issue was some of the noise on the street outside my room which was mainly do to some construction. I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to others. If you need fancy, and are super picky go pay the big bucks some place else. If you want a great location on the strip and a good taste of old school vegas this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed here before!”
Reviews.Author: nelsons4christ
Reviews.Content: The only reason that Bill's didn't get the full 5 is because we had an emergency alarm go off on our first night at 4 a.m.. I stayed on for 5-7 minutes, blaring that they would let us know if we needed to do anything. Otherwise, very clean and very quiet. We were on the Flamingo side, deciding that we didn't need to see the Strip, just visit when we wanted too! We loved the room, even had stained glass in the window at the end of the shower. The etched glass over the sink was a nice touch. Parking was very convenient. Check in and out was quick. We were comped one night of our two night stay because of the disturbance the first night. The locations is great! The service is friendly! We appreciated the "free" coupons to see Mac King at the Flamingo. Because nothing is free, we were required to purchase a minimum drink of $13 each. The show was funny, though and we were invited up on stage to help with a trick, very fun! We will be back to Bill's! We were disappointed to have to pay $12 for internet for one day. We were able to find free wireless connections the next day. We ate at the Victorian for one meal and enjoyed "all you can eat" Chinese. One plate was all we could eat - very generous!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to Hang Out At”
Reviews.Author: Sony72
Reviews.Content: The other times we've stayed in Vegas we never went into Bill's. Don't know why but it never appealed to us. However, this last time we gave it a try and weren't disappointed! We didn't stay at Bill's but spent several evenings gambling and watching karaoke there. The staff were friendly as were the patrons! We were staying at one of the other hotels on the Strip but came back to Bill's casino over and over for the good natured, laid back people. We made more friends in that casino then anywhere else on the strip - people seemed to go there to have fun and not to pretend to be someone they're not... which was extremely refreshing. It was nice to be able to drink, laugh and act like an @ss and no one cared because they were there for the exact same thing. Try it out and enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at great prices!!”
Reviews.Author: Glywri
Reviews.Content: We were a party of four adults and booked rooms at Bill’s based on reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren’t disappointed. All I can say is you’ll have difficulty finding a better location at a better price. We stayed on two separate occasions, the weekend before Memorial weekend and again midweek after Memorial weekend. The second stay wasn’t booked but they found us rooms without any fuss. We’d been slightly disturbed during the first stay by some noise from the kitchen and when we mentioned this we received a discount on our second stay! The rooms were large, clean and well equipped. Staff was friendly and helpful and the service was excellent. Unlike some of the big hotels you won't spend hours wandering around trying to find your room. If you’re looking for a place with flashy attractions like rollercoasters and shopping malls go somewhere else but if you want good accommodation at a reasonable price this is it. The location has to be one of the best on the Strip. Caesar’s Palace, Bally’s and Bellagio are right across the street, the Flamingo is next door and Paris, Planet Hollywood, the Venetian and Mirage all within a few minutes’ walk. For my next trip to Las Vegas this will definitely be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and price for our joint Bachelor/Bachelorette Party”
Reviews.Author: wteaver
Reviews.Content: Bill's was the perfect location for our group of 14. We had 2 suites and 4 regular rooms and we could not have asked for a better situation for our celebration. Bill's is clean and easily accessible and you certainly can't beat the price! I have stayed at several other strip hotels and Bill's is by far the most convenient. If you stay at Bill's, you are allowed to use the pool at the Flamingo and it was quicker to get to the Flamingo pool from our room at Bill's than it was to get to the Bellagio pool from my room at the Bellagio when I stayed there. For what we saved by staying at Bill's, we were all able to see a show (Tony n Tina's Wedding- hilarious!!!) AND rent a cabana at the Flamingo pool. The staff at Bill's was friendly and very helpful. We ate at the Victorian Room once and though the food was only ok, it was reasonably priced, and the service was good. I would highly recommend Bill's for travelers on a budget and those looking for a great location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: debsboo85
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at this hotel although the last time it was called the Barbary Coast Hotel. The Rooms are a good size, unbelievably clean, and air conditioned!! We had the most standard room possible and we still had a plasma tv on the wall whereas some bigger named hotels have tiny rooms with 19" televisions! I dont think I would stay anywhere else. There is no pool at the hotel but all visitors have use of the Flamingo pool next door, all you need is your room key. Me and my partner both agree that Bill's is a fantastic hotel, our only negative point would be the food selection but there are plenty of options nearby. If you want a central location, a clean room and some extra money to be spending once you get there I would stay at Bill's!!

Reviews.Title: “The best Price/ View/ Location”
Reviews.Author: Peca1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from May 2 to May 6. The location is excelente, in the middle of the Strip and just from ballys, bellagio and Caesar's Palace. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms was clean and comfortable, huge space room wiht TV Plasma 42''and excelent view. The restaurant was great with good food and reasonable prices. But this hotel hasn't buffet like the others. We pay usd 60 per night and extra usd 20 for an upgrade room with Bellagio view. They leave us without electricity for an entire day so we have to use the stairs. We complain to the manager and they removed the upgrade charges for the entire stay. Otherwise, this hotel has the best price-view-location and we definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: fuzzs
Reviews.Content: We purposely wanted to book at a hotel that doesn't charge resort fees. There are enough hidden fees in Las Vegas activities anyway, resort fees on top of hotel rates are just ridiculous. Thank you Harrah's group hotels for not gouging the tourists. I felt relieved to know exactly what to expect when we stayed at Bill's for 3 nights. I would be perfectly content staying at the other Harrahs group hotels but Bill's appealed to us because of its price, location and the fact that it was a smaller casino/hotel that was fast to check in/check out and to get to our room and out very easily. We enjoyed watching others wait in the long lines at the other larger casinos just to check in :} Really paid off when you did as much walking as we did. Our room being on the 1st floor on the Las Vegas Blvd. side, it really wasn't as noisy as we expected. The tub drains very slow as accurately reviewed but that certainly doesn't hamper the experience. In fact it was part of its charm. The room was large and clean - no need to ask for more. Bed was comfortable. Housekeeping staff were friendly and prompt at cleaning rooms. Had the 99 cent margaritas the last night, great drink value. Bill's was our best value during our Las Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “My third stay at Bill's”
Reviews.Author: lainee_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's for the third time May 30-June3. As always the room was clean and roomy. The price was great. The service from the front desk and concierge to the maids was amazing. The only complaint I have has nothing to do with the hotel. It has to do with some lunatic who decided to pull the fire alarm after midnight on my last night there. Normally I wouldn't have cared but I had to leave at 4:00 for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay-easy for elderly Mom”
Reviews.Author: jucogjct
Reviews.Content: I chose Bill's because I knew it would be easy for my mom to get o the strip. We arrived and parked at valet. Very friendly valet people the whole trip. Check in was easy. Had oxygen delivered and they quickly took it up to the room. They had us booked in room 113, but changed us to a room close to the elevator after noticing my mom had trouble with her breathing. The room was great, clean and just the right size. We were not expecting anything lavish. Just perfect for us. The bathrooms are small but with just 2 people we couldn't complain. They were clean and that's important. Beds were comfy. We ate one meal at the Victorian Room and the food was very good. Way too much food, but it was good. The casino is very busy from afternoon until about 6:30AM. There were a lot of people leaving the nightclub between 6 and 7 in the morning and it made for some great people watching moments, lots of drunk 21-30 year olds. There was plenty of security at this time of day because too many drinks led to many arguments, but they quickly took care of the problems. My Mom won $100 in comps by registering her player's club card, so make sure you do that. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"[--] LOVE IT"”
Reviews.Author: lolaskow
Reviews.Content: after staying at almost every 5 star casino in vegas, this is truly the best. great access. I walked ten steps from my room to get coffee in the morning and then I realized "i'm already on the strip let me go the flamingo and hit some slots at 8am!" Rooms are clean and huge. you would probably pay 500/ for the view. and you get to use the flamingo pool! I watched like 20 bellagio fountain shows from my room. This is really the best for your money. unless you want to bed and impress some chic with marble tile stand up showers then ditch out 400-600/ a night and walk over to the bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Haven't stayed yet, but there are already problems...”
Reviews.Author: muzegirl78
Reviews.Content: I am scheduled to stay here in July, and decided to add an extra day to the reservation. I called to extend my stay and the woman on the phone was completely rude to me. As I was trying to make sure I would be charged accordingly and that the reservation was in order, she began screaming at me to "LISTEN." I was not being rude, just wanted confirmation that everything was correct. I asked her not to scream at me and asked to speak to someone else, whose attitude wasn't stellar either. I'm sure I'm going to get set up with the worst room in the house, and my vacation is going to suffer because this woman had attitude. I wish I could just get a refund and stay somewhere else, but I'm already almost completely paid up. Probably will not stay here in the future unless I get an apology.

Reviews.Title: “" Excellent "”
Reviews.Author: scoff
Reviews.Content: Great location opposite Bellagio & Caesars in centre of strip. Rooms great for the cheap price paid!!!! Service at front desk was quality. Rooms cleaned all 5 days we were there. Would deff recommend!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Double the value, but not double the price”
Reviews.Author: AA7482
Reviews.Content: Bill's Gamblin' Hall is an unbeatable value in the heart of the strip. It has the old western sort of decor and is very charming in the casino but even more in the rooms. Located next to The Flamingo, and across the street from Bally's and Caesars the location is hard to beat for the price. Although no pool, Bill's guests are allowed to use the pool at the Flamingo, which is one of the best in Vegas. The rooms are all updated and very comfy and cozy for those early morning hang overs. As well, they have 42" plasma's in the room. Bathrooms are a little small but very manageable for one or two people. If at all possible get a room on the south side facing Bally's and the view of the Bellagio fountains. If you get a room there the value doubles but not the price. Overall, Bill's is a charming, not too luxurious, very affordable, and well rated hotel all around.

Reviews.Title: “Bills is ok with me”
Reviews.Author: the990
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Bill's before and it is always good. It is going down a bit every year. The general cleaning needs to improve quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Best Deal in Town!”
Reviews.Author: mylittlesunshinegirl
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three night trip to Vegas yesterday. My boyfriend and I stayed at Bill's all three nights and we were very glad that we did. Last year we stayed at Planet Hollywood, which is an excellent hotel don't get me wrong, however I always found to get from your room to the strip or the other way around, it took way too long. This year we decided to give Bill's a whirl and it was great! First off, it's right smack dab in the middle of the Strip. It neighbours Bally's, and the Flamingo and is very close to Paris and Planet Hollywood. It's right across from Ceasar's Palace and the Bellagio... Seriously it doesn't get much better than that for the price you're going to pay. Our room was a South facing view, so we got a bit of Bally's but we could see the Strip and the Bellagio fountains as well. Bill's is very small for a Vegas Strip hotel, which is really awesome because it doesn't take you long to get anywhere and check-in/out was a breeze. We didn't have to wait one second in line. The rooms were everything you'd expect. The decor is certainly dated, it wouldn't be my first choice but seriously if you care about things like that then you and I probably wouldn't get along. The bed was nice and comfy, the lighting was good and the bathroom did it's job. The bathroom is split into two, with the shower/bath and toilet having it's own door, so if someone's using that, others would be able to do their make up, use the sink, etc. We had no issues with water temperature or pressure, it was very good. We had a flat screen TV with about 30 basic channels and there were other on demand movie channels you could pay for if you wanted. For those who are interested in knowing, there is an internet hookup but you do have to pay extra for it. We didn't use it because we didn't have a computer. We didn't really have any issues with noise, although if someone knocked on your neighbours door it kind of sounded like they were knocking on yours. But really nothing bothered us at all. We didn't really have any noise from the Strip but mind you it was a South facing window and not directly over the strip. Cleaning service was good. Our second day we came back from shopping and everything was spic and span. Our third day (after the wedding we attended) we were very hungover and lazy, so we pretty much spent the entire day eating pizza in bed with the Do Not Disturb sign on the door... and they kept our wishes and did not disturb :) As a Bill's guest you can use the Flamingo pool for free. It's very easy to get to you just hang a right out of Bill's and head into the Flamingo and follow the signs for the pool. To be honest they didn't even check my room key... I could have been anyone, from any hotel. The pool was very packed and has a real party vibe but mind you it was a Saturday at 1pm. I'm sure during the week it's a little easier to find seating. We ate at the Victorian Room once for breakfast and it was good. I would have liked to try some other meals there but didn't get a chance to. We're not huge gamblers but I did some slot and video poker playing. It was pretty fun and there's a good selection of machines. The drink service if you're gambling is very good. I've been to bigger hotels where they won't really care about you if you're playing penny slots, but they do here :) If you're not gambling, drinks are cheap at the bar. Dollar margaritas, and you can get bottles of beer for $2. I was drinking half pints of Dos Equis and it was $1.50 each.... Pretty awesome! If you can, check out Big Elvis who sings there Mon-Fri at 3, 5 and 6:30 I think... something like that anyway. It's always packed to see him though so grab a seat early. Anyway all in all we were very happy with Bill's Gamblin' Hall. It's exactly our type of place... we're not very swanky. We just want a cheap, clean place to rest our heads. This is the BEST place to do it because not only is it cheap and clean, it's the best location you could get on the strip. We really want to get a friends' vacation going next year and this is definitely the place I'd recommend because all of our friends are young and broke, haha. Better to spend your money on more important things like dollar margaritas! If you have any questions please don't hesitate to PM me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, service, location and price!”
Reviews.Author: CPLUS
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled out to Las Vegas by myself to meet up with friends who were getting married there. I got a great deal at Bill's Gambling Hall & Saloon, and the reviews I read were fantastic, so I was really looking forward to checking it out. Bill's was really cool. The staff is helpful and friendly. My room was enormous and I had a great view of the strip. The location was fantastic. Staying at Bill's gives you access to the Flamingo pool, which is right next door, and also one of the best pools in Vegas. Bill's also has Fat Elvis stop by twice a day to perform in the lounge area, which is really fun and worth checking out. Craps lessons every morning at 10:30 AM (free), and the casino is open to street, so by afternoon it's really busy, and full of energy. For people who come to Vegas for the shows, Bill's is one of the few locations in Vegas where you can line up twice day to get discount tickets for same day shows. Bill's was really fun! It has everything you need while in Vegas at a great price, and I am definitely looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bills gambilin hall”
Reviews.Author: cetel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for eight days.The staff were very friendly and the rooms clean and comfortable linen being changed every day The restaurant was very reasonable and we had most of our meals here.The location is excellent being central on the strip. Thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Basic room with an upgrade location”
Reviews.Author: JWPacker
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the tardiness of this review - I thought I posted it right after we returned at the beginning of April. Bill's is an anomaly on The Strip. It's tiny, the amenities are few, and it's a little on the tired side. But the price is outrageous, and the value is hard to beat. We stayed five nights, Sun-Thur, March 28th - Apr 2, 2010, and were satisfied with the value we got for our dollar. Easy access to the strip in either direction was a huge plus, as we had opted not to get a car for this trip. Pedestrian walkway over LVB to Caesars and more importantly Serendipity 3 was quite helpful. We arrived late enough that they had all but figured we were no-shows, and as such there was no choosing of a room - we got what they had. That meant it faced The Flamingo, rather than facing Flamingo Blvd, and that may have been a good thing. No view of the Bellagio fountains, but also no traffic noise to speak of. Occasional strains of music from Margaritaville and from the CP sign we could hear, but it wasn't awful by any means. The beds were too firm for my liking, but comfortable enough, and there's a plenty-big flat panel TV. The bathroom was infinitesimally tiny, but got the job done. Would I stay there again? Heck yes. Just not for as long as we did, and not on a vacation where I wanted to feel pampered. We were there for value as part of a last minute spring break jaunt. But for the price, good sweet lord, you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: lala97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio the night before because I was there for work the first day. The last two days were dedicated to celebrating my 40th B-Day along with my best friend who is also turning the big 40 so we wanted to be in the middle of it. I made the mistake of mixing my alcohol the night before (shocker in Vegas) and needless to say I felt like I was living my last day. I had to muster up the energy to check out of the Rio and take a cab to Bill's. The cab driver told me it was a dive and asked me why I was staying there and not CP or someplace like that. I told him because I wanted to...no tip for him. I practically crawled up to the registration counter shortly after 10 am praying that I could get an early check in. With a $20 dollar tip and a pretty please, the gal was able to get me in immediately with a view of the Bellagio fountains and Eiffel tower. THANK YOU!!!! The room was clean and quaint. I knew we just needed a place to get ready and rest our heads for an hour here and there. You can't beat the $2 hot dogs, 99c Margaritas, $2 beers and really wonderful service that this place provides. It's not fancy but I can appreciate not having to walk a mile to my room especially after some heavy drinking. The location is the BEST! I can't tell you about the food in the restaurants because I didn't try them out but the $2 hot dogs on our way to wherever we went and cheeseburgers we ordered from room service @ 5:30 am were pretty good. We were able to use the Flamingo Hilton pool right next door @ no charge. There was also an after hours club @ the hotel (Drai's) that is pretty good. Big Elvis is awesome...he can really belt out those tunes. I have to say that it was a little noisy with all the action going on outside but then again so were we. I would go back to Bill's in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “I will DEFINITELY go back to Bill's!”
Reviews.Author: PattSantaMaria_CA
Reviews.Content: I admit, I booked it because I couldn't beat the price! It was VERY reasonable, at $113 for two nights (a Wed and Thurs) including all taxes, etc., AND it is so centrally located! Our room was quite nice, very clean, COMFORTABLE bed (my poor old back can't do the standard hard hotel bed), nice tv. When we checked in, we were given the option to pay an additional $20 per night for a view room, which we decided to do. We were able to watch the Bellagio fountains dance from the comfort of our room. The window faced Bally's, so we also got the Eiffel Tower and south strip glance. I WAS surprised not to have a coffee maker, microwave or fridge in the room, but didn't really miss them. I had brought my own electric Espresso pot, which I regularly do, and we had a small ice chest we were able to keep things chilled in. The room DID include a very nice iron & board, which I didn't need. Flat screen tv, nice safe hallways, friendly staff, easy parking structure... I will positively go there whenever I go to Vegas from now on. Guests are free to use the swimming pool at the Flamingo, we did not do so. This is NOT your typical High End experience, but as a 3-star property, it fits that VERY well and so I did rate it as excellent in all regards for a 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Basic Austere & Unclean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MetropolisMark
Reviews.Content: Visiting LV for first time, but travel buddy has been 5 times - there for 9 days. Having stayed at the Golden Nugget for the first three days (which was excellent in all regards), had prebooked a room for a few days then a suite at Bill's to sample the Strip. Casino compact but all you could want including resident Elvis. Restaurant for breakfast average yet more expensive then Ceasars across the road! First room fine, but the furniture hard back chairs didnt make it comfy. Rooms bit dark due to small windows with decorative bars over them. Biggest dissapointment was the suite. The double doors looked impressive, what was beyond them was not. The jacuzzi suite was large, sofa, dining area, bathroom and also a loo off the living area. Raised whirlpool was right next to living area. which i liked! It is vegas. But the room was shabby; chipped formica, wall paper peeling, old CRT TV on a rotating plinth so you can watch tv in bed or on the large sofa. One concern was the double doors didn't close or lock very well - moving a good 3-4 inches - a good kick would have opened them. The 1980s decor grey, black and red was dated and very Miami Vice. Whirlpool huge, filled fast (switch to operate is on the wall though!) but the lining was shot, again chipped with holes in it. Returning from a day out, to find a cigar butt in the middle of the floor in the room was a bit of a concern. However, couldnt order the limited room service (kitchen closed for cleaning for 2 days) as was the famed steak house restaurant. Rooms need a refurb to match the excellent quality of the staff. The suite isn't worth the extra money, its cheap but not value for money giiven quality of the room.
