Saw Cher last night at Cesars (room included in package) and was upgraded to an amazing suite and the staff equally excellent and breakfast much better and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChaosAngel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's from april 30th - may 5th, 2010 and thought it was a pretty good hotel. It doesn't have any perks like the big hotels such as pool, spa, buffett but all could be found close by. The price was great and the location could not be beat (right in the heart of the strip). The room was large, spacious and clean. The only down side was that we found it to be kind of noisy. The sounds of doors slamming, people talking and the maids came knocking on doors unusually early (8am! in Vegas). We had an issue with our sink not draining but after reporting it to hotel staff it was fixed immediately. The only other incovienience was that power was cut for maintanence on our last day at 11pm and all we were given as compensation was a glow stick. Mighty hard to pack with the use of 1 glow stick. They should have cut power during the day when no one needs to use light switches. Anyhow, if you are looking for a less expensive, no-frills option I would recommend Bill's. You are really only in your room to sleep and Bill's is in the perfect location on the strip. No in room safe, coffee maker or fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for price”
Reviews.Author: NoelMcKinley
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, great view of the fountains, room was large and clean but no room safe. No waiting to check in. Food in victorian cafe excellent aspecially $10 chinese menu, one portion enough for two. Bill's casino very friendly and busy. $5 minumum bet. 99c Margeritas and $2 beers. Used the Flamingo hotel pool next door for free. If you want to save your money for gambling and eating then at $40/night go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Check it out closely”
Reviews.Author: donrix
Reviews.Content: Their ad suggests you have internet access. This costs $11.99 per day, per computer. I booked what I thought would be a non-smoking room. Attitude of hotel staff: "Well, we don't have one, and your reservation did not mention it." They smoke in this hotel, folks! Was promised a non-smoker the following day. Parking is free, but you must go down to the casino level and then back up another in elevator to get to your room. They want everyone to visit the casino. Beds are comfortable, but it is a busy hotel, and you don't have a refrig. Centrally located on the strip, nice TV, and a business desk. Just research it well before making your choice here. I'd personally go somewhere else the next time. Never liked a smoking room!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bills!”
Reviews.Author: lakehartwellgirl
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at Bill's. The hotel is in a great location right in the middle of the strip! I booked a "cheap" room and at check in the ladies were extremely nice and gave us a strip view room. We could see the Bellagio fountains and the eiffle tower. I was extremely pleased with the hotel. The food was great at the Victorian Room and the hotdog stand ($2 hotdogs) was awesome!!! Never a wait for the elevator, room was very clean with a comfy bed and bathroom was nothing to write home about but it had plenty of hot water and worked just fine (what more could I ask for). The hotel is older and nothing fancy like the other hotels, but the convenience of coming in and out was worth it. I have been to Vegas twice before and stayed with Harrah's both times, and getting up to your room to drop things off or make a quick stop can take a while. Bills locations and size was very convenient to us. Several reviews mentioned the noise at Bill's and the noise from the strip can be heard from your room if the bathroom window is open. When the window is closed it muffles out the noise and if you are sitting in the room without the TV on, yes you can hear the strip below. However, for us it wasn't an issue. By the time we were back at the room, we were dead tired and could have slept through a hurricane! Be sure to check out the Big Elvis show it was great! We didn't go to Drais night club so I can't offer any advice there, over all experience with Bill's was great. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Habby31
Reviews.Content: Bill's is dead center on the strip, easy check in/check out, clean rooms, nice beds and Plasma TV's. Great staff and a nice little casino and sports betting area. Great deals at the bar and Big Elvis 3 times a day. My room had a good view of the strip and The Bellagio fountains. Best of all it's priced very nicely. Restaurant always had a very long lineup but who cares, there's so many restaurants within a short walk. Poker "room" is not great, but it does have the lowest limit games on the strip. Nice poker rooms at Flamingo, Imperial Palace, O'Shea's are a short walk away as are high end rooms like Bellagio. Arguably the best location on the strip because it's only a 198 room hotel you're literally 3 minutes from your room to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again --- You have been Warned!!!”
Reviews.Author: bruce58ny
Reviews.Content: Well I also read all the trip advisor comments on what a great place to stay this was. A little gem. Well if you do not plan on any sleep time then maybe this hotel is for you. However, my wife and I got no sleep. Seemed like the street was right in our room what a lack of privacy. I mean we like to go out and have a good time but you do need a place to unwind and relax and I am telling you THIS IS NOT THE PLACE. We checked out and went to the Flamingo rate was less and room was much better. Oh and to top of our poor experience at Bills they are telling Expedia we stayed 2 nights versus 1 so we arn't getting all our money back. Avoid this place you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Total disaster. Cleaner stole USD 1000 of designer clothes, hotel manager rebuffed us.”
Reviews.Author: dtanner
Reviews.Content: We know for fact that some designer clothes we left in the room were actually handed in to a cleaner, whose name we identified. Hotel management stated the cleaner "threw the brand new, clean clothes away". A total lie of course. They refused to discuss the matter, and refuse to respond to our e-mails asking for compensation. We here this is par for the course in Las vegas. Hotel management were extremely rude and ruined our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for the price.”
Reviews.Author: TeresaTennessee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bill's Gambling Hall from April 17-21, 2010. This is a nice hotel. It was very clean & the bed was comfortable. I requested a strip view (small charge) and was able to see the Billagio fountains from our window (no balcony). The price was very good, check in and out was painless and quick. I wish the room had a small refrigerator. The A/C is kind of loud if that bothers you. There is really no lobby and is not as plush and fancy as some of the other hotels. There is no pool. If you are waiting for transportation, you cannot see them without being outside. Take a taxi from the airport, it is the same price as the vans with no waiting ($12). This hotel is a good value and very clean. The room was always cleaned promptly and very well.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice for me”
Reviews.Author: rochesterNY
Reviews.Content: My husband indulged me in a solo trip to Las Vegas as he is not a gambler, (with the exception that he married me.. lol...) We had previously stayed at Bally's which was fine, but, being alone, I wanted something different with shorter hallways. Bill's was the perfect choice for me. On the plus side, of course, is the location. It is right at the main four corners of the strip. You can hop from one casino to another, as so many casinos are within an easy walk. You are located in the heart of the Vegas street life, with outdoor bars and music and people watching. it is a very safe location. If you play limit 2-4 Texas Holdem poker, you are right next door to the Flamingo , which is the best place for this game. Bill's is about 10 yards to get to the Flamingo poker room. closer than if you stayed at the Flamingo. That is where I spent most of my time, but with less commotion. (see next paragraph.) Bill's is uncomplicated. There is little to no wait for check in, little to no wait for an elevator which is right near the registration desk, and easy access to your room at all times of the day or night. The hotel has only four floor of rooms, and it is a short walk to your room. Bill's is fun. The free Elvis show and the karaoke time after the show is so much fun. People sit and have a drink or get up and dance or move around on the carpet. Bill's is friendly. You can sit on a chair at the show and talk to other guests and feel as if you have known them forever. The casino is hopping with folks having fun and it is well known for its atmosphere. The rooms at Bill's are very spacious, 400 square feet, and well appointed. Nothing too fancy but certainly attractive, with flat screen TVs and comfort. The only negative would be that there is no comfy chair in the room, so you have to watch TV on the bed. There is both a desk and a table and chairs in the room. The bathroom has a nice touch with a stain glass window. The restaurant, Victoria's, is charming with stain glass windows and the rich dark wood,,with good food, priced slightly below other strip restaurants for meals.There is also an expensive steak house and a Starbucks on premises. There was not a line to get seated. The casino also has the Victorian theme with the rich dark woods and the gorgeous Victorian chandeliers. I loved the charm, and I prefer it absolutely to the more modern and huge casinos, Bill's is good value. The rooms were affordable and you can ask for the AAA discount of 10%. My only negative was that I couldn't find a cab lined up when I wanted to go to the airport, so I rolled my small suitcase over to the Flamingo. I am sure that the front desk would have called one for me, had I alerted them, but I didn't think of it at the time, but there are generally a couple cabs that are in front of the hotel entrance. ( Cab was $13 plus tip) I highly recommend Bill's for an easy, uncomplicated experience. If you want the glitz and commotion of a bigger place, you might be disappointed, but if you want good value with Victorian charm , nice rooms, and a short walk to many casinos, you will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: zephed64
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on this site and the perfect location in the middle of the strip, I booked 4 nights. Upon arrival my card keys didn't work. No biggie. Went down to get another set. These didn't work. They sent the Bell man up with me in case I was a moron and didn't know how to use the card keys. His master worked, mine didn't. They sent a great guy from engineering. It took him 3 tries including reprogramming the lock. Ok, small hiccup. Still open minded. Then I flush the toilet and it is clogged. I put a call in before I go out on the town and I leave a note with tip for housekeeping to change one of the 4 small pillows from a Down to a foam one as I am allergic. I return and the pillow is still there. My daughter uses the toilet in the morning and it is clogged again. They probably plunged it instead of snaking it. I go to front desk and tell them about the toilet and ask for the pillow to be changed. Ashley tells me that they will remove the pillow but since I have only two people in the room, I don't need 4 pillows. Yeah huh??? The final night my daughter has a early flight so we hit the sack...only to be awakened by people partying in the hallway...while I call down to the desk, a huge fight breaks out in the hallway...security and police respond....more yelling ensues. Needless to say, not much sleep for the both of us. While I understand this place is not the Bellagio, I expect the toilets to work at the very least. The bathrooms are very outdated. They have an after hours night club that closes at 10am. This puts a lot of drunken, violent A H's in the lobby area waiting on cabs. The location is great...it is a shame that it is the only thing.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: DomZRoss
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a friend, I booked us into Bill's, and it was the best move ever. Vegas laws allow you to take booze anywhere, so why not stay in the cheapest place on the strip (opposite the Bellagio and Caesars) The breakfast is unbeatable, the rooms top notch, and the location (for the money) second to none. Don't even consider Circus Circus et al, Bill's is the place to be, and the rail from Ballys over the road takes you North of the strip to the Stratosphere in no time. Unless I could afford a suite at the Bellagio, I would stay nowhere else. Also, don't expect free WiFi, Vegas wants you to gamble not browse the net, but you can pay $14 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: rdhopkinson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bill's for 1 night. We spent 3 nights at the Mirage and drove out of town for a few days and returned to Vegas for 1 night before flying out. We wanted to stay in a smaller hotel that was easier to get in and out of than one of the larger resorts but still wanted to be in the heart of the strip. Bills is in a great location, probably the best on the strip. It was very easy to get in and out of. We booked a standard room and was upgraded to a suite at check-in. Our room was on the NW corner and overlooked Ceasars and the Flamingo and was very nice. The staff was Extremely nice and helpful!! Probably the friendliest people I have ever seen in Vegas. The hotel and room were very clean. We did see a bug in our room, but no biggie, that could happen anywhere. I would say the only thing to consider is the noise. If you are a light sleeper, this is not the place to stay. The Flamingo has music blaring pretty much non-stop and you can hear a lot of the action down on the street. It is tolerable, but still a little noisy. We would definately stay here again if we were in town for a day or two but would prefer to stay at the Mirage, MGM, TI, etc...for a longer period. Overall a very nice stay and great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, street noise a tad loud at night but hey its VEGAS BABY!!”
Reviews.Author: rainbowren
Reviews.Content: We stayed 27th - 29th March, we did the mandatory road trip from L.A. Unfortunately we hadn't prebooked accommodation but I had browsed some places to stay beforehand so we just poppd into Bills to see what they had available...It was the weekend and springbreak to boot so instead of paying $45 per night which is the standard we paid $165 per night for the first 2 nights and $45 for our last nite. We got a room on the 5th floor - it was a smoking floor but our room had an excellent view of the Bellagio fountains which more than made up for paying a more expensive price. We ate at the restaurant downstairs(The Victorian) once...it was pretty average. We instead chose to eat out at various places up the strip - The Hardrock Cafe is always a staple that doesn't disappoint plus there was a great food hall at the Venetian that we ate at as well. The noise at night was quite full on but its what you expect for vegas. For its position and normal standard price I think its worth staying at bills. Free parking too!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value And Location”
Reviews.Author: gotpunk200202
Reviews.Content: was able to check in at 9am on a sunday after a fight---try that anywhere else in vegas Had room 452 end of the hall way on the flamingo road side---- never had any problem with noise---Strip to my room less then 5 mins all times of the day Felt safe at all times, Only problem was the shower was slow to drain but i had a window in my shower so i watched many fountian shows from my shower----amazing stay very liber with the drink while playing video poker at the bar ----great stay cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: broddles2
Reviews.Content: Bill's Gamblin' Hall and Saloon is great place to stay at a reasonable price ,right on the strip, if you want a peaceful holiday I suggest you stay off the main strip. The staff at the reception desk were wonderful, only too happy to look anything up for you. The Elvis show is really good and well worth taking time out to watch, the rooms are big with plenty of space . if possible try to get a room that overlooks the Bellagio and watch the fountain display . It is easy to catch a cab as they pull up right at tha front door, I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, mostly good food.”
Reviews.Author: MissouriAmazon
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. It was nowhere near as fancy as most hotels on the trip. Think cheap eats and drinks in a slightly shabby English Pub-type setting. I didn't have good luck with the slots, but I just piddle around, I'm not a serious gambler. Our room wasn't fancy but was comfortable. The only thing I'd change is a taller showerhead. I'm 5'11 and I had to bend all around to get under the thing. We went from March 29-April 2 and got a really good rate coupled with an Allegiant air flight. The hotel was running a prime rib dinner special for $14.99 at the Victorian, which aside from occasional specials was overpriced. The prime rib was wonderful and HUGE, it had to be at least 16 oz. They under-cooked it a bit so we had to send it back, so be mindful of that. When it came back, it was perfect. The other special was from midnight to 6am and was a"Ribeye" and eggs (with hash browns and toast) for $5.99. Ribeye was a bit of a stretch, think more like a breakfast sirloin. But after a few drinks, what does it matter? And the drinks, there were 99 cent margaritas, as well as 99 cent Newcastle beer (that they ran out of one night.) Now keep in mind, the margaritas came in the small clear plastic glasses so they weren't huge, but they were pretty potent. The red flavor was very sweet, we preferred the lime margaritas. Basically, they were a little cup of slushie mix with alcohol mixed in. Not very fancy, but addictive. The location of this hotel is wonderful, it's pretty much in the middle of the strip, with the Flamingo on one side and a street and Bally's on the other. One downfall: this hotel doesn't have a pool and it is free to use the Flamingo's, you show them your room key. The hotel staff was neutral. They weren't overly friendly, but they were sufficient. The room was very comfortable, and it should be noted we were on the "quiet" side of the hotel, the north side. So we had no view to speak of (unless you consider the side of the Flamingo as scenery) but we didn't hear the foot traffic. The air conditioner was pretty loud, but we like white noise. I did not go to Drai's, the nightclub. I would stay again, I suggest it for those of you that don't require too fancy a place and like good prices!

Reviews.Title: “What's not to Love about Bill's”
Reviews.Author: Andy61Sydney
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out Bills lived up to its reputation......comfortable, great location and affordable....Bill’s is right in the middle of the Strip...easy to get in and out of...great staff...perfect for the traveller looking for the “Vegas Experience”...we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, cheap but what a location!!”
Reviews.Author: Pusskka
Reviews.Content: Bill's was comfortable. Friendly housemaid staff, but unfriendly reception/clerk staff. Vegas is vegas, it is sin city, but the bed was large, the bathroom was adequate and the location was fanastic; right in the heart of the strip. We got $40 mid week and $70 weekend prices, including taxes, so very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: powdering
Reviews.Content: Bill's probably has one of the best locations on the Strip - you're right in the middle of everything! Rooms are basic but are clean and larger than expected. Bed was very comfortable, although the pillows were average. The Hotel itself is on the smaller side but easy to navigate - although the smoke can get a bit much at times. It has a discount ticket booth for last minute shows but is super busy so you may be better off checking out the booth near the Flamingo next door. It's a shame this place doesn't offer free wi-fi and instead chooses to charge it's guests $12 per day, but with such a low rate maybe you get what you pay for. The only really negative experience was when the alarm went off in our room on the first night (after 15 hours in transit). It was deafening and took too long to disable. No explanation or apology was offered. Otherwise Bill's offers value for money and easy access to other casinos on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “This will be my choice every time.”
Reviews.Author: nichellecr
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the great reviews on tripadvisor. I paid $55 per night and was upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. The previous two nights I had stayed at the Luxor, and by my third night I was relieved to stay in a place where I didn't get lost, where I could find the restrooms, and which had a handy little counter where I could purchase small snacks and bottled water for a reasonable price. The staff was friendly and helpful. My room was clean and comfortable. This is an older hotel, not nearly as glitzy as most, but the value, the service, and the location are excellent. This is not a luxury hotel, so if you want that and you can pay hundreds per night, this might not be your place. For the rest of us mere mortals, Bill's is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Poor Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jashb012
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading a lot of reviews of the hotel, I decided to take a chance. The location is unbeatable. It's in the middle of the strip and no more than a 10 minute walk to most of the action on the strip. The rooms are clean and neat. The bathrooms are very old. If you have any desire or need to take a bath then stay somewhere else. The rooms do not have safes! You must use a safe deposit box at the casino cage which is very inconvenient. The City is working on Flamingo Blvd. at night. If your room is facing Bally's then you are certain to hear the noise. The room doors have too much of a gap at the bottom. You can easily hear noises from the hallway. Saturday night was very disturbing as people made a lot of noise in the hallway. One day we came back to the room only to hear the people in the room next door having very loud sex. There is an elevated crosswalk that connects Bill's and Bally's. It apparently is a favorite hangout for the homeless. A group of them were singing into the wee hours of the morning on Saturday. I didn't intend for this to be so negative... you'd be much better off staying at the Flamingo or Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and an ideal location in the Strip”
Reviews.Author: wabouxena
Reviews.Content: Hotel located 5 min walk from the Bellagio and the Cesear Palace. We were lucky to have our regular 2 queen beds updated to a suite for free. And what a suite!!! Great off-season deals. Would definitively go back.

Reviews.Title: “best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: jamseattle1
Reviews.Content: Bill's gets 5 stars for value, without question. Our room was plenty big, very clean, and had a great bathroom with a fantastic shower. We averaged fifty bucks a night (Sunday, Monday, Tuesday), but I believe it's more on the weekends. The location can't be beat--right smack in the middle of the Strip. The staff was helpful and friendly, and check-in was a breeze. Nice flat-screen TV. The only thing missing was a chair or two in the room--really the only place to sit was on the bed. Our room was toward the back, so we only heard the occasional siren; other than that it was quiet. I would absolutely stay here again. This is NOT a luxury hotel, or a romantic one (unless you find frugality sexy), but if you're looking for great value and a perfectly decent room in a central location, Bill is your man.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: workabull
Reviews.Content: For all the hotel choices that there are on the strip, Bill's Gamblin' Hall is fantastic. We have stayed at Bill's once or twice a year for the past few years (yes, before it was renamed) and we have have always had a great time there. They have pretty much everything you need all in one spot. If you are looking for a pool, they share one next door along with facilities. The restaurants are both very good, the tables are cheap, the dealers (most them!) are friendly. Although it is an older hotel, all the rooms are very nicely furnished, the mattresses are comfy (and new) and are all very clean. We would highly recommend this as the best value on the strip and look forward to our next visit this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: BamaFanBW
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice, and restaurant on floor had nice inexpensive breakfast special. Stayed week of our wedding we had at Chapel of the Flowers

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaDoglover_50
Reviews.Content: Agree with all other reviews, great location and nice stay for the price. No parking fees and no resort fee. My only complaint was the mysterious elevator-type whoosing--though I was 1/2 way down the hall from the elevator. It seemed to happen every 30 seconds to 2 or 3 minutes. If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs. Overall, GREAT stay at great price.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the strip, good value, stepping back in time”
Reviews.Author: worldclassinspector
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and got a good deal. Rooms are big and resemble old western style, yet clean. A charming casino downstairs, free parking and again, right on the strip! Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Wookie1966
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we checked in immediately. I asked that they upgrade our room for free and they were happy to give us a room with a view of the Strip instead of the Flamingo behind the hotel. Be aware if you are a light sleeper then the noise from all the traffic on the Strip might not be for you. Bill's is located in the heart of the Strip and has easy walking access to all the mega hotels. The casino is small and quaint. Learn to play craps if you don't know. It's fun to play and meeting a table full of gamblers that cheer and moan at the same time makes all the better. The room was larger than a standard hotel room. It's by no mean glamourous but it was clean and had a nice 42" flat screen TV. The restaurant in the hotel wasn't that good. We had the chinese buffet and it was tasteless. All in all for what you pay is very reasonalbe for what you get. I would stay at Bill's again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: herminator
Reviews.Content: I go to Las Vegas 4-5 times a year and for the first time stayed at Bills this past weekend. The rates are competitive and the rooms are pretty nice. Obviously I didnt spend alot of time in the room but the beds were comfortable for sleeping and the bathroom adequate. The wall mounted heating/cooling unit is loud but tolerable. Plenty of drawers for clothes but limited space to hang items. One thing I did like about the room was that there was a window that opened in the bathroom to let fresh air in; of course with its location that also means that the noise comes in but you're in Vegas so deal with it. Every service worker I came across in the hotel and casino were very friendly except for the bartenders. They were under staffed at the main bar so waits for drinks were longer than should be. The location cant be beat at mid strip. One drawback is that the casino is very smokey. The carpet is worn, not as clean as other casinos but on the plus side, the table limits are low and dealers friendly. Overall a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice older casino”
Reviews.Author: shock43
Reviews.Content: We liked our room to the back on the top floor. We liked the older woodwork and the large rooms. Nice new TV. They brought a coffee pot. Great parking, restaurant is nice and fancy, good service. Can only highly recommend, especially for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Older hotel”
Reviews.Author: millersokc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite. It was old but clean. For the price, I was a little let down. I'd stay at Bill's (in a regular room next time) if I were looking for a price saver on the strip. Don, the bell-man was a great help, and Monica, a waitress there, remembered what we were drinking, and never let us run out. (weather we ordered or not..) The service was really good. Our room was on the 1st floor.. SO needless to say we heard everything happening on the strip all night.. Jackhammers under our window, honking taxi's, other doors slamming.. (etc) The picture online is prettier than in person. As I said before, I'd stay again, definately not in a suite, if I were looking for a great location and a cheap room.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: jenpauleva
Reviews.Content: Let me start first by telling you that this place is a little gem in vegas. The reason I stayed at Bills is because of all of the good reviews on here. And let me tell you, I want you to belive. Now if your expecting top of the line rooms and casinos you may be let down but you want a clean nice average room and great nightly FREE entertainment...stay here. The room are decent in size and VERY clean. The only bad thing's I would say is: 1. The drains in the shower do not drain well so you have water up to your ankles when you shower 2. The drink service when your gaming SUCKS!!!! I dont think I got a "free" drink there once 3. The cocktail waitress on karoke night is mean, unless you are a man. We tipped her $1 a drink for every drink we had ( and belive me-we had many) but we just started going to the bar so no biggie there So 3 bad things....now the good sun-wed FREE karoke..now I am telling you and trust me this is entertaining, the dealer at the tables are sooo nice to even the most ditzy of us ( ME), huge tv in the rooms, clean, clean, clean hotel! Great staff and bell hops, good 2 buck hot dogs. 1 margaritas 5 dollar vodka and rell bull, 2 dollar coors light, great view from room and LOCATION< LOCATION-LOCATION!!!!!!!!!!!! You are sooo close to everything, right on the strip! Im telling you--just try to stay here once..you wont be let down!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: sleepless66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I , father-in law, with girlfriend , stayed here last summer. The weather was very hot, but the tram system they have is great and air conditioned!. Get an all day round trip and your set! Bill's was excellent, we hit a few times on the machines it's a casual atmostphere. Very easy to get from casino floor to room. We stayed during the week on the street side, the hallways were not noisy with late night people, street is busy but it's Vegas!! The location can't be beat, right across the street from Ceasars, Bellagio, and Bally's . Walking distance to the Mirage, Venetian, Treasure Island. The Flamingo is almost adjacent and the pool is excellent, get there early! You get complimentary access to their pool. Will be going again in May! The price won't be beat anywhere else. Rooms are spacious and tv's are new beds are good!! My father-in -law left his camera behind in the room when we left for the airport. they found it for him mailed it back free of charge!! How nice is that!! Very good staffing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent centre strip accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Trig-Meister
Reviews.Content: What can i say....Excellent all round hotel in the centre of the Vegas Strip...Was worried about some comments that I had read about noise...hello this is Vegas 24/7 what do you expect....but the noise didnt bother us....we had a great room with views of the Eifel Tower and Bellagio Fountains, how fantastic... The room was large very clean and had everything you needed...Staff were very friendly nothing was too much trouble...never stayed in Vegas before but if I was to return Bills it would be, after walking and searching all other hotels on the strip I was so pleased we has opted for Bills all others were so much busier and took so long to get anywhere in them....Our first night arrival in Vegas we stayed at Circus Circus before a trek to Salt Lake city...this hotel was smelly and huge, we were hour and half checking in...Bills was pleasant and a huge 5 min check in...Great place and would def recommend to anyone going....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Tinlemon
Reviews.Content: Guest Stats: 2 couples/2 rooms, ages 26-30, enjoy upscale restaurants, shows, and gambling... we don't do the clubs. After being a little timid about staying at Bill's because I wasn't sure if Bill's would be a dive or not, I'm happy to say that we had a very pleasant stay and would certainly stay there again. The rooms were large, clean, and well appointed. The halls were kept clean and overall noise was no different than any other hotels, which is to say that you hear people coming and going throughout the night but nobody was loud or obnoxious. I equate it to staying at a nice Holiday Inn Express or something along those lines. If I was looking to have a truly special trip in Vegas (anniversary, birthday, etc) I'd probably consider one of the other hotels, but if you're in town just to have a good time then I would not hesitate to stay here, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive for on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Kbarber2007
Reviews.Content: The rooms were satisfactory. The food was overpriced but good. Easy walking to great strip locations. Casual atmosphere with lower table antes than most strip casinos.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: keights
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on my route home from another trip and found it via reviews on Trip Advisor. Good price (under $50 USD per night). Great location, right in the middle of the strip. Front desk, Bell Desk, and restaurant service all excellent. This is not a top of the line hotel but it is clean and tidy, has a restaurant on sight, and is close to everything you would like to see. I felt perfectly safe staying there on my own. My only complaint would be that the windows do not open, and the air conditioner was very loud and needs to be replaced. Ask for a room at the back of the hotel as there is construction going on in the street in front.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: IdahoPug
Reviews.Content: I attented a conference at Caesar's Palace in January and found the "special rate" of $149 a night there just a little pricy, so I took a chance and booked across the street at Bill's for $40. Glad I did! The room was spacious and comfortable, and the view much better than my colleagues had over at the fancy property. Me: The Strip and the Bellagio fountains, Them: Pipes and ducts. The downside of a view room is traffic noise and the music and roar from the fountains. Light sleepers, take heed! :) Bill's is a fun little casino. Early in the evening the lounge act is an Elvis impersonator, and later there is karaoke certain nights and bands other nights. All employees I met were friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurant (The Victorian Room) was excellent and a great value. The 9.99 Chinese special would have been plenty for two people. It was crowded the morning I left and I had to catch a shuttle, so I had coffee and a bagel at the Seattle's Best coffee bar. One thing I appreciated was the short distance from the side taxi entrance to the hotel desk and to the elevators. No Bataan Death March, hauling luggage across acres of casino floor. Can't wait to return and stay at Bill's again -- but next time for a real vacation, not attending a conference!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: thebookends
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here two nights as a rest stop on our cross-country drive to California. We had stayed here on our honeymoon in 2000 when is was the Barbary Coast. The location is fantastic, with the Flamingo, Bally's, Caesar's Palace, and the Bellagio as your neighbors. For a few dollars more per night you can request a room the overlooks the Bellagio Fountains. We paid about $40 a night and the room was pretty nice. We are not into the whole gambling thing, we just basically love Vegas to walk around, eat, and people watch, so the fact it is a very small casino/hotel didn't affect. Bottom line is, you can't get a better location on the strip for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Berrnie
Reviews.Content: We checked into Bill's after spending alot of money for two average nights at the Venetian. We couldn't have been happier. We didn't book, just checked in directly off that street for US40 per night. Rooms were spacious and clean. We had an excellent view of the strip from our room - across to the Bellagio fountains. All the staff were extremely courteous and helpful. If I were ever to go back to Vegas - this is were I'd stay, without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “best on strip location in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SatuLagi17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 2nd trip to Vegas but the first time staying at Bill's and we would definately stay there again. No waiting for anything - check-in, lifts etc. We stayed at the Paris last time and it took us longer to get to the Eiffel tower restaraunt from our room in Paris then from our room in Bills.... The staff at Bills were so friendly but 2 deserve a special mention - Mike at the Bell Desk was so helpful and genuinely friendly he remembered our names and chatted to us almost daily he organised tours for us with Pink Jeep and they were fantastic. The other person was Rahel a cocktail waitress who remembered what we drank and when she saw us at the slots would just bring drinks over to us, and before she went on her break she would bring drinks. I can not stress how nice everyone was and the location was walking distance to most places on the strip very central and The Deuce Bus was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's is the place”
Reviews.Author: EGScooterLady
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Bill's for 5 days and the staff at Bill's are the best. We had a very comfortable room and the service was great. I plan to stay there the next time i go to Vegas. This was the 3rd or 4th time I have stayed there and I would recommend it to my family and friends anytime. E. Dorchester, MA

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Bills”
Reviews.Author: bernerse
Reviews.Content: Second stay at Bills and would definitely stay again. Great value for the money, great location and clean rooms. Not your fancy Vegas hotels but you will not be disappointed. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly and helpful and can't beat the location or value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: FireElfShimmer
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at Bill's after reading the reviews here at Tripadvisor and realizing the cost of our 3 nights at Bill's was equal to one night at the other casinos on the strip that we were considering. We didn't spend a lot of time in our rooms on this trip. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, the thermostat was easy to use, and the room was spacious. The bathroom was a little on the small side and we wished it had an exhaust fan to help get the steam after two showers moving, but all in all it was a good experience. The staff for the hotel and on the casino floor were great! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Amazing Time!”
Reviews.Author: nuttyelvis
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my first visit to las Vegas...trusted Bill's to provide me with those many fond memories of that first trip...Bill's lived up to all my expectations and then some! Loved everything about it...yes it may have somewhat of a wild west theme...but its cosy and friendly...and just so centrally located to everything on the strip! Rooms were clean, and spacious...food and drinks were reasonably priced...I couldn't have asked for a better time! Well maybe if the machines hadn't been so darn tight! but hey they were the same at all the casinos...and trust me...we tried them all! Best paying machines seemed to be at the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bill's location!”
Reviews.Author: 4Hawkeyes
Reviews.Content: Bill's is smack-dab in the middle of the strip so it was the perfect location for us to spend a few days with our adult children. We walked everywhere! Upon arrival the staff was helpful and check-in was quick. The view from each room was nice. One room had the perfect view of the Eiffel Tower at Paris and a partial view of the Belliago fountains! We were able to be across the hall from one another. The hallways were a bit noisy so when going there again we would ask for rooms at the far end of the hall. Bill's was very easy to get in and out of quickly. They had a nice casino area and entertainment. There is even a discount ticket booth right next to one of the entrances so we utilized that as well. All-in-all Bill's is a terrific place!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Spyro
Reviews.Content: I think Bill's is one of the best 'cheap' hotels I have ever stayed at. We paid around $25aud per night for the room. The room was spacious and the air con worked spot on, easily adjusted to suit our needs. The tele was nice and big which suited my son greatly. Staff were friendly and helpful and Bill's is handy to the other more expensive Casino's. Access to the monorail is across the road at Bally's - I loved the place and personally couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Make this your base....”
Reviews.Author: HyacinthLondon
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Las Vegas to celebrate my partner's 40th, and stayed at Bill's. We was given a great room with views over the fountains of Bellagio, and we felt Bill's gave very good value for your money unless you wish to have superior luxury! Bill's long corridors with large sized bedrooms are clean, well serviced (you can ask for a fridge - needs to say it for medical supplies!) and although the interior design may be a bit sombre and dark, the location of Bill's gives it a particular edge over much more expensive hotels nearby. We used the Flamingo next door as an extension of Bill's and prefered the restaurants there compared to the 24/7 cafe at Bills that often had long queues and not as good food as at the Flamingo. Bill's also got a good sized car park so just drive in and park, and take the lift down to the casino or your room. As a guest of Bill's you can also use the Flamingo Pool, but that was packed and unless you enjoy the crowds and pop music - something to be avoided! Bill's also got a small shop in the casino so you can buy water, drinks or a small selection of medical supplies around the clock. Fast check in and check out - compared to the larger hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: vermilch
Reviews.Content: When we arrived late on Saturday night we were given a smoking room on the 2nd floor facing Bally's. The room wasn't smoky but you could hear a lot of noises from the street. The next night we moved to a forth floor room with a view of the Bellagio Fountains. This room was spacious, clean and much less noisy. We ate at the restaurant twice and enjoyed the $14.99 prime rib and Chinese food. Great location in the middle of the strip. We will stay at Bill's again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Wendybel
Reviews.Content: Spacious clean rooms. Good location on the strip. Victorian Room has excellent food. TKTS4TNITE - half price show tickets is in one corner of the hotel, a bonus to staying at Bills.

Reviews.Title: “Best affordable stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: travelmore12
Reviews.Content: This place is great! Rooms are spacious and updated. We had a quiet room on the top floor and had no problems sleeping at all. The bed is really comfortable. Everything is modern and really nice. Staff service is better than you would expect. The casino had good pitcher specials and was not too smokey like other reviews stated. This casino is easy to get in and out of from walking or by car. Free parking was great and you don't have to walk a mile to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: vb22
Reviews.Content: I have to preface my review with the note that I have not been to Las Vegas since the mid to late 1990's and it has never been one of my favourite places. I recently attended a convention in Las Vegas and stayed a couple of extra days after the meetings. Upon recommendation from fellow colleagues I booked into Bill's Gamblin Hall and Saloon. The rates varied per night - from a high of $100 to a low of $40. Took a cab from the airport here - it is a shame the monorail is blocked from being extended to the airport and it is doing so poorly that it will likely be in chapter 11. The cab cost $20 - and the airport is essentially in-town! A place like this should have decent mass transit! The nice thing about this property: it doesn't have 4-digit number of rooms like a city until itself. Just a simple couple of person check-in area and four or five floors. This is what I remember a lot of Las Vegas being like decades ago ... Check-in was quick and efficient. The only complaint I had was the room on the street side (Flamingo) of the hotel. The first night I found the noise was a bit much: the traffic plus people and the audio from Lake Vegas a half a block down the strip (fountain music show). I would suggest asking for a room on the back side of the hotel or further from the main intersection. Rooms are fairly basic but clean. There was a large (42-inch?) plasma TV on the wall albeit it was fed with analog signals (and stretched to fit the HD format screen). They should think about upgrading their in-house cable system to provide digital and HD content. There is no safe in the room and no closet; your clothes hang in an area near the sink (which was fine). The amenities were nice but nothing out of the ordinary. Then again - what do you expect for the price? You can't beat the location. As far as I'm concerned - this is pretty much centrally located on the strip. And we walked up past Wynn and equally as far in the other direction. You can also get to a monorail stop in a minute or two from Bill's (we met people at the Flamingo hotel monorail stop). Bills has a tickets for less booth inside the casino (on the corner) - there are a number of these throughout the city / strip. We were able to get half-price tickets for the Blue Man Group. Much better than the $143 "list" price! The hotel also has FREE parking. Amazing - considering what you pay for hotel parking in a lot of other big cities. For the last day of our stay I rented a car on-line and picked it up at a nearby hotel. This worked out well as I kept the car, didn't pay anything for parking and dropped it off at the airport - saving a return cab fair. The only thing that wasn't free at Bills was the Internet access. But it seems like most of the hotels charge you - in this day and age I have just come to expect that some kind of free Internet access is available and usually only stay in hotels that provide such. Bills does have both wired and WiFi access. Through a menu choice on the TV you can get your access code (which also causes billing to your room). Didn’t eat whilst at Bills - but did have drinks in the casino, or saloon. Drink prices were quite reasonable - I was surprised. Can't say anything about the gambling as we didn't blow any money here or anywhere else. I'm sure there are other hotels in Vegas where you can get rates like $40. If I found one - I would probably consider it (as long as it was one of the major properties). But otherwise, I'll definitely stay at Bill's again and same some $$$. No need to pay ridiculous rates in other places when you can pretty much go into any property and enjoy the surroundings, gamble, have a meal or show, etc.

Reviews.Title: “"The Best"”
Reviews.Author: slamminsam
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Bills and this trip is no exception, several things make this the best place... 1. No Taxi line, this may seem a small thing but standing for 10min in 110deg does not appeal, at Bills, just ask the concierge to call a cab 2. Is any hotel closer to the strip, I reckon 3 mins from Las Vegas BLVD to my bed 3. Great price, save your dollars for the casino 4. Super clean and spacious rooms, flat screen TV in all 5. Location, 5 mins walk from Cesars, Paris, Ballys and Bellagio, maybe 7 to Planet Hollywood, $5 cab ride to The Palms or Rio 6. Big Elvis plays for free 7. Drais, the best after hours club in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Best location, good value, great steak!”
Reviews.Author: JoPattern
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, spacious clean room, and a restaurant that serves large well cooked meals what more could you want? Answer a few more hangers! Honestly this is the only fault we could find during our stay. We did not want to drive and found that the public buses that run up and down the strip every few minutes for $7 hop on hop off all day served us well when we didn’t want to walk. Don’t use the open top sightseeing bus, all the stops are at some back door well off the strip and cost $35 for 2 consecutive days. Bill’s Gamblin’ Hall had craps lessons and we found it ideally suited to us as first time visitors. We also used the half price ticket booth situated at the corner entrance. There is some traffic noise and the sirens were a bother one night, I guess you would find this anywhere on the strip. No tea or coffee facilities but a welcome ice machine.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and have finally found the best place to stay, Bill's. It is a $15.00 taxi ride from the airport, perfect location, next to 2 crossover sidewalks literally out the door. The staff was nice, the rooms are clean and comfortable and all rooms have a view of the strip. This is a very small hotel which means no 2 mile hikes to get to your room. They gave us a free coffee pot for our room and the restaurant was very homey. The traffic in Vegas is terrible so unless you are planning a day trip I recommend you don't bother with a car. I will NEVER stay anyother place than Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Very clean Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: adf1981
Reviews.Content: Being quite a picky traveller, when I arrived at Bills the check in desk was in the corner. I was a bit concerned on first impressions. These were gone when I arrived at the room. Very clean, large and very easy to get to, unlike some casinos. The room service is very good, and the food is good to the room. I didn't try the restaurants food. The room was cleaned every day and the maids worked very hard. The location in excellent and if you want to be in the middle of everything at an excellent rate stay here diagonal across the road from The Bellagio and across the road from caesars Palace. We stayed here for New years and then moved onto MGM grand, I would recommend a full stay here as the room was very good and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Bill's Gamblin' Hall and Saloon”
Reviews.Author: Jason_NC2010
Reviews.Content: This review is for my stay at Bill's from October 5th-11th, 2008. Stayed in room 442, had a nice view of the Bellagio water fountain (they didn't charge me extra for the room with a view). Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Had to turn on the AC at night to drown out the street noise, even on the 4th floor it could get loud. The casino was small and comfortable. Drink service was quick while playing the slots. They did check to make sure you had a room key before they let you into the hotel elevator. I had room service deliver breakfast one morning and it was amazing. That's the only time I ate at the hotel. I used the European (topless) GO pool next door at the Flamingo, it had a nice relaxed atmosphere. As a guest of Bill's you can use the Flamingo pools. Also went to the Flamingo spa, mostly just sat in the hot tub and relaxed. It was a quiet escape from the craziness of the Strip. The location can't be beat. Right across the street at Caesars palace I was able to watch them film a few scenes from The Hangover movie. Was just a few feet from the actors as they walked by in between scenes. Got to meet and have my picture taken with Pete Rose at a sports memorabilia place at Caesars. Overall this was a great hotel and I highly recommend it. Going to be going back for my second stay there in February 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Bills is the Place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CharlieMurphy78
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to the negative reviews on this site. These folks obviously didnt know they were going to LAS VEGAS!. Lets face it. Vegas is not a "family" vacation. Its an adult vacation. If you are looking for a great place to stay, that is affordable, in a great location, access to everything on the strip, cheap gambling, 99 cent newcastles, 99 cent margaritas, friendly/helpful staff, no lines for check in, easy access to your room without having to take 20-30 minutes to go from casino to room, and a whole lot of fun...the Bills is the place for you. Just returned from a Vegas New Years (which was awesome), and enjoyed every minute at Bills. We spent 5 minutes in check in...5 minutes! We were in our room and then back down to the bar in less time it took to check in. This will not happen at the larger, more expensive, less personal hotels. Had a great view of the fountains at the Bellagio. At night time the views were even more spectacular. But we didnt come for views, we came for action. And Bills puts you right in the heart of the action. Walk out (and on your way stop by and pick up a few margaritas and newcastles for your adventure) Caesar's Palace is right across the street, Ballys and Paris is to the left, Bellagio across the street, Flamingo, Harrahs right next door to the right, 15min walk to the Wynn, 10 minute walk to the Venetian, 7 minute walk to the Mirage...what else could you ask for. Do yourself a favor. Save your money for the shows, nightlife and of course some gambling...stay at Bills Gambling Hall and Saloon. And dont forget to check out a show with Big Elvis performing daily right in the casino!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: itsnotmee
Reviews.Content: Came out for birthday. Decided to try Bills for its Location and could not complain. Easy acsess to and from casino to room 4th floor Strip view. Plenty of room in room. Didnt notice all the noise other people have comminted on. Parking was a little Tricky if you are heading East on Flaminingo from Strip have to cross traffic,watch out for pedestrians, and go up a slight incline. Scared more than one Pedestrian makeing a run for it when traffic let up. Will GO BACK

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy of the Good Reviews”
Reviews.Author: David3614
Reviews.Content: Is Bill's a top 25 Las Vegas hotel? We don't think so. My two teenagers and I spent our first night, during New Years week, in a room facing the Flamingo Hotel. For some reason, there is free wireless access on that side of the hotel, but not on the other side. We upgraded the remainder of the stay to a strip view. Add a $20 upgrade fee, $20 for a second child in the room, and $12 internet fee per day, and the hotel rivals nearby hotels in price. You need to expect noise. With only four floors, the noise from pedestrians and traffic is close by. There is also noise from nearby bathrooms, and the air conditioner is intermittent and loud. The hotel also offers a free wake up call at 8:45 AM each morning as the cleaning staff knocks on every door announcing themselves. Apparently they do not know which rooms are in use, and have to knock on every one. The hotel is clean, but older. The clientele is older. Everyone smokes. The elevators should have a cancer warning label. While the view of the Bellagio fountains is dramatic, it is partially blocked by a huge television screen with a billboard of a dancer's butt located in front of Bally's Casino. The check in staff, restaurant staff and bell staff are all very good. We made quick friends with Mike, the Bell Captain, and he helped us several times during the week. While the food in the Victorian Room is very good, the restaurant is expensive and seems to have a permanent 20-45 minute wait. $5.00 for a bagel and butter? There is a Tix4Tonight outlet in the casino, which advertises show tickets for "up to 50% off." The truth is that most shows are overpriced to begin with, then marked down an average of 20%, and an undisclosed $5 per ticket fee, plus a hotel fee of up to $25 is added to the cost. The tickets are easy to access but not such a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “great place watch there billing”
Reviews.Author: peeon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel small quaint easy to get around resturant not bad food was ok just becareful if you have to change your reservation we origanilly had 3 with 2 queen beds a week before the third guest canceled so changed to 2 guest with a king size bed to make long story short i was still charged for 3 guest an extra 60 dollars i called and asked for a refund of the extra guest but was told they had no record of the reservation being changed and as far as they knew there was 3 guest sooooo all i am gonna say is great place to stay and i liked big elvis too but watch there book keeping thats not so good oh and they don't respond to your emails either

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: 1TEXAS1
Reviews.Content: Unless you want to say you stayed at the Luxor or the Venetian, stay at Bill's. You will not find a better rate and it is right in the middle of everything. This use to be the Barbary Coast until Harrah's bought it. The casino always has some $5 tables going and the steak restaurant is very good. The room is well worth the money. It was clean, big flat screen tv and a great view of the strip if you stay in a room with a low, even number. This is the best deal on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly place in a central strip location!”
Reviews.Author: PenelopevanSchliffe
Reviews.Content: Bill's was in a great location in the thick of it all, central strip. Our twin room was very clean, very comfortable, and quiet. The staff were very helpful and friendly throughout the hotel and casino. You could use the pool at the Flamingo Hotel next door. The resident BIg Elvis was great and one of the best free things to do in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: kittylout
Reviews.Content: Th'is was my first trip to vegas. I spent months researching,reading reviews and asking family who have been going there for 30 years. I chose Bill's for the small size and location.I could not have been happier!! We were right in the middle of the action of the strip but could walk in and be just a few steps from our room! No mile long walks to elevators and rooms! Our room was very clean and comfortable,the staff in every area were friendly and wonderful,the food was fantastic,the casino and Big Elvis were awesome!!! I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas and I cant wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to larger competitors on the strip”
Reviews.Author: markandjeremy
Reviews.Content: Located slap bang in the middle of Las Vegas Blvd, opposite Caesar's Palace, Bills Gamblin Hall offers everything you need at a great price. Rooms are recently refurbished and clean. The bar is very lively and a good place to end your evenings. It is well worth considering this hotel as an alternative to the sometimes faceless large competitors, especially if you have "done" the traditional strip hotels before.

Reviews.Title: “great location & price”
Reviews.Author: drsgbaker
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel from the stratosphere and couldnt believe the difference! This is a relatively small hotel compared to most on the strip but we liked the intimate atmosphere. The decor is highly stylised - "Wild west saloon" which we really liked and the gaming hall is not as intimidating (or noisy!) as some of those that we saw. Rooms were big and comfortable (2 queen beds in ours & a massive flat screen tv). Hotel is perfectly situated - slap bang in the middle of the strip practically opposite Bellagios. There's a restaurant which serves great breakfasts and hearty meals - not haute cuisine but good food, plenty of it and reasonable price. Free craps lessons every morning at 10am (which was a bit of a struggle but so glad we made it to one as not only did we learn to play a game we've never understood but went on to make USD1000 that night at the tables(beginners luck!!)). Personally i thought the only drawback was the lack of a pool but we had free use of the pool right next door at the Flamingo (although this was rammed it was a damn sight better than the stratosphere's pool area). Overall very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: dr_daggs
Reviews.Content: Financial constraints "forced" me to go to Bill's - $400 Hotel and Airfair. I was nervous that there be a lot of hourly customers. Upon check-in, I received a room on the 1st floor (of room). I was right above Flamingo Ave. and my first reaction was, I need to request a change. The room was clean, they decor was really nice, the sound was not noticable. Very well insulated, did not watch much TV but it was large LCD type maybe 50". No fridge, whirlpool tub, but friendly, clean, and functional. Excellent value, great location. I'd stay again, tight budget or just for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Strip location”
Reviews.Author: 50-and-retired
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat this hotel for the price and location. On the Strip, on the corner across from Caesar and Bally's and caddie corner from the fountians of Bellagio. We watched the fountians from our room for about $60 a night. This hotel use to be the Barbary Coast. It is about 4 stories tall and one of the oldest on the strip. The rooms have been updated since Harrah's took over in 2007, but it still has that antique feel. The casino is small, three tables located at the front door is their "poker room". Waitresses came by constantly with free drinks in the casino, even at the cheap machines. We prefer larger casinos but had some luck at their casino, It may not be a great casino, but it has a great location and is a great place to stay. The breakfast is good too.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location ... loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: FatBub
Reviews.Content: We planned our Vegas trip over a year ago and started sifting through pages and pages of hotel reviews to try and find the best place to stay. We looked at the highly priced options (my partner really wanted to stay at The Venetian, but we couldn't get a good deal for the time we were visiting). Then we started looking at the highly rated options, and Bill's came to the top, time and time again. We checked the prices and couldn't believe how low the cost would be for a hotel located in the centre of the Vegas Strip, opposite Caesar's, Bellagio, Bally's and The Paris. It seemed too good to be true, but we couldn't resist. Bill's did not disappoint. Obviously Bill's does not have the grandeur of Bellagio's lobby, the amazing shows of Caesar's or the magnificence of Paris' ornate buildings, charming Parisien streets and the half size replica of the Eiffel Tower. However, Bill's is only a few steps away from all of this - you can have it all. Our room was a double queen sized and we upgraded at check in to get a Strip view - which was the best $20 a night we could have spent. We overlooked Bellagio's fountains and it was a delight everytime they danced to a variety of different musical styles. We also had a great view of the Eiffel Tower from our room. The room was clean, and regularly serviced. For those who need it, the 40" plus sized TV is hung on the wall with all the tv and pay per view you need (we didn't switch it on at all - the Eiffel Tower and fountains were enough for us). Bill's is famous for their Steakhouse restaurant (they even have a $5.99 Steak & Eggs deal from midnight to 8am ... we never got the chance to try it out, but we spoke to several people who had been to the Steakhouse and loved it (these people came from some of the big hotels on the Strip). We did eat in the Victorian Restaurant, which is very popular - basic quick meals and a Chinese menu on top of that. We enjoyed our food before strolling over to Caesar's to see Cher in concert. No need for a taxi. There is a coffee bar (Seattle's Best) open long hours - I managed to get my much needed java before our early start for The Grand Canyon - at 5:30am! Drai's after hours lounge was highly recommended to us by our Red Rock Canyon tour guide as being one of the best in the city (we didn't have the stamina to try it out though). Caught one of the Big Elvis shows (a 300 pound Elvis impersonator) - he was awesome! Later the same day we heard a guest belting out a Phantom Of The Opera song in the Karaoke bar - he was amazing and it was hard to believe he wasn't professional - the atmosphere there was electric and good fun was had by all. In summary - as you have probably gathered - I am a big fan of Bill's Gamblin' Hall & Saloon. If you need a swimming pool and/or fitness centre you have to walk to the neighbouring Flamingo hotel. I have stayed at some of the finest hotels around the world, and yet me and my fellow travellers agreed we would stay at Bill's on our next Vegas visit. By the way, for those of you who wrote about poor service at Bill's I don't know where you got that from - everyone was so welcoming and friendly. It can be quite noisy at night (lots of sirens and car horns all through the night) so if you are a light sleeper you will need earplugs. If you want a great location and a great deal I would definitely recommend Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Bill's if you're on a budget!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMy2cents
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 11/26-11/29. Here's the deal: If you can afford to stay at the Bellagio or Caesar's...do it. Both are perfectly centered on the strip and absolutely beautiful inside! However, if you are like me and can't afford a room for $250+ a night, definitely choose Bill's. It's not beautiful, but it's really chill with an old Vegas kind of charm. And of course, it's an amazing/excellent location. I had a room with a partial strip view which was the top of the Eiffel tower, some of the fountains and some of the strip- very cool! And we didn't have ANY street noise (room 138) and they didn't charge us extra for this room. Big king bed, very roomy, nice little vanity I claimed for myself and a huge flat screen TV. I would MUCH rather choose to stay at Bill's than the Flamingo, Harrah's or Imperial...their prices/location are equivalent but they are SOOO tacky! I mean, basically just ugly and lame. There's not much going on inside and they seem old and weird. Similar to Excalibur, Circus Circus, etc. They are all just tacky and cheap. There's a difference between "inexpensive" and "cheap". Bill's is inexpensive. Plus, at least with Bill's it's got a nifty charm, you can get to your room in a snap, location is brilliant and Big Elvis headlines during the week. A few cons: 1. we couldn't get the temperature too warm, had to keep fiddling with the thermostat. 2. no real quilt on the bed...bring your own and you'll be fine. (although, you can probably ask for a thicker blanket) 3. water in the shower tends to not go down the drain very well BUT the water pressure and cool window in shower totally make up for it! The Victorian restaurant had GREAT breakfast for cheap. Yum. We didn't eat there for dinner but I highly recommend the breakfast. Really, people, choose Bill's if you can't afford the pricier hotels. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: H0ppers
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at Bill's 21-27 November 2009. We arrived mid afternoon, cab drops you off on Flamingo, 5 second walk to check-in. Check-in - no line, no wait & the receptionist even knew my name! We got rooms 222 & 216. I was in 216. It was a partial strip view, which is free, a strip view is an extra $20 a night. As you can see from the photo it's a brilliant view, eiffel tower & bellagio fountains, not sure a 'proper' strip view is needed! Rooms are large, comfy bed, clean, iron & ironing board - everything you need. Only downside was that there were roadworks right outside our room so it was noisy. However, earplugs sorted that out! And then exhaustion sorted it out the rest of the trip! We didn't do much gambling at Bills but it's worth joining the players club as we still got a free t-shirt & $16 off our hotel bill. Casino is a bit smokey but no worse than others. I think coming from England where smoking indoors is banned it's more noticiable as we're no longer used to it! Had coffee every morning from Seattles Best Coffee in the hotel - good stuff. We also had breakfast in the Victorian Room one morning - really, really good eggs benedict. Loved the location - for the price (we paid $280 + tax for 6 nights) you cannot beat this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-old but clean”
Reviews.Author: TeresaPortland_TN
Reviews.Content: Pros-Room was spacious, flat screen TV very nice, beds and pillows were very comfortable, Check in/out was simple and quick. I asked for room with a view at time of booking when I arrived was told this was $20.00/night extra, I paid it. (Was it worth it-- not sure) The staff was very gracious. Self parking (free) was a breeze, quick access to elevator. Cons- The room faced the Bellagio fountains, IF the window had been clean would have been able to see them., and the noise of the strip was annoying., we were on the 4th floor. The bathrooom lacks an exhaust fan, but at least there is a window that will open. The building is out dated, carpets clean but worn. Not sure if I would stay there again, but for a place on the strip great location, and in comparison -cheap rates it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: 2flycme
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a Vegas trip with my mom. We both liked Bill's! It is the perfect location and a great price. The casino can get very smokey but they usually leave the main doors open and once you get to the rooms we didn't notice it at all. Our room was large and faced The Flamingo. It was a bit noisey at night but we ran the heater so that drowned out some of it. It is great to come back to your hotel at the end of the night and not have to walk miles to get to your room. We did take in part of the Big Elvis Show ( free ) and wished we could have stayed longer. He was wonderful!! The 99 cent Margaritas were small but strong! I am a travel agent and would reccommend Bill's to my clients. Depending on what they were looking for. If you are wanting a great location, great price and are wanting a clean room, this is the place!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Deep in the hot of Texas
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpinyNorma
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Bill's and I love this place. Great location and the price is amazing for the location. It's a small hotel which is a real plus after a long day walking the Strip. Not having another long trek through the hotel to get back to your room will make your feet truly grateful. The only complaint I had about my stay there is that the internet connection was erratic. It kept cutting out on me which is pretty annoying for a service you have to pay extra for. Cocktail service was also slower than it used to be but that seems to be common nearly everywhere now. It seems like everywhere has cut back on their waitresses. Outside of these minor problems, it was a great stay. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: egsandclsareme
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, great views, and inexpensive! They also make the strongest free drinks you will find on the strip. I highly recommend Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great party environment”
Reviews.Author: bran99
Reviews.Content: Great Value, your not going to get comped much, but this place is about value. Its a fun place, good drink service, decent variety of games considering the size of the casino. The poker there is just terrible, but considering location, quality of rooms you just cant beat this place on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lil-Barthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bills for 3 nights. The hotel is great value for money, the rooms were bigger then I thought and very clean. The plasma telly is a great bonus too! The service was great and they were very friendly. Bills is right smack bang in the middle of the strip and it is within walking distance of all the major casinos. We had a lovely time and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 50young
Reviews.Content: Bills is in a fantastic location on the strip opposite Ceasers Palace. We got a fantastic deal (A$60 a night) which was value for money for this location. Rooms were spotless, good size but bathroom a little small. The only negative staying at this address was the noise from Flamingo Hotel next door. Would definitely return but ask for a room on south side near Ballys. An added bonus was having half tix in Bills.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value But....”
Reviews.Author: austinguy_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's from Nov. 8-11, 2009. I had booked a room a month earlier and requested a room with a view of the Strip. When I arrived, they indeed had a room with a view available if I upgraded for an extra $20 a night. I wasn't happy about that but decided to pay the extra $20 per night. The room on the third floor near the Strip did have an incredible view but it came at a cost. The noise from traffic was constant and kept me awake all night. Running the AC helped with drowning out the traffic noise but not completely. The room was nice and clean. Bottom line, you cannot beat the location but if you stay there, request a room on the back side of the hotel away from the street noise or bring ear plugs for rooms with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to gamble should've stayed here”
Reviews.Author: Jcjoshan
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend were in Vegas in Oct and went to most of the casinos. Bill's has a great atmosphere that you feel comfortable in. The dealers were friendly and happy to show us new comers how to play the different games. The free drink service was quite good but it did take the girls a while to get round. I would consider staying here if I ever got back to Vegas due to its central location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: molli3
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my partner to Vegas for the first time in October and we managed to get a room at Bill's for 1 week for approx $780....money worth spent!! Bill's is has a great location situated between the Flamingo hotel and Bally's. My partner and I love to walk around (mind you we take our time) and it took us approx 25min to walk to MGM Grand from Bill's. The staff were very nice and accomodating - we had a third person stay and we paid for a roll away cot for an extra $20. The Bell Desk will help you get tours/taxi's etc. The room was very nice and we had an amazing view for "Paris" and the Bellagio Foutains. We were also able to use the Flamingo's Gym ($10) and the pool/jacuzzi (free). Bill's is very simple - just a casino downstairs with kareoke each night/band/elvis performances and 99cent margaritas!! They also have a Half Ticket Booth - you can buy show tickets for half the price if you go on the same day! We saved so much money on shows (eg cirque de soleil was $113 each but we bought them for $70 each at the Half Price Tix place) The line can be a bit long so its better to get there early on opening time (10am) or later in the pm (3ish). There is also another Half Price Tix place at the "Hawaiian Place" (just after the harley davidson cafe) which was never busy. If you're not too fussed about where you stay - Bill's is an inexpensive way to stay in Vegas...You are able to go into each of the different Hotel's anyway to have a look around. We enjoyed our stay at Bill's and would definatly come back!!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, conveniently placed right in the middle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Ratty09
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Bill's are large and very clean. Ours had a view of the fountains of the Bellagio which is opposite. We didn't gamble as we were only staying one night prior to flying out from Las Vegas the next day so can't really say anything about that. We did have a 99 cent margareta at the bar after exhausting ourselves walking up and down the strip. We also didn't eat at Bill's so can't say anything about the food. The desk sorted out transport to the airport for us which arrived reasonably promptly the next morning. Bills has an excellent location on the strip and is very good value for money as you could pay a lot more without getting anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value hotel at a prime location on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: sigosling
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Las Vegas and I thought I would give Bill’s a shot, having heard good things about it on Trip Advisor and noticing it’s great location at the centre of the Strip on my previous trips to Sin City. I was not disappointed. The room was clean, spacious, included a bath and overhead shower, large walk-in wardrobe, and nice 42-inch large flat-screen TV. The bed was huge and very comfortable. I asked for a room with a partial view of the strip (not a strip-view room). As you can see from my video and photos, this was excellent, especially for the low price I paid (around $30 per night) – it was possible to see the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower across the road at Paris. The rooms included double-glazed windows so the street noise was not a distraction. Nor was it possible to hear people in the other rooms. The location of Bill’s is perfect – it is mid-Strip so easy to explore either way. Importantly, it is a lot cheaper than the surrounding hotels like Bellagio, Paris, Caesar’s Palace and the Flamingo. I would certainly stay at Bill’s again, especially considering the room rate is at least half of what is for any other hotel in the same location!

Reviews.Title: “Don't, I repeat DON'T stay here! Worst mistake of our entire trip.”
Reviews.Author: Global-Getaway
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight to Bills which is smack bang in the middle of the strip, and were greeted with a cloud of cigarette smoke as we walked in the side entrance near reception. We waited 10 minutes before someone came to the front desk to check us in. We went up to our room on the 2nd floor to find we had been allocated a room with 2 queen beds - not the one king bed that we had booked. Surprisingly it was quiet!
