Consider staying on the Flamingo Hotel side (no view) if this is at all an issue -- and I mean, *at all.* I think the windows on the Flamingo Road side of the hotel should be replaced at a bare minimum. The AC/heating unit is also fairly noisy, but it's a 'white noise' kind of thing that I found to be fine. --Carpeting in hotel hallway was very worn and needed to be replaced (carpeting in room was fine). --Price was really just OK against its competitors for the time I was there, but it probably varies during the year. Basic rooms at neighboring Bally's and the Flamingo were both only about $10/night more when I was there -- and of course, both places offer many more amenities (and also suffer from the down side of megaresort-ness). I've stayed at both hotels; Bally's rooms are substantially bigger, IMHO, and rooms at either hotel are likely to be much quieter. I'd stay there again and I play there almost every time I'm in Vegas, but I'd pick a room on the Flamingo Hotel side next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: NLCPleasanton_CA
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Bill's. Our past visits to Las Vegas include stays at Paris, Bally, Monte Carlo, TI, Planet Hollywood, and MGM. Along with the other people who have written about the location, service and nice rooms, we agree. Additonal info: if you are a light sleeper or do not want to deal with any noise , be sure not to get a room on the first or second floor with view. I couldn't take the noise from the street and asked to be moved the following night. We were re-assigned a room on the 4th floor, in the back of the hotel. There was noise from the A/C unit outside, but it was a great improvement from the street noise. I recommend for light sleepers, 4th floor, mid. hotel,if you are a person who feels "quiet "is more important than a view.

Reviews.Title: “A nice visit...”
Reviews.Author: elpelso
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a hotel in Vegas that was conveniently situated and reasonably priced, TripAdvisor reviews pointed me towards the Bill's. Free parking, nice sized rooms and a reasonable price were the main options. Even though the wifi was not free (unlike what I was led to believe), and the front desk staff were simply rude and uncooperative, the rooms were very nice, and the location and price were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Service; Simple”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal2Anywhere
Reviews.Content: Three of ten in our party stayed at Bill's for a Girl's weekend away between Feb. 15-18, 2008. Those of us who stayed at Bill's were more than satisfied with our choice. The others were skepitcal about staying at this "older" property--even after I shared reviews about Bill's with them. Can't say the others enjoyed themselves more at their fancy, hip, newer hotel off the strip. In fact, four of them staying at the other hotel left a day earlier than planned--but not necessarily because of anything negative about the other property. Positives about Bill's: * Excellent location in the middle of the strip/action; didn't need a car to get around--just walked and used the city shuttle ($2 each way with various drop-off points all the way to Fremont) * Lots of garage parking with easy access to lobby/casino * Quick and friendly check-in * Non-smoking rooms which were truly non-smoking (no residue smoke) * Hallway on the way to room didn't smell smokey either * Relatively clean (I am extremely particular.) * Fairly spacious room with two queen beds * Restful sleep: quiet room with a view of "The Flamingo" neon (just a few feet away); extra comfy bed; heavy curtains shut out unwanted light * Large enough bathroom with toilet and bath separate from sink (good for people sharing) * Window in toilet / bathroom = good ventilation * Restaurant on site (Victorian): efficient with fair food * Fair value: Split three ways, cost for three = $194 each for three nights Casino Smokey like any other and one of the smallest on the strip (which I didnt mind); not fancy like the others, but lots of fun. Nice patrons. Most seemed down-to-earth and just there to have a great time. Consequently, made friends easily. Tried other casinos up and down the strip, and liked Bill's the best for it's friendly atmosphere and size. What I imagine old Las Vegas must've been like. Negatives Truthfully, I can't think of anything--and I'm trying. Had an overall memorable stay for my first time in Vegas as a "grown-up". (I'm 45 years old!!)

Reviews.Title: “Bill's is Great”
Reviews.Author: Buskin
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I would not stay anywhere else but Bills. The location perfect. The rooms spacious and clean. Had a a view on the Ballys side with a partial view of the Bellagio Fountains. RM 340 (the fountains are a must see!!) Majority of the staff were great. We tipped well and got great service from CW. Big Elvis a must see!!!!! Hubby entered guitar contest and won a Big Elvis CD. I would say to anyone thinking about Bills...don't hesitate!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Ranger53
Reviews.Content: This being our first time in Vegas, we wanted a hotel that was close to all the attractions, yet be reasonable in price, but also clean. We were NOT disappointed at all with Bills. It may not have all the super deluxe amenities that the larger hotels like Caesars Palace or Bellagio, but it was very clean, very quiet and the price was very reasonable. It is walking distance to most of the Strip. Check-In was quick, no waiting at all, and we evecn checked in a bit early and our room was ready for us. Also the personnel at the desk were very helpful and courtieous. If we ever get back to Las Vegas, i would absolutely stay at Bills. I recommend this hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stayin' at Bills For My 50th Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: luckynumber4
Reviews.Content: We arranged a package (air/hotel) with Allegiant Air from Bellingham, Washington for 3 nights 4 days arriving in Las Vegas on Thursday, Feb 21, 2008 (my 50th birthday). Arranged for a shuttle from the airport and hit rush hour traffic. Arrived at Bills about 6 pm for check-in. 4 adults and one teen. 2 rooms - one with eldest son and his girlfriend and the 2nd for my husband and I and our teenage son. 2 queen beds in each room and facing Flamingo Road with a view of the Bellagio fountains. No extra fee for the view rooms maybe because my sister-in-law had sent me a gorgeous fruit basket (ordered through flowersbytonilasvegas.com) so they knew it was a special day I guess. Thank you Bills. Nice rooms, comfy beds and pillows, nice plasma tv. I liked the small stained glass window in the bathroom shower that you could open up. My husband thought it was noisy at times during the night but I must have been tired as I wasn't bothered by any noise.We didn't gamble much in the casino, just a few slots, we're low rollers, and with the youngest son with us we wanted to do other things this trip. We did see Big Elvis in the lounge - he was great! A must see when visiting Bills. We had a 4:30 flight home and were able to have a 1 pm checkout for one of the rooms and took our time packing and left our bags with the bell desk until our shuttle arrived. Only complaint was the breakfast in Bills restaurant. I had ordered the scrambled eggs, with hash browns and toast and the eggs were dripping in butter or margarine. Took one bite and couldn't eat any more of the eggs. Below average comments from the rest of the group for their breakfasts which were sunny side up eggs, over easy eggs, soft boiled eggs and omelet. Don't think I'd eat breakfast there again, but would stay at the hotel. Fantastic location on the strip with Bally's on one side and the Bellagio across the strip. The price is right and you can't beat the location. They're part of the Harrah's group (Harrahs, Flamingo, Bally's) and if we were there in warmer weather we could still stay at Bills and use the pool at the Flamingo. All in all a good experience and would recommend it for anyone looking for a less expensive, clean hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Better Location”
Reviews.Author: saldavies77
Reviews.Content: We did a bit of research before booking Bills and the high score at trip advisor was one of the reasons we went for it. We didn't want to be too far away from the main hotels on the Strip, but didn't anything really expensive and Bills, well...fits the Bill. We stayed for 10 nights starting October 9th 2007. The hotel is next door (literally) to the Flamingo. Lots of hotels on the Strip are "next" to each other, but involve a 10+ minute walk, so Bills was ideal being next to Flamingo, across the road from Caesars etc. It's a small hotel for Vegas, but lively and the room was just like the photos - very comfortable, clean, big TV and quiet as we were at the back. I asked for a fridge (medical purposes) and was given one within 20 minutes of arrival. Bathroom had good shower, hairdryer, big mirror; plenty of drawer space, a table and dressing table - it was a fairly big room for the price. The view was the back of another hotel, but didn't matter to us as it was quiet and we weren't there much. There was one lift/elevator in the hotel, although it was never busy. Checking in/out was very easy and quick. A tip - booked a helicopter flight to the Grand Canyon and the bus picked us up right outside Bills, to take us to the airport. There are also lots of other trips that pick up at the hotel and shuttles to the Rio etc, direct from Bills. We ate at the Steakhouse a couple of times. It appears to get booked up very quickly, but we only had to wait around 20 minutes. Overall, we thoroughly recommend Bills as it’s reasonably priced and in a great location. We could walk comfortably to the Venetian, Caesar’s, Bellagio, Paris etc and we got the bus the rest of the time. $5 all day and takes you as far as Fremont Street, which is also worth a visit. Would definitely stay next time we visit Vegas – worth going back!

Reviews.Title: “Bills was a good choice”
Reviews.Author: sportygrrl
Reviews.Content: Bills was a great bargain on the strip. It was our first time to Vegas, so we wanted to stay at a place that was easy to get in and out of, and still right in the middle of everything. Even though it is right in the middle of the strip, it is quite unassuming compared to what surrounds it, and the lack of fanfare was great. We checked right in even though we got there early and it didn't take us very long to get to our room. I liked that we didn't have to walk through the casino to get outside, but we could walk by the 99 cent margartia bar on our way out, which was also a plus. If you want to have a good time on a budget and be able to get around the strip easily, stay at Bills.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfort & The View!”
Reviews.Author: childfree_traveller
Reviews.Content: I hadn’t even considered Bill’s until I read about the hotel here on Trip Adviser. I made our reservation in January by calling the hotel. When I called to confirm the reservation in February, the rates had gone down and we were now going to pay the new, lower rate! We checked-in early and there was no line. I’d read about the rooms that featured views of the Bellagio Fountains so I asked if any were available. I was told those rooms were now considered “premium” so there would be an additional $20.00 per night charge. We really wanted a memorable experience so we snagged what was described at “the best room in the house.” I’ve attached several photos of room 402 so you can see the details, as well as the fabulous view, for yourself. Our entire stay was terrific. The complimentary parking in the attached garage was awesome. It was the cleanest parking garage we’ve ever seen, plus we usually saw a security guard patrolling so that made us feel secure. When we went to our room from the casino, we were asked to present our room key so we felt good knowing only the people who were supposed to be on the hotel floors were. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. It was the biggest room we’ve ever had in Vegas by far. The king-size bed was divine as were the pillows. The flat-screen TV was terrific. There were plenty of chairs w/not only a desk and chair, but also a table with two chairs. The window that you can open in the bathroom was terrific; yeah for fresh air! There is an ice-machine near the elevator and the gift area in the casino seemed to have anything you might have forgotten. Anything we didn’t love? A couple of things. Internet access was about $11.00 p/day and we thought that was expensive. An in-room fridge would have been awesome as would a coffeepot and an in-room safe. Overall, none of those items turned out to be deal-breakers. When we return to Vegas I hope to book the exact room again. Once you see the view, you may want to as well.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in LV, nothing you don't”
Reviews.Author: teknojack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's in mid-February. I come to Vegas at least twice a year, and have stayed at a number of other hotels in the under 150.00/night range. These have ranged from pretty crappy (Circus Circus), to just okay (Sahara), to quite good (Luxor). After reading the glowing reviews here of Bill's. I booked it. I was not disappointed. 2 minute check-in, and the 20 dollar trick got me a huge, comfortable suite. The room was excellent, the only small complaint was that they havent upgraded the TV to a plasma model. Boo-hoo, right? Super comfy bed, overstuffed couch, roomy bathroom. Very clean to start, and the maid kept it that way. Across the street is Bally's, across the other street (almost adjacent) is the Flamingo. A 2 minute walk to Bellagio and Paris. The steakhouse in-house is EXCELLENT and reasonably priced. I cant speak highly enough of this place. Everyone was friendly, and I won a lot of money in their sports book room. Go figure. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further...”
Reviews.Author: kevjack6
Reviews.Content: If you are simply looking for a good, inexpensive room on the strip, DO NOT look any further!!! Bill's will give you all of that and more. I literally spent hours on the web researching rooms and I kept going back to Bill's because of the great reviews and I was in no way dissatisfied. All of the reviews, including this one, were 100% spot on. If you are looking for something fancy, spa treatment, a pool, then Bill's isn't for you. But if you are like me, a blue collar, middle class country boy on a budget, Bill's will satisfy you greatly. Did I mention that you will not find a better location? Dead center of the strip...my room had a view of the fountains at Bellagio. The rooms are clean, large enough, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The staff was friendly and courteous. Feel free to contact me with any questions. I did not eat at the restaurants but I've heard they are great. My only complaint is that I found the traffic noise to be a little much...I'm a light sleeper and the I was woken up several times. If the AC or the fan is on, you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Can't find a better bargain”
Reviews.Author: Skimmingtn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our third stay at Bill's. We first discovered this grand little casino when it was still called the Barbary Coast. Despite the weak name change, the hotel remains the best deal on the strip. They have nice-sized, CLEAN rooms (though the bathrooms are tiny), with updated furniture, and some rooms have great views of the strip. The staff has always been friendly and helpful. And the prices are unbelievable. I don't think we've ever paid more than an average of $100 a night. It has a super small casino and is not glitzy or glamorous in any way, but it is a quality hotel in the heart of the strip - Caesar's, Bally's, Bellagio and the Flamingo are its closest neighbors. One thing I absolutely love about this hotel is that it's an easy and extremely quick walk to your room. When staying at the bigger resort-types, it can be a 10-15 minute hike from the street to your room. Not at Bill's. Because it's such a small casino, and so few rooms, it doesn't take any time at all to return to your room. Nice rooms, great location, courteous staff, and cheap rates. If it weren't for Bill's, I'm not sure my husband and I would go to Vegas as often as we do.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: mda3333
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bill's for week over Valentine's Day, and celebrated our 21st anniversay. Everything was perfect. The location is perfect. A 20min walk in either direction and you're at either the Luxor or the Wynn's. We had just as much fun at Bill's as any other place. Food was good and prices are about the same as every other hotel. They were out of strip view rooms when we checked in, but after our stay we decided that was OK. Didn't spend much time at all in the room. After all it was only $59 a night. We love our stay at Bill's. My wife and I both agree that we would stay ther again. If fact we are planning our next visit. Big Elvis is a real treat, a must see!!!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Vegas atmosphere right on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: stevee_v
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Luxor and Ceasars on previous trips we stayed at Bills based on good reviews from Tripadvisor. I am pleased to say we were not dissapointed. Fast check-in,great rooms,excellent restaurants,friendly staff.......need I go on? A great casino where people actually have fun unlike the stoney faced punters we saw in many of the "Top Hotels". Stay here if you like to have a drink and have fun. Dont stay here if your nose is stuck up your own [----]

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: battlescar
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st time to Vegas..for a 3 day trip, before heading to Palm Springs for 4 days. We looked at a few hotels and deceided on Bills..what a great choice!!! Easy drive from the rental place, and tons of parking at Bills..straight from the garage to the lobby area...and check in took about 5 mins. The room was large and clean, with king size bed and 42 inch plasma tv. The best part was that from the room to the street was about 5 mins...we did look around all the other hotels, and they are fab, but it takes forever to get through them!! Big Elvis was wonderful and free. The location of Bills has to be among the best. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved everything!”
Reviews.Author: scissero
Reviews.Content: WE were looking for a reasonable hotel on the "strip" and came across Bill's. We went in and gambled a bit and had such good friendly service with drinks and staff, that we decided to check in for the night. I think we paid $69 on a Sunday night. The room was so clean and bed was comfortable. It is an older place and has alot of character and charm. My husband was impressed with the flat screen T.V. I loved the walnut panelling and leaded glass in the bathroom. We would recommend Bill's as a friendly, low key, reasonable hotel. A nice atmosphere, and there is also Big Elvis entertainment daily!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms - very good value - "Big Elvis" a must see.”
Reviews.Author: pommie01
Reviews.Content: Bill's is a great find. The Casino is a bit smokey, "old school" and small - but the hotel rooms are really great value. The location is great, on the strip, on the corner opposite Bally's and Bellagio. The is no buffet - but a couple of restaurants, which we didn't try - we stuck to the buffet's at Bellagio and Bally's across the street. An attraction was an in-house Elvis impersonator called "Big Elvis". Very talented and cheesy - but hey this is Vegas ! The rooms themselves are Victorian style. But they we re-furbed a couple of years ago. The beds are comfy (we had a king size) - but I believe that there are twin rooms and suites too. Lots of character - and some great views over the strip. There is a 42in HD plasma TV on the wall, with plenty of digital channels. Bathroom is adequate - with opening window, good shower, tub. Seperate wardrobe area. The rooms here are sun $100 - which is great value. I think we paid $85 from memory through Expedia. If I was going to Vegas next week - I would stay there without hestitation - I wouldn't bother looking anywhere else. Some negatives: - No in-room safe. But hey, it's a casino. - Aircon/heating was a bit noisy. - Checkin staff a little distant and terse. - Holiday timeshare sales people jumping you as you get in the lift. That's not a way to treat hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Floridanana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1/24 & 1/25. Check in was easy but we had to wait until after 3. Room faced the Bellagio fountains which was awesome. There was an extra charge for a 'room with a view'. We chose this location based on TA. Convenient, easy parking, easy in and out. For us that was important. Room was clean, but they did not leave clean glasses, soap, coffee,etc. on 2nd day. We did request to use a coffee maker and it was brought to the room in 2 minutes with 2 packs of coffee. There was no extra charge for the coffee pot. LOVED Big Elvis. Great music. We were very satisfied overall. At night, a guard asks to see room key at the elevator which we thought was great.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: deak75
Reviews.Content: this was my 3rd visit to vegas in 4 years and this hotel was perfect in every way went in january so didn't have need for a pool, just a location, and you can't beat it for that. the rooms are great with their flat screen tv's and comfy beds and are clean throughout. what i also loved about it is that it only takes a few minute walk or so from when you leave your room until you're right on the strip, it's so central. just a few minutes walk over the footbridge to the amazing fountains at bellagio and the mall at caesars etc. we stayed in a certain bigger and more famous hotel further down the strip a few years back and bill's ( or the barbary coast as it was then ) beats it for location and ease of getting out of your room onto the strip hands down. it's also cheaper! the casino's also a lot smaller than others so if you're not a gambler then you're not walking for what seems like miles to get out but, if you like a flutter like myself, this gives bill's a more homely, welcoming feeling than some of the other hotel casino's. big elvis is a must! just remembering sitting there with my mates, drinks in hand watching him strut ( well mostly sitting ) his stuff and having a laugh makes me realise how much i enjoyed bill's. yes, some peoples first impressions may be a bit dubious of this great place cos it's not as big, glitzy or flash as some of the other hotels but, if you honestly ask yourself want you want out of vegas then this is the place to stay. it's a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Yeehaw!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stonebutch99
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Bill's. The location is excellent, the bed was very comfortable, and the people are very courteous and helpful. We throughly enjoyed our experience, so much, we're going back in March. The price is exceptional and the gaming was great. We had a side view of the Bellagio fountains and loved it. As soon as you get off the elevator and walk out the door the strip is at your service. Amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly, accomodating, great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: nola_girl76
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends just came back from a weekend trip. We had 2 rooms reserved, one through priceline and one through the hotel website. The staff were so friendly when we checked in! Also, they accomodated our requests to have adjoining rooms, each with 2 beds, which really made a difference for us. The rooms were fine. Very clean and the beds were really comfortable. It is a smaller,older hotel but it didn't feel dingy or anything, loved the stained glass in the bathroom and cool flower shaped light fixtures. we didn't gamble much in the casino itself, but when we did , we seemed to win on the slots, so that didn't hurt either! The restaurant was a bit overpriced, nothing special. loved the 99 cents margarita bar too! The location is Amazing! right in the middle of the strip. you can walk anywhere or take the monorail from the flamingo. I have NO complaints and the price was so low, I almost don't want to give away the 'secret' of Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Booking Comment”
Reviews.Author: djkbooks
Reviews.Content: I booked six nights in early March on Bill's website. Last weekend, perusing hotel rates at tripres.com, I noticed rates at Bill's were significantly lower for our stay. When I checked rates at Bill's website, rates were the same as on tripres.com. I phoned Bill's and asked for the lower rates appearing on the website, and they cheerfully agreed (a difference of $200 over six nights).

Reviews.Title: “Great to stay, not to gamble”
Reviews.Author: Lauri101
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Bill's from 1/13-1/17, 2008. The location is great and the size of the hotel ideal for getting out of quickly. And getting out quickly is what you should do when you are ready to gamble! The slots are the tightest we found on the strip! They did have at least one $5 BJ table, but the payoff was 6:5 and finding a seat was impossible after about 11 AM. As far as rooms and rate - warning - if you want the BEST rate available, contact hotel by phone, not by website. We booked a month out via website and our rate was decent - $65 on Sunday, $75 Mon - Wed. Two days before we left for Vegas, I checked the website and they quoted a $49 rate for all 4 nights. When we checked in, I asked for the cheaper rate and was told that the "hotel policy" was that you had to pay the rate you booked on the website, but, if I had called to make reservations, they could charge the lower rate. So - because I had the foresight to book early and NOT tie up a reservation clerk to do so, I was penalized! I also found out this is Harrah's policy and one of the employees at Bill's agreed with me that it was ridiculous but he would get in trouble if he violated it. It may seem trivial, but it's the principle, not the cash. The room was pretty decent as Vegas rooms go. We were able to get a coffee pot simply by asking for it and at no charge. Internet access was $12.99 per 24 hour period. Wireless was available but slow; RJ cable available for a high-speed connection and it was very good. We had two queen beds - very comfortable and got extra pillows from housekeeping with no problem. The staff - all of them - were very friendly and helpful - not a bad one in the bunch! The room was cleaned promptly after we left and housekeeping was excellent. Of course, I always tip the housekeepers at least $3 a day, more if I want something special. ( I was a motel housekeeper years ago and I know how woefully underpaid they are) There is a shuttle to Gold Coast that is free. A bus stop for The Deuce is right next door at the Flamingo. The 24 hour Victorian room is pricy, but service good and food excelent. Overall, a good place to stay. Gamble elsewhere for the best bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “You Get WhatYou Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Travel-happyLondon
Reviews.Content: Obviously it's not as dazzling as the Bellagio or as large as the MGM Grand, but if you want a comfortable, accessible, easily negotiated hotel on the Centre Strip, you can't go far wrong with this place. Very reasonable for such a central hotel, with fair-sized rooms and facilities, (although a kettle wouldn't have gone amiss!) It has a real "Old Las Vegas" feel to it, perhaps all the more poignant given the surge of "mega-resorts" in Vegas at the expense of fore-runners such "Stardust" and "Sands". Mike the concierge was a star, and was very helpful in organising my Grand Canyon trip. In short, give it a whirl, and if you feel the need to glam it up a bit, the Bellagio is only across the road!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a smaller hotel”
Reviews.Author: cynlas
Reviews.Content: We like a smaller hotel when in Vegas so it doesn't take forever to get through the casino to go anywhere. Rooms were very nice - no complaints. Casino could use a bit of updating (carpets worn, etc.). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Only downside is there is no pool however you can use the neighboring Flamingo pool which is a quick walk. Were not happy about their pool, though. They only had one smaller pool open this time of year and the sun only shines in the pool area from 10-2 before it falls behind the tall building. Also, check prices as we had to find our daughter a room for the last night and she got in to the Monte Carlo at the last minute for less then we paid for our room at Bills.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Crusty Casino”
Reviews.Author: SoDak1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's for two nights over New Year's Eve. The room was fairly nice. Quite large actually. The location was great also. Easy access to Ceasars and Bellagio. The only thing I didn't care for at Bill's was the crowd at the casino. A lot of thugs and punks cat calling our wives. Made for a uneasy time spent there. Needless to say, we spent our time gambling and partying elsewhere. Over all a good room for the money, but spend your time in a nicer casino.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tannedon
Reviews.Content: Went out to Vegas for my 6th trip, this one with my daughter for her first legal trip. Have stayed before at Bellagio, MGM, Luxor, Paris and Mirage. I will have to agree that this is the best for me so far and will probably be where I stay in the future (as long as it is still there). I really appreciate the fact that you don't have to walk a mile to get to your room and check in was a breeze. The staff was the only drawback, I did not find them very helpful but we really did not need much. Also, if you need a taxi you are better off walking next door to Bally's and catching one there, evidently cab drivers do not find Bill's a very lucrative spot. Rooms are big and clean, housekeeping was exactly on. Excellent location at center of strip and easy walking to everything (if you like to walk). All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: pitias
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room for $51 thru Expedia, not very sure what to expect....but was really, positively impressed by this hotel. Quite the opposite to the casino below, in terms of noise and people movement. Huge room, 42" plasma tv, toiletries, plenty of towels, everything impeccable clean and new-looking, from the carpets in the hall to the bathroom sink. Apparently was recently renovated. Double glazed opening windows, with a view to the Bellagio fountains/Strip. No noise from street or other rooms. The only thing I missed was a coffee-maker in the room. Maybe next time. The decor was 'old west', very sober and dark (not what I would have in my house), but I don't mind about that and you shouldn't!! Check-in and check-out was very swift, even though there was a line for both. Spanish speaking person in desk, which can make a difference for non english speaking clients. The Casino is ok, too many people for my style, but has plenty of service persons and everything looks under control and safe. Even outside i felt safe, right in the middle of The Strip, with everything at walking distance, and plenty of places to eat around the corner, for every budget and taste. They have these $1 margaritas at the Casino, which are fine for having a sip and people watch!

Reviews.Title: “Have recommended Bills to everyone”
Reviews.Author: JeanieRyan
Reviews.Content: I chose Bills initially because of the location which is terrific. It was also competetively priced - why pay fortunes to see the Bellagio Fountains from their rooms when you can see them better from Bills? However, the hotel itself was faultless. Our room was identical to the pictures on their website - well decorated and spotlessly clean. Although the casino is a lot smaller than most this meant that when we returned to the hotel we did not have another 15 minute walk to get to our room like so many of the bigger hotels. The food in the restaurant was very good, keenly priced and the service was excellent. As was the lounge bar, which also showed excellent entertainment daily and nightly. 'Big Elvis' is on 3 times a day for a short performance and is easily the 'best sounding Elvis' I have ever heard!! All in all a wonderful stay. I have not stopped singing Bills praises to all who are intending to go to Vegas. I know where I shall be staying on my next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ntomlinson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's over the Christmas period. Our room was great. It was very clean & the king sized bed was very comfortable. I could of gone a doona on the bed but my fiance was warm enough. We felt very safe. We came in on Christmas night to be asked by security for our room key for identification before we could go up to our floor. We had no problem's with noise from other rooms or the casino. The only noise we had was from the air conditioning units outside, but it wasn't that bad. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is going to Vegas for a few nights that doesn't mind not having facilities like other hotels(pool, gym...etc).

Reviews.Title: “Happy Camper's”
Reviews.Author: jojobz2216
Reviews.Content: Comfy beds, nice size rooms, would recommend to anyone as it is a excellent location. Only part of Las Vegas I enjoyed was the stay there. We hated the fact that every 10 feet there were people handing out cards for girls to your room in 20 minutes, we found this repulsive and a total turn off of ever returning to Las Vegas. We were harrased for 4 days to the point we counted the minutes to get on the plane and home. Las Vegas is a beautiful city its with much to see and explore it would be nice to do so and not be harrassed the way we were. Maybe it''s time they had a redlight district for these people so the rest of us normal tourists could enjoy our trips.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: RJP3
Reviews.Content: Great Christmas stay - beautiful decorations for the season. 1) Location Location Location - close to every thing you want. 2) The most beautiful casino in Vegas. Seriously. If Harrahs (new owners) fail to save the interior of this casino room when they eventually rebuild - it will be a huge loss to Vegas. Beautiful dark wood everywhere (not PLASTIC molding like in The Venetian tourist trap), REAL stained glass windows everywhere, beautiful crystal fixtures. The real deal. Looking at my vacation pictures I realized this really is the most beautiful casino room left on the strip. Nothing compares to it's CLASSIC Victorian charms. Amazing that it was built in 1979. 3) Know that your really your staying at the best location in The Flamingo Resort. When staying at Bill's your walk to The Flamingo pool, taxi stand, showroom, casino and Margaritaville is MUCH MUCH MUCH shorter than if you are in one of The Flamingo towers. And you can get away from the crowds - NO wait to check in !!! as there are only 200 rooms. 4) The GUESTROOMS are beautiful and brand new. Very nice Victorian rooms with Flatscreen TV's. 5) Flamingo Road side views of the Bally's lightshow and Bellagio's fountains - can not be beat. 6) Friendly staff. All the games you need. Sports book onsite. Seattle's Best shop for morning coffee. 7) A wonderful clean break from the MONSTERS they now call resorts on Vegas Strip. --- On check in they offered us a $20 upgrade to a suite. IT WAS BEAUTIFUL and HUGE and everything in it was BRAND NEW. For $79 a great bargain. Two baths. Two TVs. Private bedroom. Jacuzzi, Marble shower. Bar. Oak table with seating for six people. However - it is right next to the elevators and you can feel (and hear) them in the living room. Could not hear them in the bedroom and I am a light sleeper. Still we asked if another suite was available the next day as it was a bit loud in the morning. For $30 more a night (we are still only up to $109) we were moved to a Vintage 1980 original Party Suite. Retro swinging vegas cool. Very quiet, spacious and fun. Lots of chrome, glass, mirrors two bathrooms (that have seen better days). I was very surprised how well the rooms have held up over the years. Both bathrooms had stained glass windows that OPEN (fresh air is key in Vegas) and other than fire / police going by once in a great while - no real street noise. No flat screen but a cool set up with a rotating TV stand built into the bar - so you can spin in around depending on what side of the "great room" you are in (platform bed / dining table or living room / Marble Jacuzzi) The Jacuzzi is right to window - so while you enjoy yoru hot tub you can watch the Bellagio fountains). All for $109 a night ! I would have been very happy with the brand new $59 rooms. BILLS IS A GREAT CHOICE - enjoy while Harrah's allows us the opportunity. I think they have done right by the former Barbary Coast since they have put the company founder's name on the place. One last thing I noticed - they have kept the orginal doors up at the entrances with the smoked etched BC in the glass (Barbary Coast) - as they also work for Bill's Casino (BC) ! The crowd was young, hip and having a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there while you have the chance”
Reviews.Author: flyerfan22
Reviews.Content: One of our big pet peeves about Vegas hotels is the time it takes to exit the hotel after leaving your room. You usually have to walk through a smoke filled casino for 10 minutes before getting anywhere. Not so at Bill’s! We were literally out of our room, down the elevator, and out on the strip in 2 minutes. We debated staying at a bigger hotel (Planet Hollywood), but stuck with Bill’s based on recommendations from the TA forums – and I’m really glad we did! This hotel is now a Harrah’s property. Hopefully, they will leave it as is, but with all the construction and consolidation going on in Vegas, who knows? Anyway, this hotel was great. We arrived Thursday, Dec. 20 around 9:30 PM. The $20 trick worked and we were upgraded to a Jacuzzi suite (Rm 254). Although it wasn’t remodeled with a plasma TV, we thoroughly enjoyed the upgrade. The suite included a small refrigerator, bar area, leather seating (couch and two chairs), full Jacuzzi bath big enough for two, and 2 bathrooms. Bed was a king size and very comfortable. There were some down points to the room. The room was definitely older. The TV, as mentioned, was a 27” tube, which looks small in today’s world (but they are remodeling all the rooms with larger plasmas). The lighting was very dim, as the many track/recessed lights didn’t help to really light up the room. There were 10 different light switches in the room, and the room was still dark with all of them on. Finally, the windows were VERY thin. We constantly heard the honking of cars from the strip. We had a room across from the valet area of Bally’s on Flamingo Blvd. I’m not sure if there are rooms further away from traffic. Most of these complaints should be addressed by the room remodeling. What won’t change was the best part of the hotel; the location and small size. The elevator always arrived quickly – it helps that the hotel has only 4 floors. It is in the central strip area, between Bally’s and Flamingo. Vegas is not really convenient to walk back and forth, but we found Bill’s to be much more convenient than the bigger hotels. The room was kept very clean, and we had good service from the staff. We didn’t have a car, and never ate there, so we can’t comment on parking or food at Bill’s. We highly recommend Bill’s as a reasonable accommodation for anyone that likes to hotel hop on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Loved it, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: shihtzu217
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here based on all the positive reviews and am so glad we did. I loved the dark wood, and victorian charm of the place, The staff is very friendly and the rooms are immaculate. I have never been so impressed with a hotel. The convenience of the escalators and skywalks over the roads was a huge bonus .....(tip: walk across to Bally's and you can get a shuttle to the other Harrah's properties) I won't stay anywhere else in Vegas this place is the perfect location, a comfortable bed, friendly staff and safe. another plus: we had a room that overlooked the Flamingo (Tackiest place ever) and heard only sirens from the street and never heard a peep from neighboring rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: matchu19
Reviews.Content: Bill's sent me a very nice promotion in the mail after playing there my previous two trips to Vegas. I'm usually a Total Rewards guy but I love Bill's casino and cocktail service so I figured I would get a card (until they switch over to TR) and boy did it pay off! Booking online was a breeze. The reception area is small and low-key but there wasn't anyone else waiting. The lady at the desk was extremely nice and I was complimentary upgraded into a suite! The room was huge and extremely clean. I was very, very impressed! As always the service in the casino was exceptional. Cocktail service is unbelievable. Pit bosses are friendly and personable. The Steakhouse at Bill's was a perfect dining experience. The food was amazing and the service was spot on. My only, only gripe (and a trivial one it is) is that you cannot use your comps at the Seattle's Best located inside. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed here when it was the Barbary Coast, a decade ago. I loved the old style Vegas feel. Not the glitzy glass boxes that have replaced the cool older properties. Was coming through for 18 hours and booked it, hoping that the new owners didn't kill the vibe. They haven't. Awesome hotel. Amazing location for those who want to explore. The rooms, as has been mentioned, are big, spacious, and the bed is great. I've been on the road for two weeks and this was the best one yet. With the exception of one surly bartender, the staff was funny, upbeat and best of all, informative. The Steak House was quaint and the food and service were both "10's". The line to the bigger, less-expensive restaurant was LONG so I decided to spluge. Terrific steak and I used my coupon book for a free glass of wine. The casino is compact and easy to navigate. Not a high-roller joint thought. LOTS of penny slots and only one $5 machine in the place. I did very well, thank you:) The only nit-picky thing I'd say is that the free drinks were non-existent. I mean, I saw the waitresses who were supposed to be doing them. But I sat at the lone high-roller machine for 30 minutes. Zip. Will I stay here again. WITHOUT a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller011-7
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a perfect location in Las Vegas. Registration was quick, our room was very clean and quite large. If you enjoy TV, there is a big one but for us it was hardly turn on. We had a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains. I would definitely stay there again . The casino is very smoky but you do not have to go through it to get to your room. At night the security checks to make sure you are a guest before you go to your room. The outside of hotel is old fashioned with its lights around it but the room is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not What It Used To Be”
Reviews.Author: Leaving_LostWages
Reviews.Content: I've stayed and played at Bill's many times in the past, when it was known as The Barbary Coast. Harrah's bought the BC this past March and renamed the hotel, essentially leaving everything the same - with one major exception: Bill's now uses Harrah's comp system, meaning what was once a decent low-roller joint on the Strip with a pretty liberal comp policy is no more. In the past, one could play $5-$10 BJ for a few hours and expect a least a coffee shop meal in return. Now you accrue "bonus dollars" to spend instead, except they are awarded at a ridiculosly miniscule rate. Like other Strip casinos, you now have to gamble at a much higher amount over a longer period of time to get anything in return. The pit bosses I spoke with are none too happy about this, and about working for Harrahs in general. In fact, most felt that "Bill's" has a limited lifespan; that it will be demolished in the next couple of years and the space used to extend The Flamingo. Alas, it seems that Bill's is destined to become yet another victim to the mega-corporation consolidation that is now dominating Las Vegas. So my advice is enjoy it while you can, be it somewhat weathered or not, for many of the same reasons others here have described: small-sized hotel, decent room rates, good (if not somewhat disgruntled) staff, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bill's”
Reviews.Author: cazpiece
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend from 22-28 Nov after reading all the great reviews and were not disappointed. The location could not be better, centre strip next to the Flamingo and across from Caesar's, Bally's and the Bellagio. The rooms are very large, clean, and in immaculate condition. We requested a coffee machine and one was provided straight away, no safes in the room but ones were available downstairs. Bill's is a gem in Las Vegas and I would recommend it to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CherylAS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading all the great reviews and were not disappointed. The location is fantastic, across from Caesar's, Bally's and the Bellagio. The rooms are very large, clean, and obviously recently renovated. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the strip and could watch the Bellagio Fountains every 15 minutes. The flat screen TV and extremely comfortable king bed were a bonus. The only negative is the noise from the strip but once we used ear plugs it was not an issue, and well worth it for the location. Parking in the parkade is free and there's a $.99 Margarita bar in the casino. The drinks are small but for that price you can stock up. The Victorian Room has great prime rib but everything else is hit and miss. Ask for dressing on the side if you don't like a swamped salad. I can certainly see why this hotel is ranked so high on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even hesitate!”
Reviews.Author: Karinsue
Reviews.Content: Don't even hesitate to stay here. My hubby and I stayed from Nov. 12-15. Our room was huge compared to others and was very clean and well kept, with a flat screen. We were situated right next to the elevators so that it was literally 30 seconds from casino to room. Awesome!! No view, but that wasn't an issue to us. Upgrades were available, but we weren't interested. The Victorian Room was just okay for breakfast. A little pricey for what you get. I'd skip it and hit the breakfast buffet at Paris for the same price and much better quality. Casino wasn't huge but the waitresses come around very often and that's the most important thing to us! Also won a little there which helps. (Side note, spent 5 hours at the Wynn trying to get our Red Card pts for 2 free buffets, which was easy, only saw the cocktail waitress two times, no joke!) Only thing I wish they had was somewhere to grab a quick lunch, even if the coffee place had some sandwhiches or just something easier than a sitdown meal. Only issue though. I loved this hotel and won't stay anywhere else from now on. It is so much easier to navigate than the bigger ones but still very comfortable and the locatioon cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT~Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: demo22
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: In the center of everything!! Next to Flamingo, right by Bellegio, accross the street from Ceaser's! Everything is all around there in walking distance. GAMBLING: I think the best place to go is Flamingo..no matter what you are doing there is always a drink girl right there to order- Plus they would bring it pretty fast! Also, they are the only ones that has cheap rapid roulette, $2.50 min anywhere in the board...no restrictions. The drinks we're also really good there! Bill's was a nice smaller casino, everyday they had a "cash blast", when you sign up for the player card (free) you entered in a drawing where they pick 5 people to go in a money blower and you get to grab as much as you can. ROOM: We went thanksgiving week and we got the best rate imaginable...$49.95/night. It has a king size comfortable bed, very spacious, plasma TV, table & chairs, blow dryer, ice, dressers, body mirror, desk w/ mirror, vanity mirror seperate from toilet & shower, shower had beautiful flower design (see pic), balcony view (can't walk on it), all dark wood furnature that looked bran new, very clean! Was no way cramped like a holiday or days Inn. This place was up to par for that price. OVERALL: The service we received was very good, and it's one of those smaller places where you can get more of a personal touch. They had their own restaurants in there, special 14.95 for steak dinner. Also, when you sign up for the players card you get a coupon book. TIPS: (1) Super good show to see: CARROT TOP (at LUXOR) (2) PURE nightclub is worth waiting in line for (even though their drinks are expensive, $14 for a martini..ouch, then a long island & red bull/vodka was $26) It was all worth it though (3) Don't sign up for the player card on the weekend, try doing it on a Monday, because everyone seemed to be in the drawing on Sat/Sun when they first get there. If you were to wait for like a Monday, you have a better chance of getting into the cash blast (4) Think twice before seeing Penn & Teller...I heard alot of good things, but I paid $93 for 5th row ticket, and I expected more for that price. Of course they did some really cool things, but $93?? I wish I would have checked out Julibee (which was another reference I received) (5) Bus ride, be prepared to wait (if you have extra money, just take the taxi) avoid trolleys all together. (6) Avoid slots...if you were smart you would do this...you have more of a chance at the tables. Slots- you are seriously wasting your money. (7) At some places, you may want to order 2 drinks at a time, because alot of the time it's really busy. (8) Of course, bring good walking shoes- i tried to wear high heels and i almost died. i saved them strictly for the club. SEE ATTACHED PICTURES...beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Holsrme
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the good reviews. This is a lovely hotel and we really liked the old Wild West feel to it. The rooms are spacious and very clean and it only took a few minutes to check in and only a few minutes to get to the rooms. I requested a room overlooking the Bellagio fountains but I would recommend asking for a room further away from the Strip as it can be quite noisy with the traffic and sirens. I was aware of this from other reviews on here so that was my fault. - and the fountains are much more spectacular from the pavement outside the Bellagio anyway. Bills location is excellent - right in the middle of the Strip and for the money you can't beat it. I've even recommended this hotel to my boss who is going to Vegas next year and there is no way I would do that if it was bad - I value my job too much lol. We ate in both restaurants and thought the Steakhouse was very nice with good service but the Victorian restaurant wasn't as good, it was just ok, however they were open 24 hours so it was convenient for a late dinner after a show. Hints n Tips: If you get a chance, see Big Elvis in the bar at Bills. It's a free show for an hour and he is very entertaining. They also have $1 Margarita's at the bar near the restaurants and the beers are cheaper here too but come in plastic cups. If you buy them from the main bar they are normal prices. Get a coupon for free entry to the classic cars at the Imperial Palace. They have some lovely cars on show. The views from the Paris hotel (up the 'Eiffel Tower') and the Stratosphere are very similar so you only really need to pay out for one. The rides at the Stratosphere are hair-raising but it's at the top end of the strip so if you don't intend on doing the rides they just opt for the Paris view and save yourself a few $. We thought the Venetian hotel was stunning and worth a visit. New York New York is a fun hotel and would have liked to have gone to the Coyote Ugly bar but sadly ran out of time. The Village Restaurant at the Paris hotel is great for a buffet breakfast at $15 and is in a nice setting. There were only 2 negatives at Bills that I could think of - the reception guy was a bit sourly and the windows were dirty -but obviously they were only minor ones. If we went to Vegas again we would definitely stay at Bills and I certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good hotel, poor casino and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MustangAnn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bill's from Wed. November 14th to Sunday November 18th, 2007. I rated the hotel as a 4, because I am excluding the restaurant (The Victorian) and the Casino. The hotel is right in the middle of the strip so you have easy access to everything. The rooms are clean, they look like they have been re-done. The bed (King size) was very comfortable and the pillows were good too. The wall mounted LCD television is a great touch. We asked for a coffee maker in the room and were quick to supply it. I liked that at night there was a security guard by the elevators to check that you were staying at the hotel. There is an after hours night club at the casino which brings in some "questionable" characters but I never felt nervous or unsafe. I would return to Bill's to stay at the hotel, but the Casino staff are rude, unfriendly and it was not fun to gamble here. We did the first night but hated the attitude of the dealers so we chose to lose our money elsewhere! As for the 24 hour restaurant called the Victorian Room, it is aweful. The food is gross, and the waiters/waitress are useless, rude, slow and everything is way overpriced especially for the quality of the food. DO NOT EAT HERE! Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sal_UKUk
Reviews.Content: Great position on the strip, monorail station is next door in Flamingo or across the street at Ballys so easy to get around. Room was big and bed incredibly comfy, the plasma was a nice touch. Had a view of the bellagio fountains which was nice, the noise wasn't an issue for us. Big Elvis was fab, definately worth seeing !! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As With Anything ...”
Reviews.Author: CoBergen
Reviews.Content: Greate location, great price. Much better than what I was anticipating. That said, Management could have done a lot better to accomodate the inconvenience that was heaped on those guest who were unfortunate too arrive late during their name change. Unbenownst to us, it was in the process from changing from Barbary's Coast to Bill's Gambling. I reserved a non-smoking room and by the time I got there all that was available was smoking and rooms at the exterior wall where during the night they were removing the old signage. Standing in the middle of an airport runway would have been quiter. Management did nothing in letting those know in advance of the inconvenience they would incur such that you could have changed hotels if what you reserved was not available. We were there for a trade show and NASCAR was in town such that finding other hotel rooms would have been a challenge. And they did nothing at all to compensate for this inconvenience. All Staff, though very friendly, indicated was in effect to suffer in a smoking room or in an impact zone. Needless to say ... there was no sleeping for two nights. Once 2 a.m. rolled around, it was very noisy until 6-7 a.m. Nonetheless, the location is great and the rooms, albeit dated, were clean and reasonably well appointed such that I will try once again to stay there. The noise from the Strip was not that bad and the view was great from this room. As the Strip is getting pricier and pricier, this is definitely a reasonable choice in a great location, and the parking is convenient. I will try it again. I'm guessing the next change will have it being part of the Flamingo. I hope I'm not there for that name change if the structure is not torn down.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Bill's!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayfanUk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at Bill's and can't fault the hotel. The location is excellent mid strip and so easy to get around. We loved that the hotel was small and it only took 5 minutes to get from the entrance to the lifts to get to the room. The rooms were clean and the bed was massive and really comfortable. Great pressure on the shower as well. Stayed in room 436 and had views of the Bellagio fountains. 99cents margarittas were also great!! Hotel staff were friendly and very helpful with advice on getting around. Check-in was very quick and took no longer than 5 minutes. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BaltoMan52
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's in early November as I had an early flight the next morning. I had been at a conference at the Wynn, but since I was no longer on an expense account I decided to stay at Bill's mainly due to reviews on this website. While Bill's was quite a contrast after staying at the Wynn for 3 days, it is a clean, safe hotel on the strip at a very low price. I paid $60 for the night and they upgraded me to a suite right out of the 1970's that had a jacuzzi in the middle of the living room, a bed on a raised platform, 2 bathrooms and a small kitchenette. This is definitely a budget hotel and you get what you pay for. I The location is central across the street from the Bellagio next door to Bally's and a short walk every where else. The rooms are dated, but clean. The casino is small. The service is friendly and competent. I think if you shop around, especially mid-week, you can get deals at other hotels like the MGM Grand and Luxor for less than $100. If you are a looking for a luxury hotel with a pool, spa and 4 star restaurants, Bills is not the place. If you are looking for a cheap place to sleep, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jenkos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Bill's for 4 nights in October. I have to say it exceeded my expectations. I booked the hotel through their website and then contacted themn to ask for an upgraded room with a view of the Bellagio fountains. The request was respned to quickly and when we arrived late despite the hotel fully booked we had the view we asked for.(Thanks Sylvia). Also check in was quick and having seen the queses at check at some of the other hotels this is a good thing. The Room was large and very clean with a large television. The location was excellent you just walked out the door straight in the middle of the strip with the Duece bus stop nearby to ferry you up and down the strip. Some people have said the noise level was loud but we had no problems with it whatsoever. If you are looking for a central hotel, reasonably priced, clean and a friendly atmosphere this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: rustybob
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews on Bill's before visiting so I felt pretty good about staying there. I was more than pleased with my stay. The location is perfect. You are right in the middle of everything and for an amazingly low price. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out, everything went perfectly. Check in took less than two minutes. Check out was just as quick. Our room was on the 4th floor on the Bally's side. Street noise at night was a little irritating, but the bed was so incredibly comfortable that it didn't really bother me too much. The room was spacious enough for two and very clean. The wall mounted plasma tv was great too although we didn't use it much. The decor of the hotel was kind of dark but it alluded to the old timey saloon theme and it really worked. The food and service in the Victorian room was excellent. The only negative was the worn out carpet in that restaurant. Otherwise it was super. The casino was smoky, but it stayed full pretty much all the time with folks taking advantage of the low limit table games. The dealers were extremely friendly and polite as were the other guests. And you CANNOT miss Big Elvis in the lounge. He is fantastic. From Bill's you are less than a fifteen minute walk from nearly everything on the strip. From Mandalay Bay to the Wynn, you are right in the middle of it all. Hopefully Harrah's won't change Bill's format anytime soon since they acquired the property. It would be a travesty if they did. Bill's is a fun, affordable spot on the strip that draws regular folks without pretention like you find in other large casino/resorts. If you want a clean comfortable room at a great price, then stay at Bill's. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: rosiegirl18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vegas for 5 nights as part of a 3 week trip to the U S & our stay at Bill's was the best value of any of the hotel's we used during our holiday. Our room was on the 4th floor on the Bally's side. Large clean room, really comfy beds & no problem with traffic noise. Delicious breakfasts in the Victorian room. The location can't be beaten, step out of the hotel right onto the centre of the strip. As mentioned in other reviews this is an old style hotel & doesn't have any of the fancy frills that some of the grander resort hotels have. However it has a good atmosphere & the "frills" are available at other hotels eg the pool at the Flamingo, next door. This is the second time we have visited Vegas, stayed at the Monte Carlo last time, which was lovely but really we only slept there, we spent most of our time in Bills (was the Barbary Coast then). We hope to return to Vegas in the future & would definitely stay at Bills again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location. Average otherwise.”
Reviews.Author: jsr914
Reviews.Content: Each year we travel to Vegas for a weekend get-a-way. This year we stayed at Bills for the first time. We have stayed many places in Vegas including Mandalay, Caesars, MGM, Hard Rock and Paris, etc. We have learned through the years that we do not spend much time in the room and, therefore, it is a waste for us to spend $200 or more (sometimes much more) per night for the big hotels. Therefore, we picked Bills because of the price and location. Bills is next door to Flamingo and Ballys, across the street from Bellagio and Caesars. In all, the location is perfect. From your room to center strip in 30-seconds. Close to the monorail and all the sights. What can I say that isn't already on this site? The other reviews are largely correct. The Bad -- The hotel is the old Barabary Coast, which means it is old and worn. The casino is small and dated. The four floors offer little in extras, such as a pool or views. The rooms are average and can be noisy on the bottom floors. The Good -- There is a certain old-Vegas feel to the hotel that adds charm. Our room was clean and comfortable and above-average in size. The bathroom was fine. The TV was large and modern. The staff were friendly and professional. The parking is free and it takes no time to get from your car to your room (unlike MGM and others that can take forever). In all, we had a god stay, with no complaints. Bills was about half the price of other hotels and had a better location than many. We would recommend Bills to travelers looking for value and who don't need the glitz and size of the monster hotels nearby. We will likely stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great !”
Reviews.Author: VIVSpain
Reviews.Content: We loved this small hotel. It is one of the old ones but well maintained - friendly staff - rooms are ok - bathrooms on the small size but everything very clean . no lines - a small cosy hotel in between the monsters ! We will go there again ! A plus that you can use the Flamingo's pool also ! This was the 7th time we went to Vegas and the first time we tried Bill's. We loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Bill's is all you need!!”
Reviews.Author: jamborino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's Oct 8 to 18. Let me start by saying that what you don't get at Bill's is the opulence and grandeur of say the Bellagio, Wynn or Venetian - if that's what floats your boat then don't stay at Bill's! What you do get at Bill's is a hell of a lot for your buck. The rooms are a good size, they're well serviced, comfortable and clean, check in and out is the fastest and simplest I've ever known, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the Victorian Room restaurant does as good a breakfast as anywhere in Vegas. As has been said many times before, the location is superb. The only negative for me is that I did find the traffic noise excessive, but this was soon fixed with the help of some ear plugs. It's much smaller than it's strip neighbours but it has an old style Vegas feel that only adds to its charm. As for the previous reviewer's comments that the room decor resembles a Victorian whorehouse - well, I've never actually been to one, but the whole point is that Bill's has been deliberately decorated in the style of a Victorian San Francisco gambling hall. Having said that I would stress that the decor is certainly not garish or over the top. And as for the people there being 'kind of trashy' - that's ridiculous, they're exactly the same mix of people that you see in many other strip casinos. I've stayed at the Mirage before for twice the price of Bill's and I know which of the two I'd go for next time I'm in Vegas. For people who understand the difference between good value and cheap you can't go wrong at Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “EHHHHH- ok enough if you're cheap”
Reviews.Author: decobh
Reviews.Content: Its in a good location. You dont need a car BUT the rooms look like a Victorian whore house. When I brought back someone to my room they made fun of me... which is kind of funny. The MAJOR plus is that you dont have to walk very far to get to your elevator and they do have those 42 inch plasmas. The people walking around are kind of trashy.. hey its called Bill's Gamblin Hall!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: bcv
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in Oct of 2007. Even though it is listed as a 2-3 star hotel (depending on web site), we had a 4 star experience. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and the staff was great. We made a couple requests such as "could we get an extra pillow" and the pillow was delivered ASAP without complaint. The location is fantastic. Right on the strip in the middle of all the activities. We had no need for a car as we were able to walk, or take the mono-rail everywhere. The room was quiet. You couldn't hear all the noise going on down on the strip. . . Well, except for the time when several firetrucks pulled up to Bally's next door with their air horns and sirens blasting. But that was an exception to the rule. We also liked the fact that in the evenings, there was a security guard at the elevators in the main lobby. If you wanted to go up to the guest floors, you had to show your room key. Not a fool proof method, but I'm sure it discourages most of the people who might have criminal activity on their agenda. We would absolutely stay at Bill's GH&S again! BTW, I've stayed at Caesar's before (at twice the price) and except for the fancier lobby, didn't consider it any nicer than Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring Vegas”
Reviews.Author: welly172
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bills for 4 nights at the end of our 2 week vacation. We were immediately impressed with how easy it was to park (valet or self for free) and on entering the hotel found our way straight to front desk and checked in to a lovely (huge!!) room. After 4 days looking in all the hotels on the strip we were glad we chose Bills, yes there are grander hotels but from experience of going inside them it must take guests hrs every day finding their way in and out, there is none of that at Bills it is positioned on the strip diagonally across from the Bellagio (can't get better than that), it is tiny in comparison to the likes of Bellagio / Venetian / Ceasars but we loved it and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Diasappointed with Bills”
Reviews.Author: loseapoint
Reviews.Content: Having read pevious reviews, I was disappointed with Bills. OK, the location is great, the room is above average in size and the television is huge - after that, there isn't too much going for it.. The place itself is old and tired compared to its neighbours, the carpeting in the casino and in the hotel is dark and dowdy. The room too was pretty drab and the bathroom standard was grim - the sink had cracks in it, the toilet flushed only occasionally, the shower head was set at a convenient height for exceptionally small people and the towels were well worn. I suspect that Harrahs bought Bills, with something else in mind for it - expand either Flamingo or Ballys into the BIlls space? I for one would not be sorry for them to do something else with the site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: r.butterworth
Reviews.Content: Older hotel centrally located on the strip on opposite street corner to Bellagio and Caesars Palace. Rooms are good sized, we paid extra ($20) for a room overlooking Bellagio water display ...worthwhile. General decor in need of urgent upgrade and carpet cleaning in public areas (although in-room bathroom etc were spotlessly clean) but this unlikely as hotel recently purchased by Harrah hotel group who will probably demolish & rebuid. Easy access from street/car park to checkin and guest elevators (monitored by security) without need to walk miles through casino. Main restaurant, Victorian Room is small and busy at breakfast etc, " fine" dining room, the Steak House has good food at reasonable prices but service is pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bills”
Reviews.Author: Mel_fuzz
Reviews.Content: I loved Bills. We wanted a hotel that was clean and in the centre of all the action. Bills is that and more. We stayed for 7 nights and the room size was perfect for that length of time. Bills is situated between Flamingo and Ballys with Bellagio and Rio just across the street. We took the $20 a night upgrade for a view of the fountains. We were put on the 4th floor (top floor) with a view of the fountains, Paris and Ballys. In my opinion the $20 was worth it but it all depends on how much time someone is going to spend in their room. The outside noise never bothered me. The only time I woke up was during the thunderstorm on our first night. I am fairly sensitive to smoke but our room was fresh and I found the casino smelt better than quite a few larger hotels too. The decor is very old fashioned but the rooms are very very clean and 42 inch tv is a nice feature. The kingsize bed was one of the most comfortable I had ever slept on. One massive advantage this hotel has got is there is not much of a walk to your room. The evalvators were situated to the left of the reception entrance. Most staff we came across were lovelly. I would recommend Big Elvis to everyone. He was amazing. We will be going back to Las Vegas next year and I really hope Bills is still there. It is a fantastic hidden gem right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: livmack
Reviews.Content: Booked 5 nights at Bill's months ago after reading reviews on this site. We got really cheap rates - about $110 a night for Friday and Sat and $70 per night for the weeknights. Check in was fast and easy. The rooms are clean enough and the beds very comfortable. Only bad thing about the rooms is that the housekeeping service was not so great - after 4 nights, the valance was basically hanging off the bed. Casino was pretty good too. Don't miss the 99c margaritas. Victorian Room was average and overpriced - go somewhere else. You can't beat the location and it was great for the price. I would stay there again - not the best place on the strip, but very adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel and best location”
Reviews.Author: RossGP
Reviews.Content: We booked one night in vegas at this hotel after a 2 week tour of Arizona and Utah. The hotel rooms are a good size, nice tv, etc. We didn't gamble so cannot comment on that. Check in was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Central location on strip”
Reviews.Author: Roaming_Kiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Las Vegas on a Friday night which is more expensive than midweek so Bill's room rate was very reasonable compared to many other hotels. It is very well situated nearly opposite Caesars. The room was nicely decorated and large with a flat-screen TV. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but disappointed with hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-Dublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights recently. In terms of location it is fantastic and because it is smaller it is much easier to get from the car to hotel room. The decor is in a style of an old west saloon but I thought all the brown actually made the place seen dark and tired. My room had a view of nothing really except the side of the Flamingo. Rates were not so great either $149 and $199. Main problem I found was that even though the room was non-smoking it, and the rest of the hotel, seemed to smell of smoke. The casino especially I found particularly smokey. I couldn't stay in for more than 10 minutes and ended up going to another. Vistorian room for breakfast was a 20 minute wait followed by an average breakfast and then a struggle to get the check from the waitress who insisted I must want more coffee or water. It took 3 attempts but I finally got to pay $14 for breakfast !! Regretted not going to the Dennys down the block. So if you are a non-smoker or have any form of breathing problems I recommend not staying here. Overall for me the location was the only thing going for it.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Las Vegas Gem”
Reviews.Author: vegasvarment
Reviews.Content: Finally booked a night at Bill's. Would have liked to have stayed longer but rates are too high a lot of the time for my budget. Love the Victorian style rooms. You can tell the hotel once belonged to Coast Casinos. Reminds me of an upgraded Gold Coast room and the smaller version of The Orleans room. Room was very clean and bed was very comfortable. Didn't hear any noise from the other rooms. I like this hotel because it's small and easy access to casino, restaurants and most of all it's mid strip. Casino is fun and the drink service is frequent. Also had a very tasty graveyard breakfast special, eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast, $3.95. I'm looking forward to my next stay only this time it will be longer. Just keep in mind it's not the Bellagio but it's clean, comfy and has the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is true”
Reviews.Author: Hayesworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's for 3 nights and choose the hotel based on trip advisor reviews. Everything you read is true. Beds are heaven, plasma TV, great staff, room service awesome. Even the 99 cent margaritas in the casino are great! This will be our Vegas hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's is the best”
Reviews.Author: vegascats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's Sept 2-8/2007. LOVED the hotel, location, gambling --everything. Have stayed around the area before, but decided to give this a try. We were told that we could use the Flamingo Pool (which we just LOVE), but unfortunately had no time to enjoy it. The room was big, clean and renovated. The plasma tv is a bonus, although we really didn't have time to watch much tv. I liked the fact that security checked room keys in the evening. Although the shower may be a bit low for tall people, we had no problem. (5 ft 8). The window opens up in the tub area but, I wasn't going to let 100 degree temps into my room. Although we were offered a strip view for $20 more upon checkin, we didn't feel this is necessary as we are not in the room except to sleep and shower. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. I would not hesitate to stay here again, it's a real jem.

Reviews.Title: “Gambled and it paid off!”
Reviews.Author: Tonyrosenalex
Reviews.Content: Booked our five night stay at the hotel based soley on the reviews on the site and we were not disappointed. It was our fourth visit to vegas so we had been in the casino area before and to be honest it is looking a little worn but check in was quick we had room 409 which has a side view onto the strip the room was very clean and large with two double beds lots of drawer space a small table and two chairs but no wardrobe! The hanging space is located in the vanity area adjacent to the bathroom. There was a iron and board which was handy. The plasma tv is a nice touch but we didn't watch much TV. The casino itself had some of the most reasonably priced tables although they did increase the minimum bets at the weekend but thats to be expected. The 24hr $1.50 coors is only valid at one bar and wasn't 24hr they went up to $2.50 every evening. We ate in the victorian restaurant twice the first time we felt rushed but the food was okay. The second time we had the chinese food which was very good. Overall we had another great time in Vegas and the stay at Bills was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: JeanAnderson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bill's from September 4th through the 7th, and I absolutely fell in love with the place! What a great deal in the center of the Strip! You can't beat the price, location, food, size of the room or the cleanliness. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the food at the Victorian Room was great. I ate three breakfasts and one lunch there, and everything was tasty and reasonably priced. I drink a lot of coffee, and my cup was never empty! The rooms are HUGE and very clean. The 42" plasma TV was nice but could use a few more channels. Big Elvis was one of the best shows I've ever seen in Vegas, and his show is totally FREE! How can you beat that?!? Plus, there's a 99-cent margarita bar and the drinks at the main bar were pretty cheap too. All in all, this was the perfect place for me and I will definitely stay at Bill's again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bills”
Reviews.Author: readytogo10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bill's 9/10-9/15 loved everything. Beds were comfy, rooms were clean, shower great. Nice plazma TV on wall. Will defindly stay there again. Didn't have a foutain view but i did have a view facing the flamingo. Big Elvis was great. All i can say if you are looking for a nice hotel on the strip very reasonable this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: SallyAldridge
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights at Bills. Rooms are excellent, clean and quite large. Huge TV was great, but did not use it too much. Was given a Bellagio facing room with no extra cost. I cannot emphasise how easy it was to get round this Casino and find your room. Check in was immediate, as was checkout. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Used restaurant for breakfast, was not disappointed at all. Sometimes had a 20 minute wait, but did not matter, just played the slots till our names were called. How easy.
