Would definately recommend this hotel, half the price of one of the larger Casinos and centre strip. Amazing. This was our 11th trip to Las Vegas and we are finally getting the hang of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great property on the Strip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: K&L092906
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the end of August, after reading TripAdvisor reviews. An older property with excellent location in the middle of the Strip near Caesar's, Bellagio, and Bally's. We phoned the hotel directly to make reservations and received a 10% AAA discount. Room was $63 for the first night, then $45 for the next 2 (middle of the week). Great value! We checked in early, just after noon, and stayed in Room 102, right at the end over the spotlight and sign. This must be the closest hotel room to the Strip in all of Las Vegas. Room was really nice! King bed was very comfortable. 42 inch plasma TV was great. Room was very spacious. It did smell kind of old, but this is an older property. We paid an extra $20 over the above rates, in order to get this room which had a view, which allowed us to look down the Strip and watch the Bellagio fountains. The only drawback about the room was the traffic noise coming from the Strip (you may want to bring earplugs). The Big Elvis show in the lounge was fun. Also, we had a really nice meal at Bill's Steakhouse, and breakfast at the Victorian Room. This is a smaller, friendlier casino, and if you like table games, and aren't a high roller, the table limits are lower than the bigger casinos. We took the Craps 101 lesson at 10:30 am, and that provided a nice introduction to the game. There is no pool on site, but you have access to the pool at the Flamingo, a short walk right next door. This is a beautiful pool area, with palm trees, and was absolutely packed in the late August heat. Overall, a great experience, and we would go back to Bill's!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific service”
Reviews.Author: akelmel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August last year and couldn't have been happier with my choice. It was a difficult decision to make as I wanted to my my Las Vegas trip as memorable as possible but I had to stick to a realistic budget. The staff were friendly and efficient and I especially got really helpful service from reception. Whilst I'm sure you can get 'jazzier' rooms at the bigger casino's, my room with super comfy king sized bed and adorable Victorian themed bathroom was perfect for me and it would have been more than big enough to accomodate a couple comfortably. I loved the location as it was just a hop step and jump to 'Caesars', 'The Venetian' and 'Paris'. I got a great deal on mid week rates ($60 US per night) and after visiting some of the other casino's thought that I really could not have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: GrassJelly
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying here very much. In the past I have always visited the casino but never thought of staying there. I'm glad I chose to stay here for this trip, and not listening to other people saying it is too small, and to old. The room was clean and spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. Shower and air conditioning worked great. Great views from window and the bathroom window which opens. It was nice to shower and look out to the fountains of Bellagio across the street. All service from staff was fast and friendly. The only bad part about this hotel is it does not have its own pool.

Reviews.Title: “loved Bill's will go back”
Reviews.Author: pookiepie4424
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Bill's was very good. We did have a problem with the tv remote and it did take 2 phone calls to get it fixed ,but no big deal. Our check in was very fast. We asked for a room with a view and we really did have a good view!! I could sit in front of our window and watch the Bellagio fountains. Bill's location just could not be beat. Very easy access to the strip. Much better than Bally's, only because the elevator is right by the side door. We did try to order room service and they didn't have the champagne on the room service menu that we wanted, (it was my birthday so I was being particular about it) but we just cancelled and went to out to eat instead. Big Elvis was on vacation, so we missed him, the other lounge entertainment was not that great. The casino has been redone since we had been ther in Dec of 06. We liked it better before. They took out alot of slots & put in tables instead. I thought the slots were much tighter. We did not stay and gamble very much at Bill's but it was a good central location to be at and was very reasonable for the rooms. We did not eat at Bill's so can't comment on the food. Check out was very fast, no bell men to help but there were cabs right out the door for the ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: melmar26
Reviews.Content: After looking at the reviews, chose to stay at this hotel 2 nights at the beginning and end of our 3 states tour. We had stayed off strip on previous holidays but on reading reviews booked this hotel. First 2 nights we had room 433 - near the lifts but very little noise. Last 2 nights we were given room 130 - a fountains view room which we had not asked for and we did not pay an upgrade!! This was a bit noisier being nearer the busy Flamingo Road but it did not really bother us. Staff were great, no queuing for registration, rooms clean. We only ate breakfast once in the Victorian room - compared with lots of other places around, it was not worth it. Would be quite happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal and Location”
Reviews.Author: KO75
Reviews.Content: I was not disappointed in this place. If you have been to Vegas before this is the place to stay. It was walking distance to everything. We had a fourth floor strip view room. I was able to see the Bellagio fountains. The rooms are very spacious. We like to go over to the Rio buffet. So we would go next door to Bally's and catch the shuttle to the Rio since everything belongs to Harrah's. Same thing with the taxi when we were leaving. We just crossed the street and were able to catch a cab at Bally's. The casino's slots were pretty loose and their 99 cent margaritas were great. We ate at the Victorian Room the night we arrive and had steak and eggs. Very good for the price. They gave you a lot of food. I would definitely stay here again next time. I'm not big on the grand casino feel. I like being able to just come downstairs and play the slots and not have to walk 5 miles to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MarieGrace
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel at a good price. Located right in the heart of the Strip. Rooms were clean, if a little old. Loved the big flat-screen TV and super-cold air conditioning. Reminded me of old, gaudy Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “lucky it was only a 2 day stay”
Reviews.Author: floridasandy
Reviews.Content: after reading all of the good reviews, we thought that this would be a nice place to stay on the strip. the only nice thing about this hotel is the location. we stayed on the 2nd floor, room 204, which is supposedly an upgraded room and we did have a view of the fountains, but not nearly as good as from the paris hotel. it was incredibly noisy with outside traffic more so than any hotel we have stayed at in vegas. the hallways looked dirty and the garage smelled of urine. the beds were decent and the valet service was good. we would never stay here again when there are so many better options on the strip and off strip the orleans is way better for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: snowangel2007
Reviews.Content: This was a very affordable place to stay. It was on the strip and in the middle of almost everything. The hotel room was spacious and nice. It was clean with comfortable beds. It also had a nice flat screen t.v. that we didn't get to use much. The casino area wasn't the best and the only annoying thing was how to parking and hotel elevators were separate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: bettybook
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean, in excellent condition with nice views of the Strip. Casino is small and rather intimate. Great location across the street from Caesar's, Bally's and right next door to the Flamingo. If you go, don't miss Big Elvis in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice for Us”
Reviews.Author: teachermanMichigan
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas for a wedding at the Wynn. It was our first time in town, and we did not want to spend a ton of money on a room we would not be in very long. People on Trip Advisor suggested Bill's. It was perfect for us. Clean, safe, in the middle of EVERYTHING, reasonable, ($100 vs $450 right across the street at Bellagio). They had a 99 cent Marguerita Bar vs. $12.00 at the Wynn. They had $1.50 beer vs $7.00 at the Wynn. They had all of the table games and slots. 50 feet from front door to check-in and another 30 feet from check-in to elevator. We did enjoy visiting the other hotels and even had drinks and a meal in a couple of them to enjoy the ambience. We also went to a show at Treasure Island. From the crowds I saw that night, I am glad I stayed at Bill's. Thanks to all for the recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Diamond”
Reviews.Author: izzletodasmizzle
Reviews.Content: What a great place right on the strip. There is never a wait to check in. (My friend that stayed at the Flamingo had to wait in line for 30 min) The rooms are nice and big with big plasma TVs. The casino is small and loud but it really makes for a good time. The only problem i had was when i asked for a coffee maker when i checked in they said they all had already been reserved. After settling in on the way back down to the casino i ran into a group of house keepers and told them what had happened and one women asked me what room i was in and told me that she would personally get one for me the next morning from another room, and sure enough she did. I have stayed here 3 times now and will keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Bill's the Best”
Reviews.Author: LItLady
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night in this great hotel. The room was very large, very clean, bed was comfortable, and mounted on the wall was a large plasma TV. While the the casino is noisy (don't miss the Big Elvis show in the lounge, it's free), our room upstairs was quiet. Walking down corridor to our room, I felt as if I were in a Victorian Western hotel (more like the real Vegas). We liked it much, much better than all the glitz of the larger casinos with their need to impress. Affordable? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “It's the best”
Reviews.Author: bluenwhite
Reviews.Content: Bill's is an absolute gem in Vegas. I have stayed there twice in the past year. The location is ideal and the price is wonderful. The staff is very attentive and professional. I will never pay to stay at the high price mega casinos again. It is so nice to take an evevator right to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the name fool you - this place is NICE!!”
Reviews.Author: Jill2009
Reviews.Content: We had visited Bill's casino during our last stay in Vegas and found it to be a nice small casino with a 99 cent margarita bar and slots that seemed looser than other casinos, but never stayed there. After reading reviews here we decided to try it. Great price on Orbitz ($99) on a night when other hotels were much more expensive. We were the only folks at the counter for both check-in and check-out although the hotel was booked. The room elevators are 20 steps from the front desk, which was a nice contrast to other casino hotel rooms. We checked in late and no Bellagio-view rooms were available but our room (number 415) still had a real nice view of the strip. We loved the larger than average room (450 sf as opposed to the standard 350 sf). The two queen beds were wonderfully plush and comfortable. The large-screen plasma TV was mounted on the wall above a nice large bureau. The bathroom was tucked away in the back and was divided into two areas, with the shower and toilet in one room and a sink and changing area in the other. Being a group of 4, this came in very handy! Shower pressure was just perfect. On the down side: we did put a "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door, but I saw housekeeping knocking on everyone's door at 9a.m. to see if the room could be cleaned. Seemed a little early for Vegas. Staying at Bill's you can use the Flamingo pool next door... a large complex with 2 hot tubs, and several pool areas. However, the Flamingo pool was surprisingly dirty when we were there - with beer bottles, empty cups and cigarettes all over the little "islands" in the pool. Apparently it hadn't been cleaned from the night before. We saw 3 life guards, but they were all on their phone or reading books, so I doubt they'd notice any children in distress. Overall though an amazing place to stay - we'll go there again next time we're in town!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Mike_and_Andrea
Reviews.Content: Bill's was our choice for a one night stay because it is on the central strip and it was extremely reasonably priced. The room was very clean, check in/out was fairly quick and we loved the central location. You could get to any of the big hotels or even the drugstore or souvenir shops very quickly. Also note that Bill's has $1 margaritas all day/night so make sure to grab a couple as you're passing through! If you are heading to Vegas for a true vacation, you probably want to stay at one of the big hotels. But if budget is a concern, then consider staying at Bill's because at least you are very close to everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Robles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a hotel right on the strip but without the $300+ a night cost. We found a gem in Bill's Gambling Hall and Casino. Although, when we booked the hotel it was called The Barbary Coast. It did not matter. The hotel is small with no pool which was fine for us. It is centrally located right in the middle of the action. The staff was SUPERIOR to other hotels we've stayed on the strip. It didn't take us forever to get from our room to the strip. We walked EVERYWHERE and it was so much fun. The rooms are very roomy with a 42" flat screen in each room. A bonus for my sports freak husband. Also there is a sports betting area (really nice and large) and it was perfect for my hubby to sit it out awhile so I could shop, gamble or whatever. The rooms are what sold me and I will definately be back. Repeated calls to the front desk for more pillows and another blanket and room service were all greeted with friendliness. Everyone was wonderful. I was not overly impressed with the restaurant there but who cares. There are so many other places to eat in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Gigifoofoo
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a night in Vegas and stayed here. I LOVED IT. It was 77 bucks and literally the nicest hotel room I've ever had. It makes the Ritz Carlton look like poop. The best part was being right next door to Battista's where they serve FREE WINE WITH DINNER. The location in general was great. I HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE DUMP !”
Reviews.Author: ajie
Reviews.Content: I booked 6 months IN ADVANCE and requested a non smoking room overlooking BELLAGIO'S FOUNTAINS. When I checked in I was given a very dingy room which faced the side of a building.The room reeked of stale cigarettes. I called the front desk and was told to get the room I requested I had to pay $20 more daily as the hotel was now owned by Harrahs. I immediately checked out although I had prepaid for 4 nights. I was so disgusted I told them to keep the money.

Reviews.Title: “Had An Amazing Time At Bills”
Reviews.Author: pukshellz23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Bills Fri, Sat ,Sunday . I upgraded to a view room which was an extra $20 a night. It was well worth it. Great view of the fountains at bellagio as well as the Eiffel tower. The room was so comfortable with the best bed and pillows. The plasma TV is such a nice touch! We ate at the Victorian Room downstairs. Do not recommend.Food was not good at all. What we did enjoy are the 99cent margaritas they have all night! YUm. The casino is dated but it gives you a feel of old vegas which is kinda nice. The casino does smell more like smoke than the newer hotels. Plenty of slots and cheap tables to satisfy your gambling needs. The location of the hotel is the best part! The location is in the middle of the strip with Margaritaville and the Flamingo right next door! You can use their pool which is great. The liquor store is right behind Bills as well if you dont want to spend an arm and a leg at the bars. This hotel has easy access to your room and the parking garage with not having to walk a mile though a big hotel. Bills was great and I will not have to book another hotel when I go to Vegas as long as Bill's is there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, right price!”
Reviews.Author: MP376
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Bill's recently for a Girls/Birthday weekend away from the husbands. We selected this hotel because of the location and midline price range. Bill's is located about mid strip, across from Casear's and diagonal from Bellagio. We were able to access both sides of the street and both ends of the strip easily from this location. The rooms were smallish, and the linens looked a little worn. There is no pool at this hotel, but you can walk next door to the Flamingo and use theirs. The staff was helpful and friendly throughout our visit. If you are looking for a no frills room to drop your stuff and get a few hours sleep, with a perfect location and fair price, I would definately recommend Bill's. If you are looking for a little more pampering and fancy decor you probably want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Mid-range Hotel, with Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: toni.lister
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I recently stayed at Bill's for 2 nights on our cross-country road trip. We found it to be an excellent hotel for the price, & would easily recommend Bill's to any potential guests. Although there are a lot of places to choose from when picking accommodation in Las Vegas, unless you have a ton of money, you might end up being stuck in the 'back section' of some of the nicer hotels. Don't let this happen to you - as with many Las Vegas hotels, the prices are cheap during the week, & in general, Bill's is a good compromise between classy & cheap. We arrived in the evening & easily found a park in the car parking garage next door (free). Check in was straightforward & we were also told that we had been upgraded for free (I think I may have asked before our arrival about getting a larger room if possible) - in fact we were upgraded to a suite. I imagine this to be a junior suite of sorts, knowing the type of luxury that some visitors stay in while in Vegas, but to us, it was really nice - we had a lounge room with a TV, leather couches, coffee table, dining table & cheairs, & a bar area (with fridge). There was a guest bathroom, as well as one for ourselves (which was on the small size considering the rest of the rooms, but we weren't complaining in the slightest). The main bedroom was large, with a massive bed, double wardrobe, safe, easy chair & TV. It was certainly luxurious compared to what we had been expecting, & compared to other places we have stayed in the past, as far as price was concerned. Bill's looked as if it had had a recent upgrade. There were several restaurants to choose from, including the Victorian Rooms where we ate several times - there were loads of people here who had come to eat from other casions, & it was open 24-hours. I don't think there was a pool at Bill's, but I felt as if the casino was about right for us. Many hotels don't have a casino but again, Bill's managed to find the middle-ground. If you are looking for a massive gaming floor & boutique stores then Bill's is not for you, but of course, these are all nearby. The gaming floor at Bill's was fairly small, but there was just enough of everything that you could have a decent time there. There was a stage for performances, several bars, & low-limit tables (some of the lowest in Vegas). It was also actually possible to get free drinks here, whereas other casinos apparently seemed to offer them but rarely actually came to take your order. The casino had a good feel about it & we preferred it over a lot of the other places. Located fairly mid-strip, it is opposite Caesar's Palace, & near the monorail & Bellagio's (with the fountain display). Most other casinos are a short walk or monorail ride away. There are also plenty of restaurants & small stores to shop in nearby on the strip, if you are after cheaper alcohol or tourist items. In general, we really enjoyed Bill's - it offered a taste of luxury without costing the earth, & is a well-presented, spacious mid-range Las Vegas hotel. The casino & restuarant were great for first-timers or older people who might not like the larger environments. My boyfriend & I would easily stay here again, & in fact, already talk of our next trip to Vegas, based on this hotel alone. It was a really good stay - thanks for that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: FromAnotherUniverse
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8-12 July 2007. We had previously stayed at the Boardwalk and wanted something similar in size and scale. Bill's met the criteria and it's central Strip location was even better. The rooms were clean and pleasant. We were charged $20 extra per day for a Strip view which was fantastic. The taxis leaning on their horns was annoying at night. Being right at the intersection of Las Vegas Blvd and Flamingo Rd was responsible for that. Whatever you do, don't eat dinner at their Victorian restaurant. It's a rip - high prices for Denny's-like food. Go across the street to Caesar's or the Bellagio. Breakfast at the Victorian was good and reasonably priced. Re internet, Bill's charges $11.99 daily for either LAN or wireless connectivity. I used the LAN drop and it worked well. Re parking, the self-parking garage entrance is on Flamingo Rd. It's covered so protects against the sun. They offer valet parking but I prefer hotels with self-parking as I don't trust a stranger with my car. All in all, we would stay there again. Also, forgot to mention that the slots seemed looser than other casinos. We were told the same by a local so for slot fans check it out whether you stay there or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value --- Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: lovesNY
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Bill's Gamblin' Hall. What a gem for the price. No problems at check-in. Staff was courteous. Room was large. We did ask for a room facing the Ballagio fountains but was told that we would have to pay an additional $20.00 per night. We opted to take the cheaper room which faced the Flamingo wall. No problem as we were only in our room to sleep. The carpet was clean, the beds very comfortable and the pillows great. Loved the large flat screen TV. There is no coffee pot in the room, but if you ask at check-in, they will give you one at no additional cost. Coffee and Creamers/sugars were provided daily. I loved the fact that we had no lines at check in or anytime we wanted an elevator there was no line. In observing the larger casinos, there were always lines checking in and out and also at the elevators. I hope that since Harrah's purchased this gem that they don't decide to implode the whole group of hotels (Imperial Palace, Flamingo & Bills) and build a hugh casino on the whole block. I personally like staying at the smaller type casinos. This casino is in a great locations on the strip. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: matelle
Reviews.Content: I would have to give Bills a A+++ My wife and i stayed there from june 29th to july 1st before going to the Flamingo and i would have to say this hotel rooms rank up there with the big hotels. It is so easy to get to the rooms and no long walks it took less than 2 minutes to check in and less than that to get to the room and we were clear at the end of the hall from the elevator. Check out was just as fast to. We stayed in room 404 which is the second to last room closest to the strip with an awesome view of the strip and fountains. I will stay here again if i have the chance. it is a very clean hotel and highly recomend to the people on a budget or people who would rather spend more on shopping or gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Remember the TV show "Cheers"”
Reviews.Author: Cheers0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bill's July 3 - 7 for our 20th anniversary getaway. Think of the TV show "Cheers", add a Casino, a Restaurant, and a Hotel and you have the ambience of Bill's. Zero wait for check-in / check-out, exceptional and friendly staff all around, perfect location. After wandering around some of the mega-monstrosities (Caesars, Paris / Eiffel tower, Venetian, ect.), it always felt like coming home when we returned to Bill's. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price on the strip”
Reviews.Author: abbagirl123
Reviews.Content: I read trip advisor prior to going, so I knew what to ask for in a room. I asked for a nonsmoking room away from the strip so it would be away from the noise. The room was clean, the airconditioner worked well, and the price was right. It was well worth the price considering neighboring ballys, flamingo, etc.. were a lot more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Bill's Best Bet!”
Reviews.Author: AirlinesOfWorld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this great "find" July 1 - 5, 2007. Originally, I was going to stay at the Sahara, but after reading so many negative reviews, I took the chance to stay at Bill's. I made the right decision! Immediately upon checking in, the staff was very friendly, courteous, and offered me a room upgrade to a corner unit (202) with a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Check-in was quick and easy, with no lines at 7:30 in the evening. The room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable bed and pillows. I loved the plasma tv. Internet was quick, and easy to hook up to. The air conditioner kept the room very cool and comfortable. The bathroom was a little cramped, but, I am not one who lives in the Bathroom! Must say that the water pressure was EXCELLENT!, plenty of warm water, and loved the stained glass window in the shower. The curtains kept the light out of the room. Very little noise from the street (but must admit, I have a severe hearing loss, so . . . .). The chairs and table in the room allowed plenty of space, without filling cramped. Carpet was clean, with no signs of stains. Housekeeping was great. They cleaned the room when requested, and I always came back to a clean room, with my personal items left alone. The casino was small, but did well there. Things were easily within walking distance, as well as being able to catch the Monorail at the Flamingo, and the Deuce busses on the strip. I loved the old time feeling that the casino has, and hope that it retains that flavor, now that it is owned by Harrah's. This is a gem on the strip, and would highly recommend it to anyone! While it is not your five star hotel, it is very comparable to a Holiday Inn, with my room rate being $60 per night. Beats the $100 plus per night from other hotels on the strip! I will definitely stay here again on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and honest”
Reviews.Author: SK1956
Reviews.Content: Chose Bill's based on positive Tripadvisor reports. Have used TA extensively to plan several trips, but this great experience influenced me to contribute this first review. The convenience of a few steps between where the cab let's you off and the front desk, then a few more steps to the elevator and room was easy. As previously mentioned check-in and check-out was a breeze. The room was clean and quiet, with a non-descript view of the Flamingo. Use of the Flamingo pool was no problem. Took the Craps 101 lesson offered in the mornings. Upon completion, the diploma was a $5 match play coupon. Bill's tables had lower limits than the big hotels. The staff was friendly and helpful. The best part was when I left some items after checking out, they mailed me by belongings including some cash. I don't know if my leaving a housekeeping tip influenced anything, but it was an excellent experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations...”
Reviews.Author: mjohns7861
Reviews.Content: I came to Barbary Coast (I understand now the name has changed) with low expectations. I thought if was not staying at one of the big hotels I would be out of the loop on a weekend with 3 friends. This hotel exceeded all my expectations. On a bit of a downer the front desk clerk was not particularly cheerful or helpful but once we got to our rooms - we were all pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very well appointed and comfortable and the 42 inch plasma in each room is awesome. I would argue the room is nicer than rooms at other Vegas hotels like MGM and Aladdin that I have stayed in. I was surprised, to be honest. The casino is small but if you are a low stakes gambler this is the best action on this side of the strip without going to the end of the strip or Downtown. The location on the strip is suburb and the price is right - the two reasons we chose this hotel. Overall, this hotel offers a great value, a suburb location, and nice low stakes gambling. If this is criteria you are looking for - you have found your Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shanester81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's 1-3 July and had a great stay. We were able to check in early at 11am and there was no line at all which is great as we have waited in long lines in other strip hotels. The room was great for the price we only paid $60 a night and for the location it was a great deal. We could see the Bellagio fountains from our window. We ate at the Victorian Room twice and it was good and cheap. Yes you can hear the street traffic below but we turned the ac on and kept the fan on and it kept the street noise down. My only complaint with Bill's was the counter space as the bathroom counter was not big enough for two people to put their stuff on. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: libertybell
Reviews.Content: stayed here at the end of June and the rate was very good for the location. positives: * great location for walking the strip * very easy check-in and check-out * very friendly staff * very good drink service in the casino, probably the best we encountered in all of Vegas * updated rooms with plasma TV * pretty good breakfast at the restaurant down stairs * use of the Flamingo pool and facilities next door * nice view of the fountains and strip as requested (3rd floor) * very good band at the casino bar every night we were there negatives: * VERY noisy all night from the street...not the traffic, but the emergency vehicles seemed to go by every 15 minutes with their sirens blaring * The computers went down on the 3rd day we were there and the players cards didn't work all day. To top it off, when the computers went back on line all but 60 points were erased from the cards previous totals and the management didn't offer any compensation or even an apology? Hopefully an isolated incident * pretty tight slots although one did hit for $800 one night which helped solve that problem * valet parking is very fast and the free parking is also very easy, but you can only turn on Flamingo road towards the strip when exiting so you catch all the traffic every time you leave the parking garage Overall a good stay and a very good bargain and the positives far out weigh the negatives. Would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Center Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: daisitroy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Las Vegas. We stayed at Bill's. We had booked when it was still the Barbary Coast and were a little apprehensive with the name change. Especially since they were unable to find our original reservation and had to redo the reservation. But it was great. The location is perfect. Easy access to the Flamingo, Bally's, Bellagio, and Caesar's Palace Casinos. Near the monorail stops at the Flamingo and Bally's which is a great way to get to the other end of the strip without walking. The hotel rooms were typical hotel rooms. I had a great view of the strip which was a little noisy but not noisy enough that I could not sleep. The beds were comfortable. Rooms were clean and the staff was pleasant and accomodating. We were able to check in almost two hours before check in time as our flight landed early. We only ate in the Victorian room restaurant. The place is always crowded and there is usually a wait for a table. We waited 20 minutes one night which isn't too bad. The food was good. Overall it was a very pleasant stay. We usually ate breakfast in the Seattle's Best shop on the casino floor. For the price the location was excellent and could not be beat. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: travlsolo2
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at Bill's; paid $72 for a Monday night. I had booked it after reading reviews and checking websites for rates. The location was perfect and the size made it easy for check in and parking and getting to the street without walking miles through a huge casino. Nothing was available on a higher floor and the Bellagio fountains were not visible from our window, but that was the only negative to our stay. Our room was large and I like having shower and toilet separate from vanity/sink area. I would definitely stay there again, although my husband would like to try one of the bigger, fancier places because he enjoys "people watching". I say we can always hang out in one of the bigger places, but stay at Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Kitsch without much gllitz”
Reviews.Author: jhzmac
Reviews.Content: This is a sure bet if you desire a bargain price, excellent location with generously-sized rooms and a great view overlooking the most interesting part of the strip. Other pluses: a plasma TV, comfortable bed, a clean, decently-appointed room, thick towels and peace and quiet when the strip gets to be a little much. That's the benefit of a small place that doesn't have the oomph of trendier more upscale hotels. Though there was no coffeemaker in the room, a coffee bar in the casino downstairs was easily available. The casino is small and dark, but with the big hotels all within a short walk, this didn't matter at all. Staff was very friendly and accessible. Upon check-in, we were asked if we wanted a room with a view or a quiet location. We chose the view and were warned that there might be some noise. There was no noise, just a ring-side seat to the Bellagio's nightly fountain show. I would definitely come back and recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: aleshiamarie
Reviews.Content: We had room 102 which had a great view of the bellagio fountains. Quick check in and out and it only took about 5 minutes to get to the room. Only problem was that the air conditioning unit was very loud when running. Overall great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: LadyLong
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on two separate occasions during our trip earlier this month ($104 a night incl tax). The first occasion we stayed two nights and had no problem checking in. The room was a good size, clean and comfortable and it was the only hotel we stayed in that had a flat screen tv. We had a (distant) view of the Bellagio fountains which was nice but the downside was it was near a main junction which made it quite noisy at night. We took advantage of the room service which came promptly and the food was of a good quality (well, as chicken fillet burger and chips go!). The security guard at the lifts checks your room key so you don't get any strays on the hotel floors, which was reassuring. The second stay was fine also, although the room and bathroom seemed a little scruffier than the first and it was still noisy at night - so bring earplugs. The casino itself is quite small but fine for all your gambling needs. Getting a drink at the Marguerita bar turned into a bit of a nightmare though, so we gave up. Generally we thought Bill's was good value for it's location and room comfort. Would stay there again unless there was a good discount in one of the bigger places.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: KarenL1007
Reviews.Content: As in the other reviews- Great location, Great value. Nice rooms , spacious (how much are you really in your room in Vegas?) Fast check-in & out, as opposed to the monster hotels. Yes, I would have appreciated in room coffee, but room service was available, as well as Seattle's Best in the lobby. Victorian Room has good food. The casion floor is OK with lots of friendly staff. The best part for us? Being able to walk in and be in our rooms in 3 minutes without breadcrumbs or a 20 minute walk to the room. Priceless. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Centralized and pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: BMB1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bill's from 6/14/07-6/20/07. I had read all the reviews on tripadvisor and for the $ it was worth it. Got there at 10am and was able to check in immediately. The check in process was a breeze and the girl was really nice. Was on the 4th floor(top floor) view of Bally's and the Bellagio water show everyday and night. The room was clean and spacious. King size,non-smoking, 42inch plasma tv, desk,table w/2 chairs,and nice bathroom w/all amenties(soap,shampoo,lotion,etc.). The room was done everyday w/no problem. The hotel was very clean. The casino/hotel had an old look to it like Victorian style. Which was nice. Ate at the Victorian restaurant 3 times and was very happy with their food. Had breakfast,lunch,and dinner. They also had a band playing a few days on the weekend. They were called, Freeride,and they were really good. They played all kinds of music. The drinks at the bars were good and inexpensive. Everyday they had small frozen margaritas for $.99 cents. So they were good and refreshing for them hot days. They also had a hotdog cart person selling a hotdog and beer for $3.00. that was a good bargain too if you wanted something quick. A rum and coke was $4.25 and a 16oz beer miller lite was $2.00. Never gambled at the casino, so was not sure how the machines were really. Security all over the hotel was great. Whenever we came in late at night, there was security by the elevator checking room keys. So that felt good and safe. Ice machines on every floor by the elevator, a/c was strong and cold. The best part of this hotel was the location. It was in the heart of the main strip. You had Bally's on one side,Bellagio on the other, Flamingo next door,and Ceasars across the street. You can't beat the location. Why pay sooo much $ for a fancy hotel that you are literally going to sleep and shower at. We were only in the room late at night to sleep in and left early the next morning. I highly recommend Bill's and there staff was really great! Polite and courteous from the front desk staff to the bell hop guy to the maids,etc. The only thing that I suggest that was a con was no safe in the room and a mini refridge. The safe was the most important thing. I had never been to a hotel w/out a safe. If you want a safe you have to rent one in the lobby in a cage like and its $60 refundable. But, who wants to keep going there to get some $. So, that was the only complaint,other than taht we did fine. A samll fridge is good so when you are thirsty you can have something cold to drink. But, I would recommend this place to anyone on a budget or just for a nice clean place. Another thing is that I liked about this hotel was,when reading all the tripadvisor reviews,people complained about these huge hotels and the wait for the elevators. Bill's had 2 elevators,4 floors and they came by quick all the time....no major waiting. Also, the front side that I stayed in can get a bit noisy,which some reviewers put in, that is true. Overall a great stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on strip”
Reviews.Author: Sandy35
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed. We stayed on the 1st of June and had a room facing the bellagio fountains . We were very comfortable and liked the view and large tv. It was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very accommadating. I did not gamble much just had drinks at the slot machines. Nice location and my husband was able to drive there and park in the garage without any trouble. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean room”
Reviews.Author: posmanti
Reviews.Content: Well, score another one for Trip Advisor. The reviews on this were right on. My room (409) was clean and relatively renovated. I am a picky traveler (I usually pack clorox wipes!) and this room met my standards without any added cleaning. Beds were comfortable enough with fluffy (but, smallish) feather-like pillows. The flat screen 42" is a nice touch. The bathroom was fine with a powerful shower, but lousy sanitary paper (a little softer would be nice Harrah's!). There was absolutely no line at check-in/out -- which was awesome compared to the HUGE lines next door at Flamingo or other large hotels that I witnessed. Bill's patrons can use the Flamingo pool next door. It is a very easy walk -- in fact, my friends staying at Flamingo joked that the pool was closer for me than for them. The garage is extremely easy access (again, very unusual for Las Vegas) - bankrupting the valet. This is not a fancy hotel at all. But, the location is unbeatable. I walked all over the strip and loved having the central location and manageable hotel size. There's a Seattle's Best Coffee bar downstairs -- as well as a dumpy coffee shop and the most popular after-hours club in Vegas (Drai's). Service was very friendly - but, I didn't need much help. I was very pleased with security checking for keys at the elevators. There is noise from the strip and street. I was on the top floor looking at the Flamingo entrance on LV Blvd. It was noisy, but tolerable. I brought ear plugs, but didn't need them. Then again, I was exhausted each night I finally went to bed! Glitzy or glamorous -- no! Convenient and clean - definitely! I paid $400 for four nights (Thurs to Monday). I would say this was a fabulous bargain for the Las Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Titans65
Reviews.Content: Bill's Gambiln Hall & Saloon is the best location on the strip. This is a low rise hotel (4 floors) with parking on the corner of Flamingo and the Strip. This hotel is next the Flamingo, across the street from Caesars, and kitty corner from the Bellagio. Why spend between $200 - $600 at the Belligio, when you can stay a Bills from $70 - $120 a night. The rooms are fresh and they look updated. There is a 42 inch plasma screen TV in every room. The beds and pillows are comfortable. The only negative's were no in room coffee. The main Casino does look a little outdated, and could use an upgrade. Best go to Bill's now before they razed this hotel and put up another mega monster hotel on the strip. I just hope that Bills's will be there for me for my next Las Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best place on the strip”
Reviews.Author: shrek61
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 2nd thru the 6th. Paid $129 for Saturday and $69 for the rest of the nights. Perfect location!! I thought the rooms were on the large side. Had a view of Bellagio and Bally's. We were not affected by the noise as some have stated. We were so tired that we fell asleep without a problem. The king bed was very comfortable. The problem some mentioned with noise in the hall I do agree. I think why that is is that most hotels have the bathroom right when you walk into the room so there is a buffer, Bill's has the bathroom on the outside wall. The only complaint I have at all with the room would be the shower head is too low, I am 6 foot and it was about eye level. One of the best things is the size. I can get from my room and thru the casino in no time. After playing poker all night at the Flamingo the last thing I wanted was a long walk thru a casino to get to my room. I was closer to the poker tables than if I had booked at the Flamingo. I was able to check in at 1230 so that was a great plus. Any staff I came in contact with was very friendly. I left the do not disturb sign up the whole trip, and just caught the maids for fresh towels so i did not need to worry about everything being locked down. I will definately stay here for every trip as long as it stays open.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Bachelor Party”
Reviews.Author: pfriz51
Reviews.Content: Went for a bachelor party with 12 guys. Great location. Stayed Sat,Sun, and Mon, and paid $150,$70, and $60 worth every penny. Check in and check out only took a couple minutes. Rooms were small but nice. If you stay here you are allowed to use the pool at Ballys or the Flamingo. The Flamingo pool was nice and only a couple minute walk from Bills. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the hotel and rooms were very clean. The Victorian Room served great food at a very fair price. I have been to Vegas and have stayed at big hotels(including the Bellagio) and loved this place. It is what it is a fair hotel at a great price and location. Dont compare it to the Bellagio or the Wynn for it is not that type of place. It is for dudes on a bachelor party or people who dont what to pay for the glitz of the big hotels

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: reinsalot
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Las Vegas before and wanted to stay on the Strip so we chose Bill's based on reviews regarding the good location. We also were amazed at the price of some of the larger hotels on the Strip for a 1 night stay for a Saturday night. Bill's seemed reasonably priced. The location is excellent and it is really in the middle of the Strip. It was great to be able to visit the other hotels within in few minutes walk. I was disappointed with how outdated and worn out the hotel is. It also didn't feel especially clean because it is so worn out. If we visit Vegas again I would stay at a different hotel within the same area., and plan a trip for a week night visit to be able to afford one of the nicer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Double_A_71
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect when booking a room at the new Bill's Gamblin' Hall and Saloon. I know it had been the Barbary Coast and bought recently by Harrah's. I booked a room here because I had few other options in the center strip for a convention. I was quite pleasantly surprised by my room at Bill's and I hope to stay here again. They have installed 42 inch plasma tvs in all of the rooms, seemed to have cleaned up the rooms and redecorated them a little bit. I enjoy the fact that Bill's is a small hotel, but right across the street from bigger casinos. The staff was friendly and helpful, the table games were fun and plentiful and the sports book was very modern. The bathrooms were a little small, but it's an old hotel. Also, the walls seemed a little bit thin, since I could hear people in the hallway quite easily. I would strongly advise guests to book a room that is not on Flamingo Avenue. My street side room was quite noisy overnight. I had a very nice experience for only one night and I hope to return to Bill's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Cancyl
Reviews.Content: Got a very good deal at $56.30 from travelworm.com. Great location, great size of the room for 3 of us. Quite clean, and nice view to 5 star hotels opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Biggin
Reviews.Content: There's nothing really to add to the reviews below, so I'll just confirm that ifyou want a really reasonably priced, clean, well located hotel, then you should choose Bills. It really is a great little hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rate!”
Reviews.Author: wilkintj
Reviews.Content: I give this 4/5. With that said, I would not rate this a 4 star hotel. But the experience was above average. The location of this casino is about as good as it gets, in my opinion, on the strip. The price was right (~140 a night), the room was clean (flat screen tv was awesome), and the Victoria Room restaurant is perfect for a late night breakfast before bed. Yes, this is an older hotel / casino. Yes, it's smoky. No, the cocktail waitresses aren't as beautiful as some of the 5 star resorts, but for the money, this place can't be beat. It also has cheap tables and cheap slots. I would definitely recommend this for a group of guys going to Vegas to have a good time. For a honeymoon, or romantic weekend, I'd pick some place else.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: highflyerswa
Reviews.Content: For the money and the location it can't be beat. Staff is friendly, location is close to everything you want to see or experience, right in the middle of the strip. Its very affordable and I have never had a disappointment when I stay there. Check in is a breeze and its easy to find your rooms when you stay there. I never spend time in my room except for sleep and its quiet and clean. Why pay for the expensive hotels if you are never there. It does'nt make sense. I hate the new name by the way but the place is great. I'll not stay anywhere else on the strip if I don't have to.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: RCFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bill's for five nights recently. I picked the hotel based on the reviews here on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed! What a great place, at a great price! Check-in and check-out both took only a couple of minutes. The small size of the hotel really helps as far as how long it takes to get out to the strip, and how much less walking is needed . I didn't find the hotel to be run down at all. Sure the hotel itself is older, but I found it to be very well maintained. Our room was cozy and was kept very clean. There really wasn't anything that I would change about Bill's. I would stay there again tomorrow. In comparison, my brother-in-law stayed over at the Wynn, so we had a chance to check it out too. Unless someone else is paying the bill, I would choose Bill's over the Wynn. The common areas at Wynn were impressive, but the rooms in my opinion were not worth $299 and up a night. In conclusion, if you want a clean, comfy room, Bill's is great! If you are looking for prestige, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: JnRinWI
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. It is very old and run down. We booked a room with a king bed and received a room with two double beds. The mattresses were old and sagged in the middle. The rooms are dated with exception of the plasma t.v. If you are planning on spending any time in your room at all I would stay somewhere else. We booked this more inexpensive hotel as part of a leisure vacation before my business trip started. This was our first time to Vegas and this really was disappointing. We pre-paid for two nights and checked out after the first night. Luckily we were booked at The Platinumn for the rest of our stay which was about a 10 minute walk from the stip. The Platinumn was fabulous if you are looking for a place to relax between gambling, it is brand new and features all suites which was well worth the extra money. We booked Bill's for $70 night and the Platinumn was $135 a night mid week.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the truth!!”
Reviews.Author: Squidcv62
Reviews.Content: I was going to write a long story about how those that were so unhappy with this place are the same people that nothing makes them happy, but I decided not to. I prefer they don't come back to Bill's because then the room rates will go sky high from all of the business. Here's the facts. It's right in the middle of the strip. You're about the same distance from the very north end as you are the south. Pretty much everything is going on within 2 blocks on either direction of where Bill's is. If you want to be on the strip, I suggest you go here. It's not big, fancy, or have a theme like the other casinos on the strip, but it is a small, more quiet, and a nice place to stay for 1/3 of the money that the casino right across the street charges. I paid $70 dollars a night for 4 nights. That's $280 and will get you one night in the Bellagio which you are a half of block from. All you are doing is sleeping and showering in your room. I might add that this room was just a normal king as in any hotel and was very nice. It had a 42" T.V, a cherry wood "i believe" headboard, very comfortable bed, nice wood trim throughout the room, nice shower, sink, toilet, with instant hot water, and the room was always clean no matter what time we left it was clean when we got back with fresh linens. If you're room means everything to you and you're not going to leave it, I'd still stay here over the Bellagio, MGM, Caesars, you name it. I stay in hotels every other day for my job, and this is a nice hotel for what you do in a hotel. There are 2 restaurants that are very good, and plenty of slots and table games to choose from. Security stands post at the elevators after 7 to make sure you're a guest going "up." I never lost any sleep. I often stay in hotels in big cities right downtown. Bill's was more quiet than what I'm used to. Check in was about 3 minutes and checkout was about 1 minute. Waited about 3 minutes for a cab at 8 am when none were around. The bellhop saw me and came right out and got one for me. There are bus station all over the strip that take you downtown or on down the strip for $2. If you want to go "see" the big casino's/hotels, just walk there. You have to leave your room to go see them anyway even if you were staying there, so why not get a nice, cheaper room and just go visit them? Caesars, Ballys, Flamingo, Paris, Bellagio, are all a stones throw away. Venetian, Mirage are about a 15 minute walk....with the crowd, and the Rio is directly in front about 2 blocks. Bottom line, if you want the strip, but don't want the $200-400/night strip price, go to Bills. You WILL NOT find a cheaper/nicer place to stay on the strip than Bills.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place, Best Value, Best Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joiebean
Reviews.Content: Bill's is a great place to stay!!! We went to Vegas for a romantic week and got engaged while we were there! Bill's is right in the middle of the strip and we had so much fun at the casino. It is pretty small in comparison, but the people there (other people gambling along with the dealers) were a ton of fun and everyone was down to earth and there just to have a great time. Definitely no stuck up people! We learned how to play Craps the first night (well afternoon) we were there and the table manager was more than willing to teach us while the game was going....something you wouldn't find many table managers eager to do at the bigger casino's. I've stayed in a penthouse suite at the Bellagio as well on a previous trip and have to tell you, the people were really stuck up, everyone expected a tip, the service wasn't that good and definitely not worth the value. I can't believe that Bill's is one of the most inexpensive places to stay on the strip because of how centrally located it is, how clean and updated the rooms were and how nice everyone was. The Bell hop was one of the nicest people, getting us a shuttle to the airport (definite recommendation-CLS shuttle service-$5 per person no matter how many bags you have-taxi is $20 min and the shuttle comes on the 15's-1:15-1:45 etc as long as you have the bell hop call). Also make sure to ask for a room on the 4th floor with a view of the fountains. We had room 422 and it had the most spectacular view!! We had the Eiffel Tower and the Fountains and if you open the bathroom window you can listen to the music that goes along with the fountains too! And while there is no pool right at Bill's about 50 feet (literally) away at the Flamingo is a great pool with a bar and waitress service, which Bill's guests can use anytime. Plus there are real Flamingo's and a garden you walk through to get to the pool. Plus, by saving money on the hotel without compromising location, service (we got room service on Saturday night and it only took about 20 minutes), cleanliness, etc, you can spend the extra money left over on all the fun to be had!! Make sure to go play Craps too! Great time at Bill's! We'll definitely go back! You definitely feel like you got your money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Not Clean and Not Upfront with fees”
Reviews.Author: snugglesiniowa
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel and interior design of the rooms. But, at check-in, I was not told of any extra fees. But, at check out, I was told, I would have to pay a phone fee. When I stated, I would not pay it because I did not use the telephone phone and I was not told of the fee, the manager stated he would take the charge off. But, a week latter the fee was billed to my credit card without my approval. The room was very dirty compared to other hotels on the strip and in Las Vegas that I have stayed. I had a great view but the windows were very dirty. I would not stay again. Lot's of other selections of hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Frostback
Reviews.Content: We just got back, having gone with my parents for an extended weekend. It was the only time my partner and I could get away, everything was booked with the big fight, and Bill's was the only attractive and well situated place available for a reasonable price. Their motto is "With rooms like this, why stay anywhere else", and we found ourselves repeating it. Very nice, extremely spacious, great views. The noise is quite easy to deal with if you shut the bathroom door and close the curtains. As other posters say, the locations is the best, and we liked the atmosphere. Everything is on a very manageable scale, and there is a certain welcoming feel to it. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for location, value”
Reviews.Author: Caro11
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at quite a few Vegas hotels, on and off the strip, and downtown. This one has its drawbacks - it's a bit dark, small building, and non-flashy - but these things can be plusses as well. The parking is SO CLOSE, you can go back to your car from your room within 2 minutes if you need to. No lines at check-in, which is right outside the elevator doors (instead of walking thru the whole casino just to get to registration!) I would appreciate a chain/latch-type thing on the room door - that bothered me a bit, but it looks like they just renovated, so hopefully that will be added. Also, there was ALWAYS alert security staff in front of the elevators asking everyone to show their room key, which we appreciated. I asked for a room on the quiet side (I don't care about the view so much as being able to sleep) and it was fine on the side of the building. The rooms are actually pretty roomy for South Strip standards - including a small eating area and a cute bathroom area w/ ironing board/iron! Not much smoke smell in hallways or rooms, which was nice, and the room was really clean. We asked for a fridge, which is 10$ extra, and didn't mind paying, since we needed it, and the room price was good enough. We like to indulge once in a while, and this isn't the place to feel like a high roller, but it's great when you just want a place to sleep that's in a good location, for a good price on busy w-ends in Vegas (Cinco de Mayo Sunday was ~75$! A bargain...) Note to management: put in-room chains/latches on doors please!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Normsie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bill's Gamblin' Hall and Saloon from Apirl 22-26. The location is wonderful, and we had a fountain view room which was spectacular. There is noise, so if that will be a problem, choose a room on the other side of the hotel. We enjoyed the view of the eiffle tower and the belligo fountains tremendously. We ate a couple of times at the victorian room and would recomment their prime rib. Breakfast was excellent also. We also watched Big Elvis and he is quite good. This hotel has a lot of charm and is very nicely decorated. The only problem we had was that their computer system was "down" frequently, so we couldn't use credit cards at the Victorian Room, and at checkout we could not get a final receipt. which the desk clerk promised to mail to us, but we have never received it.

Reviews.Title: “The best location and value on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: maddokm
Reviews.Content: We were a little leery about staying here - but I'm so glad we did. The location can NOT be beat! Adjacent to the Bellagio - right beside the Flamingo - and right on the famous strip. Of course, it is not as new and up-to-date with the other casinos - but that was one thing we we liked about it. It was really like you were at an old gambling hall. Especially for novice gamblers, it was great. You did not feel as intimidated - and the tables were pretty reasonable. The rooms were average - the plasma TV ROCKED! But it is true - you aren't in your hotel room that much. When we did go to bed, there was no noise from other rooms or the outside, so a perfect place to get a little shut-eye. We did take advantage of the steak special - and I guess it was OK for the $ - but I would probably recommend going elsewhere. We also stayed at New York, New York - and yes - it was grander - and more chic - but I would definitely stay at Bill's again too. Again - you can't beat the location, the staff were all super friendly, the rooms were very accommodating, and we felt very safe at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Hits, but a few misses”
Reviews.Author: MichaelonLI
Reviews.Content: I usually stay off the strip at Palace Station, Gold Coast, or Terribles. But I got a great rate of $50 on Expedia, so I thought I would give it try. Overall it is a nice place. I wanted a room facing the Bellagio and the front desk was most accommodating. I was in Room 202 which is the corner room with a great view. The bed is extremely comfy. I love the little peek-a-boo window in the shower. There is a large flat screen TV. There are lots of lamps and cieling spotlights that can make the room quite bright. As the hotel is small, using the parking garage is a snap compared to the mega-resorts. Bill's is in a million dollar location, that alone is good reason to stay there. The room is rather large and the king bed takes up only a portion of it. There is a huge empty space that feels as though someone stole the furniture. There is a tiny table with two chairs. But there is room for a couch, coffee table, you could probably even fit a ping pong table in there. But instead there is just lots of empty space that makes the room look incomplete. I guess Bill likes the "stark look." No doubt about it, the room is noisy. A passing fire engine sounds like it is coming through the wall. I went down to the casino about 7:00 in the morning. There were two incidents of loud and drunken guests being escorted out of the place by security. And the guy next to me at the craps table was warned several times about shouting curses on every roll he missed. The pit bosses and security were on top of the situation but it seemed like a disproportinate amount of bad behavior at what is usually a slow time on the casino floor. I'm glad I stayed here before the place gets imploded as part of the Harrahs buyout. I would stay there again if I could get another great rate. It is a piece of old Vegas charm that offers comfortable accommodations and a great location

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Satch1SouthWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bill's from 5 - 10 April 2007 and thought it was excellent value for money - we paid only £280 for five nights which included the Easter holiday weekend and the Grand Prix. It's a small hotel for Vegas and so there were no check in or check out queues - we were actually in the room within ten minutes of getting out of the taxi! They also let us check in early. We went to a lot of the big hotels and saw huge check in and check out queues which would put us off. The room itself was spacious with a very comfortable king size bed and a 42" television screen. Everything was very clean with housekeeping and clean towels every day. We were at the front of the hotel and had a fabulous view of the Paris Eiffel tower and the Ballagio fountains - only negative side to that was some traffic noise from the strip - however we didn't find that a problem due to a few nightcaps from the bar! Staff were really friendly and helpful and the Victorian dining room had good food and service. The bars were much cheaper than those in other hotels. Excellent central location as it was within walking distance of many hotels and also had a bus stop for the Deuce double decker bus service just up the road outside the Flamingo. The monorail also ran from Bally's which was opposite (much quicker than the bus but you can't get downtown to Fremont Street on it). We would have no hesitation in staying there again if we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “distance from Bill's”
Reviews.Author: Mo76
Reviews.Content: We stayed just before Christmas and found the Barbary( Bill's) to be excellent) I would like to also confrim that the 24 hr Cafe in the Flamingo (also a Harrah's property) had the best sandwiches for late night. Exit Bill's North side cross the driveway and use the doors where the patio deck is. The poker room is right there. Go up the ramp and left at the Golf desk and go straight up the hall about (50 feet) and look on the left. The club wrap was terrific. The prime rib at Bill's was terrific I hope they don't mess with that part of the menu.(Victorian Room). The hotel was convient and centrally located. Due to the slow time before the Holidays, everything was geared for a customer appreciation week including the Palms. (50% off all buffets for the week) We also utilized the 24hr bus passes for the CAT ($5) and they can be used on ALL bus routes. (Flamingo Rd included) Since we are from New England we found the weather to be nice in December even though the locals thought it was too cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: NomadSF
Reviews.Content: Decent rooms, some with a nice view of the Bellagio fountains & Eiffel tower. Mediocre room service....apparently their 24-hour service was closed early the night I called for food...had to walk a mile to some place in the Flamingo to get a sandwich. No pool, although you can use the pool at the Flamingo & maybe some other facilities since it was recently bought by Harrahs. Also, their players club seems to be messed up with the ownership change. Overall, a good comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: novice_anna
Reviews.Content: I know many reviewers have raved about this hotel, but I fail to see why. On the plus side: the rooms are clean and comfortable. The location is great. The negatives: this is a depressing place. This is not a place you will want to spend any time in. It is dingy and has a "bus station" feel to it. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay on the strip and plan on spending every waking moment somewhere else, this is the place. If you want to gamble and eat in the place you are staying- go elsewhere. You can find other deals on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem !”
Reviews.Author: Diamondgirl1
Reviews.Content: After reading the many positive reviews on this property, we booked it for our anniversary trip to Vegas. I had spent days researching for a property that would be central, but not overwhelming. Check-in was a breeze, and we got the 4th floor room we had requested which overlooks Paris and the Bellagio. It was a quiet location (except for traffic noise which we had been forewarned by fellow posters.)We took earplugs, but never used them. We never missed any sleep. I used room service every morning and found it to be delicious and arrived in a timely fashion. The room was very clean, and the cleaning staff was accomodating and pleasant. We had our meals at the Victorian Room, and again were not disappointed. The casino is small compared to surrounding hotels, but on at least FOUR nights, we talked with people from those other hotels who were not happy with their rooms or their casino. Staff at the casino were friendly and helpful. The free drinks kept coming. My husband already knew how to play craps, but took advantage of free lessons given by the casino. It must have worked because we came home with more money than when we started! LOL Rooms are basic, but now have 42" plasma tvs. If you are looking for a small, friendly, clean and pleasant hotel in Vegas & lively casino, Bill's should suit your needs. You can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: MSLM4
Reviews.Content: The central location on the strip is wonderful and our room was spacious and clean. The check in and out was fast,courteous and without a LINE like the other big hotels with thousands of rooms. Another nice feature was the free onsite parking and not blocks away from the hotel. Overall I would definitely stay here again. I felt it was the best deal on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to wrong with Bill's”
Reviews.Author: stdokl
Reviews.Content: Bill's is just what a person would expect for the price. Location is excellent as mentioned in previous reviews. You are basically in the middle of the strip. Quality and size of room is average but clean a bit older but with some nice updated touches such as the plasma tv. The bathroom reminds me of a Best Western with seperate sink and toilet shower area again bathroom was dated but clean. We had three rooms they put us all next to each other on the first floor 20 strides from the elevator. We were on the casino floor and the strip in minutes. Gambling has low limits and was average but friendly. Sports book is small we made bets there but watched the games elsewhere. Food wise the victorian room is always busy but just average quality. Great hot dogs in the sportsbook we ate plenty of those between the eight of us that stayed. All in all most reviews have hit it right. It is clean although old with a bit of an old casino odor. It is a perfect location and service was very good, dealers friendly, cocktail service okay and front desk service okay. Maids were not noisy in the hallway at all as mentioned by some, in fact we thought they were very courteous. Lastly the noise issue from the strip, as far as we were concerned was a non factor if you go to bed late enough and party hard enough sleeping is never a problem in Vegas if your looking for a quiet night of sleep try a different city. In any hotel in Vegas people are coming and going all hours of the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Best hotel on the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: corndogy
Reviews.Content: I always use Tripadvisor to check out where we are going to staybefore we book. The reviews were spot on! Small hotel on the strip. Walkways just outside the front door to Ceasars/ Bellagio and Bally's and Paris! Short walk to our room! Room had great beds and pillows as well as the advertised 42" plazma tv. View of the fountains at Ballagio from our room! There is no pool but do not fret! They have recprocity with the Flamingo(next door) for use of their pools!!!!! Flamingo also has a great breakfast buffet. Valet parking has your car just 1-2 minutes away so there is no wait. This is by far the best stay in Vegas we have had in 10 years. Better than Ceasars or any large hotel where you spend 15 minutes just to get to your room which is no better or worse than Bill's!!! Let's keep it a secret between us so we can always get a room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: deskclerk102
Reviews.Content: Bill's is an excellent choice in Las Vegas for comfort and convenience. Our room was spacious with a large plasma TV. The views of the strip and Bellagio fountains are nice from some rooms on the Bally's side of the building. If sirens going down the street don't bother you, this is a good request to make when reserving. There is no pool, etc, so this is not a place for kids. However, the casino is complete and the limits are low. Big Elvis in the lounge area is excellent. Didn't try the steakhouse, but The Victorian Room was good...even the Chinese food believe it or not. The Flamingo next door is a monorail stop, which is convenient. Harrah's free shuttle to Rio is on the other side at Bally's. Caesar's Forum Shops are an easy walk away. Battista's Italian is excellent and about one-half block behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Trip Advisor, GREAT choice! Great stay for Bally's conference”
Reviews.Author: bestestes
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at a 'name brand' hotel in Las Vegas, or at least one of the big themed hotels. After reading the reviews of the Barbary Coast we went for it, despite my wife's raised eyebrows when I told her it was only 200 rooms, and right in the middle of the strip... When we arrived, the name was different than what we booked, but had traces of the old name and old vegas style. We were surprised to find the front desk about 20' inside the door from the street, with one young chipper girl waiting to check us in. Our room was as requested, on the street, with a view of the Bellagio fountain (rm 202). Nice view of the strip, nice view of the fountain show, and E A S Y access in/out of the hotel. We were attending a conference at Bally's, and it was probably easier for us to get to the show than those folks staying at Bally's! Very easy access. Clean room, good housekeeping, convenient restaurant. Internet was sparodic, and didn't work at all the 2nd/3rd days. The man at the front desk was an [--] about me having problems, and denied that any others existed- but the building engineer that I happened into on the way down the elevator said they had been experiencing internet problems since the name changeover with service providers etc (they did credit my card for access fee of 10.99/day). That mean man at the front desk was the only negative element of this trip. We'd stay there again, and would recommend it to others. We paid $120/night; when we asked about a late checkout they offered an add'l night at $73, or half day at $40, but were reluctant to add more than 30 mins to our noon checkout. We asked for pool ideas and were directed to the Flamingo pool with the (now) common ownership- which makes this a great deal. Flamingo's pool, Barbary Coast / Bill's charm. No noise from inside our room, but easy to hear the TV and conversation noise when walking in the hall from inside the rooms. Plenty of street noise in the room, easily masked by setting the AC unit fan to 'on'. Room smelled clean and the TV was nice. We were fortunate to witness the Stardust implosion the first night we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bill's (Barbary Coast)”
Reviews.Author: MAL12
Reviews.Content: While planning our first trip to Vegas, I read almost every review I could find on the Strip hotels until my heading was swimming in detail. Each time, I kept coming back to Bill's (or the Barbary Coast as it was called at the time I booked). I was even one click away from booking the Bellagio but again, I kept coming back to reviews of the BC. So, I booked the BC and we were NOT disappointed. The hotel room was spotless (my main concern in any hotel), the bed was one of the most comfortable we had ever slept in, the staff was friendly and the location was PERFECT. Hotel has an old world Vegas charm and we loved the character displayed in every detail of the interior. The casino was lively and Big Elvis was....well, we're not sure what Big Elvis was but he did make us smile. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, but Too Loud”
Reviews.Author: una_mas_cerveza
Reviews.Content: We had room 451, top floor facing the Flamingo - non traffic side. The noise we had was caused by housekeeping. All three morning starting around 8:30 we got to listen to the maids clean. Vacuum cleaners bumping, and bumping and bumping in the hallway and adjoining rooms. Knocking vigorously, yelling out "Housekeeping, Housekeeping!" and non-stop talking between them in the hallway. I know this is their job, but I have never stayed at a hotel where the staff this loud. It was just plain rude. This was my second time at Barabary Coast and my last. However, I will still visit the property as they have a great casino and fun bar!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden little gem right on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: sdbyrd
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I took a weekend trip to Vegas in mid-February. I started researching on TripAdvisor and stumbled upon the Barbary Coast Casino/Hotel. Since it was a weekend I was expecting slightly higher prices. When I first checked their website, a room (King) would be $150. I checked the next day and the rate dropped to $100 for a Friday night. I went ahead & grabbed it. We were meeting others the next night and staying in another hotel, so we only needed the Barbary for one night. When we were walking to our room, we noticed our room had 2 doors for the entrance. Sure enough, they had upgraded us to a suite for no additional charge! The room was very spacious and very nice. It also had a great view (see pics) and a huge garden tub/separate shower! I couldn't have been happier with our choice. I'm sure the other rooms are just as nice but it might be worth upgrading, depending on the cost. We stopped by their restaurant the next morning for breakfast and it was also excellent. The location of this hotel couldn't be better. It was directly across the street from Bally's and within a mile of just about every casino on the main strip! I would definitely stay here again if I had the option.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Barbary”
Reviews.Author: hisinc
Reviews.Content: Well, my trip started off to a rough start, as my original flight was cancelled, therefore instead of getting into Vegas at 1pm, I didn't arrive til around 9pm. I called the Barbary in between connections to tell them I would be a "late arrival" and to make sure my room was not given away. Although I had booked months in advance (and the hotel charges you upfront for one night plus tax), considering it was NBA All-Star weekend, I was concerned. No worries however!! My room was ready, and exactly as I had asked for it with 2 queen beds. The rooms were spacious and clean. The plasma tv was large. The bathroom had a nice set-up, especially for 3 females, as the toilet and shower were in a private area, and the sink had it's own private area. Both locations with doors you can close off from the rest of the room. The tub/shower was a good enough size for me, and having a window in there that you can open is great for letting out the steam or other fumes before the next person uses it. The beds are very comfy, and the maid service did not bother you if you had your do not disturb sign out.
