We always removed the sign once we would leave out for the day, and would always return to a clean room. At one point, they did not restock the washclothes, only towels and handtowels. And when I requested more, they sent up more handtowels. This was minor, but was a little strange. Maybe they ran out of washclothes. Anyway, I have no complaints about the room or the hotel. There is security at the elevator, that checks for your room key at night. The casino was small, but not being an avid gambler, it was perfect for me. At some wee hour of the morning I went down to the casino, and the staff was very kind to me and actually taught me the basics of roulette. The table was empty, and the dealer said it was the perfect time for me to learn. So that was great!! I got a one-on-one instructions on the rules of the game. We ate one morning at the Victorian room.. the breakfast was good, and the waiter had a weird sort of humor, but he was really nice. The location is above all the BEST thing about this hotel. You can practically walk to almost everything and can see a lot of the major hotels just by standing outside of the Barbary. I recommend this hotel to those persons who do not need the glam and glitz of the bigger hotels. If you just want a nice place to stay, on the strip, that is reasonable and convenient... then this is the place. Unless you find a comparable rate at one of the monster hotels, I would save my money for things like shopping, attractions, etc... and stay at the Barbary!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great rate!”
Reviews.Author: mulli31
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas many times and stayed at some of the larger hotels, but this time for my husband's first trip I decided to try someplace new, and based on reviews on this board I chose the Barbary Coats. We had a 2nd fllor room on the Flamingo Road side, which can be noisy with the water show at Bellagio across the street and traffic on Flamingo Road, but it did not bother us at all at night. If noise might be of concern for you, just ask the front desk for a room on the other side of the hotel. We were in Vegad for the Pats-Colts playoff game (Pats fans) and after unsuccesfully trying to find seats at a sports bar to watch the game, retired to our room with its 42" plasma TV and wathed the game in peace, whcih was great. I liked the bathroom, it was older design but all tile and very nice. The hotel is centrally located so we were able to walk up one end of the strip 1 day to see other hotels and attractions, then walk the other the next day. The Victorian Room is a nice restaurant in the hotel where we ate breakfast each morning - the complimentary cofee cake they serve could be breakfast in itself! Overall a great experience and one I have already recommended to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Room ok for the price but too loud”
Reviews.Author: tracey720
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at the Barbary Coast based on the reviews on this website. We normally stay at other larger resorts but thought this property would be ok for a short stay. The room was as described on the hotel website and it was clean. Check in was quick and the staff member was friendly. The big thing that I want to warn others about is the noise level in some of the rooms. The window in our room did not close all the way and the noise from the street was VERY loud. Our room was also near the elevator shaft and all night you could hear the cables moving and a loud banging noise every time the elevator stopped . We were unable to sleep much at all. We did not ask to be moved to another room, which may have helped, but decided to change hotels so that we could relax for our last 2 nights in Vegas. If you stay here, I would reccomend asking for a room on one of the upper floors that is not close to the elevator shaft.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: runrzwife
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! We take 2-3 trips to Vegas a year, and this hotel is definitely our favorite. We had reserved a standard room, but, upon check-in, were upgraded to a suite. It is a small hotel by Vegas standards, but that is one reason we loved it. Didn't have to wait for elevators, didn't take forever to get from our room to the casino or outside. Can't beat the location on the Strip. The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. We also won more money here (video poker) than anywhere we've stayed. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Grinninjen
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Vegas on Saturday. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Barbary Coast for 2 nights. You absolutely cannot beat the price for this location! Center strip, across from the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace, you can pick up the monorail from the Flamingo next door. You don't really need it though, as you are in walking distance of so many major attractions. The hotel is small but clean and the staff very friendly. Nice plasma TV's, not that we watched it much! Our friends had a suite at the MGM and I was surprised that we actually had a nicer TV in our room than they did! We stayed in room 106 and had a terrific view of the Bellagio fountains. Some reviewers complained about the noise from the fountains but I honestly did not hear a thing. The pocket door to the bathroom did make a horrible screech when I tried to use it. I definitely heard that and so did everyone else in the hotel! Overall, I great stay I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old time Vegas feel”
Reviews.Author: Lay9
Reviews.Content: Went on the back of the reviews and did not regret it. Clean and comfortable rooms, plush towels and comfy king size bed. Elvis was good...lovely voice., try to see him at some point on your vacation in the Lounge. I think he is 16.00 to 18.00hrs..not so lucky on slots...broke even though. Ironing board and iron in room...always handy.Took shuttle bus to sister Hotel orleans and was more impressed with the variety of food but it is a much bigger Hotel so you have to weigh up the pros and cons. Big meeting went on halfway through our stay at the Barbary Coast while we were there regarding Harrahs takeover. Staff seemed to be happier after the meeting so it looks as though things may stay pretty much the same, apart from a name change. Freindly almost cosy atmosphere and the age range seemed to be late 30's upwards, It is my third time in Vegas and would probally stay here again...Very easy and quick to check in. Paid $80 midweek per night., in my book for the two of us...excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Getting into the Garage Just OK”
Reviews.Author: tomnett
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in the middle of the Strip. Small is good in the fact you never have to wait long for an elevator. Small is good in that you don't get lost in the facility. It has a great location and the rates were reasonable. The staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms facing Flamingo have a great view of the fountains of the Bellagio. The down side of being small is your not too far from the street below and if you are on the first room level, you do hear some of the crowd noise. The rooms are spacious with a large flat screen tv. The bed was comfortable. The hotel appears a little worn but clean nonetheless. The biggest drawback was the entrance to the parking structure. The entrance is on Flamingo and returning from the Strip requires a left turn (there is a left turn lane). Because of cars and pedestrians, we sometime chose to go around and make a right into the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Barbary”
Reviews.Author: funfamilyfun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our anniversary trip to Barbary Coast. The reviews on Tripadvisor were correct, we loved it. We enjoyed that the property was small and easy to navigate. We toured the other hotels in town and commented on how long it would take to get from the lobby to your room! Our room was very clean. The plasma screen was great. The shower pressure was amazing. Our room overlooked the Paris Eiffel tower, the Bellagio fountain and we could see the mountains. Housekeeping was great. We also ate breakfast at the hotel and it was great. If you are looking for a place to sleep, centrally located and do not care about a pool, this would be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: tabbykat
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas and we were getting married. We stayed at three hotels during our week the first being Barbary Coast. This hotel was great for the price we paid as we wanted cheap for the beginning of our trip before we got married. It was around $65US/night. Located across from Caesar's right in the heart of the strip it is a perfect base for exploring Las Vegas Blvd. When we checked in we were upgraded to a suite. Not sure why, but we weren't complaining. The room was large with seperate living area with 27" TV (bedroom also had 27" TV neither plasma, unfortunately), two bathrooms and a bar. My husband's family also stayed at Barbary for the same price in regular rooms so we also saw those rooms. They were just fine and they had plasma TV's. The rooms are very clean and quiet as we were on the first floor directly above the casino I thought it would be noisy. We never tried the restaurants, but there is a really friendly Italian restaurant right behind the Flamingo (next door to Barbary) that is fantastic. Can't remember what it is called, but it starts with a "B". Our first night we went to the casino bar for a couple drinks and decided to play the slots. I was able to play for over an hour on $5 and I got a bit drunk as they gave us free drinks while we played. Great first night. If you don't plan on spending much time in your room, and who does in Vegas, Barbary Coast is a great buy. We also liked how small the hotel/casino is. After walking through the mega Casino/Hotels, coming back to the Barbary was a relief. My husband and I hope it is still standing the next time we visit as we both agree we would be happy to stay here again. We also stayed at Bellagio and the Venetian and although Barbary doesn't hold a candle to Bellagio, I would choose it over Venetian. Not impressed at all for the price we paid and the room we got with old, dated furniture and overlooking construction. Barbary Coast, better than we had thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Barbary!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa_marie72
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonable priced hotel in Vegas for my 14 yr. anniversary. I read the great reviews on trip advisor so decided to stay there...it was far more cheaper too! I have to say it was a great hotel....nothing you would get lost in. You can actually get to your room in minutes. Plus there is a security card by the elevators checking room cards...which is nice. And everyone is right about the beds....they are SO COMFORTABLE! Yeah, you can hear the traffic outside....when your sober, but it didn't bother us at all. By the time you're ready to go to sleep from all the alcohol and running around believe me..you don't hear a thing! I couldn't ask for a better location...walking distance to pretty much everything! Awesome, awesome! Check in and out was a breeze and maid service was excellent! You can't go wrong staying at the Barbary...it's worth it! I would definately be staying there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the rough!”
Reviews.Author: Salamar
Reviews.Content: In planning this trip to Las Vegas, I spent MANY hours looking up reviews for several hotel/casinos on the strip. Having been to Vegas and walking by the Barbary Coast, it wasn't even a consideration when planning, but a friend of ours that was to meet us there suggested it. After reading all of the positive reviews, I reluctantly agreed and booked our room. Boy, am I glad we did. I am a bit of a hotel snob, a room has to be absolutely clean. I take my ever present container of Lysol Disinfectant wipes with me on EVERY trip. I wipe down the toilets, counter tops, remote controls, doorknobs....you name it, I clean it. Each and every surface I cleaned, the wipe came up just as white as before. I can't say that about some other higher priced hotels. The rooms where fairly good size, the toilet is in a separate room with the tub/shower, so you aren't holding up anyone from using the sink/vanity area. The beds where VERY comfortable. And the plasma TV hanging on the wall is a beautiful thing. We never heard a sound from any of the other rooms or from the hallway, even though the hotel was booked solid when we were there. One morning my husband ordered room service. We had waffles w/fresh sliced strawberries and cream. YUUUMMMM!! The cream was real whipped cream, not that mess in a plastic tub. They told us it would be brought up to the room in 35 mins. It only took about 20 mins. QUICK! The casino is small compared to the other mammoth casinos, but it is nice and cozy. Every employee we encountered was very nice and knowledgeable. We asked for a good "locals" place to eat breakfast one morning and was sent to a great little place. And according to Mike the wonderful bellman that has been there for 22 years, Harrah's bought Barbary the same week that an investment firm out of Texas bought Harrah's, so it will be years before they can do anything to this hotel. This investment firm does not have its gaming license and since it takes years and years to get it, they can't touch the hotels/casinos. I was very surprised by this hotel. On the outside, it looks dated and in need of some TLC, but on the inside, its warm, cozy and very nice. Barbary Coast is home to a 4 diamond rated restaurant (sadly, we didn't take advantage of it) and one of the hottest after hours bar around. Who Knew??? I really liked the fact that after dark, you had to show your room key to a security guard to get on the elevators. I would definitely stay there again. We highly recommend this hotel. Go without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: jssujon
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, good customer service. The rooms are nice and recently refubished. I liked the ease in entering and leaving the hotel. Not like walking miles at the Mirage. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally clean and safe, mid-strip”
Reviews.Author: knr
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Barbary. The hotel exceeded my expectations in every way! The employees were friendly and helpful on all levels. The rooms were clean, large and no trace of smoke in the air. The only drawback were the down pillows, as I am not a fan of them. The window open in the shower for fresher air, too. We had a south facing, 4th floor room from which we could view the Bellagio water fountain show. The hotels location can't be beat and neither can the rates!! Highly recommend this to everyone and this will be my hotel choice from now on. My other favorite hotel is Monte Carlo just down the street, but a higher price!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Verbatim
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Barbary Coast after staying three nights at the Fitzgerald's downtown. It was great! The beds were the most comfortable beds I've ever had in a hotel room. Don't know where they got them. The Barbary Coast is such a neat older-style hotel. Has many neat characteristics ... with the woodwork and the glass windows. The staff is very nice ... from the front desk people to the maids to the security man before you get on the elevator. I really liked that they check room I.D. in the evening to be sure that non-hotel guests don't roam the hallways. It's a great location. Right across the street from Cesaer's Palace and right next door to Bally's and Flamingo. Only down a block from the volcano, and the fountains at Bellagio are right there. Great place for a great price! They'll match any prices you find on the internet so keep searching and keep calling them with new rates and they'll lower them each time you call.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: MacsMomBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Barbary Coast, Jan. 15 - 20. We had chosen the BC based on the reviews of this website and were not disappointed! Check-in was quick and easy as was finding our room. Unlike the huge mega-resorts, we did not have to wander around the hallways looking for our room. We had read that noise might be a problem and since we had a room on the 2nd floor, there was some concern. But, we did not have any problem for 4 of the 5 nights we were there. The exception was Friday night when there seemed to be a lot of sirens, etc. But it never really bothered us all night. We had a partial view of the fountains and the strip but our room was a little far back but we liked it! We also liked the fact that security asked for a room key after 7:00 at night to anyone wanting to go to a room, makes you feel a little safer! There were also a lot of security in the casino itself, I suppose because there are so many people at the tables. The rooms were exceptionally clean, we thought that might wear off after a few days, but our room was just as clean the first day to the last. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly and they don't make you feel like they are waiting for a tip just by giving you directions. We especially liked the casino which is on the smaller side but always lots of people, especially at the tables. If you go out the side door which faces Bally's, you can catch the shuttle which will take you to the other Coast properties and you can get a taxi there also. The shuttle runs every 20 minutes but we never waited that long, they seemed to always be pulling up. The other properties seem just as nice but the Sun Coast was definately for the geriatic crowd. We did not eat at the BC, as the Victorian Room was always crowded. But, as was also recommended on this website, we tried the Paris Buffet. It was incredible and I would recommend that buffet highly! We will definately stay at the BC again next year and would recommend it to everyone, it is an excellent hotel! We were completely satisfied with our choice and having stayed other years at the Flamingo, Harrahs, and the IP, the Barbary Coast is definately at the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BurningGiraffes
Reviews.Content: Thanks for everyone who submitted reviews on the Barbary Coast! My girlfriend and I stayed there for four days in the middle of December because of the reviews and enjoyed every minute. We checked in around 6 PM on Tuesday. There was no wait at the reception and hardly a walk to the room. The airline lost one of our bags, and when it finally arrived, the Bell Captain delivered the missing bag to our room around 11 PM. Good service! The room is just like the picture on the website. The bed and pillows are very comfortable for those that like a firm but soft mattress (I think the mattress was a pillow top). The pillows are the kind you can fold in half and it will still contour to your head. We had a 2nd floor view of the Bellagio fountains. The only noticeable noise was from the sirens on the strip and an occasional tour bus, but didn't bother either of us. The window that opens in the bathroom is a very nice feature. It's great for letting out steam from the shower or smoke if only one person is a smoker in the room. As with the Orleans, the amenities were good; they provided lotion, face soap, body soap, shampoo, conditioner and body wash. The plasma TV is nice (though it is not high definition). The casino is small with limited seating for the lower limit tables during the busy times. If you like the Sports Book action, you could find much worse. We never had a problem finding seats, like in some of the better known sports books. We had an unobstructed view during the NFL games of the aged 56” (estimated) projection screen in the lounge and the multiple 32” (estimated) screens in the betting area. We received free drink coupons for placing a wager. We enjoyed good food and service both times at the Victorian Room. If they are busy, they will call your name in the casino when your seat is ready. Everyone was very friendly and housekeeping was exceptional. No matter when we left the room, within an hour, the room was clean. Also, expect a gentle wake-up warning knock from housekeeping around 10:00 every morning, which wasn’t so exceptional. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks Barbary Coast!

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back again”
Reviews.Author: JeepMaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barbary Coast for 4 days just after Chirstmas in 2006. First of all, this hotel is in rough condition. I was told it had a renovation 2 years ago. We stayed at a room on the 2nd floor facing the strip. From the look of our room, it's more like 20 years ago. The only think that looks new are maybe the wall paper and the 42" LG Plasma TV. Everything looks old, the bathroom is the worst of them all. The bathroom tiles have brown stains all over. The silicon along the bathtub are peeling and has black dirt all around. The bathroom door frame is falling apart. It has a 2 inchs gap between the side and the top part of the frame which exposed the wood trim inside the wall. It looks like the top frame was lifted 2 inchs up or something. The AC was old and really loud, but still works. Our room eventhou was facing the strip, we can hardly see the water show across the street at Bellagio. That's the only reason I requested a room facing the strip. I should have picked one not facing the strip, at least it won't be so noisy at night. Noises are mostly from motocycles. I've stayed at better and cheaper hotels along the strip than this one. So avoid this hotel if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barbary Coast Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: M&D1970
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay over MLK weekend and were not dissapointed with our selection of hotel -- the BC hotel is grand!!! We had room 410 - a King Non-Smoking room overlooking the strip - awesome view of the Paris Hotel and Eiffel tower, Ballys, and most awesome we had a straight shot view of the Bellagio Fountains! It can be loud with the street noise but we used the fan feature on our heating/AC unit to create a nice humm in the room while sleeping and it blocked out ALL of the street noise. The room was very large and roomy, the linens they use are top quality, beds were high quality too, the rooms were fantastically clean and nice, the 42" plasma flat screen tv hanging on the wall (while we didn't use it much) was great, the bath products in the room were top-notch too. Housekeeping was very effective and very friendly, the front desk staff are pretty rude and unhelpful and the casino is dark, dingy and the smokiest of anywhere we went. The nice thing though is you can get from the front door of the hotel into your room in less than 30 seconds and once in your room, you are in your own nice little oasis! Loved the stained glass window in the shower that actually opened to let in some fresh air and let out steam. Heard a rumor that they are going to tear down BC, Flamingo, Imperial Palace and Harrah's but upon asking the front desk staff they said that Harrah's had bought all of the hotels/casinos but no plans to tear anything down yet. Recommend gambling at the Flamingo next door (slots pay out well and frequently and the free drinks are plentiful even if you are playing only the penny slots) or taking the Deuce Bus ($5 for 24-hour unlimited pass- works great and runs the entire length of the strip both directions) down to Riveria (they pay out pretty good and they have a restaurant that has over 35 selections for 99 cents including margaritas and beer! Good quality stuff, very yummy and cheap!) and Binions at Fremont Street has an awesome steak and lobster dinner for $10.95 - big meal and really great service and food quality. Recommend avoiding the Victoria Room restaurant in Barbary Coast - horrible service, food quality is poor and it is terribly overpriced. Overall though, Barbary Coast can't be beat for the room value and quality and the subperb location on the strip -- we'll be going back next year and wouldn't stay anywhere other than BC!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: malco1
Reviews.Content: Good value, but I was interested in one review that said it was quiet. Perhaps I was unlucky as I was close to the crossroads on a lower floor but I had to sleep with earplugs in!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JarJar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Barbary Coast and we had the most amazing time. The BC is a small hotel; only 4 floors and about 400 rooms so it only takes 2 minutes to get from the casino to your room. We booked a standard King room, but were upgraded to a spa suite!! They don't look anything like they do in the pictures on the website. They are better! Ours had a Vistorian theme, lots of dark wood, lounge, dinning room, kitchen, full wet room 2 bathrooms - awesome!!! Everything was fantastically clean, lots of bottles of shampoo and towels, etc were left daily, we even had a coffee maker. We loved the casino - it was smaller than some but plenty big enough for all our needs. We loved the $5 blackjack and the waitress service was quick and frequent. We ate breakfast in the Victorian Rooms and it was delicious, plenty of coffee and tea refills and excellent food. The BC has been bought by Harrah's - the sale will be finalised in February time. I have been informed by a friend who works there that the name witll be changing but nothing else at the moment - I have booked again for June, so they are still taking bookings. I would not hesitate to recommend the Barbary Coast to anyone, young or old, rich or poor. It is a great property and arguably has the best location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: ckoz25
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Barbary Coast and loved it. The hotel is small and doesn't have any fancy amenities like a gym or pool but for the price (and considering it was too cold to swim) it was perfect. The rooms were spacious, clean, and newly renovated. The bed was so comfortable and the tv was a large plasma mounted on the wall. The only complaint I have about the room was the bathroom was a little outdated but it was clean and functional (just nothing fancy). Check in and out was a breeze and the safe was very courtious. The casino wasn't huge and a little stuffy but one could always find a lower limit table and slots. My boyfriend and I both won at the casino and I won $1,000 on the slots right before check out. The casino also has a small Sports Book which was great to place bets however I would not recommend watching the games in the Barbary Sports Book because its a little small, smokey, and stuffy. Check out Caesar's or Venetian for more room and better chairs. The Barbary Coast has a small coffee shop which is great to grab a coffee and bagel but we didn't eat at any of their other restaurants so I can't comment on those. And lastly, the LOCATION! I can't think of a better location for the price as it is right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Town!”
Reviews.Author: ThePinks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 nights, (long for being in Vegas, but it was our 3rd time in Vegas, so we were Ok about the length of stay, as we travelled from Sydney Aust!) This hotel is an absolute gem, the location is terrific, directly opposite Caesar's Palace. Rooms were large, very clean, with huge plasma TV's on the wall, and plenty of soaps/shampoos in the bathrooms. We were on the 4th floor, with an AMAZING view of the strip. Yes it was noisy, but that's Vegas, bring some earplugs! Check-in and Check-out was quick and easy, no ridiculous lines of people. The restaurant was also excellent (The Victoria Rooms) and has great meals, the Barbary Coast had fab free entertainment (Big Elvis, or tribute bands) and the drinks were much cheaper than the other hotels. I'd stay here again definitley, as it's the best place to stay in Vegas, it's central, it's clean and it's cheap! VEGAS ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mettys
Reviews.Content: For a seedy little hotel, this was way better than expected. The location is FABULOUS, and the room was much better than expected: plasma tv, COMFORTABLE BED and quiet! Don't stay on the strip if you want quiet. The only down fall was the bathroom which was outdated, but great water pressure and clean. I would definitely suggest Barbary Coast. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the Middle of the Strip!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrgale
Reviews.Content: The Barbary Coast has the perfect location for a trip to Las Vegas. Check in and out was a breeze! You can get from the front door to the room in minutes. The rooms were clean and had very comfortable beds. The bathroom has two parts, the toilet and shower are behind a door so someone can get ready while the other is showering. There's an iron and ironing board as well as a hairdryer in the room. We didn't enjoy the Victorian Room restaurant, but it was the only thing open when we arrived at 11pm. Be aware that if you arrive that late, many of the restaurants will be closed. We walked through the entire Forum shops in Caesar's palace looking for a place to eat and ended up back at our hotel for a less than desirable meal. The casino at the Barbary Coast is great! There's plenty of low limit tables and a variety of slot machines. They even offer craps lessons for free every day at 10:30 am. The dealers were very friendly and the drink service was good. We enjoyed "Fat Elvis" in the lounge one afternoon. This hotel doesn't have the glitz and glamour of the other hotels, but you can visit those hotels for that and save money by staying at the Barbary Coast. We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: MissDaisy
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Barbary Coast was a true delight as the hotel staff were friendly, the rooms were immaculate, and the casino was cozy. After shcleping through some of the larger Vegas hotels, where we were beginning to feel more like a "non guest" we decided to check out this small hotel and casino. We were treated like guests where the staff went out of there way to accommodate us and seemed to care about their hotel. The rooms were clean. The beds were so comfy. The bathroom including the shower was perfect. Some folks reported the showers as being too small but they were just right for me and I am a tallish woman. Cost of the room was reasonable and far less than some of the swankier hotels neaby. The Victorian Room restaurant, which was lovely with its pointsettia decorated Christmas tree surrounded by the red velvet decorator touches once again served up tasty food. Nothing fancy just good old-fashioned American cuisine. Location is a plus as Bally's and Paris are across the street. The Flamingo is next door and Bellagio is not that far either. My only negative comment is this is an older hotel and the sound insulation is not the best. This was not a major detraction as we go to Vegas to gamble and see the attractions. We are already planning another trip within the next month or so as we enjoyed our stay at the Barbary Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Candleuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbary Coast for 10 nights from the 8th Dec 06, we did a lot of research on here before booking and what everybody has written is true. The location could not be better, it is smack bang in the middle of the strip, it is in-between the Flamingo and Ballys, only a minute or so to the Paris casino which does an amazing buffet. We arrived at the hotel mid afternoon and were checked in and up in our room within 5 mins of arriving. The elevators are next to reception which in turn is next to the main entrance so no dragging your cases through the casino. we had requested a room with a view of the fountains across the road when we booked 3 months earlier and that is what we got. We were in room 216 on the 2nd floor, see the photos for the view and some room samples. We found the room very clean and they serviced the room every day, the maid never bothered us when we had the do not disturb card on the door but we could hear her knocking on other doors. The room was quite large and as people have mentioned the 42" TV on the wall was a bonus. They gave us clean towels daily and they provide plenty of free shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, soap and a hair dryer. Plenty of draw space for the clothes but no wardrobe as such. You go into the bathroom which is split into 2 rooms, in the 1st room you have a wash basin, mirror etc. and then at one end of this room is a ironing board and a pole that runs between the walls with hangers on and a shelf above. It was different but actually worked quite well. At the other end of this room was a door leading to the bath, shower and toilet. This layout worked well as while one person was in the shower someone else can shave or brush teeth. The bed was massive and extremely comfy, probably one of the best beds I have ever slept in, luckily they also provide an alarm clock. The main road outside was always busy and the noise at night from the traffic was loud, I have stayed in New York a couple of times but it was much worse in Vegas. I am lucky in that I can sleep through anything but if you have trouble just take some earplugs as the view on that side of the hotel more than makes up for the noise. There is no safe in the room but you can use a safe deposit box at the casino cage, we had to give a $60 deposit for the key in case we lost it but this was returned when we checked out. the casino cage is open 24hrs so you always have access to the box. The elevators were quick and we never had to wait very long, they have an ice machine on every floor by the elevators and a soda machine on the 1st and 3rd floors. At night a security guard will ask you for your room key when trying to use the elevator to get back to your room which was nice. We never felt unsafe walking up and down the strip and never came across any trouble. They have a little gift shop which also sells crisps (chips) and sweets. We had a meal in the Victoria Rooms in the hotel a couple of times and it was fine, it is open 24hrs so you can eat at anytime. We had to wait 20 mins or so before a table was free as we didn't book but they announce it over a loud speaker system so you can go and get a beer at the bar or have a gamble while you wait. Alcoholic drinks are brought in by a waitress and paid for separate to your meal for some reason. A beer at the bar in the casino was between $2 to $3 depending which beer you had when you are not playing on a machine, they only did half pints for some reason which seems to be a bit of a theme in many of the casinos. If you are playing a machine which is set into the bar then the beer is free. I am not much of a gambler but all the staff are very very friendly from reception to the pit staff. We tried roulette for the 1st time ever and they made it easy for us. They offer free craps lessons daily if you want to learn. The slots start at 1 cent a go so you don't have to go mad. They had entertainment daily from Fat Elvis in the afternoon to a live band in the evening. They have a coffee shop in the far corner of the casino which was very nice and not badly priced, we would have liked a coffee machine of some sort in the room for 1st thing in the morning when we woke up and to be honest the lack of the coffee machine is the only bad thing I can say about this hotel which when it comes down to it is nothing at all to worry about. I had never been to Vegas before and I loved it, when I go back and I will the Barbary Coast will be my 1st choice every time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rach212
Reviews.Content: The wonderful reviews on this website are all true. This is a wonderful small and informal hotel on a strip full of large garish hotels! The location was perfect - directly opposite Bellagio, Caesar's Palace and Paris. Our room was super comfy, the 42-inch plasma TV was a treat and we had a great view of the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower. The noise did not bother us at all. At night, security men guard the lifts and ask for hotel keys for identification, which was great - it felt really safe, especially if you are travelling in a ladies-only group. Whilst the people at reception were rather curt and unfriendly, the dealers at the casino were friendly and even taught us how to play poker! It was much cheaper than the large hotels on the Strip yet it gave us a really nice Vegas experience. We will certainly return again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Little Place at Ground Zero”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbary Dec 1-4th for 3 nights. Our room #110 (on the 1st room floor) faced the Bellagio Fountains - which is the direction we requested. It was, however, noisy - being on what is really the 3rd floor -as there are 2 floors are parking above the Casino and below the 1st floor of rooms. Our room was fine - but on day 1 for eg. there were two water glasses, day 2, one water glass, day 3 no water glasses. Shamposs etc. were not repleished on any day - and were of a Motel 6 quality. The bath was clean - but we did notice mould on the tiles. The room was clean - but given the cold weather, we were surpirsed there were no blankets, and the heating system (a fan system linked to the air condfitioner was very noisy). The Plasma or LCD screen is a nice touch - but rarely used. As we had coats (it was cold) we needed to hang them - but no closets, or room safes. Bottom line is that room is basic - do not expect a 4* or even a nice 3*. What is great about the Barbary is: (1) location, location, location, (2) ambience - loads of it, (3) the small size makes it comfy - the Casino being small enough so you feel at home after a day or so and (4) car self parking was a breeze, so very convenient (valet is also available) and 2 minutes from self parking to walk to your room - need we say more? We had the "famous" hotdogs - which were OK - but nothing special. Service in the hotel is very good, and staff are great, We did not eat in the hotel, despite trying twice - but the regular restaurant (Michaels?) had a 40 minute wait - so we went elsewhere. Would we stay again? - we have thought about it and if we visit in the fall/winter we would stay at the Barbary as we do not need outdoor amenities. But for the summer/spring - will stay in a place with a large pool area, loads of resturants and bars etc. We have stayed at the Orleans, MGM etc. so do know what our options are. Overall though, we love the Barbary - for being what it is - a great value property at ground zero - dead centre of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic place”
Reviews.Author: SurfJogger
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel in the heart of the strip. Don't expect a lot of amenities. The location is the amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway Location”
Reviews.Author: sportsbook
Reviews.Content: Went with buddies for a weekend of football wagering. No difficulties with flight or airport. Check in was quick and easy, room was ready before noon. Did not request fountain view and wish that I had. Room comfortable and spacious. Bathrooms were a little small, but not any problem. Have stayed at Bally's the last several visits and Barbary Coast was as nice or better. Only thing better at Bally's was the bathroom. Barbary Coast had better TV's in room and beds were more comfortable. Would definitely stay here if I go again before the takeover.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GASJMA
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Las Vegas, stayed at the Barbary Coast from 22nd Nov - 20th Nov. Have stayed in many of the hotels on our yearly trips over the past 16 years. This was a great surprise, great position, great view, great staff. Will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: u9537503
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Barbary coast for week in November getting three separate rooms. Each of us loved the hotel. Myself I have stayed in Vegas four times and this hotel has the best positioning and is the friendliest I have stayed in. Check-in and out was fast and efficient. My wife and I got a room on the top floor (4th so you can tell how small it is) with a view overlooking the Bellagio fountains. This was an added bonus as both our friends had rooms on the other side of the hotel looking out on the top of the car park. The positioning is great as you are on one of the busiest cross roads with Paris, Ceasars, Ballys and Belliago all within 5 minutes walk. The atmosphere of the hotel is great compared to the hussle of the bigger ones you actually feel like you get a personal service which makes a change in Vegas. There were only two very very minor problems, but they are worth mentioning. Firstly the shower head is set very low in the bathroom, so if you are slightly too tall you can hit your head on it. Secondly though the view was good the windows are not overly sound proof so you can hear all the traffic and noise from the strip. If this bothers you stay on the other side of the hotel and you don't have a problem. Over all I would stay here again just for the position and the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: pacers220
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, clean, very friendly, great location, and a great price. me and my colleg buddies meet in vegas every year, and always stay at the Barbary Coast.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Yokod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Barbary Coast 11/9-12 and would definitely stay there again. The definite pluses: 1) Walk to anywhere on the Strip. 2) Compact facility with speedy elevators -- room to sidewalk takes two minutes. 3) 2-minute check-in. 4) 2-minute check-out.. 5) Super view of Bellagio fountain and Eiffel Tower (Room 310). 6) Wonderful front desk staff. 7) Wonderfull gift stand staff with unusual selections. 8) Rapid casino cocktail service; never an empty glass. 9) Blackjack dealers affable and totally professional, although one of the pit bosses could use a day or two at charm school. 10) 42" plasma is quite nifty. 11) Ice machine in hallway. 12) Very reasonably priced room service. 13) Unbelievable rate - $65 weeknights; $115 weekends. The marginal negatives: 1) Older and threadbare, but quite clean. 2) Jam outside coffe shop (Victoria Room) whether crowded or not. We did eat there once (out of four attempts), and the food and service were quite good. 3) No coffee maker in room. 4) No mini-bar in room. 5) Impossible to get a cab. Order car service for trip to the airport. Omni town car is $40 plus tip. Absolutely superb for the price, and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Barbay Coast is recommended”
Reviews.Author: brendasue
Reviews.Content: BC is an excellent location on the strip. The rooms are clean and comfortable. No frills but certainly a great room and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in the style of The Old West.”
Reviews.Author: Littletulip
Reviews.Content: Stayed 24th Oct - 2nd Nov 2006. We chose to stay at the Barbary Coast after reading reviews of it (and other hotels) on this site and found the reviews to be entirely representative of what we found. A comfortable small 200 bedroom hotel right at the centre of the strip, ideally placed for sight seeing. Our room was large and comfortable. (The bed was amazing!) As other reviewers have pointed out, the rooms do smell a bit smokey but not to any degree that we were put off. Our room as with all rooms on our side of the hotel have a view of the Bellagio fountains which are an awesome sight. We managed to catch most of the shows whilst we were there. Unlike other reviewers however, we did not find any problem with outside noise at all during our stay and we were on the noisy side apparently! The bathroom is small and outdated, but clean and functional. The bath is teeny. I just managed to fit in it and I am 5'2" so husband had no chance at 6'1"!!! The showerhead is also low as someone else pointed out, but it's not insurmountable and we got on fine with the facilities available. The only thing we didn't like was the closet area being inside the bathroom area, and the only place to hang clothes. There is more than enough room inside the room for an additional wardrobe. An expensive dress I had with me for my birthday dinner was ruined whilst hanging here - we can only assume by housekeeping but are confident that it was accidental. The hotel were very quick and accommodating and sent officers up to investigate and take photos, and have promised to resolve the matter as quickly as possible with us. We are waiting to here from them but have every faith that they will. Arrival and departure were swift and hassle-free. No queuing. The bellman, Mike, was tremendously helpful during our stay. The casino is small and old-fashioned looking, this gave the hotel an unique character, certainly amongst the strip hotels and it's small size seemed manageable rather than overwhelming as some of the larger hotel resorts. The Seattle Coffee Shop inside the hotel has fantastic coffee, tea and cakes. Avoid the Victorian Room at all costs - awful and greasy - there are plenty of other places to eat in other hotels which are far better. Overall, we feel a great choice for our first trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: shazbabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and couldn't fault it. The location was excellant, we had a view of the fountains and the Paris Hotel. It was a little noisy at times but what do you expect! Would recommend everyone to stay here who is after an affordable hotel in an excellant location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barbary Coast for one night in July. It had a good location. There were not some of the perks of the larger hotels like the Venetian or Bellagio, but it was okay for a night. The stained glass windows in the bathroom were a nice touch, but the sliding doors were a bit odd.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful lil' Gem.”
Reviews.Author: babsroth
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this hotel and we truly loved it. The hotel is nice and small - we were on the 1st floor. The room was very clean and the decor beautiful. The first night we could hear music from the Flamingo for awhile - but we were so tired - it wasn't so bad, we zonked out anyway. The air conditioner in are room was probably louder than most would like - but I actually like WHITE NOISE, so this only helped me sleep better throughout our three night stay. The location is ideal and you step right out the door and you are by the shuttle bus/valet/taxi area. The beds were so comfy and the staff were very friendly. I thought the security guards checking for hotel room keys at night to let you up to the rooms was a great added security plus! I applaud them for that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: TexasFox
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Barbary Coast for four nights, and would stay there again in a heartbeat. The price was great, the room was clean and spacious, great plasma TV and the staff was courteous and helpful. It is possibly the best location on the strip. We stayed at Bally's next door previously, but you had to walk forever just to get off of the hotel property. Barbary is just small enough to make it easy to get in and out without walking for fifteen minutes to get to the strip. My only gripe is that we asked for a non smoking room, which we did get, but there were several people on the floor who were smoking. It would sometimes waft into the room, and even the housekeeping staff seemed annoyed with the strong odor in the hallways. This was not enough to keep us from returning, and we will look for great deals on this gem of a find again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Priestley
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from Vegas where we stayed at the Barbary Coast and must admit, we were pretty impressed with the location and service. Okay, so it looks a bit dated but I've stayed at worse hotels in London and paid a lot more for the privilege. The room was spacious and clean and we loved the plasma screen TV. Our room overlooked the Bellagio fountains and although there was some noise from the strip at night, we were usually so tired it didn't really bother us - anyway, the air conditioning drowned it out! We picked the Barbary because there had been so many good reviews and we were not disappointed. The location is really good and you are close to all the action. We stayed at the Luxor last year which we found to be a bit far out, especially if you're relying on the bus to get around. It was also also nice not to have a 10 mile trek to get to your room. We went to the Victorian Room a couple of times for breakfast and this was ok but we found the Sidewalk Cafe next door at Ballys was much better - it certainly filled us up for the day! We didn't try the other restaurants (Michaels & Drais) but they have good reviews. The hotel also had plenty of entertainment in the form of Big Elvis most afternoons and they also had "lounge bands" in the evening. The drinks were reasonably priced and during the day there is a hot dog stand in the hotel which only costs $1.25. I'm pretty fussy when it comes to food but it wasn't bad at all. The rates are so much lower than the bigger hotels and although it doesn't look as grand the table limits are lower, which is probably good for beginners. They also have free craps lessons every day at 10.30. If you want to see a show then try the half price ticket booths. They are situated in Fremont Street, the Fashion Show Mall and at the Hawiain shops up from Aladdin. Tickets go on sale at 11.00 for shows that night and there are some bargains to be had. Be prepared to queue but you will save a hell of a lot of money. The Fashion Show Mall is good for shopping but so are the shops in Aladdin & the Venetian and you should definitely look around the Forum Shops at Ceasars just for the fantastic ceiling! I would definitely recommend the Barbary to anyone - especially first timers in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortouble”
Reviews.Author: sophie3
Reviews.Content: We will stay at the Barbary again it was comfortouble and nice and big fluffy pillows . In a great location . We have stayed in 2 other hotels along the strip at double the price , at differant times ,the Barbary is just as nice and more conveinient . We highly recomend staying here again . Thank you all ,great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: alt2mn
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night 10/3/06 for $65. This hotel is great for the price if you are looking a clean, great location, fast check in and no long walk to room through casino. My room was 414. It has a flat screen TV, clean, soft beds with awesome view of the bellagio hotel fountain and the eiffel tower! I booked the room on the hotel website and found it cheaper on travelocity and they matched the price over the phone - very easy. The checkin was easy (no line) and elevator is close to the entry, so no long walk through casino before getting to checkin counter. The self parking elevator brings you to the casino level and you have to take another elevator (just around the corner) to get to the room elevator. I booked a king size bed non-smoking, but they only have 2 queen size non-smoking (not that big a deal for me). They said reservation only guarantee room (not smoking or non smoking or queen or king). I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Karen122
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Barbary Coast in October 2006 and had a fabulous time at a very reasonable cost. The hotel is in the best possible location - we could see the fountain show at the Bellagio from our room window - but is not as big as the resort hotels. This meant that check in time was quick and it was easy to get around the hotel. The rooms are extremely large and were both clean and comfortable. We had fun in the casino - even making some money at the end of our stay! I would certainly stay there again and would recommend this hotel to any other traveller to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: bizzokiki
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good hotel, but don't need anything fancy I would stay here. For the price and location this hotel was great. Clean, big rooms with a plasma TV. It is not too big so you won't get lost finding your way through the casino and to your rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Barbary Coast is a Gem in Value and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: gypsy716
Reviews.Content: We were coming to a convention in Las Vegas and wanted to stay a couple of extra days. We stayed at the Barbary Coast because it was one of the few reasonably priced hotels on the Strip. We were delighted at what we actually got! The rooms have just been remodeled so the bedding was top quality. It is as comfortable, if not more comfortable, as the bed at Caesar's Palace where we stayed during the convention. Every room has a big screen LCD TV and all the amenities of the huge casino hotels. As a matter of fact, a couple of friends came early and stayed at the Excaliber and their rooms were nowhere as nice as ours. It's right near Bally's so the view we had of the Bellagio and its fountains was absolutely breathtaking. It's only 5 stories or so which has an upside and a down: For those who don't like the high rise hotels, it's easy to get around in. For those who want quiet, it's difficult to get away from the traffic noise of Las Vegas Blvd. Then again, who comes to Vegas for quiet? Will definitely stay here again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location will definately go back”
Reviews.Author: lawsom34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BC for 7 nights in Sept, we spent some time choosing the right hotel for our holiday, and it paid off. It is in a perfect location hardly needed to get a taxi as nearly everywhere we wanted to go was walkable. The rooms were lovely our room overlooked the Bellagio fountains quite a bonus. Thought the Plasma tv was a nice touch. Didn't actually eat in the BC so can't comment on the restaurants. We are planning to go back for another week at Christmas and will definately book the Barbary Coast.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: marmerdave
Reviews.Content: barbary coast was perfect! my husband and i stayed there for three nights and loved every minute! the hotel is smaller than the rest- which we loved because it only took two seconds to get to our room from the lobby- unlike the other newer hotels that were so freakin huge you had to have a map to find your room! our room was great- the bed was comfy, the bathroom was clean, and we had a view of the bellagio fountain show! the shower didn't drain as quick as it should- but we really didn't mind considering the great deal for this hotel room. the location of the barbary coast is the best! it is across from ceasars and the bellagio- and next to bally's and the flamingo. there is a shuttle that runs from here to the other coast hotels- which is great because you don't have to pay a taxi! and if you're a smoker, bring plenty with you! the ciggs at the little counter were $6.75 a pack! but the tampons were reasonable at only $3.50 for a box of ten(compared to $6.00 at a different little shop). the tables and slots were all wonderful... $5 blackjack tables and penny slots were tons of fun! we highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to the Mega resort/casinos”
Reviews.Author: CintiTravelers
Reviews.Content: I think that I must have stayed at around 25 different hotels in the Vegas area over the last 15 years. My wife and I, early forties, stayed for three nights recently. We would both highly recommend the BC. Check in was simple. The elevators were right next to the check in desk. And getting to your room is easy. Our room was small, but very adequate. It was clean, and the 42 inch plasma gave it a feel of a much more expensive room. The only down side was that it was pretty loud. If street noise (lots of sirens) keep you up, the BC may not be for you. The gambling was pretty good. Double deck blackjack for five bucks a hand. Tables were usually available. On Friday nights the after hours club still had a line at 6:00 AM. There was no pool at the BC, but that allowed my wife and I to attempt to sneak into some of the better pools in Vegas. Successfully. Best of all, the BC has one of the best locations on the strip. It is easy to get in and out of and the service at the bars and at the Victorian room are excellent. The BC was a great value compared to other strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: goatboy326
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I stayed at the barbary coast from Sept 5-9, 2006 and had an excellent time. I have been to Vegas Twice before and i must say that this trip was by far the best trip yet, and the room was also the best room i've had anywhere! we arrived in Vegas Early like 11:00am or so caught the Coach USA shuttle bus from the Airport to the hotel, and was given a room right then didn't have to wait untill the 2:00pm check in time, which was awsome. The room was a little on the small side, but when your in Vegas what do you need a gigantic room for??? it was fine for us! and the 42" flat Panel TV was a neat touch and since i was hanging on the wall it didn't take up any extra space. The room was very clean, and since my dad smokes i booked a smoking room but it didn't smell of smoke at all. the beds were way too comfortable I almost didn't want to get out of bed. The shower was clean, but the shower head was mounted a little low for me, had to crouch down to wash my hair, lol. and i am only 5'10" but it wasn't bad and they gave you Shampoo, conditioner, Body wash, hand lotion, and body scrub bar. which was nice. We never got up early, and usually headed out around noon or 1:00pm but the room was always cleaned and made up while we were out, so we always had made beds and fresh towels when we came back in the wee hours of the morning. I am going again in December and am definately booking the barbary. I reccomend booking early as they sell out fast only having 200 rooms and a few of those are Suites. but the entire trip for me and my dad was less arounf $700 that included round trip airfare from BWI to LAS and back and the four nights hotel accomodations. And as an added bonus there is a Free Shuttle that takes you to the other coast Casinos and the Orleans, which makes it easy to get to all the hot spots in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but goodie”
Reviews.Author: n2snoopy
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel, it is older but located in a prime spot. We checked in on a Saturday mid-morning, they gave us an upgrade without asking, we got a king room with jacuzzi tub, large living area, wet bar and 2 seperate toliet areas. We enjoyed they stay didn't eat in any restuaruants but liked the small quaint casino. If you are looking for a clean inexpensive place in a great location this is it. A freind also checked in at the same time and they placed him next door to us, which was something other hotels wouldn't do. We had an oppurtunity to look around his room and it was clean and spacious!

Reviews.Title: “small hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Dianne8868
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend in August for 3 nights for the start of a 2 week holiday in USA. The airport in Las Vegas is very close to the strip which meant that the journey to the hotel was short, however in that time the taxi driver decided to inform us about what we should see, do, think, in Vegas which although helpful was a little too much after a 10 hour flight from Gatwick. The hotel is one of the smallest along the strip next door to the Flamingo Hotel. The check- in service was quick and we were swiftly taken upstairs to our rooms by the bell man who again decided to tell us about all the things to see and do in Vegas. I think we were getting the picture!!! The room had large queen sized beds and a plasma screen TV. We were pleased with our choice and liked the fact that everything was so conveniently located. We were on the 1st floor of the hotel and was able to nip downstairs without too much fuss. We used the hotel restaurant which was ok. However all of the hotels had an open door service so you could go into the hotel restaurants and be served. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast at the Hotel Flamingo for $15 you could eat a hearty meal it was fantastic. Having the casino within the hotel meant that there was so many people coming and going and you felt slightly alienated from the staff working in the hotel you kind of lost track of who worked there. however most staff were courteous. For the cost of the rooms I think it was good value for money. Although be sure to change your travellers cheques into dollars if wanting to settle your hotel bill and also be aware that you will need to bring the credit card used to book the room as this hotel was the only one which requested that you pay for one nights stay as part of the deposit. They will credit back the deposit onto your card at the end of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: PokerPlayerAA
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! Right in the middle of the strip. Easy walking distance to many other casinos. The rooms were clean and had everything you needed. Service was great and the Victorian Room had a wonderful breakfast and a good prime rib dinner special. The casino had alot of action with low limit tables and a good sports book. It was small but not overly stuffed. I will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheshah
Reviews.Content: Nice place stay, right in the middle of the strip. Room was clean and comfortable. Friendly staff. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BARBARY COAST THE PERFECT HOTEL ON THE STRIP!”
Reviews.Author: BoricuaPR
Reviews.Content: I Arrive to Las Vegas in July 27 and stay at The Barbary Coast Hotel. Wao! What a nice experience, from the moment you enter those doors the service is great ! The price was excelent and the room was impecable and HUGE! For the price is the best place to stay in Las Vegas. Dont miss THE BIG ELVIS SHOW he is great! I will stay in this hotel for my future visits to Las Vegas for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Property somewhat over rated”
Reviews.Author: Willow-Jen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barbary Coast for an overnight in early August. The room was fine, generally speaking, and the location on the strip was good. However, the property is very dated and rough around the edges, so to speak, in appearance. It has an overwhelming smell of stale cigarette smoke throughout. Check-in desk is tiny and understaffed. For $20 more we could have stayed at one of the newer properties with a lot more to offer. If you can spring for just a little more I would suggest considering alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rilla
Reviews.Content: Although I had just booked a room, we were given a suite, with a lounge and 2 bathrooms, which can't be bad for $65 in August. The King bed was comfortable, and the location couldn't be better, just across the road from the Bellagio. So stay here without all the themed razzamatazz, and wander in and out of all the other hotels. Parking is easy, in the attached hotel multi-storey car park, with lift directly into the hotel. No problems using my wheelchair.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, clean bed”
Reviews.Author: nymorena
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a convention in Las Vegas. The place where my meeting was held was scenic but very expensive. Barbary Coast was over $100 per night cheaper and was walking distance to my meeting. All I really needed was a clean bed and a quiet place to rest. I got this and more. The internet rate was a great price (although that alone would not be enough to make me come back). The room was spacious and clean. I also liked the fact that there was an ironing board and iron in the room - I didn't even have to call the front desk; these supplies were already there. After I unpacked, I ironed my clothes and hung them up in the closet space, which was adequate for the number of clothes that I needed for the trip. The sheets were clean, as were the carpeting, drapes, and tub. The large flat screen TV in my hotel room didn't hurt either. The hotel is on the strip, and it's walking distance to many pretty things that I wanted to visit during my free time in the evenings. The front desk staff was helpful with my questions. The restaurant is reasonably priced. Also, the hotel gives you a coupon book which includes a free drink at their cocktail bar. I had the most delicious virgin strawberry daiquiri! The Barbary Coast has a free shuttle to other hotels that are owned by the same company that owns Barbary Coast. It was fun to visit those other places, which had nice buffets and this increased my eating choices. Long story short - this is a nice, clean, safe place on the strip that is affordable for a non-wealthy person who wants to visit Las Vegas. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: cl100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the barbary coast for a week in July 2006 - it was cheaper than some of the hostels we stayed at and definately the nicest accomodation - rooms are really nice, huge, clean with plasma tv screens and we had great views of the strip. Fantastic location - write in the middle of the strip. COmpared to some of the others the casino is small but it really didnt make a difference to us. The staff were really friendly and you can use the facilities (eg- pool) at the other hotels run by the same group. Would definately recommend and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Barbary Coast perfect location 42in plasma TV”
Reviews.Author: KCinKY
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great room, 42in plasma TV, cheap drinks good casino. What's not to like? I was in Las Vegas Aug 13-19 with my boyfriend, he was there for the letter carriers union convention. We originally planned to stay at the Stratosphere. When I realized I would be spending my days alone while he was in the convention I decided to change our reservations to a more central location. I am very glad I did. The Barbary Coast is in the center of everything! It is a small hotel and casino, especially in comparison to the giants nearby like Ceasars and Bellagio. Barbary Coast couldn't be in a better location. It is next door to the Flamingo. It is located on the same corner with Bally's, Ceasar's Palace and Bellagio. We arrived at the Barbary Coast at 2am and I was afraid we would get a crappy room. Our room was great. I called ahead to say we would be arriving late and that we wanted a King room. Our room was very nice. The king bed was very comfortable. The linens were soft and wonderful. All the rooms have been recently spruced up. The furniture was rich looking, crown molding all around, carpet and wallpaper new. I know the furniture was new because there was still some plastic on the chairs. Our view was good, except for that bothersome Bally's sign. The Eiffel tower at Paris was right outside the window. The fountains at Bellagio would have been in plain view if not for the Bally's sign. I could still see everything except the center of the fountain display. Yes, you could hear the street traffic outside. It didn't bother either of us at all. The room was clean and comfortable and quite large. The bathroom was a bit small, but also clean. The tub/shower had a lovely stained glass window that could be opened. There was ample storage space, a desk with internet access, and a table and chairs. The 42 inch plasma TV was a real hit! The hotel staff was wonderful, especially the bellman who arranged my tour to Hoover Dam and our shuttle back to the airport. The room staff was also great. Our room did not have a coffee maker, but I think if you ask for one you can get it. We ate at the Victoria room a couple of times, it's open 24 hours. I had the prime rib special for $13.95. it was excellent. The breakfast was also good, cheap and fast. They gave us some coupon books when we checked in that had some good stuff in it. You can get another coupon book if you sign up for the Coast Club Casino card. I took the hotel shuttle to the Orleans one day to go to the pool. I got another coupon book there with more free stuff. All the drinks are $2 all the time. If you are gambling they are free. The entertainment in the lounge was good. I enjoyed the bartenders at Harrah's Carnival Court. You must have the breakfast buffet at Paris. You have to stroll the Venetian and Ceasars. Buy the 24 hour pass if you ride the Deuce to downtown because you will want to use it the next day to go to MGM, New York, New, York, etc. See the dancing fountains several times at the Bellagio up close where you can hear the music. It's a different show every time. The pirate show at TI is crowded and hard to get a good view. The volcano at MIrage is worth seeing. I rode the roller coaster at NY NY and loved it, but I'm not sure it's worth $12.50. We saw Tom Jones, He was AWESOME!!!! There are live flamingo's at the Flamingo and lions at the MGM. The Conservatory at the Bellagio is also very impressive. Bottom line is I had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “wasnt bad”
Reviews.Author: adamchand
Reviews.Content: check in was fast and easy.room was quiet and faced back of flamingo.hotel is small,had good service and slots were loose. liked seattles best coffee for breakfast. victorian room dinner was the worst meal of the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: rep99
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the Barbary and not the last. Yes, rooms are very clean, beds are comfortable and the flat screen is a nice treat. Staff is great at the desk and with only four floors the line at the front desk is never long. Don't worry about casino 'noise' if you get a room on the first floor because there are actually two floors of parking between the first floor of hotel rooms and the casino. We had a great view of Bally's, Paris, and Bellagio. The only thing that was disappointing was the meal in the Victorian Room. Having been continuously impressed with the breakfasts and lunches, my breakfast potatoes were cold and had to send them back. Upon return they were warmer, but still not my idea of a breakfast. I noticed others left a good portion of their breakfast uneaten. Other than that I would recommend this place for the value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: sfslinky
Reviews.Content: We had the best time at the Barbary Coast Hotel last week. This is not one of the new mega casino properties, but that was why we stayed here. Check in was really quick with none of the long lines that you encounter at the other properties. Getting to your room took 3-5 minutes from the lobby. Unlike the other properties, you didn't have to walk a mile through the casino maze to get to the room elevators. There is another elevator bank behind the room elevators which takes 3-5 minutes to get to your rental car. It isn't like Disneyworld. It was easy parking and even the farthest spot is close to the hotel elevator, unlike other large hotels. This is an older property but it is quaint and conveniently located between the Flamingo and Bally's. The Bellagio and Caesar's Palace are across the street. You can visit all the other casinos without paying their high prices since you centrally located on the strip. The rooms were fine. The beds were so comfortable and we had a 42" plasma, flat screen TV on the wall. The staff were so helpful and friendly, and they even preprinted our boarding passes before we left for the airport. The casino is very small and user friendly so it is easy to get around and find your party without getting lost. We really enjoyed the Barbary Coast and will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Vegas. This is an extremley affordable secret on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Barbary Coast was just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: flygurl814
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to introduce me to Las Vegas. I'm a young, married professional who was heading to Las Vegas for the first time on a girls weekend. The Barbary Coast was great! The beds were super comfortable, better than some Hilton's I've stayed in. The rooms were very clean, and the bathroom setup with the sink and mirror outsite the tub/toilet room was perfect for a group of girls getting ready to go out. The lobby was nice, with a great casino ($5 tables) for those interested. I was told that the Barbary coast was nothing special, and I guess it's easy to get lost with all the other gimicky hotels in Vegas, but it was great for me. I thought it was a clean, classy and inexpensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Barbary Coast was a hit”
Reviews.Author: melissaoz
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay for the location the price. Stayed 8/3-8/6 All I can say is that it was the best kept secret in Vegas as far as I am concerned. We had ladies night out weekend and I highly recommend it for singles or couples out for a great time. Highlights: 1. Perfect location!!!!! great price!!! (Great helpful staff) 2. Check in and out was 5 minutes 3. Get to and from your from your room in 3-4 minutes. 4. Large (400 square feet) clean room, great beds, clean restroom (reviews mentioned them to be small but I was delighted) 5. Fast room service anytime! 6. All night party in the lobby with 2$ drinks and a band (great afterparty!!!) Only thing that was not a highlight was that taxi service is a little slow outside. We walked to Bally's (just across the street) and got a cab in just a minute so really not a concern. On checkout the nice bellman walked out with us and hailed us cab, very nice!). I go to Vegas often and usually stay a bigger name brands so I was hesitant to stay here but I was so impressed I will defintely stay here upon my return. Loads of fun!!! oh and I forgot to mention, had a wonderful strip view!!!!!! that was a bonus for us!! Best little kept secret in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: philco57
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in the middle of everything! We booked online and had quick check-in and great service all five nights we were there. Good food in the restaurant, and reasonably priced, too! Clean, comfortable room. Close to lots of other properties, easy walking distance to at least ten other casinos. Monorail station next door at Bally's. Good drink service at the slots, and decent free entertainment daily. This was our first trip to Vegas, and when we go back we will definitely consider the Barbary Coast. Had a GREAT time!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sicilianii
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was a great disappointed. When we booked this room, Vegas Jacuzzi Suite, I was told all rooms had been remolded and all with a 42” plasma TV. This simply was not true. The problems with our room are as follows: 1. The light gray carpet was ripped and stained in various places. 2. The gray counter tops had pieces missing from the shelve and around the TV. 3. The black Jacuzzi tub was stained and with very little power from the jets. The 30 minute timer was located on a wall by the bathroom you have to get out and re-set the timer for another 30 minutes. 4. The tile around the Jacuzzi is very slippery (be careful when get out). 5. The black blind were damaged, did not keep out much sunlight. 6. The refrigerator was falling out of the cabinet. The shelves inside were all broken. 7. Wallpaper stained and falling off the wall. 8. Red painted wall was chipped and stained. 9. The toilet keep running, I repaired it myself. This to me was not a remolded room. When I question the front desk they told me when I booked the room it was through the Orleans and their employees have no idea what the rooms look like. Not much help. The manager did give us $50.00 off our room; I guess this was to make it all right. The great elevators in the hotel, a joke. One of only two worked the time we were there. The elevator was very slow, hot and no air! The maid every morning at 8:30 would come by and knock at our door and walk away. This seems to me as if she was making sure we were awake and up. I’m not use to ordering a drink from a bar and having it server in a little plastic cup a shot in a plastic medicine cup but, that is what you will get here. When I ask for a glass I was told I could have one but not to tell anyone where I got it from. After I got the glass the bartender left the bar. We will not return to this hotel even if they do remodel ALL the rooms, I should have known better.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MomsTuxedo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Monday to a beautiful, CLEAN, well maintained little hotel. Staff was great. Very centrally located, so that we were either near all the things we wanted to see, or able to get to them by bus or trolley. And they have an absolutely FANTASTIC latte stand near the back door on the way to the Flamingo Casino. Restaurant was a little spendy for us, but good food. My daughter & I are planning on going back again in April and will definately make this our place to stay as it is quite reasonable during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcpiper
Reviews.Content: Stayed at BC July 4-7. Have to agree with everyone this is a great small hotel. Arrived at 10 AM on July 4th and checked right in. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms were a nice size & very clean ( the rooms have been recently renovated). Asked for extra pillows and they were in the room when we returned from lunch. Bathrooms are small but nothing you can't work around for the great price. Good security (they check room keys at night). We plan on staying here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never had such great service in a hotel before! The Barbary Coast hotel in Vegas had an amazingly attentive staff that were ready to solve any problems head on. Starting with the front desk/reservations staff on day 1 when Priceline messed up my reservation, the staff proved to be helpful and courteous. The room was huge with 2 double beds and an enormous flat screen tv - far more than I expected! All throughout my stay, each aspect of the hotel -- room service, bell service, housekeeping, security, casino, bar -- amazed me more and more! Room service advised me on what food NOT to order, housekeeping was thorough in cleaning, and the bartenders were so friendly! I would without a doubt stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room.Check in nightmare”
Reviews.Author: flowerladytoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barbary Coast on July 9th. The room was very nice, big and roomy with a great pillowtop bed and the large plasma tv.
