The a/c unit was extremely loud, kicked in with a loud bang that woke us up during the night, it roared the entire time it was on. We were on the 4th floor, on the flamingo side and still head the sirens and strip noise all night...though the noisy a/c drowned it out whenever it was running. Still the room was nice and I would have given this hotel a 4 if it wasn't for the rude clerk at check in. We had requested a refrigerator for medication and she got very snippy about it. Actually raised her voice and yelled at me in front of all the people standing in line waiting to get into the Victorian Room. We were embarrassed, to say the least. I have always thought if you were nice to someone they would at least be civil back..I was wrong with this clerk. The next morning, on checkout, we mentioned it to the man doing checkout and he excused her, saying she was probably ticked off at another person she checked in. That's no excuse in my book. We did get the refrigerator, after I called back downstairs and asked a different clerk about it, and she also got us the extra pillows we needed. After that experience I would not stay at this hotel again...instead we would stay at the South Coast, or the Gold Coast, where they give you service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Barbary Coast”
Reviews.Author: tmsdjsgracie
Reviews.Content: Never stayed at a "little unknown hotel" but thoroughly enjoyed the Barbary. Small but personal is the key. Right in the middle of everywhere. MGM is great but toooo big. Takes forever to get out. The Barbary is still big enough that you don't get lost. At check in they gave us a ticket book for some freebies. Haven't had that in awhile. Rooms were very nice. Had a partial view of the strip so that was nice too. Food was very good, but make sure you ask for the specials, because they don't tell you about the $15.00 ones. Front desk people are extremely nice and even got us our boarding passes for the trip home. Got our tickets online which saved a lot of money. If you don't mind not having a pool, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: katshif
Reviews.Content: After a recent disappointing stay at MGM, I would say to stick with the Barbary Coast! A fantastic location, great rooms, very accessible. One of the things I hated the most about the MGM was how abnormally huge it was and how long it took us to get to our rooms, even from the front desk. The Barbary Coast is small and intimate. Also, the restaurant is really good! Cons: There is only the one restaurant, as opposed to the bigger hotels that have tons of eating options. But it is so centrally located that you can get to wherever you want to go easily. Also the casino is not the best. It is kind of old school--like what you would find on Fremont Street. A little cramped, etc. So unlike the bigger hotels, it is not a place to just stay for three days and never leave. However, I now find that to be a plus after the MGM experience. And you can't beat the price for the location and everything else. I would take this place over the MGM any day!

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Deal !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel back in January for our stay at the end of May, we were a little concerned that we may have let our "inner cheapskate" get us into some trouble. We couldn't have been more wrong! This hotel is fantastic !!! You can't bet the price and the staff is wonderful. Check in was super quick and easy and the room was super clean with GORGEOUS plasma TVs ! I did not hear the massive noise that others have referenced, but then again, by the time we went to sleep, we were usually beyond exhausted. To make our bargain even more delightful, a friend of ours meet us in Vegas and stayed at Treasure Island. She paid almost $60 more a night and to be honest, the only thing she had on us was a just slightly larger bathroom. Definitely not enough to warrant $60. In addition, we had views of Bally's, Paris and Bellagio, she had views of parking garages. It's also worth noting that we won more at Barbary Coast than at the other casinos we played in. Try the big wheel of fortune penny slots in the front of the casino. We won $80 and saw others win upwards of $400. Overall, if you want the big mega resort experience, it's not for you , but if you just want a place to lay your head without getting lost looking for your room, I highly recommend Barbary. We will definitely stay here when we come back !

Reviews.Title: “Its a keeper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Its all about standards people. We didn't pay much for this room in comparison to other showy hotels on the strip (about $100/night), so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was pleasantly suprised. We had a great stay for 4 nights and got married while we were there. The Barbary is a tiny hotel next to neighboring giants, but that can actually be a good thing when travelling with a group of people that are staying in various hotels. If you want to meet up, all you have to say is come to the Barbary, no questions asked. You don't have to direct through mazes of slots, tables, fanciful lobbies, multiple escalators or what have you that has become Vegas these days. Beleive me, if you want that you can go to any of the surrounding hotels for a visit and you'll get your fill. The rooms were also very nice. We had a king sized bed, decorations were upscale and tasteful. Plasma TV was a bonus. The room was clean and housekeeping was excellent. Only they were almost too on top of things, coming around at 8:30am, you could hear them knocking several doors before and after yours. "Houskeeping" tap tap tap. The do not disturb sign doesnt help too much. Come on, this is Vegas I don't go to bed until 5am, thats prime sleeping time. The a view of the Ballagio fountains was nice aside from the giant Bally's billboard. My only other warning to those of you wanting peace and quiet, its pretty loud on the strip/Flamingo Ave. facing side, with all of the traffic noise, ambulances, hot rodders and not to mention the Frank Sinatra, Bobby Darin and Dean Martin coming from next door (I think it was that giant billboard). You will have that music stuck in your head for days after you come back home. All part of the Vegas experience! There's no pool but if you know anyone staying somewhere with a pool all you need is one room key and everyone can get in without any hassle. One side comment, Jubilee, the topless review at Bally's right next door was such a great show. Go there, its only $50, the best entertainment you'll see in Vegas and it was done in such taste. Back to the hotel, one other extremely handy feature of the Barbary for us was the roomservice. It was really affordable considering you usually shell out for a dissapointing buffet or eat crappy fast food. For your time, money and your poor aching feet, roomservice is the way to go. They also deliver liquor which is the smart thing to do if you are trying to save some money. The food was really pretty good too. There is also a real liquor store if you walk east a block down Flamingo Ave. The best bet for getting free drinks in the hotel is to sit at the bar and play video poker. Drinks are free if youre playing reguardless of how slow you play and they keep em coming at the bar, just tip them to keep them happy. All of the folks working at the hotel were really friendly and extremely helpful. Especially the bell hop, even if you call from you're room. One other tip, if you are looking to find a taxi, go to Bally's. There is an actual cross walk, thats right you will be walking on the street, on the south side of the hotel that will take you right over there to a whole line of waiting taxis. Barbary does not get this kind of taxi service because they are such a small hotel. WARNING!!!!!: Never get into an unmarked taxi. On our way to the airport while toting luggage over to Bally's to get a taxi ($12 by the way), my new hubby was chatting on his cell, we were grumpy and tired and ready to vacate Vegas for a long time, when this man approached me. His car was pulled up backwards to the curb just down from where the taxis usually are, with his trunk open. He asks me if we need a taxi and starts to grab for my bags. Luckily Im still holding on to them. As I check out his car I notice it is not labeled as a taxi would be in any way, so I asked him about it. He says they are "new company, specializing in no wait service" I asked him for ID and he says there just too new to have it. Im no sucker but I bet someone would have bought the whole game. He was on it..... So I said no and he was like "well you can go wait in line down there" and I look to see that only 2 people are in the real taxi line. Come on...so we walk down there and ask the people at he taxi line if there is such a thing as an unmarked private taxi company (seems obvious) and they say there are no private companies in Vegas. The guy just completely takes off as soon as we starting talking to the staff at Bally's. Such a crook. Dont know what he would have done, maybe stole our stuff or worse. So shady and creepy. Be wise out there, you never know. Don't ever let your guard down. Thats all I can think of. I would definately go back to the Barbary. I just wanted to write this becasue I saw a lot of bad reviews for this place and I think people just expect different things. If you have a lot of money this may not be your ideal getaway in the lap of luxury, but if you are short on cash and dont want to spend it on a hotel this is the place to be. I just hope it will still be there next time we go!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Bellagio (stayed at both)”
Reviews.Author: amrdia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbary Coast on June 3rd 2006 for one night. A reschedule by the airline required an earlier arrival into LV. We stayed at the Bellagio the following three nights. The Barbary Coast is deceiving in a positive surprising way. The hotel is the older genre. The clientile is not up scale compared to Bellagio/Venetian/Paris. The outside is not impressive. The casino is not impressive. It appears you have arrived in the 70's. The check in was easy and quick. The young lady names Ashley assured me the rooms were nicer than Bellagio. Sounded like good corporate brainwashing. She upgraded us to a suite. We used the elevator which smelled musty...but is only steps from the entrance. Exiting the elevator is still unimpressive. The carpet needs changing/stretched. The doors are cheap looking black formica crap. Still very concerned. We arrived at room 153 on the fifth floor. A double door signaled the suite. We opened it and stepped into another world. I am guessing 15oosqft. A granite topped bar, dining room table,two bath rooms,living area with sofa (2) love seats and a plasma TV. The other room had a firm king sized bed, plasma TV, (2) sitting areas, the master bath has a large jacuzzi with, yes another plasma TV. There was a large walk in closet two dressing areas, a huge shower with stained glass outside window. OK no real good view to speak of. Did not eat at the restruants but heard good things. The tables are low $ buy in. Everyone was very nice. The location is second to none. I WILL STAY HERE AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - you will not regret it!”
Reviews.Author: racitonleroy
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was nervous about staying here, and the fact that 3 other parties were also staying here because we were made me even more anxious - but I could not have been more pleased with all aspects of the hotel. Check in - quick and easy. The staff were friendly and polite and proficient. All I can say about the rooms is- WOW! For what we paid I was not expecting much, but we got a lot! A comfy king size bed, a 42 inch plasma tv and heaps of room for luggage etc. Not to mention an uninterrupted view of the Bellagio fountains. The bathroom was not huge or super modern - however it was more than adequate to do what you need to do! The decor is Victorian and even though this is not our taste, it was quite nice for a change and not too overdone. I checked out the other rooms our friends were in and they were all of the same standard. We were in Vegas for our wedding, and had two nights at the Barbary and then three nights at the Bellagio ( where the wedding was being held ) and after seeing the room, we both wished that we had the room the whole 5 nights and only stayed at the Bellagio the night of the wedding - it was that good and a real bargin ( especially compared the the Bellagio prices! ). Some of our other wedding guests who were staying elsewhere were kicking themselves that they didn't stay at the Barbary also as they were paying a lot more for a lot less! The location is probably the best in Vegas - and certainly the best for the price! An easy walk everywhere and to everything! The staff were also extremely good to one of our wedding guests who was very ill and ended up in hospital - they went out of their way to assist with extending the stay, arranging transport to the hospital and even constantly checked up on the patients process. This is something that you do not see everyday and which will not be forgotten by us and our wedding guests. I cannot recommend this hotel enough and will not stay anywhere else when we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel In Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise. This hotel is in the most perfect location. I had read many reveiws about noise from the street, but overall it was grreat. After all, you are in Las Vegas, the city that never sleeps. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was very nice. Perfect location on the strip. I have been to Vegas many times and stayed at some bigger hotels. I will definately stay here again over any of the others. I like the ambiance of the smaller hotel with the older vegas feel. The food at the Victorian room restaurant was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “24/7 Fun in the Epicenter of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Here There and Everywhere
Reviews.Content: We have found a new favorite in Vegas! The Barbary Coast offers so much in such a cozy package. We stayed in a great second floor room with a wonderful view of Bally's, the Eiffel Tower, and the Bellagio fountains. Ceasar's is right across the street, too. If you need complete quiet, this is not the place to stay. However, the sirens, yelling, honking cars, and music didn't bother us. The room was very spacious and comfortable. Our only (minor) complaint is that coffee service is not offered in the room; however a Seattle's Best Coffee shop is located right in the building. (Besides, it's fun to wake up and take a walk through the casino for morning coffee and muffins!) Of the three on-site restaurants, we ate only at the Victorian Room. The food was good, and the service was efficient. While the casino is not vast, it offers a good variety of slots, games, and a sports book. There is also an entertaining 80's rock cover band that plays in the lounge in the evening. We WILL return to the Barbary Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: VegasTinks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barbary Coast from Apr 14 - 21. The location of this hotel is wonderful! Dead center on the strip, within walking distance to any point. The rooms are not huge, but are layed out in a way that makes them feel more spacious. You walk in and the bed is right there, then as you walk past the king bed (and the 42" plasma TV) there is a little sitting area with a table and two chairs, next to that is the bathroom, the sink is seperate from the shower/toilet area. Everything was clean and the bed was nice and comfortable, I believe it was quite new. The only two complaints (which keep it from getting the 5th star) I had were with the shower, it didn't drain very well and the shower curtain rings didn't want to slide at all, I've never run into that before. The stained glass window in the shower is a very nice touch. Some other nice things you get here are the short walks to the room. The entrance on the side is right next to the elevators which take you to your room, 1min and you are in your room. Also, we were on floor 1, however, the parking garage is below the rooms so even 1st floor rooms are actually 4 floors up. The view was amazing we could see Bally's and the fountains. Noise was not a problem, we had the AC fan running all the time and that would drown out any noise. Also ate at the Victorian room a couple times, the chinese food is excellent!! If you are looking for a reasonably priced, clean comfortable hotel room, without all the frills (pools, malls, spas, etc) you will be very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoipolloi
Reviews.Content: I fully agree with all the positive reviews. As several people have commented this place has all the benefits of being right on the strip but also a relatively small hotel. It's got a slightly old-Vegas feel to it overall but I get the impression that the rooms are all recently renovated, so the best of both worlds. My perspective is probably biased however as I had reserved a "deluxe king" but we arrived to find ourselves in one of the jacuzzi suites! I don't know if it was a mistake on their part or if they just don't advertise their suites very clearly, but it was fabulous, by far the hugest hotel room I have ever stayed in, and remarkably cheap. We didn't get any noise from outside, maybe because we were at the end of the hotel farthest from the strip; we did have one thoughtless woman talking loudly on her cell phone as she walked down the hall at 3am but luckily that didn't last long. I would definitely come back, though I suspect we won't end up in a jacuzzi suite again!

Reviews.Title: “love the room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a long day of walking the stirp, its nice to know that in barbary coast i can zip in and out of the hotel quickly. and not get lost like the bigger hotels. my room was excellent just right for three people. the beds were superb. took little naps after the walks. the beds were better then the ones i have at home.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up on Barbary Coast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: April 2006: After reading the good reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book at room at Barbary Coast. We spent 3 nights at Barbary Coast Hotel on the strip and the reviews are true; it's clean, friendly, comfortable, quiet and in a great location! Best of all the price is right - half the cost of the pricey hotels around it. Try it! You'll enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel, but not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: bingo03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbary Coast for two nights April 1-3, 2006. The hotel is very nice, is small and very convenient. It is right on the strip across from Ceasar's Palace and near Bellagio. In fact, we could watch the fountains from our room. The beds were extremely comfortable as well as the pillows. The flat screen TV was also very nice. The room was a good size, bathroom was small, but adequate. We do not gamble, so I cannot speak about the casino other than to say it was always busy. The price was very reasonable for a Saturday night stay, especially on the strip and being mid-strip. Henry, the bell hop was extremely nice and helpful to us on our last day. He was very friendly. The front desk staff were also friendly and efficient. Check-in was a breeze as well as check-out, no long lines at this small hotel. The only concern, and not the hotel's fault, we had trouble sleeping because being so close to the strip, and hotel only having 4 floors, the noise from the strip filters in all night. Once you get used to that, you have to deal with sirens all night long. Apparently, this intersection must be near the fire and rescue house as they were busy all night and constantly driving right by our hotel. The second night we were there, we adjusted more to the outside noise, but then had very noisy young neighbors (sounde like a bunch of college age girls). They came in about 2:00 a.m. talking very loudly, etc., We could hear every word. Was quite disturbing. I was considering calling downstairs, something I have never done, when they left out again. As we got up and prepared to leave the next morning, I considered returning the favor of noise, as their "do not disturb" sign was posted, but I didn't. We did see "O" while here and it was awesome, no way to describe, just to say it is worth every penny. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as long as they are aware of the outside noise issues. If you plan to be up very late, won't bother you I imagine. It is a fantastic location and very nice, comfortable rooms as well!

Reviews.Title: “Tossed Out”
Reviews.Author: oneplay2
Reviews.Content: Stoped by barbary coast to eat the prime rib dinner that was advertised. after eating i stopped by the 10.00 blackjack table and set down with a couple of middle aged women who seemed to be having fun. bought 100.00 dollars in chips and began to play . after about ten minutes the pit boss asked me if i would like to be rated, at first i said no because i was staying at the wynn with a convention but one of the ladies told me i should get rated because i might get a free buffett so i said sure and i gave the pit boss my drivers licence. after about ten minutes he gave me back my licence and said my card would be ready soon. a few more people came to the table and we all started to have fun getting to know each other and talking about were we were all from. about 20 minutes later a different pit boss came over to the table and informed me that i was no longer welcomed to play in the casino. i was totally shocked and so was everyone else at the table i asked him if this was a joke and he informed me it wasn't and i should cash in my remaing chips and leave.which by the way i was down to 25.00 in chips left. not only did i cash in my chips but everyone at the table did as well and they all said they would never go back inside the barbary coast again. since this was my first as well as my last time also i thought i would send in this review. i go to las vegas about once every three years for conventions but i will assure you i will never recommend the barbary coast to anyone. i was never even given a reason for being asked to leave i wonder what they would have done to me if i had been on the 15.00 table.

Reviews.Title: “Great things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: chrisinrochester
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at maybe 15 properties in vegas and I've settled on Barbary Coast as the one to which I choose to return time and again. What I like best....The property is nice and small but has a great center strip location on the corner across from Bellagio, Caesars and Paris. Unlike your typical vegas mega property with 419,000 rooms, you can actually walk out of your room, walk 100 paces to the elevator, press "lobby", and be right in the casino. Another 100 steps and you are outside on the hottest corner of the strip. If you've ever stayed at the Flamingo, you know how nice this is...no more 25 minute hikes to your room!! Other things I like...The rooms are nice and comfy. Nothing fancy, just nice and decent sized. Decor is kinda San Francisco gold rush. Think lots of brocade, burgundy and gold. The food is great...If you want very traditional vegas diner (think prime rib, eggs, rueben) the Victoria room is right there. But if you want some of the city's finest gourmet food (no overstatement) Michael's is there too. Never eaten at Drai's but it gets good remarks from foodies. Also, I'm a coffee snob and they have a Seattle's Best in the lobby. What I don't like...Its a small property with a devoted following so it tends to be full. Also it seems that the comps and freebies are still fairly tight. Also, the sportsbook is about as barebones as they come. Also, no poker room. As to these last two points, remember you are a 5 minute walk from the nicest sports book and poker room in vegas at Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Best beds and pillows in Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: huttpl
Reviews.Content: The Barbary Coast is located in all the hussle and bussle of the strip. We much preferred the quiet of the offstrip hotels that run shuttles to the Barbary Coast (like the new SouthCoast and the Orleans). However the Barbary Coast has the best beds and pillows in Las Vegas. I made the comment to my husband in the elevator that I would like to "steal" one of their pillows. Turned out the head of housekeeping was sharing our elevator. She said the Barbary Coast had just replaced all their mattresses and pillows. They are the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Work the system”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've done annual stays with the Barbary for years. Not the prettiest hotel in terms of the mega-resorts but it has some features that suit my style of gambling. Without a doubt, the one thing we all joke about is being able to be in your room and on the casino floor in 30 seconds. If you want to be a drunken fool or just need a quick nap to catchup on sleep after an all-nighter, you will appreciate that. Also, the 'main bar' is a great place to meet people from all over on weekend nights. From a gambling perspective, if you want to be recognized, you need a Players Card for whatever game you choose to play !! The Coast Properties are well known for that. Comps will come as long as you use that Players Card. The staff is very nice but again I've been there for years so alot of them recognize me when I return. No lie !! If you want to play poker at the Flamingo, you stay at the Barbary because the walk is shorter from your room. The rooms have been remodeled with hi-def TVs. The beds and pillows are new and I had a very comfortable nights sleep in those beds. The drawback is on which side of the casino you sleep on. The 'Ballys' side can be very noisy but if you are on the 'Flamingo' side everything is good. The restaurants are great although I'm partial to their Chinese menu in the Victorian room. Location is great if you are thoroughly sick of the Barbary and want to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “what a view!”
Reviews.Author: nettie-g
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay on the strip but not break the bank. 59 bucks a night at the Barbary fit the bill.Room 306 has a spectacular view!!! Yes it was a bit noisy right on the strip but we stayed up very late so we were tired when we hit the bed. (very comfy bed with fluffy pillows)The renovated rooms are lovely and tasteful with a nice TV to watth while getting dressed in the am.. The elevators were quick. the food at the victoria room was good tho they had no chinese combo plates. fat elvis was great to finally see.He has a super voice. The cocktail service was terrific. The only complaint was that the small casino was a bit smoky for me. So we played near the doors where some fresh air would reach us. And we did well gambling too.Yes we would absolutely stay there again. The staff was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in Town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barbary Coast over New Year's (December 30, 2005-January 1, 2006). Had the best time. It is a small hotel (about 200 rooms), so check-in is fast (about 10 minutes), and we were in our room five minutes later. At first, we were placed in a room with two Queen beds rather than the single King we had requested, so we went back downstairs to the desk and they switched us immediately, with no questions and no hassles. The new room renovations look wonderful, as does the casino after its recent facelift. The decorations and furniture are tasteful, and the new plasma screen tvs are very impressive. As is the view from the room (see photos). As an added bonus, the little stained glass window in the bathroom can be opened so that you can get both fresh air and all of the sounds of the strip. Down in the casino, the bartenders and waitresses were always prompt, courteous, and friendly. As were the slot club attendants. This is no small thing over the crowded New Year's weekend, the busiest of the year! On New Year's eve, just after midnight (when we came back inside after cheering our lungs out), we sat down at some nickel slots and had a waitress come by about every 15 or 20 minutes or so. Two years ago, when we stayed at the Aladdin, I do not think we saw a single one (not to bag too much on the Aladdin, we loved it there too, but they are simply too big to have that kind of waitress to customer ratio... Oh yeah, and Aladdins buffet is truly amazing. Well worth the wait). And the bartenders and the rest of the employees were also very busy, but never too busy to help us out or even just smile and say hello. Makes you feel appreciated. In the wee hours, we ate at the Victorian room, which is one of the better diner style places on the strip. Try the chinese food and the steak and eggs. Pretty reasonably priced and pretty damn good. People complain about noise at the Barbary, but it has never been a problem for us. Either we keep getting the quiet rooms, or we are just heavy sleepers. To sum up: Great service, nice rooms, good value, excellent location, and easy access. Keep in mind though, if you are looking for extra fancy, huge, impressive hotels, the Barbary is not for you. But if you like small, friendly, relaxed places, the Barbary may be just what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: kateoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 3 friends for 3 nights in mid-January. We chose it due to the cheaper rates ($380 in total from Friday to Monday) and its prime Strip location. Location is wonderful, next to Ballys and opposite the Bellagio. Couldn't be better. Room was quiet, we didn't have any trouble with noise like some other posters. We shared a room with 2 queen beds and had plenty of room, it was a great size. Always clean and the housekeeping service was great - really friendly and helpful. Didn't gamble in the casino so can't comment on that. We received a funbook when we checked in that gave us free cocktails and a free souvenir - that was good. Would definitely stay here again. Right in the middle of the action and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worth thinking about”
Reviews.Author: GrahamCScotland
Reviews.Content: Friends and I booked rooms for two nights at the BC because, when the CES exhibition was in town, the room rate at the Monte Carlo, where we'd spent five nights over New Year, shot up to $399 a night: the Barbary Coast was $89. We'd been a little wary but needn't have worried. Our room was large and spotless with great views of the Bellagio fountains, while the plasma TV was the biggest we've ever seen in a Vegas hotel room. Because the hotel is so small it is very simple to get to the Strip, where you are in the middle of everything. The casino is, I suppose, a little low-rent compared to the mega theme resorts, and it can sometimes be hard to get a cab outside but, on the plus side, a draft beer is only $2. Finally, we found all the staff among the friendliest and most helpful we've ever come across in the city. Would I stay here again rather than pay three times as much to go back to the Monte Carlo? Undoubtedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: olinemother
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel,do not be fooled by the low rates. Even though the reviews were favorable I was still worried. Wow, was I suprised. We paid 39.oo per night and after spending two nights there I would definately go back, there is no reason to stay anywhere else. The location is awesome, right in the heart of the Strip; as others have posted, it's a small hotel (200 rooms) and you don't have to walk through miles of the casino to find the elevators. The parking garage is free and a breeze to use. The only drawback I could find was there was no coffee maker in the room. There is a Seattle's Best coffee spot in the hotel so I just sent my beloved down for coffee in the mornings. We stayed on the fourth floor with a nice view; all the floors have now been renovated and the rooms are very nice, clean, spacious and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Location, Some Noise”
Reviews.Author: Juju11
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Barbary and we will definitely stay again if the price is right. We requested a room with a nice view when we made our reservations. When we checked in, I asked if it would be possible to get a view and the woman at the front desk said that they had already set aside a room with a fantastic view based on our request. I didn't think that any hotels actually took requests seriously but, the Barbary actually tries to honor them. Go figure. Anyway, the rooms have recently been remodeled. Appeared to be new carpet, wallpaper, furnishings, and television. The bedding was a little worn looking but, otherwise, a very clean hotel room. The bathroom itself (toilet and shower) is a little small, but not unreasonable. Plus, we enjoyed having the sink area separate from the rest of the bathroom. That way, you don't have to de-fog the mirror everytime someone gets out of the shower. The one downside on the accommodations is the street and air/heater noise. When we turned on our air, the wall unit started clanking and grinding. It subsided, but the unit was still quite loud while it was running. The funny part is, we ended up turning the air on at night just to drown out some of the street noise. The Barbary is on an extremely busy intersection and you can, most certainly, here the traffic. It is not unbearable but, I would consider bringing some earplugs or some "white noise" contraption with you if you are a light sleeper and plan to stay here for several nights. We were able to take advantage of the complimentary shuttles to the Orleans and the Gold Coast on several occassions. The shuttles arrives about every 20 minutes and there are different shuttles for different routes. The only downside with the shuttle is that no one really forms a line while waiting so, if it is busy, the boarding gets a little crazy. Overall, we were happy with our accommodations and loved the convenience of staying in a smaller property. We will definitely consider the Barbary for future trips...next time, with earplugs. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt,this is the WORST!! casino in vegas.We spent several hundred dollars on the slots.Trying to get a drink was impossible.After an hour I went up to the bar for a drink.I told the bartender we had been playing for an hour and, no waitress. All he said was, they are out there and charged us for our drinks.Thinking this was a fluke, we went back the next day. Same thing!!.I checked with guest services about any comps we had earned. They said we did'nt qualify for any! This has NEVER happened to me in vegas.It will never happen to me again as long as I stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Rose”
Reviews.Author: JoeinAustin
Reviews.Content: This is old but well maintained and clean hotel on the strip that offers good value for the money. The rooms and bathrooms were more than adequate for a stay of only a few days in LV. It is centrally located on the strip, right across the street from a monorail stop. The staff is incredibly unhelpful, answering all questions politely but not volunteering much more. There is in hotel dining which was good, at least for breakfast and there is a casino which I paid no attention to. For its location, appearance and comfort, I would stay there unless I could get a very good deal on the Bellagio or Wynn. There is basically nothing wrong with the place except it is old and dated looking in comparison to all the places around it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault The Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barbary Coast for 6 nights in October. I honestly can't fault the place. The room was a good size with good amenities and great value for money. The room was cleaned/ made up every day and was spotless. The location couldn't have been better - right in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip with a lot of the mega resorts and themed hotels just across the road or minutes walk away. The hotel has 3 restaurants - I ate in the Victorian Room which was good value for money with a good menu. There is a good sized casino (if that's your thing, it's not mine.) For the 6 nights my bill came to about £390.00 but bear in mind that Fridays and Saturdays are more expensive and my stay included a Saturday. Also I was there on my own but the price would have been the same with two sharing. If I return to Vegas I will stay there again - as I said, I honestly can't find anything to fault about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if You Get Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: cookiehead
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel for our anniversary. The room was AWESOME. It was huge and clean. The decor is a bit funky and dated, but no different than the theme and look of the hotel. The bed was big and comfy. One thing to note: This hotel is much smaller than most of the hotels in Vegas... so there wasn't much "padding" between the room and the strip. In other words, if you are a light sleeper, you might not like this place. The bigger hotels seem to shield you from the noise better. Also, the casino is much smaller than other ones, but that didn't matter. The location is GREAT. Right in the middle of the strip. If you can get a better deal on the strip, go for it. But if you get a great deal on this place, it's worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not great....but Good location”
Reviews.Author: All4sarcasm
Reviews.Content: Overall...it was OK. I had some problems...such as I stayed on the 1st floor...and there are no "do not disturb" signs in the rooms - Ask for one when you check in! Otherwise, around 8:30 AM EVERY day you will get a "room check" from the cleaning service and even if you answer they will still come in. My room's phone seemed to be tied to the "room service" line...so twice in one night/morning I received calls for room service, where I unceremoniously pulled the line out of the phone. The beds...not that clean despite some reviews...I had a double bed room and I had "bug bites" on my feet - definitely disturbing. The mattresses were sleepable but not overly comfy. They did have good pillows if you like them fluffy though. Great location if you are just going for a couple of days and will not spend alot of time in the room. I came for business. The staff were nice and friendly, especially the bell desk. So, overall, I'm just going to chaulk it up to hopefully just bad luck...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel and had a wonderful time. I was worried at first because of the price I paid. But after arriving I was well pleased. The location of the hotel is right where all of the action is. They provide a free shuttle to the Gold Coast hotel (which is across the street from the Rio) and The Orleans Hotel. The food was good but not exceptional. They have remodeled the entire 4th floor and are now remodeling the 3rd. My view from the window were the Bellagio fountains. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is not looking for a fabulous stay but still commands a decent place to lay there head. I am a female and clean bathrooms, sheets, lobbys and restaurants are a must. This hotel fits that bill. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: klcvs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here August 20-22 and really enjoyed our stay. We had a room with a view of the fountains at Bellagio and the Eiffel Tower, which surprised us as we were on the first floor. We were pleased at how large the room was, and although showing wear, the rooms decor was pleasant. We liked the casino and the Victoria Room as pretty good. The cheap menu at 2 AM was nice. There were a few drawbacks, the bed was not too comfortable and it was almost impossible to sleep in as the room next door was constantly being opened and closed. The location was great as this was my husbands first trip and we were able to comfortably walk to most of the resorts. All in all for the price we got $190 for both nights, one on a Saturday, we will be back for another weekend trip!

Reviews.Title: “good weekend alternative”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are plusses and minuses of this hotel. I'll start with the bad..... We reserved a non-smoking room and they gave us a smoking room, telling us that we get whatever is available at the time we show up. I thought this was really lame. I've been in smoking rooms that I could never have stayed in, luckily this one wasn't too bad, but if it had been worse, what could I have done? Also, the bed was as hard as a rock. Probably the hardest bed I've ever slept in in my life. Now, the good......The service staff were really great. Everyone seemed to be truly happy to help you and they were very proficient. The hotel is in a great location and an easy walk to quite a few other hotels. And speaking of walking....it didn't take half a day to walk to your room like at some of the facilities. That was nice. In the neither good nor bad category....the casino itself is rather small compared to most of the Strip hotels, so it felt very crowded, but it also felt very lively. The problem with the small area is that it can get rather smokey. There's not much ventilation and room to move. And the hotel room was good-sized, but all the decorations were dark-toned, so it made the room feel very dark and gloomy. This hotel is a good Strip alternative for the weekend when the prices at the fancy places go through the roof, otherwise I would shell out $20-$40 more and stay at one of the 4-star places during the week.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the action minus the expense!”
Reviews.Author: EzBeinGreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here instead of paying the almost $300/night that our friends and family paid at Caesar's the weekend of June 24-26. $109 per night, INCLUDING room tax. TOTAL BARGAIN! Comfortable rooms, clean and well-kept. Friendly staff and helpful bellman. Nice casino with good variety of games. Easy to get around and not crazy like other casinos. The only negatives were the quality of room service food and not the best of luck at gambling. :-( But for the overall quality and location, it's a great place to be if you want to be on the strip but don't want to be gouged on room prices.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip - Good place to stay - Great location!”
Reviews.Author: OH_CA_transplant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BC for my bachelor party weekend because it offered a good hotel in an excellent location (on the same corner as Bellagio, Caeser's Palace, and Bally's) at a great price. We got exactly that. The customer service was average, but from what I have read on other reviews, Vegas hospitality is NOT why people flock to this city sized adult amusement park. We played some BlackJack in the casino and the dealers were relatively friendly and helpful. The rooms themselves are nice - nicer than an average hotel room - but definitely not luxurious. The furniture was older, but seemed to be holding up well. The bed was comfortable and the restroom facilities were average to above average. They were clean, which is the most important thing in restroom facilities. I liked the seperate sitting area as it made a good area to prepare for a night out without constantly stumbling over your own bed. As noted earlier, the main attraction to this hotel, though, is its price and location. Mid-Strip location at Off Strip prices. If you are looking for a resort type, all inclusive hotel, do not stay here. If you are looking for a decent hotel in a great location for a great price, definitely give the Barbary Coast a try.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I started planning our vacation to Vegas in November for a week in June. Obviously planning that far ahead I was able to choose just about anywhere to stay for the week. I did a lot of reading and internet searching before I finally arrived at what I thought would be the perfect place to stay for 6 nights. This was my husband and my first trip to Vegas. While most look at the bright lights and hustle and bustle of this adult Disneyland, as very exciting, I looked at it as a little overwhelming for our first time. I choose the Barbary Coast for the exact reason that a lot of people would over look it. It was small, did not have a swimming pool, it did not have any special attractions and it was quoted as being "Victorian" in decor. It became our safe heaven from all that is Vegas, when we needed a break. To some that might be a turn off, to me it was perfect. My husband and I loved the location it was easy access to the Monorail that we used everyday we were there, and within walking distance to some of our favorite places like Paris, Desert Passage and the Flamingo which we really liked. The room we had was wonderful. I loved the burgundy colors and the brass king size bed. I like to stay up late and read and the drapes that separate the bedroom from the little sitting room made it a great place to read while not bothering my husband. My personal favorite part of the room, was the window in the bathroom. I loved having it opened so that I could hear the music from the Bellagio as I watched the fountain show every night from the sitting room window. One of the reviews of the Barbary complained about the fire department being right around the corner. We did hear sirens all the time, but with all that is going on in Vegas, it hardly merits complaining about. My husband and I LOVED the Barbary Coast and would stay there again whenever we go back. The people there were very friendly and I loved the small size and personal feel of the hotel. I give this a five star excellent review, because it was perfect.. perfect location, perfect size, perfect room and perfect for us. Marylou

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: kakijalan
Reviews.Content: Compared to all other others in the area, Barbary Coast is very reasonably priced. For about the same price as a room in a motel chain, it has a better location. A small hotel compared to the rest, but has large rooms. It is in the centre of the Strip, just across Ceasars Palace and next to Bellagio, Ballys, Flamingo... making it a wonderful base to explore the other mega resorts. Being a small-ish hotel, we didn't have to walk thru a big casino to get to the reception and back to the room. There are security personnel stationed at the guest lifts at night to make sure only guests can go up. Free parking is a plus too. However, the room does not have an in-room safe, no fridge or coffee making facility... which is a minus. Otherwise, a good for tourists to Las Vegas, especially the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Great Deals”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I rate this place excellent because for what it is, it is EXCELLENT! Make sure that you make your reservation months in advance to ensure the lowest rates. I am staying again this June and I am paying $300 for a 3-night weekend. You can't get any better than that. It is right in the middle of the Strip and you avoid the hustle-bustle of the mega resorts. The room is cool. They are more like old studios from the Victorian Era. I liked the bathrooms especially. Try to request a room facing Bally's and at night you can get a pretty good view of the Bellagio fountains. Avoid the rooms on the North side or you will get a view of the service alley to the Flamingo. Also if you go out on Flamingo street and walk east about a 1/4 mile there is a mini mart where you can buy moderately priced liquor that you can't get in any hotel. If you are the type of person that goes to Vegas to party and use your room mainly as a sleeping quarters then this place is great. If you are looking for an all-in-one relaxation package (pool, spa and restaurants etc.) it is probably not the best choice. One cool thing about The Barbary Coast is that we got to Vegas at about 10AM and the front desk checked us in early. I don't know if this is a normal thing that they do, but we thought it was great and it earned them a lot of respect, and that is why we will be staying again this June.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised at The Barbary Coast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Barbary Coast the week of 28 March 2005. We thought we would give it a try since it is just a place to sleep and shower and use our money on other things. We were pleasantly surprised! We were able to check in at 10 am and got to freshen up before hitting the casinos. The room was clean and the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. It felt like our bed at home. The hotel is small so getting to/from the room was quick and efficient. We liked the Victorian atmosphere. It was quaint like a B&B. Some of the furniture was a little roughed up but we were very pleased. Room service was quick and friendly. The bathroom is small by Vegas standards but clean and well-maintained. The shower pressure was awesome and the stained glass window in the tub/shower offered a neat view of The Flamingo and Caesar's Palace. We did great in the casino there. Staff and attendants were friendly--we even got comps for dinner! Although we usually prefer Bally's casino, we kept coming back to The Barbary Coast. A very nice selection of slots and lower table minimums if you aren't a big spender. We hated to leave it was such an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Barbary Coast a year ago and loved it. Our room faced the Bellagio fountains, the staff was nice and we got everything we needed promptly, and the rooms are huge! For the price, the location is fantastic...we've been promoting it since we returned. The casino is small, so what? Go to the mega places, they're all around you and the shuttle to Gold Coast to swim is worth it! We're going back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, affordable”
Reviews.Author: j7critter
Reviews.Content: Arrived for two nights on the 3rd. Check in was immediate, spent maybe 3 mins. at the desk. Requested corner room on third floor with view, recieved it. Great view of the Bellagio fountains. Had read of others complaining about noise from the Ballys sign (which was directly across the street). Those people must be the world's lightest sleepers. We had to strain to hear anything at all and we certainly weren't disturbed in the night. The room was very large with the bathroom on the smaller side, although the bathroom itself is split into 2 areas. The outside containing the sink, mirror, ironing board (with iron) and clothes hangers, and a seperate area (with a door) that contained the toilet and tub/shower. Unless you plan on living in the bathroom, you won't notice the size as it's not a bad setup with enough room to freely move about. The bed was comfortable, had a large T.V. and room was extremely clean. The casino is smaller than the mega hotels but had a great intimate atmosphere. Nearly every dealer was fun and courteous. There worst we experienced were a couple that seemed they didn't want to be there (end of long shift maybe?) no one was rude. Low mins on the tables, free beads to the players and quick drink service due to the small size of the casino made for some fun times with the other players. Check out was equally as fast as check in, with the bell hop quickly storing our luggage until we were ready for our departure to the airport. If you want a clean, large, affordable room that is right in the middle of the action, Barbary coast is a safe bet. If you plan on using hotel ammenities when you are in vegas (spas, pool, etc.) this isn't the place for you. If you just want a nice place to stay and can do without the bells and whistles, Barbary Coast fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I needed”
Reviews.Author: Bigalbr
Reviews.Content: Just completed a great 6 night stay at Barbary Coast. I rate it as above average for what it is. If you expect Caesar's Palace, it can't compete. It gives you a clean, decent sized room in a small hotel with an excellent coffee shop. I can't comment on the other two restaurants. The casino is also small, but very friendly and with favorable limits and rules for the strip. It has no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price you cant go wrong its in the middle of it all easy to get around. Its nothing fancy mind you but the room s are big and clean so what more to want when all you do is sleep there. If your picky and you need the flash and glitter its not the place for you. Casino is very small and the book is nothing to speak of and when its packed not a very fun place but then your there for the room and the ability to get to any of the other casino's with no problem. BIG THUMBS UP!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Liked The Room Decor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Barbary Coast Oct. 7th / 14th 2004, we thought the location was great right in the middle so to speak, we had a great room with a great view looking right down the strip, we could see Bally's / The Paris eiffel tower the fountains all the way down too the NY NY. When we got our room it was like going back in time to the old west, like in an old western movie thats how it was decorated, the brass head board the colours, we were really pleased with the room, so it had a small bathroom big deal, how much room does someone need to get cleaned up or take a shower. My son had come with us and this was his first time to Las Vegas and he was quite thrilled with it all, he had lust turned nineteen so was unable to gamble but this did not really concern him, although he appeared to be old enough that the security did not notice so they always wallked right on by. We really enjoyed the restaurant their great steaks good service. Now the only problems that we encountered were the elevators or should I say the one elevator, and our room keys. The elevator was really really slow and the other was always under repair for a week, guest were always waiting for an elevator I found this to be a little annoying at times. Now the room keys, I found this a little odd my wife and sons room keys had stopped working but mine still functioned, so we went down to the front desk and the attendant said oh! you have been here to long, I replied that we had booked for seven nights as per usual while in Las Vegas, she just looked at me with a smug look gave me new room keys, very rude no class what so ever, just turned her back like we did not exsist, oh well I thought, oh and getting a cab (FORGET IT!) good luck in this department, the bellman had to stand in the street and whistle real! loud! needless to say we tipped him for his great effort, other than that we love Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend decided to stay here when we decided to add an extra day to the begining of our trip. It was last minute and even though I am a pretty frugal guy when it comes to las vegas I was unsure what I might be getting into with barbary. Well it was great. First I asked for late checkout at the front desk, and they said no problem, then I asked for king with view of belagio fountains, they said no problem. We got 302 last room down the hall and with a great view. Now there was the ballys sign across the street which played all night but not so bad you can't sleep well. The view totally makes up for it. 25 dollars per night was nice too. Made us wish we had stayed there instead of the over rated aladin down the street where our strip view comprised of the paris balloon and some wall. Just on a side note I think vegas is in for some knocks down the road. Customer service is at an all time low, stinks of corporation most places you go on the strip. Sad cause I really used to like going there. They really need to start remembering they have to earn my money just like I had to, sticking too downtown and off strip from now on. Oh yeah victorian room. Steak and eggs great value, service sucked.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Lovingvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Aug 2004 I thought for the price that I paid which was 39.00 a night buy 2 get 3rd night free i was scared to see what i was gonna get for my money. But i was very surprised. There are only 4 floors it is very small and it isnt too loud it was wonderful the room was BEAUTIFUL. The bathroom is small but how much time are you gonna spend in the bathroom in Las vegas. I LOVED IT AND WILL STAY THERE AGAIN WHEN I GO BACK IN DEC

Reviews.Title: “A terrific value”
Reviews.Author: orlando-davis
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large and clean. Check in takes 2 minutes. Room had a great view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. Had separate shampoo and conditioner, mouthwash, and bath gel. Beds are very comfortable. Didn't take forever to get from your room to the strip. Also, the room prices were very low and the location was terrific. The only downsides to this hotel were the parking garage which was small and dark and if you are a light sleeper you can hear traffic from your room(King bedroom. Doubles are supposed to be quieter but don't have a view). There is not a pool either. Don't waste your money on the big strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is very nice”
Reviews.Author: Franr123
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was just fine! The location is great! Hotel rooms were big and comfortable. Prior reviews talked about the very small bathrooms, but we thought they were plenty big. If anyone has taken a cruise, these bathrooms were much larger. The tub/shower and toilet were in a room and another room had the dressing table with sink and closet area. Casino was ok but the smoke smell was strong. But the Flamingo, Bally's, and Caesar's are a very short walk away. Restaurant (Victorian) was disappointing and service was extremely slow as prior reports said. We wouldn't recommend eating there but would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Barbary Coast is an excellent deal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbary Coast from July21 to the 24th. To begin we checked at 11:00 am and it took 3 minutes. This is really neat because as soon as we checked in, we went to the Flamingo to eat and people were lined up through the lobby waiting to check in. Also I really liked that the hotel is small and there is no elevator wait. The layout of the hotel took about a minute to memorize. The bathrooms are small but the rooms are really nice for a budget hotel. You have to ask yourself what you want before you book. If you want one of the fancy mega resorts stay there. But if want excellent budget accomadations , good location, and more time to enjoy vegas stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: PlainVanilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights (July 25-28). Excellent location, right in the middle of the Strip. I thought the room was very nice - large and well maintained. Beds were very comfortable, as well. Free parking available in their parking garage. It’s actually around the corner from Las Vegas Blvd., which made it a little hard to find, but once located, the fact that it’s off the drag makes it easier to access. I thought that it was a fantastic value. Hey, its not the Bellagio, but point out the time periods when I can get the Bellagio for $20 a night! Regarding a few of the negative comments I've read here: The bathroom was kind of small (but not that small - how much room do you need to take a bath?). No, it didn't have a Jacuzzi (refer to the $20/night observation). It doesn't have a pool, which wasn't an issue for me, but it might be for some people. As was pointed out previously, you can take a shuttle to one of their sister hotels for that. They also don't have a fitness facility, although I was told that (the Orleans, I believe) does, and can be accessed by shuttle. Remember that there is like a three hour turn around for their shuttle schedule. They also don't have any wi-fi access points in their hotel, which was a bit of an issue for me. I had just stayed a couple of nights at the Las Vegas Club, which was arguably not as nice a place, and they did have a wi-fi "hot spot." Lastly, regarding employees with "attitude"... In general, I found the staff to be reasonably courteous and helpful (one of the guys at the front desk was kind of distant, but not bad). The exception, however, was the hostesses at the restaurants (Michaels, the Victorian Room). I did find a noticeable "don't let the door hit you on the butt" demeanor from a number of employees there. By the way, I do have to say that the food and ambiance was very good, however. I think that some people believe that an aloof staff is required in a nice restaurant (#!* those French, anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view (at least from my room: 401)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Easy access from parking lot. Check in was fast and I was in my room just 2 minutes after entering the hotel. I stayed in room 401 and had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Enjoyable! Room was clean and well furnished, but the mattress was thin and a little bit uncomfortable. Casino is small, but well ventilated. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer65
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 12th and 14th, 2004. The Barbary Coast is a must stay for those on a budget and want the mid-strip location. The room was very large in comparison with other budget motels (not even in the same ballpark as motel 6) and was decorated nicely. The view we had of Bally's, Paris, and the Bellagio fountains was wonderful! Room was also quite clean and was easily accessible from the casino, parking garage, or the strip (security checkpoint at the bottom of the hotel elevators). The casino was not large, but had enough slots and table games to keep us entertained. The lounge acts, Big Elvis, and the Smith Brothers, had great music, were funny, and had large audience participation. The steak in the midnight breakfast special at Michael's was the best steak I had in Vegas. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Barbary Coast was awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some positive on-line reviews, we booked the Barbary Coast. Not quite sure if the people writing the reviews stayed in the same hotel. There's no pool or jacuzzi (though you can take a shuttle to one of their other hotels and use the facilities there). There's no transportation to/from the airport. Nearly all employees were rude (including front desk, security, dealers, restaurant personnel, and cocktail waitresses). The room itself was so-so. There's no in-room coffee (you can request a coffee pot, if they have one available, and IF they're not "too busy" as we were told several times). If you need anything from housekeeping, make sure it's early - otherwise there's no one available until 9 am. Bathrooms are beyond tiny. Checking in or out can be a nightmare, as they don't have much of a front desk. There's no way to get so much as a soda unless you either call room service or stand in line at the bar. If you need bellman services, forget it. The location is great (mid-strip), but if you're expecting anything beyond a low-rate motel type of atmosphere, forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: Vermonter38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barbary Coast May 23-27. Great location. Price was half what others charge. Room was very large and very clean. Checkin was convenient and quick. No walking forever through the casino dragging bags. Casino not the greatest, but at this location, who cares? For the price, would absolutely stay here again. Staff was friendly and helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Bill's Gamblin' Hall & Saloon
HotelInfo.Address: 3595 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109
